title: newHotel Controller
description:
Job Overview

To ensure accurate and timely preparation/distribution of financial information at the property and assist the General Manager by providing analysis/management information to assist in profit conversion while ensuring accurate and timely provision of information to corporate accounting.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • To compile or where appropriate consolidate monthly/quarterly forecasts to achieve accurate forecasting of revenue and expenses by each department.
  • To provide timely summary revenue and profit forecasts.
  • To achieve full and accurate preparation of the monthly/quarterly financial statement identifying and providing guidance on any variances from budget.
  • To prepare a financial statement per accounting standards on a monthly/quarterly /semi-annual/annual basis.
  • To prepare detailed monthly and year-end working paper files for audit or review purposes.
  • To ensure full and proper use of the purchase order system by department managers
  • To ensure all capital/major repairs are processed/authorized correctly.
  • To ensure efficient accounts payable/ accounts receivable/ income audit/ cashiering and payroll functions completed on property within the guidelines of the company.
  • To work with the General Manager and department managers to prepare the budget for presentation to operations working within the agreed time and format guidelines.
  • To encourage team commitment to budget achievement providing proactive guidance and training as necessary to develop understanding and use of financial results/reports.
  • To participate with the General Manager in the monthly/quarterly financial review process by providing additional details.
  • To provide management information to the General Manager to assist in timely and proactive business decisions.
  • To recognize the importance of the role in maintaining ethical accounting practices with any deviations at the property level is brought immediately to the attention of the Regional Controller, Hotels.
  • To ensure adjustments to accounts are carried out/authorized as required
  • To cooperate with internal and external auditors/consultants to achieve time and cost-efficient completion of visits.
  • To ensure accurate filing of information (HST, MAT etc.)
  • To maintain an orderly work environment and prompt access to information by authorized personnel.
  • To provide training and /or assist in other properties as authorized by General Manager and Regional Controller, Hotels.
  • Accurately accrue for items at month-end.
  • Ensure verification and confirmation of daily cash and credit card deposits, with reconciliation of deposits against the front office system and bank records.
  • Responsible for property cash floats and deposits to safes including the issuance of individual cash floats to required staff, spot-checking and regular counting of floats/safes in line with company policy.
  • To prepare and check receipts of change orders to achieve the smooth running of departments.
  • To maintain tracking for all paid out expenditures including refunds to guests, per Company policy.
  • To maintain tracking/documentation records for various items including (but not limited to) calculation/payout of gratuities, credit card, cash deposits, US cash deposits and no shows.
  • To alert the General Manager to cash shortages or deviation from Standards & Procedures laid down by the company.
  • To assist in conducting accurate counting, recording, costing and extension of all food, liquor, and other inventory within the property as required by company policy with additional counts/ proactive measures as necessary to address any shortfalls.
  • To review and ensure full implementation of all accounting/cash/control related procedures as laid down in Company policy.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Education level - Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance or equivalent
  • Experience - 3 years in hotel accounting or internal audit with one year in a supervisory role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Personal characteristics - Ability to analyze; prioritize; delegate, demonstrated ability to exercise appropriate judgment, demonstrates leadership through team building, skillful delegator, strong mediator, and supervisor of staff.
  • Physical abilities - While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate with others and exchange accurate information; operate a computer and other office productivity machinery; move about the workplace; remain in a stationary position for 60% of the time; and extend hands and arms in any direction.
  • Other - Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances are utilized frequently.

Problem-solving, reasoning, motivation, organizational and training abilities are used often.

May be required to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays.

title: Load Controller | LOT Polish Airlines
description:
Job Details

Description

Main accountabilities include:

  • Responsible for safe and secure turn around of our client’s aircrafts.
  • When required moving payload in transit flights as per weight and balance requirements.
  • Check NOTOC as per regulations.
  • Be proactive in all areas in terms of Load Control file: flight plans, Met, Pibs.
  • Bring correct PNL to the flight system for check in purposes.
  • Make sure that the correct hold version, crew, and pantry for the handled flight.
  • Adjust service weights as required.
  • Obtain cargo weights with the order of offloads as stipulated by carriers.
  • Calculate and send message for estimated Zero Fuel Weight.
  • Calculation of baggage ULDS required and advise baggage team.
  • Completion of the load plan.
  • Completion of General Deck list as required by some carriers.
  • Retrieving flight plans.
  • Obtain new slots in case of delays.
  • Work together with OPS to obtain final weights from flight deck for load sheet.
  • Responsible to get signed load plan from the ramp supervisor.
  • Get a signed NOTOC from the captain.
  • Ensure that the flight is in PD mode.
  • Create load control file and ensure all documents are filed as required by the check list.
  • Make sure that all the flight messages are released as required by the carrier.
  • Advise cargo warehouse on cargo off loaded from the flight.
  • Send flight stats as required by the carrier.
  • Perform any reasonable duties when requested.
  • Ensure that all staff comply with all safety and security policies and procedures as safety and security is the responsibility of each employee

Key Skills, Qualifications and Experience:

  • Ability to work any shifts.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Computer literacy.
  • Costumer service orientated.
  • Acknowledgment of load control
  • Acknowledgment of DCS systems.
  • Detail orientated.
  • Good in mathematics.

Functional Knowledge:

  • Experience in load control/ ramp supervision

Business Expertise:

  • Ensure that airline regulations and procedures are followed.
  • Performing any other duties as instructed by Duty Manager.
  • Complying with the company’s procedures regarding clocking times, leave, calling in sick, notice period, work performance, etc.
  • Maintaining the highest level of service to the company’s and customer’s satisfaction
  • Attending all training required by the company when and where instructed
  • Adhering to the company’s disciplinary code
  • Ensuring that all information communicated by the company, client and airport authority is read, understood and acknowledged by signature

Area of Impact

  • Operations.

Interpersonal Skills:

  • Good communication.
  • Work under pressure.
  • Customer focused.
  • Attention to detail.

Qualifications

Experience

Preferred

1 year: Acknowledgment of load control
1 year: Acknowledgment of DCS systems.
1 year: Experience in load control/ ramp supervision

Licenses & Certifications

Preferred

DRIVERS LICENSE

title: Financial Controller ($120-140K Salary!)
description:
• Join one of the most trusted names in mining and construction in BC
  • Receive $120-140K annual salary plus full benefits
  • Help us achieve our long term financial goals as a key decision-maker

Rock Construction and Mining Inc.

Rock Construction and Mining Inc. (ROCK) is one of Canada’s largest rock excavation contractors specializing in drilling and blasting operations. Scope of works include construction and mining projects of every size and complexity in locations across Canada. 

Since 2002, ROCK has secured its reputation as a trusted partner in drilling and blasting applications such as road and highway construction, quarry and mine production, infrastructure foundations and hydroelectric development. Founded with the philosophy of providing a safe, efficient, and guaranteed service, in meeting all client expectations. ROCK believes that people are the greatest asset and utilizes the valuable resources gained through worker engagement.

For more information, please visit our website.

The Opportunity

ROCK is looking for a full-time Financial Controller based in Kamloops, British Columbia. 

The successful candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of the company’s financial administration systems. To qualify for the role, the individual must hold a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation or equivalent. 

Main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

  • Managing accounting operations including journal entries, payroll, accounts payables, accounts receivables, and statutory reporting
  • Overseeing job costing, budgeting, financial planning, and forecasting
  • Preparing all required financial statements, including supplemental financial reports
  • Managing all internal and external financial, tax, and compliance audits
  • Managing compliance with all contractual reporting requirements
  • Monitoring overall internal financial controls throughout the organization
  • Providing daily, weekly, monthly job costing reports to the executive team
  • Maintaining relationships with banks and other financial institutions
  • Working with external accounting subcontractors
  • Managing contact with CRA and provincial regulators
  • Preparing, analyzing, and presenting monthly, quarterly, and annual operating results for the executive team
  • Inventory Control
  • To ensure an orderly transition, the individual will receive mentorship and support will be phased out as required. 

Personal Attributes

The Financial Controller is expected to be proactive and take the lead in their role, therefore you must possess excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. You can prioritize and adapt in a dynamic work environment, while ensuring financial best practices are sustained.

As a key decision-maker, you will possess exceptional communication skills and outstanding attention to detail, as well as a proven innovative and results-driven mindset. 

The following knowledge, skills, or background are crucial in performing the role effectively:

  • Capital asset management
  • Financial planning and reporting
  • Cash management
  • Microsoft Excel, Word, and ERP
  • Leading a finance team 
  • A background or proven experience in a mining and/or construction environment is considered an asset

Compensation

As a valuable member of the team, you will receive excellent benefits which include:

  • $120-140K annual salary, dependent on skills and experience
  • Performance dependent, discretionary bonus after 1 year service
  • Extended Benefits
  • Opportunity for employer-sponsored learning and development 
  • Relocation Assistance for the successful candidate if located outside of Kamloops

ROCK’s core values are at the very heart of the company, guiding the individual actions of the ROCK team members, while inspiring the company’s culture.

If you share common values and hold the skills and drive necessary to bring success to the role, then we invite you to apply today!

title: Vice President, Credit Risk Management
description:
• Make a difference in the community by contributing to an award-winning work environment!
  • Receive a highly competitive salary of $140k+ (negotiable based on experience)!
  • Join an organization with a supportive team culture within a tight-knit community in Bonnyville!

About Lakeland Credit Union

Lakeland Credit Union (LCU) is a provider of financial products and services in the Lakeland area. We have been serving our members in Bonnyville, Cold Lake and surrounding rural communities for over 80 years. We believe in community, integrity, excellence, the co-operative system, and our people.

Lakeland Credit Union is an employer who can help you shape your career, right here in the Lakeland. Our team is focused on creating a leading-edge financial institution where everyone works together to achieve our personal and financial goals, at the same time building a better community. It’s simply part of the way we do business, and that’s what earns us loyalty from our members and their families.

Our workplace culture encourages employees to treat each other with respect - happy employees look forward to coming to work each and every day. Employees that have a sense of purpose, feeling valued and engaged are going to pass that along to our members. Our Executive Leadership team is committed to open communication and swift decision-making for the betterment of our work environment. We pride ourselves on having every voice heard and providing our employees with a real chance to make an impact in our healthy, dynamic credit union. 

To learn more about us and the services we offer, please visit our website by clicking here.

About the Opportunity

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Vice President, Credit Risk Management to join our team on a full-time basis to oversee our organization in Bonnyville, AB. 

As an influential leader, the Vice President, Credit Risk Management oversees the full lending portfolio of our growing, independent credit union. This role establishes and implements plans and strategies to ensure controlled growth and profitability in the lending portfolios while being positioned to achieve corporate goals. The successful candidate will deliver innovative products and services that bring the brand to life and improve the financial well-being of members, while being responsible for the overall adjudication and collections for all of Lakeland's lending operations. The candidate will lead a team of employees, dedicated to providing high-quality service and solutions to members, potential members, and employees. 

More specifically, some of your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Collaborating with the executive team to set annual plans and budgets, ensuring achievement of organizational goals
  • Ensuring that LCU’s credit and risk management practices balance innovation and growth, and supporting short and long-term objectives
  • Recommending changes to credit union policy and procedures 
  • Contributing to the overall profitability and growth of the Credit Union, researching and recommending the optimal credit concentration for the loan portfolio
  • Being accountable for the implementation of pricing guidelines on all credit products and ensuring pricing is adjusted for risk; reviewing, recommending, and implementing automated loan decision parameters
  • Establishing credit, lending policies, and procedures that align with sales growth in key target areas
  • Being responsible for the overall adjudication and risk analysis for all retail, small business, commercial, and agriculture lending and support of our strategic initiatives
  • Partnering with executives, credit and member experience personnel to educate employees and proactively managing credit risk assessment on transactions and portfolios
  • Providing advice and guidance on the viability of retail and commercial/agricultural credit applications and the associated credit risk, interpreting lending policies and procedures, recommending alternative approaches to minimize credit risk
  • Working with Finance and Reporting group, managing and/or participating in high impact projects related to credit risk policy/portfolio management/other issues that have strategic importance 
  • Overseeing collections to ensure that delinquencies are being monitored and followed upon; negotiating with members and third parties to minimize the risk of loss
  • Developing, recommending, and maintaining credit risk corporate policies and standards across the Credit Union
  • Simplifying existing credit risk policies, standards, and guidelines, ensuring they reflect the Credit Union’s risk appetite, proper controls, accountabilities, authorities, and that business-level Lending Policies align with our Policies and Procedures
  • Reviewing and renewing credit facilities in the credit union’s commercial/agricultural credit portfolio and ensuring that quality controls, risk mitigation practices, policies, and procedures are in place and being applied 
  • Identifying areas of potential risk and initiating action to mitigate potential losses within established controls, identifying quality deficiencies and/or areas of risk
  • Being accountable for compliance with applicable legislation, regulations, policies, and procedures
  • Managing commercial/agricultural loan reviews to ensure quality of rating adjustments, as well as other issues; ensuring reviews are properly staffed, adequate dialogue is maintained with lending unit, and is completed on time 
  • Managing the annual review process to ensure quality of rating actions recommended, and reporting results to management

More About You

In order to qualify for this role, you will need formal post-secondary education such as a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Commerce, Finance, or a related business discipline, and at least 10 years of progressive job-related experience in the financial services industry with expertise in lending (commercial, retail, agricultural), underwriting, credit adjudication, relationship management, and senior leadership. A formal designation (CPA, CMA, CFA), a Master's in Business Administration, an understanding of the credit regulatory body, and experience with the securitization of mortgages would be strong assets for this position.  

As our ideal candidate, you will have a passion for delivering exceptional service and are dedicated to building strong peer and employee relationships, and connections in the community. You are a resourceful, superior communicator, with experience in underwriting and securitizing credit. Moreover, you are able to remain calm in the face of changing priorities, with a thorough understanding of the culture of the organization and the ability to problem-solve and think outside the box. As a member of the Executive Leadership team, you possess a strategic mindset with innovative ideas, and strong oversight, mentoring, coaching, and conflict resolution ability.

Above all, you will lead by example with a passion for building, mentoring, and developing a team where employees are empowered to positively contribute to the success of the branch and organization.  

About the Benefits

As a valued member of our independent financial institution, you will be awarded a highly competitive salary of $140k+ (negotiable based on experience), along with a host of benefits, including:

  • Extended health, dental and vision benefits
  • Healthcare spending account
  • Wellness spending account 
  • Vacation negotiable dependent on experience 
  • Variable bonus and incentives depending on branch performance
  • RRSP matching
  • Discounted employee financial services benefits 
  • Relocation assistance
  • Opportunities for long-term personal and professional development
  • Employee bonding events, Christmas parties, and summer socials! 

If you’re a team player who shares our company values and is looking for a stable career with an independent credit union, then we would love to hear from you - Apply today!

  • Ensure verification and confirmation of daily cash and credit card deposits, with reconciliation of deposits against the front office system and bank records.
  • Responsible for property cash floats and deposits to safes including the issuance of individual cash floats to required staff, spot-checking and regular counting of floats/safes in line with company policy.
  • To prepare and check receipts of change orders to achieve the smooth running of departments.
  • To maintain tracking for all paid out expenditures including refunds to guests, per Company policy.
  • To maintain tracking/documentation records for various items including (but not limited to) calculation/payout of gratuities, credit card, cash deposits, US cash deposits and no shows.
  • To alert the General Manager to cash shortages or deviation from Standards & Procedures laid down by the company.
  • To assist in conducting accurate counting, recording, costing and extension of all food, liquor, and other inventory within the property as required by company policy with additional counts/ proactive measures as necessary to address any shortfalls.
  • To review and ensure full implementation of all accounting/cash/control related procedures as laid down in Company policy.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Education level - Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance or equivalent
  • Experience - 3 years in hotel accounting or internal audit with one year in a supervisory role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Personal characteristics - Ability to analyze; prioritize; delegate, demonstrated ability to exercise appropriate judgment, demonstrates leadership through team building, skillful delegator, strong mediator, and supervisor of staff.
  • Physical abilities - While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate with others and exchange accurate information; operate a computer and other office productivity machinery; move about the workplace; remain in a stationary position for 60% of the time; and extend hands and arms in any direction.
  • Other - Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances are utilized frequently.

Problem-solving, reasoning, motivation, organizational and training abilities are used often.

May be required to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays.

title: Operational Controller
description:
Inland Group

Operational Controller

Corporate Office Truro, NS

 

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (IDS, Inland Technologies and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in aircraft de-icing, environmental management, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Inland delivers services at small and large airports across North America and internationally using a range of technologies and customized equipment systems that are purpose-built to meet our clientsâ€™ needs.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:  www.inlandgroup.ca

 

As our company continues to change and grow we are seeking a qualified individual to contribute to our on-going success in the role of Operational Controller. The role will be stationed at our Corporate office in Truro, NS. The position will report directly to the Vice President, Finance.

 

About the Position:

The Operational Controller will play a key role in financial and management reporting and be responsible and accountable for the budgeting and forecasting, financial planning and business analysis, contracts, pricing, billing and all related operational finance processes. The essential duties and responsibilities of this position include (but not limited to):

  • Supporting Operations and Sales in preparing and negotiating new contracts, including reviewing and advising on proposed contract terms, preparing related pricing models and financial oversight of the customer bidding process;
  • Reviewing contacts, ensuring contract requirements are understood and met, including insurance, bond and AR/billing requirements;
  • Primary customer contact for financial issues and concerns relating to contracts, billing and budgets;
  • Managing the production of the annual budget and periodic forecasts, liaising with operating groups to gather relevant information required for the budget and forecast, and compiling data used for forecasting;
  • Managing the production of quarterly board packages and annual 5-year forecast files;
  • Supporting CEO, COO, VP Finance and Operational Management with understanding of financial results and implementation of corrective actions and improvements, including providing financial analysis and expertise to support management decision-making;
  • Setting goals and expectations as well as providing appropriate guidance, assistance, training and development to operational finance staff;
  • Provide financial analysis and expertise to support management decision-making, including explanations of variances between budget and actual results;
  • Development and ongoing reporting on KPIs for the Operational departments;
  • Signing and approving documents as required, including cheques, contracts, purchases orders, etc;
  • Assisting Corporate Accounting team with the completion of monthly financial statements and directing staff on meeting required deadlines for monthly reporting;
  • Identifying process improvements to ensure the Inland Group employs relevant and up-to-date finance related systems and procedures while optimizing efficiency;
  • Recommending new approaches, policies and practices to continually improve organizational efficiency;
  • Work cooperatively with all team members and external stakeholders involved in the completion of assigned duties;
  • Perform/complete other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by request. 

 

Qualifications:

  • CPA designation;
  • Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting or business administration, although relevant post-secondary education and a combination of continuing education and experience may be acceptable;
  • 15 years of progressively responsible experience for a major company or division of a large corporation, including supervision of finance staff;
  • Valid Passport and eligibility to travel internationally is required;
  • Working knowledge of the aviation industry considered an asset;
  • Strong analytical ability and experience developing data driven metrics;
  • Staff management skills, including mentorship, performance management and conflict resolution;
  • Computer literacy in Microsoft Office applications including Word, PowerPoint, with an emphasis on Excel based knowledge and experience;
  • Experience with financial systems in use at Inland, including Sage accounting and Agiloft, would be considered an asset;
  • Experience with foreign currency and consolidations;
  • Ability to quickly and successfully learn, interpret information and transfer knowledge to others;
  • Strong attention to detail and analytical ability;
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently while achieving outcome expectations;
  • Ability to self-manage multiple, simultaneous projects on deadline;
  • Above average written and oral communication skill;
  • Excellent presentation skills and an ability to effectively and respectfully influence people at all levels of the organization;
  • Open-minded, consultative and collaborative style;
  • Ability to work under pressure while maintaining professionalism in all interactions;
  • Willing to learn new skills and adapt to change in order to support the growth of the company.

 

About Inland: 

At Inland, we offer the following benefits, some of which are subject to eligibility requirements:

  • A rewarding and safe work environment (company provided PPE);
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching;
  • Growth and advancement opportunities for high potential employees;
  • Employee and family assistance program;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package;
  • Pension plan with employer contribution;
  • Access to group rates and discounts.

 

If you are a self-starter who is committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume to the Inland HR Team, quoting posting number 22-31.  Full job description available upon request. 

 

Please apply online.

 

Inland is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

 

Please note:  All employees working in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 unless provided by Inland with an approved accommodation under Canada's Human Rights Act.

title: Terminal Controller - Goose Bay, NL
description:
Position Description:

Are you a self-starter always thinking of better ways to do things? Are you looking to be part of a dynamic team focused on providing top-quality services to customers? If yes, please keep reading!   As a member of Sercoâ€™s dynamic team, your expertise and collaborative skills will make a positive impact towards our military defense and safety of our soldiers.

As the Royal Canadian Air Forcesâ€™ prime service provider at 5 Wing Goose Bay, Labrador, our team delivers comprehensive air operations, emergency services, logistics and engineering expertise to the Department of National Defence. We work on behalf of DNDâ€™s â€œno failâ€ mission at Goose Bay: supporting NORAD operations for the projection of air power on the north and northeast coasts of Canada, while supporting military training for the Canadian Armed Forces, Allies and NORAD. 5 Wing Goose Bay provides effective training facilities, adaptable infrastructures, and a unique, austere, and challenging training location. Currently, Serco Canada has over 1,200 employees across four provinces, including a strong and growing Indigenous workforce.

You will be part of a team that works closely with the military customer and other Serco teams to deliver quality and efficient services to DND. The Serco team has been recognized as one of Atlantic Canadaâ€™s Top Employers for 4 years in a row and received the prestigious Atlantic Canadian Aerospace and Defence Association. Industry Excellence Recognition Award for Gender and Diversity Excellence.

 

Purpose of the Job:

  • Responsible to the Lead Terminal Controller for the overall control of IFR traffic within the terminal control area by applying the rules and procedures defined in NAV CANADA MATS and other publications listed in B-GA-164-000 / AA-001
  • Ensure compliance with all Serco Canada Inc. policies and procedures, including but not limited to Code of Conduct and Ethics, Serco Management System, PDRâ€™s, etc.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Shall assist in training of Air Traffic Control personnel.
  • May be required to assume the duties of Lead Terminal Controller as applicable.
  • Ensure all assigned deliverables and other reports are completed accurately and on time.
  • Visibly demonstrate Serco Values and work practices while completing duties.
  • Other related duties relevant to this position as may be required.

Other:  

  • Performs other tasks as assigned.
  • When required, cross train peer(s) to complete relevant tasks (e.g. vacation coverage, perform Acting duties, etc.)

   

**This position is located in Goose Bay and it is not a Fly In-Fly Out position**

Qualifications:

Requirements:

  • Must possess a valid Canadian Forces, or Transport Canada/Nav Canada, or ICAO equivalent Air Traffic Control License.
  • A previous Terminal/Arrival endorsement is required.
  • Must be able to pass and maintain a Transport Canada Class II aviation medical.
  • Must have or be able to obtain a Transport Canada Radio Operators certificate.
  • Experience in controlling military fighter jets and/or working in a complex terminal/arrival sector would be an asset.
  • Possession of a valid Class 5 NL Driverâ€™s license.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain Secret Level II security clearance is required.

 Competencies:

  • Effective communication skills and ability to work cross functionally within the organization.
  • Excellent collaborative and organizational skills.
  • Strong degree of integrity and judgment.
  • Willing to take ownership for the outcomes of tasks within scope of responsibility.
  • Strong planning, coordination, execution and analytical skills.
  • Proven ability to meet deadlines and changing priorities.
  • Employees  who have to drive a company vehicle must also provide a copy of their Driver Abstract.

title: Assistant Financial Controller - US Controllership
description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management. 

 

 

The Opportunity

The Assistant Financial Controller (AFC) will work with the Manager, Financial Controllership to support the controllership functions for Open Text’s legacy and newly acquired US entities. With $1B + in total revenue in the US, the AFC will be an integral part of the accounting cycle, providing support to the broader finance team, assisting in accounting and financial reporting activities as well as regional requirements for the particular legal entities in the US. The AFC will be a key member of the North American finance team, managing traditional controllership responsibilities, in addition to being a significant contributor to the consolidated US GAAP close.

 

You Are Great At

Responsible for the US GAAP close for US entities:

  • Perform analytical review of period end financial results, including I/S and B/S review.
  • Respond to monthly questions from management on the balance sheet and P&L review.
  • Prepare the monthly and quarterly analytical review documents.
  • Prepare the quarterly and annual financial statements.
  • Prepare the annual legal entity memos.
  • Review account reconciliations and promote best practices with Accounting Services to ensure proper accounting and controls are in place.
  • Gain an understanding of business changes and drivers the contribute to month over month, and quarter over quarter variances

 

Provides support for new acquisitions and legal entity system migrations

  • Participate in post-acquisition integration activities
  • Participate in migration meetings and conference calls when required
  • Work with our tax and legal teams on legal and tax step plans
  • Assist with general ledger migrations

 

Responsible for other US controllership requirements:

  • Support the tax group in the preparation of the annual tax return, including the preparation of tax information packages for provisions and tax returns
  • Support our indirect tax teams during sales tax audits by providing supporting financial information
  • Provide support material for tax compliance requirements
  • Assist with commodity and income tax audits
  • Liaison with FP&A regarding finance matters pertaining to the US
  • Prepare and file US statistical filings
  • Work closely with the Corporate Accounting team to resolve technical accounting matters and assuring all processes remain efficient and effective
  • Leading and/or participating in broader finance transformation projects

 

Provides local support to the business for matters pertaining to the US:

  • Assists the business in addressing finance matters
  • Provides general support and information to the business as requested
  • Act as the face of the Chief Accounting Officer (CAO) organization to the rest of the business functions.

 

What It Takes

  • 5+ years of experience in a finance leadership role, preferably in a technology company
  • Finance degree (CA, CMA, CGA, or equivalent)
  • Experience with general controllership requirements
  • Good knowledge of U.S. GAAP reporting
  • Strong collaboration and organizational skills
  • Must be meticulous and detail oriented
  • Capable of working independently, multi-tasking to establish priorities, and completing objectives without supervision in a fast paced environment.
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Knowledge of SAP is an asset

 

 

 

 

OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact

accomodationrequests@opentext.com

).

title: Contrôleur financier
description:
Poste de Contrôleur Financier

Vous avez envie de travailler pour une entreprise en pleine expansion? Vous êtes à la recherche d’un rôle de Contrôleur financier ? Vous n’avez pas peur du défi et vous désirez travailler pour un leader dans son marché ?

Sous la supervision du Directeur Financier, nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne autonome, ayant un grand sens de la communication et qui a une bonne capacité d’analyse.


Avantages
Le poste de Contrôleur Financier-Poste permanent comporte de nombreux avantages :

-Salaire très compétitif;
-Assurances collectives complètes payées à 50% par l’employeur (modulable);
-Télémédecine disponible;
-Horaire flexible de 37.5 heures par semaine, présentiel;
-REER collectif avec cotisation de 1,5% de l’employeur;
-Entreprise avec une belle notoriété sur le marché.


Responsabilités
Les fonctions du Contrôleur Financier -Poste permanent-Québec sont très variées :

- Responsable du département de la comptabilité et supervision de l’équipe (3 employés) pour 8 entités distinctes;
- Effectuer la révision des fins de mois et préparer les états financiers;
- Gestion de la trésorerie;
- Procéder à la préparation du dossier de fin d’année pour les vérificateurs externes;
- S’assurer de l’exactitude des documents gouvernementaux à produire;
- Élaboration et suivi du budget annuel, corriger les prévisions;
- Procéder à différentes analyses financières et proposer des stratégies financières;
- Mise à jour des procédures internes et amélioration continue;
- Répondre aux questions des vérificateurs comptables;
- Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.


Qualifications
Le poste de Contrôleur Financier–Poste permanent nécessite les qualifications suivantes :

-BAA en comptabilité ou expérience;
-Expérience minimal de 5 ans recherchée;
-Expérience en multi-entreprises;
-Expérience en gestion de personnel;
-Débrouillardise, autonomie et leadership sont des qualités recherchées.


Sommaire
Pour manifester votre intérêt, vous pouvez me contacter :
Annie-Pier Bouchard au 418.572-5512
Directrice, services professionnels
Annie-Pier.Bouchard@randstad.ca
www.randstad.ca

Vous n'êtes pas prêt à postuler, ou vous avez des questionnements en lien avec votre cheminement de carrière? Vous pouvez me joindre, il me fera plaisir de discuter avec vous de vos aspirations professionnelles et de vous épauler dans vos recherches.

L’humain en tête.


Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Controller
description:
The Organization

De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

 

Profile

The Controller is a senior member of the management team reporting to the Director of Finance. The Controller is primarily responsible for the direct supervision of all accounting and financial functions, including the generation of monthly financial reports, maintenance of strong internal controls designed to mitigate risk, enhance the accuracy of the company's reported financial results, and ensure that management is provided with information to make sound business decisions.

 

Duties & Responsibilities

Financial Governance

  • Responsible for all month close activities and preparation of accurate consolidated financial results for the group.
  • Oversee accounting, payroll and financial operations of all business units.
  • Responsible for implementing, monitoring, and maintaining internal control systems, payroll, U.S. Federal and State tax compliance.
  • Manages the annual financial statement audit, acting as key point of contact for external auditors. Responsible for providing auditors with all required working papers, disclosures, and analysis.
  • Responsible for statutory filings for all the entities in the group including corporate tax returns, SRED returns and GST/PST returns.
  • Manage treasury activities, including the issuance and management of letters of credit and the administration of foreign exchange hedging programs.
  • Develops and monitors manufacturing performance metrics (chargeability, efficiency, yield).
  • Prepares analysis of asset utilization and investment efficiency metrics (inventory turnover, ROA, ROI, make vs. buy analysis).
  • Acts as a key resource for the ERP financial software system consolidation transition to one system across the group.
  • Support ad hoc requests from leadership as required.

Stakeholder Engagement

  • Provide strategic recommendations to the Director of Finance and Executive leadership team.
  • Identify and address financial risks and opportunities for the company.
  • Guides financial decisions by establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures and provides advice to senior management.

Strategic and Operational Management

  • In collaboration with the Finance leadership team, assist in the development and execution of a centralized shared services finance model across De Havilland legal business entitles.
  • Maximizes return on financial assets by establishing financial policies, procedures, internal controls, and reporting systems.
  • Collect, interpret, and report financial data in a MD&A document to be distributed to management and Board of Directors monthly.
  • Prepares quarterly reports of financial and operating metrics for the Audit Committee and the Board of Directors.

Leadership

  • Lead, inspire, mentor, and motivate a team of accounting and finance professionals in multiple geographies to drive optimal performance and maintain strong morale. Provide leadership and guidance by delegating tasks, advising on technical problems, and streamlining processes.
  • Coach and mentor the Finance team through collaboration and a mindset of continuous improvement.
  • Establish and develop relationships with senior management and external partners.

 

Education & Professional Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education in Accounting or Finance along with relevant work experience. CPA designation required.
  • Minimum 5-10 years' experience in accounting/finance in a Controller or Senior Manager role with consolidation experience involving multi currency reporting.
  • Minimum 5-7 yrs. experience managing/coaching and mentoring a team of finance/accounting professionals.

 

Experience 

  • Previous experience working in a manufacturing environment is considered an asset.
  • Previous experience implementing an ERP system is considered an asset.
  • Extensive knowledge of accounting and financial management principles and procedures is required.

 

Skills

  • Must possess a high level of moral judgment for handling confidential information and monetary transactions.
  • Strong leadership skills coupled with experience as a financial management leader within a team focused culture that supports people and performance.
  • Strong business intelligence/data analytics skills. Experience creating automated reports and dashboards.
  • Advanced knowledge/experience using Microsoft Excel, Access, Power BI, Power Query.
  • Previous experience working with multiple legal entities is a preference.
  • Previous experience with ERP software (Visual, SAP) and ability to learn new and different ERP software.
  • Strong knowledge of auditing, accounting, and corporate finance principles.
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong internal and external business relationships.
  • Solution oriented, customer service focus, and positive “can do” team attitude.
  • Strong grasp of internal controls and finance procedures and practices.
  • Clearly understands how to assess the importance of tasks and decisions and set priorities, focusing time/energy on the most important issues/opportunities.
  • Effective attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy.
  • Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communications skills required with demonstrated ability to handle confidential information in a professional manner.

 

At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation and disability, are encouraged to apply.

title: Controller
description:
Come build with a BC Top Employer 2022 winner!

Jacob Bros Construction is immediately hiring a Controllerto support the Accounting & Finance team at our head office in South Surrey, BC.

Please note this position is 100% office based.

Responsibilities:
  • Reports to the CFO; supervises and directs Accounting & Finance Team
  • Leads Monthly Job Cost Reviews with Project Managers
  • Directs procedures and systems necessary for the maintenance of proper records and adequate accounting controls and services
  • Prepares monthly financial statements for each corporate entity
  • Manages analysis of operating companies
  • Prepares year-end financial statements in partnership with CFO and external accountants
  • Monitors and controls Capital Asset Accounting
  • Maintains Chart of Accounts, G/L, sub-ledgers, and inter-company reconciliations
  • Maintains Sage Accounting System
  • Ensures compliance required by regulatory agencies including GST, PST, Corp Tax etc.
  • Oversees hourly employee payroll, including reconciliation of WCB and T4’s
  • Processes salaried employee payroll
  • Reviews and streamlines work processes and procedures to ensure maximum efficiency and effectiveness in conjunction with the CFO
  • Oversees filing systems; both electronic and hard copy
  • Special projects and ad hoc financial analysis and reporting as required
Requirements:
  • Minimum five (5)+ years of progressively responsible financial management experience in a medium size private enterprise or similar environment
  • Proven management and supervisory skills are required
  • Proven track record of forming positive working relationships with every level in the organization
  • Professional accounting designation or pending completion required
  • Construction or related industry experience strongly preferred
Your Rewards:
  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Group Medical, Extended Health and Dental Plan
  • Matched RRSP contribution
  • Eligibility for Profit Sharing Program
  • Three weeks vacation
  • New 50,000 square foot office and maintenance facility in South Surrey with full gym and on-site personal trainer

About Jacob Bros:

At Jacob Bros, our team of talented construction professionals is taking on some the most challenging projects in British Columbia's construction industry.

We are one of BC’s largest and most respected construction organizations, offering construction services in a variety of markets including heavy civil construction, major public infrastructure, and industrial, commercial, institutional and residential projects.

Jacob Bros has proudly served every major sector of Western Canada’s construction industry since 2008, and has been consistently recognized as a BC Top Employer.

Jacob Bros employs over 300 construction professionals, including staff and craft employees.

No agencies please.

title: Contrôleur(se) financier(ère)
description:
Description de l'entreprise

TONIC DNA est une maison de production qui offre un service complet en animation et disposant d'un contenu créatif de haute-qualité. Avec plus de 35 ans d’expérience dans le domaine de l’animation, le studio est à la fine pointe des technologies numériques et offre une gamme complète des services reliés à la production de publicités, de séries animées, de courts et de longs métrages, ainsi que des solutions de contenu de marque, numériques ou interactives, pour des clients partout dans le monde.

Description du poste

Contexte de recrutement. Il s'agit d'un contrat temporaire commencant idéalement en mai 2022 pour se terminer en octobre 2023 (remplacement d'un congé de maternité). 

Le poste plus en détails

Relevant directement du directeur général, vous serez son bras droit au niveau de la gestion complète des opérations financières et comptables de l’entreprise. Le ou la candidate devra faire preuve d’organisation et d’agilité dans la gestion des nombreux dossiers qui lui seront confiés. Il devra également être en mesure de bien représenter la culture d’entreprise et les valeurs de Tonic DNA dans ses opérations quotidiennes.

Si l’idée de joindre une équipe dynamique au sein d’une entreprise en pleine expansion vous stimule au plus haut point, ce défi est pour vous!

Vos responsabilités: 

  • Planifier, diriger et coordonner toutes les fonctions opérationnelles relatives à la comptabilité;
  • Coordonner et préparer les états financiers internes et externes;
  • Coordonner les activités des vérificateurs externes;
  • Préparation des rencontres mensuelles avec l’équipe de direction incluant la présentation des résultats et l’analyse des écarts; 
  • Participation à l’élaboration de tableaux de bord pour les membres de la direction;
  • Fournir à la direction l’information essentielle pour des prises de décisions éclairées;
  • Gérer le processus budgétaire
  • Supervise la production de la paie ;
  • Évaluer les activités de comptabilité actuelles, offrir des recommandations afin de les améliorer et mettre en place de nouveaux processus;
  • Évaluer les systèmes comptables et les systèmes de contrôle interne;
  • Évaluer l’efficacité des logiciels comptables et de la base de données connexe, au besoin;
  • Élaborer et faire le suivi des mesures de rendement de l’entreprise;
  • Participer aux projets de croissance de l’entreprise, acquisitions, partenariats;
  • Superviser les obligations réglementaires, qui incluent souvent la planification fiscale et la conformité ;
  • Préparation des demandes de crédits d’impôts multimédias
  • Effectuer les rapports de taxes (fédérales et provinciales)
  • Superviser le travail de la commis-comptabilité & paie et participer au développement adéquat de son apprentissage pour permettre une grande efficacité et un engagement optimal
  • Être la personne-ressource pour supporter les systèmes comptables et de suivis de projets
Qualifications

  • Baccalauréat en comptabilité ou finance;
  • Détenir un titre CPA (atout);
  • Expérience de 3-5 ans dans un poste similaire;
  • Excellentes capacité d’analyse; 
  • Facilité à communiquer;
  • Connaissance du logiciel Génie Comptable (un atout)


Informations complémentaires

Contrat temporaire pour une durée de 2 ans. La date de début serait idéalement mai 2022. 

Assurances après trois mois (comprend soins visuels, assurances maladies complémentaires, assurance vie). 

Travail hybride et flexible. Vous choisissez les jours où vous souhaitez travailler de chez vous ou de notre studio. Nous sommes situés proche de la station de métro Lionel Groux.

title: Controller
description:
Financial Controller
Part-Time (Option for Full Time)
Work Location: Elmira, ON
Compensation:$35-$50/hour

Company Overview
Earthscape Ontario is recognized as an award-winning design-build firm that specializes in high-end residential landscaping. We are a group of young, enthusiastic, creative dreamers and builders who work hard and are exceptionally proud of what we design and create. We have a positive, productive, fun and rewarding environment, with enough challenges and opportunities to keep us growing. For examples of past landscape design-build projects, visit our website at www.earthscape.ca.

The Role
The Controller reports directly to the CEO and is responsible for all accounting operations of the company. The role has two direct report bookkeepers and is responsible for all Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, accounting, the production of financial statements, revenue and expense recognition, and our audits. The Controller owns the accounting technology, processes, and controls. The successful candidate will engage in proactive problem solving, process development, and make recommendations to the Leadership Team that will enhance our financial and business strategy.

Responsibilities

  • Maintain and enforce a documented system of accounting policies and procedures
  • Calculate variances from the budget and report significant issues to management
  • Ensure that bank, merchant, and sales reconciliations are completed
  • Issue timely and complete financial statements
  • Recommend benchmarks against which to measure the performance of company operations
  • Calculate and issue on-time financial and operating metrics 
  • Manage the production of the annual budget and forecasts in concert with our leadership team
  • Provide supervision, leadership and development of the accounting team
  • Act as the primary point of contact with our external accounting firm

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting or business
  • Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation preferred
  • 10+ years of progressively responsible experience in accounting with both public accounting and private industry experience
  • Exceptional knowledge of accounting, A/R, A/P, General Ledger, Audits, Canadian Accounting Standards (GAAP, ASPE)
  • Excellent computer skills; experience in accounting software (QuickBooks), expense management tools, invoice retention tools, as well as Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Analytical ability to develop and implement improvements or recommendations
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong team-work and communication skills
  • Ability to prioritize and escalate
  • Exemplifies precision culture and core values
  • Proactive problem solver with the ability to identify issues and tasks without being asked or notified

What's in it for you?

This job will offer you the opportunity to support some of Ontario's most innovative landscaping projects.  The pace, challenges and problem-solving opportunities will mean you are never bored.  You will have the chance to develop and refine a wide variety of skills in our rapidly growing business.  Your dynamic and highly-skilled colleagues have an impressive range of backgrounds, skills and expertise.  Above all they are dedicated to Earthscape's success.

We believe strongly in rewarding our staff with a combination of:

  • share ownership options and profit sharing
  • flexible working hours
  • hybrid home/office work options
  • benefits for full-time employees
  • friendly work environment surrounded by dedicated and professional colleagues

Compensation: $35-$50/hr

Accommodations: We are committed to treating all people in a way that respects their dignity and independence. Should you require any accommodation during the recruitment process or otherwise, please notify us of this when you apply and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Pre-employment checks: As part of our selection process, successful candidates may be required to consent to background checks relevant to the role, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, criminal offense and driver's license record. 

Safety protocols: Throughout the COVID19 pandemic, Earthscape is following the recommendations of public health authorities. For more information about our COVID safety protocols, please reach out to our team.

title: Controller
description:
mCloud Technologies Corp. (“mCloud”) is one of Canada's fastest growing tech companies, most recently ranking #57 on the Deloitte Fast 500 List and #2 on the Canada Clean Technology Fast 50 list. As a global provider, mCloud is committed to solving the worlds most challenging energy problems with AI and its proprietary solution AssetCareTM. In November 2021, mCloud successfully up listed to the Nasdaq, positioning the company to accelerate R&D, take new solutions to market, and expand its presence internationally.  The Company currently reports in Canada on the TSX.V and in the USA on the Nasdaq.

The Controller will oversee mCloud's accounting operations. The successful candidate will be a versatile professional with excellent communication skills. You're motivated to achieve efficiencies through continuous improvement and systemization. The Controller plays a key role in partnering with the business and finance leadership team, informing leadership of actual and projected performance. Furthermore, the Controller will analyze business trends, changes, and new initiatives in a fast paced, dynamic, and highly collaborative, cross-functional environment. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, driven, have strong business acumen, and will enjoy diving into the details.

This position can be based out of Calgary, Alberta or Vancouver, British Columbia.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions reporting to the Director, Finance
  • Maintain, review, and complete all general ledger reconciliations and financial report analysis, investigating and resolving account discrepancies
  • Responsible for ensuring accounting software is maintained current, accurate and used to its most effective capabilities by all level users
  • Review working papers for quarterly and year-end reporting
  • Preparation of annual/monthly budgets and forecasts as required
  • Ensure accounting entries are made promptly, accurately and supported including reconciling accounts on a monthly basis
  • Daily cash management and forecasting processes
  • Ownership of the accounts receivable and accounts payable functions and related accounting processes, including receivable collections
  • Oversee filing of GST/PST returns
  • Review bank reconciliations
  • Wires and online banking
  • Review, analyze and implement internal controls/business policies and procedures
  • Responsible for HR and employee management including hiring, training, supervising and resourcing accounting staff
  • Special projects on an individual or team basis as assigned.

Must Have Experience, Education, and Designations:

  • Professional Accounting Designation (CPA preferred) with 5+ years of experience
  • Knowledge of finance, accounting, IFRS, budgeting, forecasting, risk management, operational finance
  • Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills including the ability to think outside the box, and see the “big picture”
  • Strong relationship builder and collaborative team player with ability to influence stakeholders
  • Excellent team leader with the ability to motivate, coach and develop upcoming talent
  • Passion for continuous improvement

About you:

You are approachable, confident, forward-thinking, and have a winning teamwork attitude. As a self-starter, you multitask and adapt to changing priorities. You are creative in problem-solving and excel in a dynamic work environment. Overall, you navigate and act inclusively and collaboratively in an organization that brings together many different perspectives and skill sets from all over the world.

About us:

mCloud is unlocking the untapped potential of energy-intensive assets using IoT, AI, and the cloud. We operate three lines of business, connecting and optimizing assets like HVAC units in commercial buildings, wind turbines in renewable energy, and the control systems at process industry facilities. We're a global company, headquartered in Calgary with a presence across North America, the UK and continental Europe, the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and China.

Today, we connect and manage over 59,000 energy assets through our AssetCare™ platform. We help our customers double asset productivity, reduce their asset energy consumption by up to 25%, and triple the speed at which they are able to respond to the unexpected. mCloud helps eliminate about 80,000 tons in greenhouse gas emissions every year – or the same amount of GHG emitted by 18,000 passenger cars on the road.

Solving the world's most challenging energy problems is hard work – it takes dedicated, talented, and innovative people working together as one team to make it all happen. We are a team, which means "we" comes before "me." And we are driven to deliver measurable, bottom-line results for our customers everywhere through our technology. We get stuff done and we have fun doing it!

Why you want to join our team:

If you want to be part of an elite team with the ambition to become Canada's next big unicorn tech company, mCloud is the place for you. We are a team that helps one another succeed and thrive – you will get the autonomy, support, and flexibility you need to be successful from every part of our business.

Why you shouldn't join our team:

We are busy and fast-paced! We work hard. We are a global company, so our hours are not standard. Sometimes you might be up early or work late to meet with people in different time zones, but with that comes flexibility.

Our expectations are high. This is not an organization where you can hide or not constantly be driving for results.

No day is ever the same, and most days, you come in with a list of things to do, and then something happens, and you need to pivot.

We do not tolerate people who are only in it for themselves. We are a team, and we are all in the business of helping those around us succeed. We expect and demand nothing less.

title: Assistant Controller
description:
TELUS Agriculture is a great place to work. You can see it in our team members. The diversity of the team and their unique contributions set us apart from the competition. Our success is based as much on our future friendly team as the innovative technology solutions we offer.

Our team members include people like you – enthusiastic, innovative, passionate and energetic. We believe that you'll find our high-performance culture personally fulfilling, professionally challenging and financially rewarding.

Here's the impact you will make and what we will accomplish together

The Assistant Controller for Decision Support is responsible for ensuring financial information is properly planned, reported, and analyzed in a timely and accurate manner to allow for more efficient business decision-making by senior leadership

Here's how

• Prepare monthly, annual, and multi-year budgets in support of operational objectives (revenue,  costs, headcount, capex) 

• Produce accurate monthly reporting including variance analysis, written commentary, KPIs,  scorecards  

• Perform analysis of key business information and drivers, presenting recommendations to  business and finance leadership 

• Work inter-departmentally to provide quantitative and qualitative analysis to articulate business  risks and opportunities 

• Partner with the business to ensure there is a deep understanding of the cost base and instill  strong cost discipline 

• Assist Accounting with the month-end close process 

• Monitor and drive improvements in key financial processes to optimize efficiency and quality of data 

• Perform Ad Hoc analysis and develop financial models and business cases to identify operational  efficiencies and support strategic business initiatives; Act as insightful Business Partner to guide  decision making  

• Take ownership of own personal development by ensuring PDP remains relevant and activities  identified are executed on a timely basis 

What you bring to the role

• 3-5 years of experience in same or similar role 

• Bachelor's degree (Finance or Accounting preferred) 

• Proficient with MS Office applications (advanced Excel skills) 

• Strong verbal and written communications skills  

Strong financial modeling and information presentation skills, including financial planning, forecasting, and reporting  

• Advanced knowledge of accounting and finance theory with the ability to perform complex  financial analyses

• Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities within tight  deadlines 

• Excellent numeracy and problem-solving capabilities 

• Experience forecasting and modeling in a SaaS environment preferred 

• Experience operating in a complex matrix organizational structure and fast-paced business  environment across different time zones preferred 

• Strong working knowledge of U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and IFRS • SAP experience preferred 

• Capable self-starter 

• Detail oriented 

• Strong analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills 

• Ability to communicate and interact with all levels of the organization as well as cross functionally 

Who is TELUS Agriculture?

Our growing team of global experts are passionate about leveraging our world-class technology and innovation to tackle one of the most pressing social challenges of our time – more efficient production, while lowering the impact on the environment. We believe that by delivering digital insights and solutions that empower and connect producers to consumers we can improve the quality, safety and sustainability of our food and consumer goods. 

We offer an unmatched suite of innovative solutions and purpose-built applications for every participant in the supply chain, from seed manufacturers and farmers through to grocery stores and restaurants. Our solutions are comprised of the latest technologies to enable all organizations in agribusiness, animal health, food, beverage, consumer goods and retail: Exceedra, Agrian, TKXS, Farm At Hand, Decisive Farming, Muddy Boots, AGIntegrated, Blacksmith Applications, Herdtrax and Feedlot Health Management Services.

Collectively, our talented team and integrated solutions uniquely position us to transform collaboration within the industry at a global level, empowering and connecting producers to consumers for a more efficient, sustainable future.

Everyone belongs at TELUS Agriculture. It doesn't matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS Agriculture, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.

Do you share our passion for enabling remarkable human outcomes?

At TELUS Agriculture, let's make the future friendly.

title: Cost Controller
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Woodâ€™s Power Solutions business performs consulting and EPCM services for many of Canadaâ€™s power generation and power distribution companies.  

 

Wood currently has an exciting opportunity for a Cost Controller.  Reporting to the Project Controls Manager, this position is located in Vancouver, BC.   If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Key responsibilities:    

  • Analyzing and forecasting project costs as well as developing, preparing and collecting schedule and cost data for monthly project reports
  • Reporting project cost status to management for internal reviews, as well as analyzing cost variances and recommending corrective actions
  • Setting up projects and tracking and analyzing engineering man-hours and associated costs within Wood's proprietary management system.
  • Reviewing project scope change(s) and preparing change order requests to ensure proper justification, schedule impacts, and adequate budget and funding
  • Assist with the coordination of resource planning within the business unit; including maintaining and updating associated resource planning system
  • Coordinate the administration of consultant time, including performing weekly timesheet reconciliation, monthly timesheet uploads and preparation of invoice reconciliation sheet for Accounts Payable processing
  • Provide timesheet support to the business unit, including troubleshooting issues and completing timesheet corrections as required
  • Maintain various project lists and assist with the generation and maintenance of various excel files and templates
  • Assist engineering/project controls with various tasks as required
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills is essential
  • Detail and results oriented with the capacity to successfully manage multiple and competing priorities and timelines
  • Superior analytical, problem solving, audit and investigation skills
  • Demonstrated effective communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with multiple internal disciplines and external customers
  • An interest in a career in project controls, with some knowledge and understanding of basic cost control principles including earned value management
  • A degree in a relevant discipline is preferred
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Regional Controller - North America
description:
About our Client

Success and constant growth

Our client, a leader in the technology field and experiencing sustained growth, is looking for a Regional Controller to lead the North American accounting team.

This dynamic company has been in business for over 40 years and has established itself as a leader in the technology field while offering renowned consulting services to its loyal and diversified clientele around the world and in all fields of activity.

You will have the opportunity to join this dedicated, ambitious, and innovative company that provides unparalleled customer service while developing the full potential of its employees.

Culture and Values

Winner of numerous awards and recognized for the excellence of its services

Our client is committed to excellent customer service, employee development, teamwork, and an engaging work atmosphere. They offer a dynamic work environment in an ever-changing industry. You will join a friendly environment that encourages you to use your professional skills while allowing you to add new strings to your bow.

Our client also stands out with a multitude of awards for excellence and an employee-driven social program.

Brief Description

Reporting to the Regional CFO, the Regional Controller leads and oversees the North American accounting team. He is responsible for the monthly accounting closing process, financial reporting, and analysis to support the company's decision-making processes and acts as a financial liaison with the Regional CFO, FP&A, and Global Finance.

He ensures a timely accounting close process to enable the presentation of monthly regional consolidated financial statements and analysis to management. In addition, he develops and implements harmonized financial processes and tools according to given action plans and actively develops the required skills within the accounting team.

The Regional Controller will play a key role in the regional finance team.

Main Tasks and Responsibilities

  • Produce monthly and year-end financial statements for multiple legal entities with different currencies, including regional consolidation.
  • Lead the preparation of periodic financial reports and month-to-month analysis, balance sheet documentation as well as ad hoc analyses.
  • Responsible for financial reporting procedures to ensure accurate and quality information for strategic and operational decisions.
  • Plan, organize, and review activities of the accounting team including customer billing, accounts receivable, accounts payable, credit and collections, assets and inventory, commissions, and cash management.
  • Lead the year-end audit process for the region, ensuring financial statements comply with generally accepted accounting standards and practices; interact with financial auditors.
  • Promote the use of common and harmonized processes and tools across the region based on best practices/strategies.
  • Collaborate and align with FP&A and Global Finance to provide advisory support to planning initiatives through financial analysis and management information, reports, and recommendations.
  • Participate in the development and implementation of policies and procedures and ensure all internal controls and procedures are in place and effective.
  • Supervise a team of 14 people in Canada, the United States, and Mexico
  • Participate in other special projects as required for the growth of the company.

Required Qualifications

Training

  • Hold a recognized accounting designation (CPA, CA)

Professional experience

  • A minimum of 7 years of relevant experience
  • Experience working in a multi-site environment and international operations
  • Experience managing a full-cycle accounting team

Key Competencies

  • Good knowledge of IFRS standards
  • Knowledge of SAP
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and French

Abilities

  • Demonstrated management skills
  • Ability to foster employee performance and development
  • Decision-making skills
  • Initiative and autonomy with a strong sense of responsibility
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
  • Organized and rigorous
  • Act as an agent of change

Only the people selected for an interview will be contacted. We support the principle of employment equity.

TALINKO is a recruitment firm of middle and senior executives also offering support in the recruitment of members of the board of directors or advisory committee. We operate in different business sectors.
