title: Senior Cost Controller
description:
Company Description

Do you want to be part of our successful Real Estate team supporting top clients for Turner & Townsend in Toronto?  We are hiring an ambitious and forward thinking Senior Cost Consultant to work in our growing team.

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Our team is dynamic, innovative and client-focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver.  As a result our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world.

Who are you?

You are an experienced Associate Director/Senior Cost Consultant with a minimum of 7 years post-graduate experience looking for the next step or are currently undertaking a similar role in a similar environment

 

Job Description

As an Senior Cost Consultant, you will be involved in:

  • Implement, administer and maintain cost control system and procedures to track project budgets, commitments, expenditures and forecasts for projects of medium complexity and value
  • Preparation and review of cost estimates
  • Provide cost information to support decision and alternative selection
  • Evaluate and analyse fee proposals / bids and provide recommendation for decision making
  • Provide forecasts and cash flow analysis
  • Manage the cost report and provide regular updates on financial position
  • Manage the development, validation and maintenance of the project schedule
  • Develop reporting tracking tools and generates cost reports on regular basis including evaluation of earned value
  • Build intricate spreadsheets to enable fast and accurate data manipulation of large datasets
  • Extract data from several sources, transforming it to fit operational needs
  • Reconcile data to support complete accuracy and creates a clean audit trail

Other Key responsibilities at senior level 

  • Business Development – Being aware and proactive to highlight potential opportunities to Associate Directors and Directors
  • Staff management– Input into performance review process of consultants and graduate consultants
  • Recruitment - Inclusion in selection and recruitment process, including interviews
  • Knowledge management – Ensuring that key information and learning generated from each commission is input into the Turner & Townsend internal database
Qualifications

  • 10 years of Cost Control experience
  • A recognized university degree in Construction Management or related field
  • Membership in a relevant professional organizations (i.e. RICS, AACEI).
  • Certification or designation from a professional organization is an asset (i.e. MRICS, CCP)


Additional Information

Turner & Townsend is a leading independent professional services company specializing in program management, project management, cost management and consulting across the property, infrastructure and natural resources sectors. With 108 offices in 45 countries, we draw on our extensive global and industry experience to manage risk while maximizing value and performance during the construction and operation of our clients’ assets. We are an Equal opportunity employer who will ensure accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities upon request

Turner & Townsend does not accept any speculative or unsolicited CV’s that have been sent to our internal recruitment team or hiring managers from agencies outside of our preferred supplier list. Any speculative or unsolicited CV’s will be treated as a direct application.

title: Assistant Controller
description:
Overview:

Assistant Controller

We are looking for an Assistant Controller  to join a global engineering and manufacturing leader in tech that does cool stuff that matters. In this role, you  will be responsible for ensuring accurate financial reporting of the division's results while working to improve understanding of key business drivers. Identification and implementation of best practices comprise a key component of this role,  as well as ensuring effective controls in the financial management reporting systems. The successful candidate will be a highly resourceful individual who can understand a broad range of accounting, financial reporting and tax challenges. Excellent skills in financial analysis are essential for this role. A deep understanding of IFRS accounting standards, and a working knowledge of US GAAP accounting standards and income tax rules (both Canadian and US) is also essential.

 

The Company:Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector and mobility applications. Youâ€™ll be joining over 22,000 people in 50 countries on the leading edge of your field.    

 

This position is with Hexagonâ€™s Autonomy & Positioning division, a global technology leader, pioneering end-to-end solutions industry leaders rely on for assured positioning and autonomy on land, sea and air. Our work touches every aspect of life, from sustainability on Earth to enabling autonomy. Within the Autonomy & Positioning division your work will contribute to the operation of our brand(s) NovAtel, AutonomouStuff, VERIPOS and Antcom.

 

The Location: Hexagon is a global company with locations around the world. This position is based in Calgary, Alberta.  

 

Responsibilities:

As an  Assistant Controller, you will:

  • Manage the monthly, quarterly and annual financial close processes and provide financial analysis to management
  • Prepare, review and evaluate monthly, quarterly and annual consolidation accounting and elimination entries with supporting working papers
  • Report divisional revenue to internal stakeholders
  • Conduct analytical business unit performance reviews compared to forecast/budget for management reporting, and present findings and recommendations
  • Oversee business unit month-end accounting, ensure processes are followed, and results comply with the companyâ€™s accounting policies
  • Maintain professional relationships with external auditors and compile interim and annual working papers for successful external audit requirements
  • Prepare and review working papers for the filing of multi-geography tax filings to ensure statutory deadlines are met, including providing supporting data for corporate tax filings and taking overall responsibility for provincial and federal tax compliance
  • Continuously evaluate accounting processes and provide feedback to effectively design preventative and detective controls  
  • Exercise professional judgment to strike the right balance between business objectives of the division and the reporting requirements under IFRS
  • Perform accounting research and implement new accounting standards; remain abreast of IASB and FASB accounting developments
  • Participate in performing ad hoc analysis and other duties as required
  • Manage responsibilities for an indirect tax analyst, cost accountant and treasury analyst, providing transactional advice and playing a mentorship role
Qualifications:

Must Have:

  • CPA designation
  • Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in accounting
  • Deep understanding of IFRS accounting standards
  • Working knowledge of US GAAP accounting standards
  • Proficient MS Office skills including the ability to use pivot table and simple macros as well as the ability to work with and analyze large data sets
  • Experience in multi-divisional consolidations and foreign currency translations
  • Strong accounting, reporting and analytical skills
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Highly motivated, organized, reliable, enthusiastic self-starter with the ability to work independently when required

Key Success Factors:

  • Team player with the ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and strict deadlines
  • Regularly offer process improvement ideas, share best practices and facilitate standardization among business units
  • Excellent analytical skills and initiative to solve problems
  • Excellent people skills and the ability to motivate lower-level staff to do their best in a supportive environment

Nice to Have:

  • Extensive experience and understanding of accounting systems (ERP Systems), and consolidation systems (Hyperion or OneStream) would be considered assets

title: Group Controller
description:
Job Description

Group Controller

 

Reports to: Vice President, Accounting

 

Primary Responsibilities

 

A Group Controller will have financial oversight of multiple dealerships. They will be a key operational partner to the senior leadership team.

 

Primary Duties

  • Overall responsibility for the assets of the dealership in conjunction with the General Manager
  • Oversee staff for day-to-day accounting at multiple stores
  • Play an integral role in the accounting. May post deals and schedule cleans, depending on size of store
  • Responsible for finalizing statements and submission to banks and manufacturer
  • Responsible for inventory financing and following the financial institution rules with respect to payouts and such
  • Responsible for counting inventory – vehicles and parts
  • Responsible for year-end working papers
  • Responsible for financial information, numbers and information produced by the team and strives to ensure integrity and accuracy
  • Leads accounting team to deliver information of the highest quality
  • Budgets: plays a leadership role in the budgeting process, including the timelines, communication, execution, consolidated, summarization and reporting  

Requirements

  • An accounting designation is required
  • Previous experience as a Controller in the auto industry is preferred
  • Experience with VBA, Access or Power BI is also awesome, but also not required
  • You eat, sleep and breathe Excel
  • You can prepare monthly financial statements, detailed departmental budgets, and year-end audit statements like it’s a walk in the park
  • General accounting functions are the jam to your toast
  • Let’s see those dollar signs! You’ve got ideas and strategies that help contribute to the overall profit and success of the dealership
  • Things around here are great, but you’re ready to make them even better! You’re over the moon to help improve financial controls and develop policies and procedures

Benefits

  • Competitive starting salary
  • 100% company paid health and dental benefits including a Health Spending and Lifestyle Spending Account
  • Access to our own Employee Investment Program that guarantees a 10% return every year (max of 25%) based on Go Auto profits
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation which increases to 5 weeks per year with tenure
  • Paid training with the Go Auto University

 We don’t build jobs, we build careers. Ask about one of our many success stories during your interview.

title: Business Unit Controller
description:
In addition to the responsibilities listed below, employees are also expected to complete other duties as required. All managers are expected to have familiarized themselves with the Health & Safety and Human Resources manuals, including their responsibilities as outlined in each.

Role #1:Accounting and Finance 60 % of time:

Responsibilities:

  • Provide the necessary planning, organization, direction, coordination, control and management of Finance including - general ledger, cost accounting, reporting, payroll, invoicing, payables, collection of accounts receivables, HST, US sales tax, and monthly financial statements.
  • Responsible for preparation, auditing, and analysis of financial statements. Prepares balance sheets, profit and loss statements, and other management reports as requested.
  • Develops and implements processes either within the Finance team or as part of a collaborative effort with other teams to ensure compliance with appropriate internal controls and audit readiness and compliance.
  • Establish, maintain and monitor the financial records and transactions of the company - assuring compliance with applicable taxes, local regulations, rules, laws and requirements.
  • Research cost variance issues as they arise and identify root cause and implement improvements to prevent future occurrences.
  • Monitors cash flow of the company and ensures that all inputs and outputs are managed to provide maximum cash flow: AR, Collections, Payables, etc. Prepares weekly cash projections.
  • Leads the effort to ensure all information needed for annual financial audit is timely and accurate.
  • Responsible for providing all supporting data needed for the timely completion of the Canadian and US income tax returns
  • Raise awareness of any financial issues to be addressed to Controller.
  • Prepare annual budget.
  • Support annual insurance renewal.
  • Ensure sales commissions are paid in a timely manner.
  • Independently or as part of a team identifies and implements business process improvements. Seeks ways to increase the value that the accounting department brings to the organization. Supports management team with timely data and efficient accounting processes.
  • Work in conjunction with all policies and procedures.

Role #2:Accounting and Finance 40 % of time:

Responsibilities:

  • Establish Finance and Accounting related policies.
  • Facilitate Finance/Accounting meetings on a regular cadence.
  • Attend Management meetings and contribute to the Management team.
  • Select new employees when necessary - Process, Reference check, checklist.
  • Orientation of new employees.
  • Conduct regular coaching and feedback to ensure employees meet or exceed Job performance standards.
  • Manage performance issues.

Qualifications:

Education, Experience & Skills:

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field with 5 or more years of progressive experience including supervision of staff.
  • Preferred Professional designation in Accounting.
  • Demonstrated leadership ability, including coaching and development of direct reports.
  • Strong accounting background in manufacturing with costing experience.
  • Have a positive attitude and a willingness to learn and to change, to suit Company needs.
  • Be a team player & self-motivated.
  • Strong internal auditing and financial analysis skills.
  • Strong proficiency with personal computers and associated word processing/spreadsheet skills; experience working with ERP systems.
  • Demonstrated success in executing process improvements.
  • Ability to work effectively with others and lead and participate successfully on team.
  • High degree of business acumen.
  • Strong ethics and drive for results.
  • Must be able to occasionally travel to the United States.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

ELS will not discriminate based on race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status, or sexual orientation.


ELS strives to create an accessible and inclusive work environment where everyone is treated with respect and dignity. If you require accommodation, please contact Human Resources at HR@destuffit.com. Upon request, appropriate accessible formats or arrangements will be provided as soon as practicable.

description:

title: Controller (Prince George, BC, CA)
description:
Posting ID:   22933
Position Type:  Regular  
City: Prince George, BC, Canada 
Location: PG Pulp (BC19) 

 

 

Detail oriented, methodical, organized, and structured, you are willing and able to get to the core of a problem. A natural leader, you work effectively with others, communicate with credibility and confidence, and can drive multiple initiatives forward concurrently. You are highly motivated, an effective influencer of people, and have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Based at our CAC office in Prince George, BC, this is your next opportunity to really “branch out” into this “fir-bulous” finance management role.

 

As the Mill Controller, you will provide overall financial support for the General Manager and the management team while you review and report on variance analyses and rolling forecasts. You will utilize the skills you have acquired in your current or previous financial management role(s) to oversee the delivery of financial services for Northwood and Taylor Pulp, working closely with the finance shared services group.

 

You have outstanding integrity and are a quality leader; these skills will assist you as you guide the finance team at Northwood and Taylor Pulp and become the key point of contact for the GM for all financial matters. You will be responsible for performance management evaluations and will work to develop a positive working environment with the team to ensure they are empowered, encouraged, and rewarded for their contributions and performance. With both finance and management responsibilities, this role is bound to keep your “interest”.

 

Ideally, you come armed with your CPA/CA designation, experience with standardization and continuous improvement, and past experience in financial management specifically in a manufacturing or operational setting. For bonus points, you have operational performance management and or business process improvement (Six Sigma, Lean).

 

If you are an outstanding leader with advanced analytical and problem-solving skills, ready to motivate a new team, click that “apply” button today!

 

Our Talent Acquisition team is actively recruiting on this role and in order to be considered, please apply today!

 

At Canfor, diversity means understanding, recognizing and valuing the differences that make each person unique. We see inclusion and diversity as an essential part of our productivity, creativity, innovation and competitive advantage. We strive for a fair and equitable recruitment process, where hiring decisions are based on the individual qualifications and experience of each applicant. 

 

We are not your run of the mill forest products company, join us and find out why. #canfortalent

 

Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!

Prince George, BC
Known as BC’s Northern Capital, Prince George is city that offers big city comfort and convenience, but small town serenity and sensibilities. As the largest city in northern BC, Prince George is a hub of industry, offering numerous employment opportunities and is home to the University of Northern British Columbia. This region’s temperate climate creates a lush environment of emerald-green forests and ample opportunities for outdoor activity. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/prince-george

title: Controller/Finance Manager (22-213)
description:
Thank you for your interest in positions at IPG Photonics. All Applicants must apply on our company website to be considered. Please visit www.ipgphotonics.com and click on the “Company” tab. We look forward to seeing your application soon!

IPG Photonics (Canada) Inc. designs, develops and manufactures a unique and rapidly growing laser welding process monitoring technology with significant importance to the electric vehicle revolution. We are the national subsidiary of IPG Photonics Corporation (NASDAQ:IPGP).

IPG Photonics Canada Inc. is growing rapidly and is seeking to hire a new Controller/Financial Manager. This hands-on position is responsible for overseeing the financial operations of the subsidiary (~30-50 employees), preparing intra-company reports and basic payroll/benefits administration through existing commercial software platforms.

The ideal candidate will have over 5 years of accounting and financial management experience; a CPA designation is preferred, however, candidates with a solid track record of bookkeeping and payroll/benefits administration will be considered as well.

Detailed Responsibilities:
  • Directing all aspects of accounting operations, overseeing all transactions related to general ledger, receivables, payables, payroll and financial reporting.
  • Reconcile general ledger accounts, sub ledgers and prepare reconciliation entries.
  • Administer payroll and benefits specific to the Canadian subsidiary
  • Manage day-to-day banking operations, reconcile monthly bank statements.
  • Applying corporate finance policies.
  • Oversee Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Payroll and Human Resource operations with assistance from corporate headquarters.
  • Fulfill month-end closing requirements.
  • Ensuring that records are maintained in accordance with GAAP/ASPE standards.
  • Prepare documents and forms related to regulatory requirements (GST/HST, CRA, Ministry of Finance, WSIB, StatsCan etc.) and ensure accuracy and timely submission.
  • Work with corporate staff and local accounting firms to prepare tax submissions.
  • Analyze subsidiary and product line profitability and suggest improvements to transfer pricing and related policies.
  • Customized financial reporting as required by management.
  • Administer all payroll activities and benefits administration.
  • Managing all tax planning and compliance with all required federal, provincial, local, payroll, property and other applicable taxes.
  • Calculate royalty payments from sales documentation.

Qualifications:
  • A CPA designation with 5 years of Financial management experience or 10+ years of bookkeeping and payroll administration experience
  • Preference will be given to candidates who are familiar with reporting requirements of a publicly traded company with global subsidiaries, and experience with enterprise ERP software.
  • Meticulous level of detail, highly organized, business oriented, dependable and capable of supporting the rest of the team.
  • Experience working with a rapid growth company is preferred.
  • Self-motivated and interested in streamlining processes.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Able to work with tight deadlines.
  • Strong computer skills. Ability to design/prepare reports and other appropriate documentation.

title: Controller
description:
Destinationone Consulting is recruiting a Controller for its client in Toronto, Ontario.


About Our Client
Headquartered in Toronto, this is a publicly-traded up and coming beverage manufacturing company at the verge of an explosive growth in Canada and U.S.


About the Role
We are looking for someone in the GTA, but this a remote role with once a week or twice-a-month meetings. The role comes with base salary, bonus and potential stock and equity options.


About You
You are currently a Senior Accountant, Assistant Controller or an Accounting Manager with a CPA designation and working in a publicly-traded company with Food&Beverage, Alcohol/Tobacco manufacturing or Consumer Goods industry experience.

Accounting Responsibilities

  • Record journal entries related to the cannabis business and some corporate transactions in accordance with IFRS. Ensure all accounting is accurate, timely, complete and valid
  • Record and/or review AP, AR transactions. Complete AR, AP and Bank Reconciliations. Record manual quarterly Journal Entries for month end close process.
  • Record intercompany transactions and eliminations
  • Technical accounting and support the completion of the consolidated financial statements under IFRS;
  • Establish financial internal controls and procedures. Implement internal controls documentation and testing procedures
  • Cannabis business and aspects of Corporate cash management
  • Reviewing bills and credit card statements for accuracy before paying them
  • Review and approve Alcohol Free accounting entries, financial reporting and reconciliations. Providing back up support to Controller of Alcohol Free business.

Financial Planning and Analysis

  • Budgeting and forecasting with sensitivity analysis.
  • Current short and long term forecasting and planning processes and provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Assist in the preparation of long-term financial projection presentations to the Board of Directors, Senior Management and various stakeholders as required
  • Closely monitor financial performance and update the short term model as needed, implement process improvement initiatives
  • Build and develop corporate financial models in order to provide accurate financial picture of the entity and provide valuation support as needed (SOTP, DCF, etc.)
  • Participate in the development, improvement and update of Long-term Model – three year financial projection plan
  • Monthly financial management planning and reporting. Weekly sales and cashflow reporting - Specific focus on short term and long term cash planning.
  • Leverage Netsuite Planning and reporting to develop reports and planning tools
  • Work closely with Business partners to ensure planning assumptions are aligned with the key stakeholders, ensure collaboration and mutual accountability is in place
  • Support business development and investor relations teams
  • Assist in maintaining and developing Cannabis and company-wide KPIs
  • Model scenario analysis based on the request from the senior management team
  • Develop and maintain new financial models
  • Assist with financial valuations of various business units

Other Responsibilities

  • Oversee entity tax filings for US and Canada
  • Manage and implement excise taxes process for Canada
  • Assist in set up of US operations (and any international expansion as required), including but not limited to banking, transfer pricing, intercompany, review of contracts and impact on financials.
  • Develop strong understanding of the company’s structure and be the expert in various areas of business including CPG for alcohol free and highly regulated Cannabis business
  • Provide input and guidance on strategic financial issues
  • Identification and investigation of financial performance variances as needed
  • Develop various management presentations as required
  • Assist with implementation of any additional NetSuite modules
  • Establish, maintain and document the firm’s policies, practices, procedures and internal controls.
  • Ad hoc projects and team support as required


Requirements

You are:

  • Self-motivated. Roll up your sleeves and complete all financial aspects of the position. You see what needs to be done and you figure out a way to make it happen – no excuses, because those don’t exist.
  • Willing to easily move from reconciliations and day to day accounting entries to strategic financial analysis.
  • Think strategically, synthesize complex business/financial data and develop solutions.
  • Strong financial modelling, valuation and forecast skills
  • Extremely strong understanding of accounting principles, and of legal and ethical business practices.
  • Ability to manage and complete multiple projects simultaneously with a sense of urgency.
  • Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
  • Use financial systems and standard office applications software effectively.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or a related field.
  • Obtained a CPA designation
  • A minimum of 5-10 years directly responsible business experience involving financial management, or an equivalent combination of education.
  • Experience in NetSuite
  • Experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job as determined by company.
  • Experience in entrepreneurial environment
  • CPG and/or Cannabis and/or Alcohol experience is a plus

title: Senior Project Controller, Finance Consulting
description:
Job Type: ((filter6))
Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada
All Available Locations: Calgary

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Have many careers in one Firm.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.

Are you a Senior Project Controller looking to provide project controls knowledge to the entire project management team(s)? Then this is the job for you!

What will your typical day look like?

You will perform various financial analysis, reconciliations and variance analysis. Also prepare budgets and forecasts and track financial values such as revenue & expenses. Interact frequently with senior level internal and external clients and firm leadership to present various analysis, discuss recommendations and provide project financial advice. Build complex financial reporting models in excel and customize project financial reporting. Conduct quality reviews and provide feedback on the technical work products of junior resources. Support the growth and career development of junior resources by serving as an informal mentor and as a formal Coach to junior staff, providing them with regular career and professional development guidance. Participate in formal mid-year and year-end performance assessment activities for assigned counselees. Contribute to the growth and development of the overall Engagement Financial Services Practice through active involvement in one or more practice initiatives.

About the team

Deloitte Consulting's "Engagement Financial Services Practice" is comprised of Project Controls professionals serving as a focal point for financial aspects of project, program, and account management.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone with:

  • Has a Major in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Management and a minimum of 3-5 years' experience in a financial analysis role working with the entire Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced level Excel
  • Has outstanding attention to detail and adherence to project deadlines while handling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Has the ability to identify problems and develop creative solutions
  • Has experience developing project pricing models and performing scenario analysis
  • Seeks challenging opportunities across businesses and borders and takes accountability for personal and team results
  • Builds relationships and communicates effectively in order to positively influence peers and other stakeholders

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

    The next step is yours

    Sound like The One Firm. For You?


At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally. Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Accounting, Financial, Consulting, Developer, Equity, Finance, Technology

Apply now "

title: Controller - Nova Metrix LLC - Client Opportunity
description:
Your opportunity:

About Nova Metrix LLC

Founded in 2009, Nova Metrix is the worldâ€™s leading provider of geotechnical, environmental, and materials testing instruments, sensors, software, and consumables serving the structural health, construction, civil engineering, energy, and medical markets.

With globally recognized premium brands, the Nova Metrix portfolio of companies provide best-in-class products and services in its served markets. With a global reach into over 90 countries, decades of technical leadership, and proven application know-how, Nova Metrix and its associated brands continue to be the largest independent geotechnical instrumentation manufacturer and leading provider of fiber optic solutions and technologies.

Two of these portfolio companies are Roctest Ltd. (located in Montreal, Canada) and Durham Geo Enterprises Inc. (located in Tucker, Georgia). Both are well known, global manufacturers of geotechnical instrumentation. These companies operate autonomously, retaining their existing brands and management teams, but benefit from strong, experienced affiliated companies that can enable each company to achieve its full potential.

The Role

The Controller will be responsible for managing all accounting operations of these two Manufacturing Companies (Roctest Ltd. and Durham Geo Enterprises Inc). The responsibilities include managing Customer billings, A/R, A/P, G/L, inventory/cost accounting, revenue recognition, and all aspects of multiple plant financial management. The successful candidate will be hands-on and can provide leadership and look at opportunities for cost savings, along with system improvements. This position reports directly to the Division Finance Manager and General Manager.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform as an expert in all aspects of financial planning, reporting, controls, and administration
  • Preparation of periodic financial statements in accordance with US GAAP
  • Manage all plant accounting functions related to cost accounting, payroll, accounts payable, accounts receivable, general ledger, fixed assets, etc.
  • Responsible for all accounting, audit, and tax activities for multi-site global locations including Durham Geo Enterprises and Subsidiary/Branch in Australia and Canada; Roctest Ltd (Canada) including subsidiaries Enomfra and Telemac (France) and Smartec (Switzerland)
  • Develop and maintain standard production cost models and perform audits to determine accuracy
  • Provide financial services to support all departments to assist them in areas of purchasing, inventory, costing, budgeting, and understanding of financial statements
  • Analyze variances and communicate explanations to management with recommended actions
  • Coordination of the US GAAP audit with the Companyâ€™s Independent Public Accountants as well as statutory audits with local statutory auditors
  • Establish and maintain internal accounting and operational controls over revenue recognition, expense management, and effective measurement and control over all assets
  • Ensure the accuracy of physical inventory and controlling the flow of raw materials, tools, and other assets within a manufacturing environment
  • Help develop and support short and long-term operational strategies
  • Prepare the annual budget and quarterly forecasts
  • Manage the month-end closing process and provide daily and weekly flash reports
  • Consolidation and Foreign Currency Translation
  • Oversee and support accounting team with dynamic leadership that creates an environment of trust, productivity, and accountability

Qualifications

  • Fluent (reading, writing, speaking) in English and French
  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Accounting or Finance with CPA designation preferred
  • Minimum 7 â€“ 10 years manufacturing
  • 5 â€“ 7 years as a Controller
  • Global accounting experience
  • Broad understanding of business issues, metrics, organizational linkages, and customer value
  • Ability to build partnerships across and between functional groups
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to effectively present complex topics in a concise manner
  • Multiple ERP package experience (Great Plains preferred)
  • Travel to and from Roctest in Montreal and Durham Geo Enterprises in Georgia will be required
  • Work extended hours as needed

title: Controller - Mariposa Dairy
description:
Controller
At Mariposa Dairy, we operate with honesty and integrity. We recognize the contributions of others and work together with all stakeholders for the mutual benefit of all. We treat others with fairness, equality and respect in all aspects of our business. We recognize and value the health and sustainability of the individual, the product offering, and the environment.
We are currently seeking afull-time Controllerfor our operations in Lindsay, Ontario. Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO), the Controller is a key member of the management team and provides financial management guidance and related analyses to support operational, managerial and strategic decision making
The Controller is also responsible for overseeing all fiscal and fiduciary responsibilities for the company, in conjunction with the requirements impose by the Board of Directors and any Finance, Audit, and Investment Committees of the Board, if applicable.
This is the perfect opportunity for an experienced individual, looking to grow with an organization.
Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Leadership
  • Supporting employees’ personal and professional development through a demonstrated commitment to coaching and other development activities.
  • Develop and manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Inspires and engages with operational and functional managers to understand and achieve Business Unit objectives.


Financial planning and reporting
  • Lead the development and compilation of financial plans, budgets and subsequent performance monitoring quarterly and annually, or as needed
  • Oversee the provision of daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual information for operational, managerial and strategic decision making
  • Develop short and long-term financial plans in alignment with Mariposa Dairy Ltd.’s strategic plan

Financial function oversight and controls
  • Ensure records and systems are accurate, timely and maintained in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles
  • Develop and communicate accounting and financial management policies/processes, internal controls, delegation of authority guidelines and ensure compliance with these policies and controls
  • Ensure cash management is optimized and resources are spent in accordance with senior executive guidance
  • Oversee the timely reconciliation of bank deposits and customer account relief, bank and credit card accounts, reconciliation of balance sheet accounts
  • Establish efficient month-end practices to expedite monthly management reporting

Costing and pricing
  • Approve cost standards for the ERP system and provide accurate BOM’s for maximum costing to customers
  • Oversee the systematic and continuous review of cost variances and develop action plans to improve results

Banking and Finance
  • Monitor and maintain compliance with bank covenants

Compliance and reporting to external entities
  • Ensure compliance with local, provincial, and federal reporting requirements and other external agencies (Insurance, Stats Can, etc.)

Technology and systems
  • Participate and inform IT managed services provided by external service providers
  • Report on progress and development on a regular basis
  • Manages the ERP and NAV systems

Other duties as assigned

Requirements:
  • University Degree in Commerce or Business Administration
  • 5 years in a related field
  • CPA Designation
  • Extensive experience and knowledge ERP, accounting systems, budgeting processes, internal controls, business planning and asset management
  • Knowledge of GAP, federal and provincial financial regulations.
  • Experience in negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management
  • Demonstrate effective oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate, build and maintain strong working relationships with staff, departmental peers, leadership, key business partners, and government agencies
  • High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office productivity suite
  • Microsoft Dynamics / NAVISION knowledge preferred

Working Conditions:
  • Travel required
  • Ability to attend and conduct presentations
  • Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals
  • Overtime as required
Mariposa Dairy welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We thank all applicants for their interest in Mariposa; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. No agencies or phone calls please. Any offer of employment will be conditional upon reference checks and employment verification.

title: Controller
description:
Who we are: Amilia is more than just a tech company – we’re a close-knit family made up of caring, entrepreneurial-minded individuals. Our multi-disciplinary team members will challenge and support you on every project.

What we do: We provide online registration and digital management software solutions to recreation organizations, such as cheer gyms, gymnastics clubs, dance studios, and many more.

How we do what we do: We provide all our team members with the tools and flexibility they need to succeed every day. We also put an emphasis on collaboration and encourage everyone to bring new ideas to the table, even if it’s outside of your department.

Why we do what we do: We’re not just here to sell software – we want to revolutionize the way recreation organizations leverage technology. Every Amilian is incredibly invested in our mission to disrupt the status quo and help our clients achieve great things.


What can you expect:

Under the supervision of the Director of finance and administration, you will be responsible for ensuring the compliance of the accounting and financial operations of the Canadian and American entities. You will also support the Director in the process of creating and implementing policies and procedures to identify, resolve and document accounting issues.


You'll be responsible for:

  • Preparing monthly financial statements and reviewing them with the director;
  • Putting in place analysis of balance sheet accounts and monthly verification;
  • Verifying and approving month-end journal entries;
  • Verifying and approving supplier invoices and expense accounts;
  • Leading the annual audit file process and follow-ups;
  • Preparing the file for tax credits (SRED & E-Business credit) and following up with the resources involved;
  • Suggesting and documenting any improvements to be made to internal controls and processes;
  • Monitoring cash-flow;
  • Monitoring and accounting for inter-company transactions.


What we want from you:

  • CPA designation;
  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting combined with a minimum of 3 to 4 years of experience in a similar position;
  • Good knowledge of ASPE;
  • High reliability, rigor, and organizational skills;
  • Autonomous, resourceful and creative;
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously;
  • Good communicator (both oral and written) in English and French;
  • Be able to question current processes;
  • Team spirit and tact;
  • Adherence to deadlines.


What you’ll get from us:

  • Competitive salary & insurance package;
  • Group RRSP employer contribution up to 5%;
  • Wellness credit (500$ per year);
  • Flexible hybrid work model (home-office) and possibility to work from anywhere in Québec;
  • Dedicated Learning and Development Specialist committed to your personal and professional development;
  • Weekly Amilia fitness classes (Yoga and Bootcamp);
  • A strong work-life balance with paid vacation, personal days, and year-round mini-Fridays;
  • Monthly commuter discount of 25%;
  • Team bonding and social activities once a quarter;
  • Up to 15 hours of group volunteering paid per year;
  • Skill development opportunities through Lunch & Learn talks;
  • In-office snacks, including fresh fruit baskets, coffee, and free drinks.

title: Divisional Controller
description:
Overview:

Divisional Controller

 

Cooke Aquaculture Inc., a dynamic and growing east coast family company, with Platinum Member status in the Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies Program,  and one of Atlantic Canadaâ€™s Top Employers, has an opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join the Companyâ€™s Finance Team.

 

Cooke is a global seafood company with operations in North America, Europe, and South America. Our companyâ€™s success is driven by our dynamic, highly-skilled and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who live in coastal communities and contribute to the local areaâ€™s economy and sense of community.

 

The Role:

We are hiring a Divisional Controller to join  our team of accounting professionals. This role will work out of our Saint John, and / or Blacks Harbour, NB office.  This position will be responsible for the divisional accounting functions.  You will manage a team and be responsible for completing period end financial statements and management reports, working paper files and ad hoc reporting. You will be responsible for continuous process improvement and will be involved, periodically, in projects to support the overall accounting and finance team. You will also be responsible for coordinating the requests of the external auditors for both the interim and year end audit tasks.

 

 Qualifications:

  • Professional accounting designation preferred,
  • University degree in accounting or finance,
  • 5 years plus of relevant experience,
  • Excellent leadership and communication skills  
  • Valid passport required for travel to other non-Canadian operations (when permitted),

The Opportunity:

The role description is just one part of the story.  This is your opportunity to grow, to work within the parameters of the role but to reach your fullest potential.

We are a team that is driven to succeed. We count performance, we reward contribution and we recognize talent.  

It is about being at the centre of a global leader in seafood and knowing you are an important part of that growth.  

The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer.

 

The Why:

Why Cooke? Simple â€“ we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness and work ethic. We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career and your future.

 

NOTE: The recruiter is reviewing and interviewing eligible applicants for this position as they are received. If you are interested in this posting, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.  

 

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted

title: Controller - (Langley)
description:
Otter Co-op is now accepting applications for a Controller at our Administration Office located in Langley, BC.
Who we are:


Otter Co-op is a $350 million dollar retail co-operative with a diverse portfolio of commodities which includes liquor, petroleum, food, feed, pharmacy, hardware, family fashions and hospitality. Co-op does business differently.  As a co-operative, we believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth.  To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our brand to life, visit us at www.otterco-op.crs.


What youâ€™ll do:

  • Coordinate an effective, efficient, and timely period-end close process, including ownership of the general ledger and preparation of financial statements.
  • Contribute to the annual budget process, including any necessary maintenance and re-forecasts during the fiscal year.
  • Identifies potential financial risks and recommends corrective actions. 
  • Regulatory compliance and understanding of Federal and Provincial tax applications in a retail & petroleum environment.
  • The role will assist in the management of the treasury function, as it relates to bank accounts, monitoring and adjusting foreign exchange rates.
  • Directs the training and mentorship of a team of 11 in their job responsibilities.
  • Fixed asset/depreciation/disposal calculations and reporting.
  • Review and approve monthly reconciliations (banks, prepaid, receivables, etc.).
  • Improve and implement financial policies, systems, and processes.
  • Directs the development and administration of accounting policies and operational procedures to ensure effective accounting and internal controls.
  • The Controller supports any accounting software projects.
  • Must work within strict confidential guidelines and with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to deal with a diverse and fast-paced work schedule and to work with a sense of urgency in a changing environment.
  • Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, with a positive attitude and the ability to work as part of a Team.
  • Contribute to the Team in living the Corporate Values of Integrity, Community and Excellence
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Why it matters:
Our team provides a range of products and services to support our member-owners. Through the work that we do, we help to build, fuel, feed and grow Western Canadian communities together.  

Who you are: 
You are looking for a career in Finance and:

  • Minimum 10 years of accounting experience and 3 years of Controller experience
  • Post-secondary undergraduate or technical degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance; CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is required
  • Proficient in a variety of computer applications including MS Office Suite and advanced knowledge of excel (VLookup, Sumif, left-mid-right, formatting, creating charts, pivot tables)
  • Must have a pragmatic and diplomatic approach to managing people through change management and projects
  • Excellent organizational, planning and time management skills
  • Experience with credit management
  • Superior attention to detail
  • Must be committed to a SAFE working environment

Whatâ€™s in in for you:

  • Competitive wage
  • Qualify for wage increase based on the number of hours worked & meeting expectations in the position
  • Team discount on Liquor, Food, Gas, Fashion, Hardware, Feed & Restaurant purchases
  • Co-op Membership with an annual dividend payment on qualified purchases
  • Annual bonus program for all team members
  • For eligible positions: comprehensive benefits package and an employer matched pension plan
  • Learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation
  • Team Events, community volunteering opportunities

Otter Co-op is committed to a diverse and supportive working environment based on our Core Company Values of Integrity, Community and Excellence. We are committed to giving back to our communities through our Corporate Social Responsibility Program.

At Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve.  We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

All successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.

We would like to thank everyone for their application, however only candidates that will be moving forward in the interview process will be contacted.

title: Senior Inventory Controller
description:
LMI Technologies, recognized as one of Canada’s Best Workplaces, is a medium-sized technology company built on a culture of openness, respect and professional excellence. At LMI our staff work passionately toward the common goal of designing and delivering innovative 3D machine vision solutions to OEMs and System Integrators working in industrial factory automation around the world. The result of this teamwork is high-performance, easy-to-implement and cost-effective 3D sensor technologies that deliver the best results in even the most challenging 3D inline inspection applications.

What will you do as a Senior Inventory Controller?

Reporting to the Logistics & Materials Manager, the Senior Inventory Controller is responsible for overseeing day to day inventory requests, issues and escalations. As well as working with the department manager on project implementation and process improvement.

  • Assist department manager to develop, implement, and manage a formal inventory control program which includes both inventory cycle counts and year-end physical count
  • Investigate, report, and provide explanations for inventory variances to department manager
  • Manage the flow of goods for LMI Kanban shipment including overseeing daily shipment, adding or taking off parts, reviewing and adjusting quantity periodically
  • Optimize of inventory storage at LMI Vancouver (storage room & production floor)
  • Oversight of inventory adjustments (including scrap & write-off), adjustment approvals & reporting. Analyze data and transactions for root cause analysis
  • Oversee the consumables program, bin sizing, reorder points
  • Assist department manager to take actions on Engineering Change Orders (ECO) related to materials movements, setup or removal
  • Provide ideas and insights to refine established procedures to improve inventory accuracy and efficiency, improve quality, or reduce cost
  • Works with various departments to resolve inventory processing questions and issues. Provides training as needed
  • Organizes and maintains warehouse and inventory for efficient storage and handling
  • Continually work with management on other optimization ideas
  • Proactively contributes to continuous improvement initiatives
  • Adheres to LMI Employee Policy Manual

What do you need to be successful?

  • A Post-secondary Technical or Business diploma or degree is preferred
  • 5 or more years of experience in inventory management and cycle counting in a manufacturing setting
  • Experience with both Radio Frequency (RF) scanning and manual inventory counting method
  • Excellent computer skills and knowledge of ERP systems
  • Cycle counting experience is mandatory
  • Thorough understanding of inventory policies and procedures
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Superb attention to detail

How to submit your interest?

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity and working for a fast-growing global technology company with an inspiring and engaging workplace environment, please submit your application to our Human Resources team in confidence by clicking the “Apply Now” button.

While we appreciate your interest in LMI very much, we are only able to respond to candidates selected for further consideration. We look forward to talking to you about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career!

Why being inclusinve is important to us?

At LMI Technologies, we are an Equal Opportunity employer and we value the diversity of the people we hire and serve. We strive to build and grow our team that fosters variety in backgrounds, perspectives, experiences and skills. We embrace inclusiveness in our workplace, so we can utilize each person’s talents and strengths.

If you are interested in working for a fast-growing global technology company with an inspiring and engaging workplace environment, we invite you to apply and talk about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career.

 

We ensure you, once you complete your application, your information is safe with us. To learn more about how we use your personal data, please review our Privacy Policy (https://lmi3d.com/privacy-policy).

title: Contrôleur Financier
description:
CONTRÔLEUR(EUSE) FINANCIÈRE

 

Relevant du Chef de la direction financière, vous serez responsable de contrôler et superviser l’ensemble des opérations reliées au cycle comptable et à la paie de l’entreprise et de ses compagnies apparentées, selon les échéanciers établis.

 

Vos responsabilités seront les suivantes :

 

·        Préparer ou produire les états financiers mensuels et annuels;

·        Assurer le contrôle qualité et l’exactitude des données comptable et financière;

·        Assurer la préparation et transmettre les rapports mensuels de taxes de vente, de remises gouvernementales d’impôt et de retenues à la source et autres rapports aux autorités règlementaires;

·        Tenir à jour la projection de trésorerie;

·        Assurer le traitement de la paie;

·        Participer à la préparation et au suivi du budget annuel et des révisions budgétaires;

·        Participer à limplantation et loptimisation des rapports de gestion et supporter les opérations dans leur recherche d’amélioration de l’efficacité;

·        Effectuer le suivi des indicateurs de performance financiers et contribuer au développement de ces derniers;

·        Superviser et offrir un soutien à l’équipe de comptabilité;

·        Contribuer au développement de politiques et procédure de contrôles internes;

·        Assurer le suivi du processus de collection;

·        Participer à la préparation des demandes de crédit d’impôts de la RS&DE

·        Préparer les dossiers de fin d’année et agir comme personne ressource auprès des auditeurs externes;

·        S’assurer de l’efficience des processus, méthodes et outils de travail;

·        Appliquer et respecter rigoureusement les contrôles opérationnels et financiers.

 

Compétences et exigences

 

·        Membre de l’Ordre des CPA ou en voie d’obtention du titre;

·        5 à 8 ans d’expérience en comptabilité, dont 3 ans dans un poste similaire;

·        Bilinguisme (français et anglais) à l’oral et à l’écrit;

·        Excellentes aptitudes en communication verbale et écrite;

·        Expérience en gestion de personnel;

·        Maitrise avancée d’Excel et de la suite Microsoft Office;

·        Expérience pertinente sur des systèmes comptables et ERP;

·        Connaissance de Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains et Management Reporter, un atout;

·        Expérience avec l’extraction et la manipulation des données à partir de la base de données SQL, un atout;

·        Excellente capacité de concentration, esprit d’analyse et de synthèse ;

·       Capacité à gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément et à travailler sous pression;

·       Autonomie, responsabilisation, minutie, sens de lorganisation et rigueur.

Company Overview:

Teledyne Micralyne Inc. is internationally recognized for its unique design and fabrication in Micro Electromechanical Systems (MEMS) technology. With over 30 years of experience and business, Teledyne Micralyne is leading todayâ€™s cutting-edge MEMS technology in Canada. Every member of the Teledyne Micralyne team is committed to the following core values: Innovation, Excellence, Integrity and Commitment. Teledyne Micralyne is proud to work with customers as strategic partners towards providing innovative solutions to meet evolving global needs and societal expectations. Teledyne Micralyne is the heart of devices that advance humanity.

ISO9001:2015 and ISO13485:2016 certified.

Position Summary and Responsibilities:

Summary

The Financial Controller plays a key strategic role and is a business partner helping the organization achieve market leadership. In partnership with the senior management team, the Financial Controller helps shape business strategies that align with growth and profitability and driving accountability across the organization through rigor, financial discipline, and transparency. Reporting to the Director of Finance in Bromont, QC, the Financial Controller works in collaboration with the operations and finance teams, as well as build relationships across Teledyne Micralyne Inc. The Financial Controller provides analytical tools to allow senior management to make data-driven decisions.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • In collaboration with management team, develops new strategies in maximizing both top line and bottom line.
  • Ensures compliance and accuracy in all financial matters for Teledyne Micralyne Inc.
  • Manages period end (weekly, monthly, quarterly) processes, ensuring all corporate deadlines are met.

  • Large company reporting experience.
  • Experience in US GAAP.
  • Experience in SAP S/4 HANA.
  • Experience in working with a geographically dispersed team.
  • Experience in manufacturing and/or technology sector.
  • Experience working in a fast-growing company through multiple phases of growth.
  • Experience working with data platforms, information systems and analytics.
  • A proven track record of successful training and development of talented people.

Our client is a well-known Capital Equipment Manufacturer and industrial distributor of machinery across Canada. We are actively recruiting for a Controller reporting to the CFO for this multi-national corporation. The head office is located in Oakville, ON.
The Controller will be a Degreed individual with a certified accounting designation (CPA) and 5-7 years of experience in manufacturing or industrial distribution. You will have experience with a Sage 300 Computer System, Excel Accounting Schedules and monitor exchanges for rates in Yen, USD and Euros. Daily review of bank positions (CDN Bank, USD Bank) and review new machine orders and following up on Deposit payments. You will manage (1) Accounts Payable, (1) Accounts Receivable, and (1) Accounting Manager.
You will prepare lease documentation for TD and RBC Financing deals and review internal sales schedules for new orders as well as Shipping dates. You will have responsibility to sign-off on all purchase orders (Machinery, Parts, Accessories and Misc parts). Working closely with AR, you will review all A/R invoices monthly. You will also prepare Conditional Sales Agreement (Lien Agreement) and review conditional sales agreement. Working with TD and RBC, financing schedules and collections.
You will monitor machine commission sales (Direct sales from Manufacturer to Customer), Collections on Machine Commission sales. Overseeing Accounts Payable and prepare Machines for A/P entry. You will also prepare and review all journal entries (as required) and review the G/L thoroughly. Review System P&L, OIH Accounts and Balance Sheet Prepare Monthly Exchange Schedule for Buy Forwards. Review all Excel Reports for P&L and Balance Sheet accounts prepared by Accounting Manager prepare Financial Statements. Prepare Extra Scheduling for Year End Audit. Overseeing Year End Audi
Qualifications
You will possess:
  • 8-10 years of Experience as a Senior Accountant or Controller in Manufacturing or Industrial
  • Distribution Industry
  • Degreed Accountant with CPA is required.
  • Experience with General Ledger, P/L , Audit experience.

title: Controller
description:
Are you the new Controller at Pagefreezer?

What we do and why:

  • Millions of conversations are taking place online every minute. And the content of all these conversations is often important and sensitive. Regulations demand accurate recordkeeping of all content, and companies are realizing the value of having access to complete, searchable electronic records—not only for evidence capture and litigation preparedness, but also for greater insight into how and why conversations are taking place.
  • We offer solutions at every stage of the information governance lifecycle (creation, retention, management, and disposal) that archives data in real-time and gives organizations a simple and effective way to search and use it.
  • Pagefreezer’s Social Media Archiving and Monitoring solution enables organizations to create and share defensible records of their social media content, quickly and easily in our dashboard, in real-time—every like, share, edit, and deletion. With added features like sentiment analysis and keyword flagging, our customers can also get insights into the conversations taking place and receive alerts when inappropriate or sensitive information is shared in their platforms, to help them promote and protect their employees, customers, brand, and business.

What’s special about us:

  • Our coworkers are collaborative, proactive, and interesting -- and they care about the right things. We’ve built a culture based on values that mean something to us and we practice them daily.
  • Our compensation is comprehensive, competitive, and can include benefits like extended health insurance, a $600 Lifestyle Spending Account, a $1000 annual learning budget, a Tax-Free Savings Account and a matching Retirement Savings Plan and paid time off, if you’re in Canada. Not in Canada? We’ll create a compensation package you’re excited about together.
  • Our employees’ priorities matter. Career growth? Balancing work and life? Growing your own side-hustle? Helping you live your best life is #goals.
  • Our track record is strong, our market opportunity is growing, and we’re already providing solutions to some of the biggest companies in the world-- and you'll be helping us accelerate even faster. Come join a sustainably profitable, small company and see the impact of your work.

What our Controller does:

  • Enable the company to achieve its mission, vision, and goals in a values-aligned way through creating and implementing comprehensive, creative, and measurable finance and accounting projects, and programs.
  • Excel at overseeing and organizing the Finance team to complete mission critical finance operations -- general accounting, record-keeping, budgeting, payroll, cash flow, receivables and payables, financial controls and policies, reports, etc.
  • Prepare and review the budget, cash flow, audits and other financial reports in collaboration with the CEO.
  • Empower department managers to create and manage their budgets, make advantageous vendor selections and purchasing decisions, and understand trends and compliance.
  • Collaborate with HR to recruit, retain, reward, engage and develop your people and teams through practical talent acquisition, talent management, and talent development initiatives (including workforce planning, onboarding, career pathing, coaching, performance reviews, and more).
    • Promote a Values-led working environment that is safe, respectful, diverse, equitable, and inclusive through role-modeling, accountability and support.
  • Manage the tools, stakeholders, trends, best practices, processes, and budget necessary to stay compliant and financially secure.
  • Enforce adherence to legal, regulatory, and company policies to maintain the company’s legality and business ethics with regards to finance and accounting practices, including the following information security (IS) responsibilities.

What makes you a great fit:

  • Alignment with our Core Values
  • Deep understanding of SAAS finance operations and metrics and ability to adapt your experience to our organization to create initiatives
    • CGA or CFA certifications
    • 5+ years of progressive Finance or Accounting leadership experience or;
    • 5+ years of managing the finances for a SAAS company
    • Bonus points for experience scaling a finance operation from $15+ million revenues
    • Bonus points for M&A due diligence experience
  • Demonstrated ability to build relationships with and serve as a knowledgeable resource to the executive management team that provides overall company leadership and direction
  • Familiarity with several different Finance and Accounting tools and ability to leverage them
    • Specifically, Xero, Klipfolio, etc
  • Impressive negotiation skills
  • Discipline, organizational and time management skills to work with a high amount of autonomy while delivering results
  • Outstanding interpersonal relationship and consulting skills, maintaining a high level of confidentiality
  • Keen ability to work under pressure, organize workload effectively, and delegate
  • Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills
  • Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Finance or Accounting, or in Business, Organization Development, or similar
    • Bonus points for MBA, Masters or higher degree
  • Customer service-oriented “all hands on deck” attitude, driven to serve the organization
  • Able to work 40 hours a week and either authorized to work in Canada (anywhere in Canada works for us)

title: Regional Controller
description:
Job Description – Canadian Solar Solutions Inc.

Canadian Solar Inc. is one of the world’s largest solar modular producers.  As a leading vertically integrated provider of ingots, wafers, solar cells, solar modules, solar power systems and specialized solar products, Canadian Solar delivers uncompromising value to its customers across the globe.

Position Title: Regional Controller

Department:Accounting

Reports To:VP, Finance Controller of Energy Group

 

Description:

The Regional Controller is responsible for managing the Accounting/Finance functions for the subsidiary including GL, disbursements, collections, compliance general accounting, financial reporting and business analysis. This position will lead the finance team and may also support or supervise accounting work in regions other than Canada as needed.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide strategic analysis from a strategic finance and internal control perspective as required to drive decision making
  • Assume responsibility for project accounting set up and management, project construction accounting/reporting according to US GAAP
  • Work with operations to define, measure, analyze, improve and control current processes which impact customer quality and influence internal operating efficiency
  • Assume responsibility for the accounting books for subsidiaries in Canada
  • Manage credit risk; Make sure AR collection risk is mitigated /covered by credit insurance company (Sinosureor othernotablecommercial insurance)
  • Ensures rapid and consistent collection of receivables by refining and implementing control mechanisms
  • Liaise with HQ regarding any CSI directed policies and procedures
  • Establish and monitor internal controls to ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with established legal regulatory and company policies and procedures
  • Collaborate with senior management team regarding budgets and forecasting
  • Collect and analyze cost data versus budget for ascertaining financial performance and risk assessment
  • Generate performance reports, compare against budgets
  • Assist in cash flow management
  • Liaise with HQ and tax consultants regarding tax issues for Canadian Entities
  • Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the Canadian Solar Solution Code of Business Conduct
  • Support ISO 9001 activities
  • Adhere to all environmental, health and safety rules and policies
  • Conduct other duties as required

 

 

 

 

Qualifications and Experience:

  • University level degree in Finance or Accounting along with Professional Accounting Designation (CA,CMA,CGA,CPA)
  • 10 - 15 years of related experience; Minimum 5+ years as a Controller and in a Senior Manager position
  • Previous experience in supporting senior level managers in subsidiary
  • Public entity reporting experience (US GAAP and CAD GAAP)
  • Ability to proficiently communicate in English; Ability to communicate in Chinese (Mandarin) would be a plus
  • High level of professionalism
  • Ability to work with clients and to understand the sales process
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to anticipate needed actions; Exercise initiative within scope of responsibilities
  • Able to travel as necessary

 

Canadian Solar Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

We are committed to ensuring accessibility for persons with disabilities by identifying, removing and preventing barriers to promote the rights of all persons and to create an inclusive and accessible working environment.

Upon individual request, Canadian Solar will endeavor to remove any barrier to the hiring process to accommodate those candidates with disabilities.

title: Controleur adjoint
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Joins-toi à une équipe spécialisée qui consacre ses efforts au service de la passionnante industrie de l’assemblage électronique à l’échelle mondiale.

Chez AIM Solder, notre engagement à fournir des produits de haute qualité assure notre réputation en tant que chef de file dans notre marché. Joins-toi à notre groupe, reconnu pour son esprit entrepreneurial et familial, pouvant offrir une flexibilité inégalée lorsqu’il s’agit de répondre et de dépasser les besoins ainsi que les attentes de nos clients.

Visons l’excellence !

 

Description du poste

Le candidat devra être en mesure de fournir des conseils et propositions de qualité au sujet de l’analyse financière pour la fabrication, l’achat de matériel, matière première, la main-d’œuvre et les frais généraux. De plus, il sera responsable de l’évaluation des coûts tout en supportant le département des ventes pour la tarification. En travaillant pour le centre corporatif, le candidat sera appelé à étendre ses connaissances vers les autres usines basées en Asie, Europe et Amérique latine.

Le candidat responsable du site canadien et américain devra couvrir trois grandes sphères de tâches:

  • Établir et rapporter à la haute direction les variations générales de la fabrication et des achats;
  • Gestion des immobilisations et de certains projets pour le Canada et les États-Unis;
  • En tant que membre du siège social, soutenir les employés locaux chargés du calcul des coûts et les contrôleurs à l'international avec le calcul des coûts et l'analyse des ventes ;
  • Recommander et participer à la mise en œuvre de mesures d'amélioration si nécessaire ;
  • Fournir des analyses significatives à la direction ;
  • Soutenir le contrôleur corporatif lors de la standardisation des activités mondiales, l'audit interne, les acquisitions et la gestion de la croissance;
  • Lancer et participer à des projets d'amélioration de l'ERP;
  • Évaluer régulièrement la rentabilité de l'activité de récupération;
  • Responsable de la préparation des KPI, Dashboard et analyse des ventes;
  • Procéder à l’analyse des gains et pertes unitaire au quotidien ;
  • Effectuer les évaluations des coûts, des prix et les analyses financières tel que demandé par la direction;
  • Coordonner et gérer les inventaires cycliques et annuels;
  • Optimiser le roulement des inventaires
  • Coordonner les prix de vente et achat interco ainsi que les valeurs d’inventaire qui en découle
  • Superviser le processus d’entré de production au niveau financier;
  • Administrer le développement des coûts unitaires standard;
  • Suggérer et implanter des améliorations de processus pour donner suite aux analyses de marges
  • Implanter puis supporter la proposition de tarification pour les clients 
  • Améliorer les outils d’estimation de coût standard 
  • Établir le lien entre les immobilisations physique et celles aux livres comptables;
  • Suggérer les bonnes pratiques de comptabilité de gestion dans les différents sites à l’échelle mondiale.  
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche connexe et projets spéciaux, selon les besoins.
Qualifications

Détenir un titre comptable professionnel (CPA; CPA, CGA), atout;
 
Minimum de 5 années d’expériences en comptabilité analytique dans un environnement manufacturier de fabrication;
 
Démontrer une expérience pertinente en comptabilité et finances propres aux coûts de fabrication, prix de vente, inventaires et analyse de variance;
 
Être bilingue (anglais et français) – oral et écrit;
 
Expérience avec IFS, Concur et en gestion des systèmes d'inventaire;
 
Compétences avancées dans l’utilisation de Microsoft Excel, Word et Outlook;
 
Grandes aptitudes organisationnelles, communicationnelles, interpersonnelles, analytiques, de leadership, de travail équipe et être capable de gérer ses priorités;
 
Aptitude avérée à travailler sous une supervision limitée; esprit d’initiative et pensée créative dans diverses fonctions du poste.
 



Informations complémentaires

  • Télétravail possible;
  • Assurances collectives, REER collectifs;
  • Gym sur place;
  • Service de cafétéria;
  • Programme santé bien-être.
