title: Cost Controller
description:
Here's what you will do as a Cost Controller at Spark Power:

  • Set up project and work orders in the SparkOps Operations Management System
  • Maintain the costing database and manage cost and accuracy against work orders and project budgets
  • Prepare detailed project accruals and forecasts at the WBS level based on project schedules
  • Work closely with the accounting team on the preparation of client invoices and processing of vendor invoices
  • Identify trends and monitor project cost variances and report to Project Managers. Provide variance explanations as required.
  • Support the project managers on preparation of change orders
  • Maintain change order log and follow up regularly on the status of change orders
  • Prepare monthly reports for projects and portfolio level that shows key financial KPI's, cash flow projections, risks and opportunities
  • Review of WIP and unbilled cost reports and provide explanations
  • Other tasks as assigned/required by project management and controls

Do you have the Spark? Here’s what we are looking for:

  • Post-Secondary degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Management or Technical discipline
  • Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in project planning and control preferably on EPC projects
  • Proficiency in project control and monitoring principles
  • Advanced MS office skills and proficient in Excel
  • Experience with other Financial/Cost systems is an asset
  • Highly organized and attention to detail and keen on getting accurate data and results
  • Able to manage time effectively and work
  • Able to meet deadlines, deliver, and manage multiple tasks
  • Excellent communication skills both orally and in written

Who is Spark Power?

  • We provide end-to-end electrical contracting, operations and maintenance services, and energy sustainability solutions to the industrial, commercial, utility, and renewable asset markets.
  • We have over 1300 employees across 38 offices across North America.
  • We have numerous exciting projects in commercial, industrial, and institutional sectors across Canada and the US.

What we offer our employees:

  • Diverse and exciting scope of work
  • Continuous training and skills improvement
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Competitive wages plus incentive program
  • Excellent benefit package with wellness spending account options and corporate discounts
  • RRSP matching
  • Laptop and phone provided
  • Employee Share Ownership Program
  • Fun and supportive company culture

….and much more

title: Controller (bilingual)
description:
Job Description:

CONTROLLER

Bonlook business unit



FYidoctors is Canada's leading diversified healthcare organization. Doctor-led, professionally managed, and patient-focused, the organization concentrates on delivering outstanding eye care and medical aesthetics treatments along with patient-centric products and services. Recognized as one of Canada's Best Managed Companies in 2020 and 2021, the organization operates over 300 locations across the country.

 

BonLook is the latest acquisition of FYi Group and becomes one of their pan-Canadian banners.

BonLook offers an innovative sales experience and stylish products with unwavering quality. Since its inception, the company's goal has been to make prescription eyewear accessible and a must-have fashion accessory with unparalleled value. Initially launched online, the company has 36 points of sale in Canada and over 350 employees. Today, BonLook defines itself as the ultimate destination for a wardrobe of trendy frames, designed and created in Montreal.

 

Why join our team ?

 

  • Participate in the success of a local company founded by entrepreneurs who saw the potential to develop an entire industry.  
  • To evolve in a company whose products are conceived and designed in Montreal in a head office located in the heart of the Saint-Henri district on the banks of the Lachine Canal.
  • Work in a company whose organizational values are applied daily: joy, excellence, innovation and transparency.
  • Participate in a culture of diversity and inclusion in all areas of the company.
  • Develop professionally by having access to training on optics via our internal platform and the coaching of our optician trainers.
  • Access to a competitive total compensation package and a generous employee discount for you, your family and your friends.

 

Position

Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance based in Calgary, the Montreal based Controller has a leading role in the management of BonLook accounting and the financial controls for the preparation, monitoring, analysis, and reporting of financial information.   The Controller sets up processes and policies for controlling accounting and financial information and ensures the effectiveness of internal control systems, followed by budget commitments during the year. The successful candidate will need to be resourceful and proactive in producing reports and analysis relevant to decision-making. Also, the candidate is comfortable in a changing environment and establish appropriate internal controls. The company will be experiencing rapid expansion in the next few years and the candidate is excited about growth and career opportunities within the organization.

Responsibilities

 

  • Production of financial statements and reports on a monthly basis
  • Overseeing operational accounting AP and AR
  • Approving payments and monitoring cash flow
  • Preparation of audit files of three companies and management of the audit process
  • Support the operations team as needed
  • Participation in control of annual and monthly budgets
  • Prepare and communicate variance analysis of results monthly
  • Establishment of internal financial controls according to new business models
  • Oversee the quarterly inventory count process
  • Participation in implementing and migrating the accounting system to NetSuite
  • Production of various reports to government authorities in different provinces in Canada
  • Supervision of a small team of accountants
  • Production of reports reflecting the financial situation of the company
  • Responsible for the accounting cycles of the company, income, and expenses
  • Preparation or approval of journal entries and reconciliations
  • Preparation or approval of monthly working papers
  • Ad hoc projects

 

Qualifications

 

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in accounting
  • CPA designation
  • Minimum of 8 years of relevant experience including 4 years in a company
  • Expert knowledge of Excel, NetSuite and OPENERP (an asset)
  • Analytical and self-starter
  • Strong team spirit, leadership, and ethics
  • High sense of priorities, organization, and autonomy
  • Excellent communication and good management of priorities
  • Strong change management skills
  • Bilingual in English and French



Since its inception, BonLook has been committed to making a difference and promoting diversity and inclusion. We believe that diversity in the workplace provides employees with the opportunity to reach their full potential. BonLook encourages people of all genders and cultures to apply for our roles. We offer equal employment opportunities to all.

title: New - Controller
description:
Overview

Virtek Vision is a leading provider of precision laser-based templating and inspection solutions based in Waterloo, Ontario.  We serve customers worldwide in the aerospace, prefabricated construction, transportation and manufacturing industries.  Our solutions enable customers to produce their products better, faster and at a lower cost. 

As an integral member of the Finance team, reporting to the Senior Director, Finance, this role has both hands-on accounting duties and supervisory duties.  The successful candidate must have solid communication, technology, analytical and management skills.  This role is responsible for planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions.

Functions will include, but not be limited to:

  • Manage the accounting operations (cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable, general accounting and payroll). 
  • Direct responsibilities for inventory, intangible assets and taxation accounting (income & sales tax); review of working papers and journal entries; and completion of month end reporting supporting schedules
  • Weekly selection for vendor payments, electronic authorization of vendor payments
  • Assessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes in adherence to company policies
  • Supporting adoption of new US GAAP pronouncements
  • Provide solutions to internal staff on accounting issues
  • Mentoring and supervision of four direct reports
  • Project lead for replacement ERP implementation
  • Coordinating activities of external auditors, regulatory audits, Statistics Canada and global tax compliance

 

Skills and Expertise required:

  • CPA designation is required for this role with a solid understanding of US GAAP, with a minimum of five years post qualification experience, five years employee management experience,
  • Understanding of US sales tax would be an asset
  • Experience with ERP/MRP and CRM systems is an asset
  • Impeccable attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple competing priorities
  • Ability to be a committed team player and provide exceptional internal and external customer service

 We Offer

  • Great team members!
  • Competitive wages & benefits
  • RSP Program
  • Training Support

 

Virtek encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available upon request.  Should you need an accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process please contact us at 519-746-7190 ext. 202.

title: Controlleur Financier / Financial Controller
description:
DESCRIPTION DU POSTE
 
Se rapportant au  Président, le Contrôleur financier planifie, organise et coordonne l’ensemble des opérations du cycle comptable. Il assure le contrôle comptable, le suivi financier et la fiabilité des informations comptables et financières pour l’ensemble de l’entreprise. IL supervise une équipe de 5 personnes dédiée à la comptabilité.

RESPONSABILITÉS
  • Diriger les activités reliées au crédit, au recouvrement et aux comptes payables;
  • Superviser la production des états financiers mensuels et procéder à des analyses de performance;
  • Superviser les comptes payables, la facturation et  les comptes recevable
  • Assurer que les inventaires sont correctement comptabilisés et évalués au système financier
  • Développer les politiques et les procédures requises au bon fonctionnement de la  fonction comptable;
  • Assurer le respect des lois fiscales;
  • Assurer un suivi du respect des contrôles et des politiques internes et implanter les mesures correctives lorsque requis;
  • Effectuer le suivi et la mise à jour des composantes/variables du coût de revient;
  • Effectuer la planification, l’analyse et le suivi des budgets;
  • Préparer des rapports sur les mesures financières en temps opportun (budgets, prévisions de la trésorerie, autres indicateurs financiers); 
  • Superviser la préparation du dossier de vérification externe et assurer le rôle de personne ressource dans le cadre du processus de vérification annuelle; 
  •  S’acquitter des autres tâches qui lui seront assignées.
 
PROFIL DU CANDIDAT
Éducation 
  • Baccalauréat en administration; 
  • Détenir un titre comptable de CPA –CGA -CMA

Expérience
  • Minimum 10 ans d’expérience de travail en comptabilité dont au moins 3 années à titre de contrôleur financier; 
  • Expérience en gestion de personnel; 
  • Expérience en implantation de systèmes comptables (un atout); 
  • ·Expérience en gestion de filiales à l’étranger (un atout);

Compétences
  • Bonne maîtrise de la planification financière (gestion budgétaire, prévisions financières, analyse financière); 
  • Connaissances des normes liées aux programmes de crédits d’impôts en Recherche et développement; 
  • Connaissance du système comptable Sage 300 et (un atout);  
  • Excellentes habiletés de coaching, mobilisation et formation; 
  • Forte capacité d’analyse, esprit critique et de synthèse; 
  • Rigueur et intégrité; 
  • Excellentes habiletés relationnelles et de communication;
  • Excellente habiletés à planifier et organiser le travail et à gérer les priorités.                                     
  • Facilité à s’adapter aux changements; 
  • Orienté résultats, action, flexible et capacité de travailler sous pression; 
  • Autonomie. 

Aptitudes
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais à l’oral et à l’écrit; 
  • Office Excel niveau avancé.

title: Business Controller
description:
Business ControllerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Smart Buildings digitally transforms commercial, industrial and residential buildings for the highest comfort, efficiency, safety and security - enhancing quality of life in the buildings of the future, through sustainable electrification solutions, services and products.As the Business Controller, you will be a vital member of the finance team within the Emergency Lighting business in Dorval, Quebec. Reporting to Global Business Controller Emergency Lighting you will provide key support to the business, ensuring accurate tracking and processing of all transactions.
Your responsibilities

  • Serving as the key partner for the Emergency Lighting Business Line Unit Manager in determining business strategy in line with wider Division and Product Group strategies.
  • Translating business strategy into plans and establishing measurable targets, evaluating the financial implications of various strategic decisions, identifying risks and recommending actions.
  • Overseeing the business planning and forecasting process for Emergency Lighting Business Line and serving as the interface with the country function.
  • Establishing cost structures, productivity optimization and capital efficiency while closely monitoring cash flow and taking relevant actions to improve net working capital.
  • Ensuring compliance with internal guidelines/procedures and external regulatory requirements.
  • Performing financial analysis, reporting to business managers and making suggestions to improve performance, where appropriate.
  • Establishing and overseeing the processes and tools necessary to obtain transparent and reliable financial data and business information, ensuring high quality information in line with defined standards and financial closing schedules.
  • Ensuring timely and efficient communication with relevant Local/Country/Division/Region Controllers, the Accounting Center and other internal customers to identify and discuss issues, suggestions for improvement of operations, work quality and efficiency.
  • Living ABB's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues, and the business.

Your background
  • 3 - 5 years of experience in a similar role preferably in a manufacturing environment.
  • A Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Business.
  • Experience with computerized accounting systems and financial reporting software.
  • Current CPA/CMA valid in Quebec.
  • Outstanding attention to detail, accuracy and ability to multitask.
  • A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, fluency in French and English, spoken and written.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our websitewww.abb.com.For the 4th year in a row, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's top employers by Forbes Magazine and has been ranked #1 within the industry category. Also named as Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Top Employers, Canada's Top Employers for Young People, and Best Candidate Experience Award (CandE Award), ABB's culture and commitment are to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Hybrid

title: Controller
description:
Water Made Exciting!

At SodaStream, we are growing fast and looking for problem-solvers and thought leaders that are ready to grow with us. If you have the energy and determination, then we'll provide the tools you need for success. We have fantastic benefits and a variety of perks that create an outstanding work environment for all our employees.

Benefits

  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability, and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with Employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.

Job Summary:

The Controller is responsible for providing leadership and coordination of the company’s financial and accounting management. The Controller oversees company accounting receivables, payables, taxes and Internal Controls functions. The incumbent also performs the review and analysis of all month end, and year end and financial statements along with a number of other financial areas including cash flow, banking, credit analysis and HQ reporting requirements. This person will be responsible for developing policies, procedures for areas of their responsibility as well as ensuring compliance.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze complex financial information and reports to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management
  • Develop, implement and oversee accounting processes and controls
  • Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variance
  • Manage the team through month-end, year-end and and support forecast cycle processes
  • Prepare and analyze budget and cashflow forecasts
  • Prepare financial statements and reports, including presentation materials for HQ meetings
  • Support the acquisition of capital assets and ensure that assets are properly recorded, amortized, and disposed of as appropriate
  • Lead annual review of internal controls for the Canadian operation to ensure adherence; responsible to implement remediation to address any control issues
  • Provide direction and oversight to Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable
  • Ensure compliance with all accounting policies and procedures, as well as government reporting requirements/ payments


Country:
Canada

Requirements:

  • University Degree/ College Diploma in Accounting, Finance or other related discipline
  • CPA designation
  • 7-10 years of experience in a management capacity, specifically in a general accounting position overseeing statement preparation and analysis
  • Prior experience using and ERP system, analytical software, reporting software, and Microsoft Office Suite. Net Suite and TM1 an asset.
  • Experience in the CPG industry preferred
  • Strong people leadership and development abilities; ability to accomplish tasks and projects through engaging others
  • Strong business acumen; ability to effectively partner with and advise business groups to achieve desired results (Supply Chain, IT, Sales, Marketing, HR, HQ)
  • Excellent communication, organization and planning skills; able to meet tight deadlines
  • Proactive self-starter
  • Strong attention to detail and desire to define clear processes
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills
  • GAAP

SodaStream Canada is committed to an inclusive, recruitment and selection processes. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, SodaStream Canada will provide accommodation throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please advise the Human Resources Department

title: RPA Controller
description:
RPA Controller
Our client is a global leaders in professional services. In the role of RPA Controller you will manage the workload of the digital workforce. Right now they are running 120 processes and plan on increasing that to 200 by the end of the year.
Responsibilities:
  • Managing Bots, monitoring automated processes and performing daily administration tasks. Coordination of manual processing of exceptions.
  • Scheduling and prioritizing the processes.
  • Communicate breakdowns and downtime to the concerned stake holders in a timely manner and ensure that the various SLAs are met.
  • Ensure the RPA operations documentation is kept up to date and include all changes.
  • Optimization of the Robots through realigning of the schedule runs & Multi Bots processing
  • Ensure we meet the SLA’S from the business for the processes the RPA team has automated.
  • Act as second level support for workflows and processes, infrastructure, platform management; identify incidents, determine whether they are workflow related or systems related and escalate to Business owner, SME, developer or IT support respectively.
  • Ensure all Blue Prism processes are properly scheduled, and platform resources are adequate and available.
  • As the volume of automated process increases, the Controller must determine resource balancing and schedules to ensure SLAs are met.
  • Plan for platform growth by reviewing trends and RPA roadmaps, and formulate recommendations for approval.
Requirements
  • Require 2 to 3 years’ experience in an RPA controller Role.
  • Have excellent problem solving and analytical skills necessary to support large scale IT systems and networks.
  • Good communication and organization skills – able to explain technical issues in a clear and concise manner.
  • Team player & collaborates well in cross-functional teams.
  • Database knowledge and SQL experience.
  • Experience with RPA and/or Test Automation a plus. Knowledge of Software Development a plus.
  • The following Blue Prism certifications, while not required, would be of added benefit; Blue Prism Foundation Training, Blue Prism Installation Engineer Certification, Blue Prism Technical Architect Certification

title: Controller
description:
We are searching for a Controller for our client, a fast-growing, privately-held designer and manufacturer of industrial lighting fixtures in Etobicoke. The opportunity arises due to the upcoming retirement of a long-tenured member of the team.

The company is on a steep growth curve in a rapidly advancing sector (i.e. LED lighting), an area with huge potential for energy savings and positive global impacts. With roots going back over 50 years, they are also poised as a leader in new technology. They have a strong collaborative culture and an aggressive growth agenda.

The successful candidate will be a finance leader able to lead a team through full-cycle accounting and reporting, with a particular focus on manufacturing costing. The role reports to the VP of Finance and is a key member of the management team. Experience in manufacturing or distribution and strong Excel skills are required.

The ideal candidate:
  • Has a CPA designation, and 5+ years of management experience.
  • Has a strong understanding of product costing, Bill-of-Material management, etc.
  • Is a strong communicator, and respected people manager
  • Has a high level of integrity, dependability, and sense of urgency
  • Collaborates effectively across the organization
  • Has a curious and analytical mindset.
Apply today and in confidence to be considered for this opportunity.

title: Controller
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Controller at our 591 Arvin Ave. facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reports directly to the Director of Finance.

Responsibilities:

ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING & ANALYSIS

  • Responsible for the accuracy and maintenance of the General Ledger and accounting systems, including providing oversight of all day-to-day accounting transactions.
  • Preparation of timely and accurate monthly, quarterly and annual year-end financial statements plus other reporting and analysis for internal management and external financial stakeholders.
  • Provides a detailed review and analysis of monthly consolidated financial statements including analysis on sales, gross margins/program profitability, expenses and inventories.
  • Leadership in co-ordinating and managing all internal and external audits.
  • Plans and co-ordinates all aspects of the year-end audit to ensure a smooth audit process and clean audit results. Activities include: preparation of the audit package and schedules, review of tax and other provisions, preparation of the financial statements and notes to the financial statements, and interface with external auditors.
  • Prepares reports for regulatory agencies.
  • Responsible for preparing all schedules and information to support the completion of Corporate Income Tax Returns and Tax Planning.
  • Provides support to the Director of Taxes.

BANKING, CASH MANAGEMENT AND TREASURY

  • Prepares and submits reports to the bank and other external entities.
  • Responsible for cash flow management, processing and reporting of cash.
  • Responsible for the corporate accounts receivable and accounts payable operations and accounting processes.
  • Manages reporting to support insurance coverage, including reporting of Insurable Values to insurance providers on an annual basis.

INTERNAL CONTROLS AND SYSTEMS

  • Ensures compliance with accounting policies and procedures and generally accepted accounting principles.
  • Monitors, evaluates, enhances and maintains the internal controls to support the business.
  • Establishes and recommends to senior management objectives, policies and procedures for the safeguarding of corporate assets.
  • Responsible for the integrity and accuracy of the Fixed Asset Sub-ledger.
  • Senior leader in the deployment of upgrades to the ERP system and implementation of other new systems and software.

BUSINESS LEADERSHIP AND OPERATION SUPPORT

  • Leadership in managing direct reports, executing on people management best practices and fostering a culture of teamwork and operational excellence.
  • Key member of the Senior Finance Leadership team responsible for business simplification and process re-engineering of accounting and financial processes.
  • Participates as part of the company leadership team in supporting business activities and the achievement of corporate objectives.
  • Provide business advice, analysis and guidance to support Operations, Engineering, Quality, Sales, IT, Purchasing, HR and Legal.
  • Provides data, analysis and advice to ownership & senior management in assessing and evaluating business opportunities and strategic plans.
  • Supports and enforces the company priority of Safe Operations, assisting and managing others to perform work in a safe manner so that no work site accident or illness results from any operational activity.

Qualifications:

  • Accounting designation, CPA/CA Preferred
  • University degree (Business Administration or Accounting/Finance)
  • At least 5 years' experience in Public Accounting (Audit) and/or related experience
  • Management experience leading teams
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Manufacturing experience is an asset
  • Experience in business process re-engineering and process simplification
  • Strong systems & computer skills (Knowledgeable in ERP/MRP, QAD experience is an asset: Microsoft Office, Excel, other accounting packages)


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources athr@tiercon.com.

title: Controller
description:
About the Opportunity

Rohit Group is expanding! We are currently looking for a full-time Controller to join our team from our office in Edmonton, Alberta. The Controller is a mid-senior position who acts as the head of accounting, and oversees the preparation of financial reports, such as balance sheets and income statements.

Your key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

What will you do in this role?

  • Overseeing the operations of the transactional accounting department, including the design of an organizational structure adequate for achieving the companyâ€™s goals and objectives.
  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business results.
  • Coordinating and preparing internal and external financial statements.
  • Coordinating activities of external auditors.
  • Providing management with information vital to the decision-making process.
  • Evolving current accounting operations to manage the growth of the organization in an efficient and effective manner.
  • Maintaining the chart of accounts and internal control systems over accounting transactions.
  • Evaluating the effectiveness of accounting software and supporting database, as needed.
  • Overseeing regulatory reporting, frequently, including tax planning and compliance.
  • Staying abreast of financial related practices, trends, political/regulatory activities, and competitive economic changes which may affect the ability of the team to meet objectives.
  • Overseeing the payroll functions including all related regulatory tax compliance.
  • Managing the Corporate and real estate insurance risks.
  • Monitoring the treasury daily and maximizing the efficient use or allocation of cash.
  • Developing the team and improving their performance through coaching and feedback loop.
  • Hiring, training, and retaining skilled accounting staff.

What do we look for?

  • 5 years in a management role and a CPA designation.
  • Possess deep knowledge of accounting principles.
  • Possess broad knowledge of income and excise tax rules
  • Exposure to end-to-end Finance function.
  • Strong analytical skills, problem-solving and critical thinking
  • Demonstrated leadership skills across large and diverse business and ability to recruit and develop high-performing team.
  • Influential personality to drive results and facilitate the growth of a profitable business. 
  • Proven track record in project cost accounting and reporting.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in internal controls and processes is required.
  • Effective time management and prioritization skills in managing multiple projects.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Exposure to different styles and personalities of business unit leaders.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, a self-starter, and driver of change.

Assets

  • Experience in managing a multi-level and multi-companies in different jurisdictions.
  • Experience in change management.
  • Working experience in a Shared Services environment.
  • Working experience as a controller.
  • Working experience in Power BI, Synapse and/or Power Query.
  • Working experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365.

Who are we ?

Rooted in family values and entrepreneurial spirit, Rohit Group of Companies was founded in 1986 by Radhe Gupta. Together with his wife Krishna and son Rohit, Radhe grew the company from a small home builder to a diversified organization with operations in home building, residential and land development, residential rentals, commercial assets, and real estate lending.

This vertical integration has positioned Rohit Group as an award-winning industry leader in Canada with operations in Edmonton, Calgary, Regina, Saskatoon, and Ottawa.

For more information, please visit ourwebsite

Grow with us

As a valued member of our team, you will be awarded a competitive salary evaluated on knowledge, skills and experience, plus:

  • $1,200 Annual Phone and Computer Allowances
  • Competitive Health, dental, vision, and life/disability insurance plans
  • $600 Annual Personal Wellness Spending Account
  • Encouragement and financial support for continuous learning & development programs and numerous opportunities for growth and mentorship
  • Corporate Wellness Program (recreational facilities, fitness, and health centers)
  • Employee discount program on Rohit products
  • 100% Employer matched RRSP program
  • $2,000 per referred hire as part of our Employee Referral Bonus
  • And many more!

Experience. Opportunity. Efficiency. Integrity. Innovation. Perseverance. Balance. Leadership. These are the 8 core values that are at the heart of Rohit Group.

If our values resonate to you and are looking for an exciting opportunity and a rewarding career, look no further. We are always looking to add talented individuals to our team. Apply now!

title: Business Unit Controller
description:
_The WRIGHT career!_


As part of Curtiss-Wright's Valve Division, Dyna-Flo is a Control Valves manufacturing business catering to the global process industry's most critical applications. As a recognized leader within the Oil & Gas, Chemical, Petrochemical, and Refining, Dyna-Flo offers a diverse product portfolio of Control Valve Systems.


Curtiss-Wright invests in the development, recruitment, and retention of critical skills as part of its model for business success. We offer a competitive wage, a comprehensive benefits package including medical and prescription drug coverage, dental benefits, life and disability insurance, retirement, tuition reimbursement, and paid vacation/holidays.


Title:Business Unit Controller, Reporting to the Business Unit General Manager


Coordinates, administers, and controls financial operations for the business unit while mitigating financial risk to the Company. Provides tax, insurance and other reports required by governmental regulations. Reviews, analyzes, and interprets financial and budgetary reports. Directs all aspects of accounting operations and the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial forecasts. Oversees the development of financial accounting systems required to maintain reporting requirements. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function.


Location:Edmonton, Alberta


Your Challenge:


+ Ensures compliance with GAAP and other regulatory or governmental requirements such as Sarbanes-Oxley, Cost Accounting Standards (CAS), and Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) as well as Corporate policies and procedures. Must stay attuned to early warnings of financial problems, and be able to provide suggestions on decisive action to resolve or address these problems.

+ Provide advice in developing objectives, strategies and tactics from an accounting and financial perspective. Plays an active role in the evaluation of business systems and develops proposals for upgrades. Measures performance against company goals

+ Ensures accurate and timely reporting of financial statements and analyses results based on actual and forecast revenue/budget and provides reports with observation/recommendations to location management.

+ Coordinates the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual budgets, forecasts, and cash flow projections to guide the financial management of the business segment.

+ Review proposals and appropriation requests, analyze ledger and module transactions, prepare special reports, handle routine and special projects, manage elements of A/R and A/P transactional flow, active participation in strategic planning process.

+ Interfaces with Program Management and Engineering to ensure accuracy of development program costs to date and estimates to complete in support of POC Revenue recognition.

+ Prepares month end journal entries, maintain and reconcile ledger accounts, determine inventory reserve requirements.

+ Lead and/or support annual Dyna-Flo physical inventories that include on-site implementation.

+ Annual Cost Roll coordination, preparation, and implementation of standard cost rates.

+ Detailed, hands-on work of cost accounting and inventory analysis and reporting.

+ Collects data, allocates costs, and prepares reports on labor, equipment, depreciation, assembly, or other

+ operating expenses, ensuring that established procedures are followed.

+ Other ad hoc and special reporting related to financial reporting, P&L analysis, and cost and inventory


Your Expertise:


+ Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration. MBA preferred

+ CPA, with 10+ years of industrial product manufacturing experince

+ Valve product knowledge/experience preferred

+ Strong oral and written communication skills with knowledge of MS Office

+ Strong report writing abilities

+ Excellent critical thinking, analytical skills, and problem-solving abilities


This position may require exposure to information that is subject to US export control regulations, i.e. the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) or the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of U.S. regulations.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request. #IND

title: Financial Controller
description:
Over the past 10 years, Influitive has built an incredible team of smart, motivated, and experienced â€˜Influviansâ€™ in Toronto and across North America, for its customer marketing and engagement software (SaaS) solution . As we grow our business and our profits, organically as well as through acquisitions, our finance & accounting processes as well as internal/ external financial reporting requirements are becoming more sophisticated. Itâ€™s an exciting time to be part of this fast-moving, thriving company; and at this time we are rounding out our finance team, ensuring it is properly scaled to match the increased operational and reporting needs we have today and anticipate having in the future.


Thatâ€™s where you come in! Working on our awesome finance team, the Financial Controller role will take primary responsibility for the companyâ€™s consolidated monthly financial reporting, including accounting statements as well as SaaS metrics. You will be working with other members of the team in ensuring complete and proper accounting of financial transactions, revenue recognition, etc., in addition to taking on several other analytical projects and operational tasks from time to time. 


If you are a qualified accountant with prior experience in a SaaS business, looking to get hands-on experience in corporate accounting and analytical finance, this is the opportunity for you!


How youâ€™d make a huge impact here - and on your career:

  • Youâ€™ll be responsible for overseeing our month-end reporting processes, and consolidation of our parent company (Canadian and US operations) and subsidiary financials, in accordance with US GAAP.
  • Youâ€™ll be leading special finance projects in partnership with the leadership team, to support decision making and improve business processes; also creating ad-hoc reports and supportive analyses to assist with business strategy planning and forecasting.
  • Youâ€™ll compare and analyze the variance in monthly financials, versus the companyâ€™s budget.
  • Youâ€™ll partner with VP of Finance and Sales Operations manager in tracking SaaS metrics and dashboards for reference by the leadership team.
  • Youâ€™ll run the commissions calculation process (through salesforce.com) for all members of the sales team on a monthly basis.
  • Youâ€™ll oversee our payroll accountant to ensure accurate processing of payroll in Canada as well as the US.
  • Youâ€™ll be playing an important role in finance systems and process integrations in relation to our recently acquired subsidiary, and potentially with more future acquisitions.
  • Youâ€™ll take responsibility for the companyâ€™s annual external audit process as well as tax filing compliance work, working directly with our Big4 firms on their requests.
  • Youâ€™ll be setting up accounting best practices and guide the team as and when necessary, in ensuring all non-routine transactions are recognized and reported correctly.

Qualifications and Skills required

  • You have a CPA designation with at least 6-8 years of post-qualification experience and a thorough understanding of US GAAP. 
  • Relevant work experience in a corporate business environment (SaaS) is required.
  • You are highly organized and detail-oriented, combined with a curious and analytical bent of mind.
  • You have good knowledge of and a strong desire to learn and present SaaS-business metrics.
  • You are fully comfortable with your Microsoft Excel skills.
  • You are flexible and understand that scale-up environments are fast paced and dynamic.
  • You enjoy working independently and driving multiple projects simultaneously, while pulling in cross-functional teams for support, where needed.

Note: This is a full-time position, reporting to the VP of Finance.
 


 


At Influitive, we believe that diverse and open teams perform the best.

Fostering an inclusive environment where we can learn and grow from each others’ perspectives is an important element of our growing family. Influitive welcomes and encourages people from all backgrounds, abilities, experiences and perspectives to apply to join our team. We are committed to being an equal opportunity employer, and are happy to provide accommodations upon request at all stages of the interview process. If you require accommodations due to a disability, please contact us at talent@influitive.com.

If you're up for an adventure, we hope you'll apply to join our team!

title: Ingénieur en Contrôle de Coût \ Cost Controller Engineer
description:
English version follows.

Progesys est une firme reconnue en gestion de projets industriels et leurs transitions optimales de la construction à l’opération. La société est basée à Laval (Canada) depuis 2002 et possède des bureaux aux États-Unis, au Moyen-Orient et en Asie.

Progesys est à la recherche d'un Ingénieur en Contrôle de Coûtpour rejoindre son équipe de travail !

Principales responsabilités:

  • Planifier et organiser la gestion et les contrôles du projet
  • Participer aux prévisions, à la ligne de base de contrôle des coûts et aux délais
  • Supporter les projets en cours avec l'analyse des coûts, les rapports, les prévisions, la budgétisation et la gestion du changement
  • Préparer des rapports de coûts mensuels et des relevés des coûts-heures et des progrès du travail (budgets, prévisions, dépenses, engagements)
  • Exécuter les procédures de gestion de changement et veiller à ce qu'elles soient suivies tout au long du projet
  • Émettre les mises à jour budgétaires et les flux de trésorerie du projet.
  • Préparer les prévisions, les rapports sur les tendances des coûts et suivre les prévisions de coûts et de budget
  • Surveiller et faire des rapports sur les répercussions financières dû aux changements
  • Assurer le respect des procédures de qualité en matière de contrôle de la documentation
  • Établir et maintenir des relations avec les clients
  • Surveiller la conformité de la santé, de la sécurité, de la réglementation et de l'environnement
  • Coordonner les efforts des différentes parties prenantes
  • Travailler avec les coordonnateurs de contrats sur les budgets des contrats, les paiements progressifs, le processus de fin de mois, les variations des contrats, ainsi que la clôture des contrats.
  • Surveiller la qualité globale des produits livrables
  • Soutenir l'équipe de gestion pour s'assurer que le projet respecte le budget approuvé.
  • Diriger, former et encadrer une équipe de contrôleurs de coûts

Qualifications requises :

  • Baccalauréat en génie mécanique, industriel ou civil
  • Au moins 5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle de contrôleur de coûts, dans un environnement EPCM sur des projets industriels ou miniers légers ou lourds.
  • Expérience de travail avec PRISM G2 est un atout.
  • Excellente connaissance des contrôles d’ingénierie, du contrôle des coûts, de la comptabilité des projets et des rapports sur les projets.
  • Connaissance des achats / contrats, de la gestion de la construction et de la planification.
  • Excellentes aptitudes analytiques et attention aux détails.
  • Réflexion stratégique. Capacité de gérer et de prendre des décisions
  • Un bon communicateur
  • Capacité de travailler avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires
  • Connaissance approfondie de MS Office, en particulier Excel est obligatoire.
  • Connaissance de Primavera, SAP
  • Bilingue (anglais, français)

Vous désirez joindre une entreprise en pleine croissance qui valorise le développement professionnel et personnel de ses employés? Vous désirez travailler avec une équipe dynamique où vous pouvez relever des défis intéressants? Nous attendons votre candidature dès maintenant!

Merci pour votre intérêt. Veuillez noter que seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

___________________________________________________________________________________

Progesys is a recognized firm in project management and the optimal transition of these projects from construction to operation. The company has been based in Laval (Canada) since 2002 and has offices in the United States, the Middle East and Asia.

Progesys is looking for a cost controller to work on current and future projects in Canada. The person will be responsible for the implementation of control procedures, from the initiation phase to the completion of the project. The cost controller is also responsible that all cost activities, including change management, are reported and tracked accordingly.

Main responsibilities:

  • Support in monitoring the Project performance, activities progress, verifying and reviewing progress and cost reports.
  • Understand the project resources requirements, review manpower curve and act to prevent any resource constraints.
  • Prepare and issue monthly status reports providing critical analysis of progress status, trends and potential problems as well as identifying corrective action.
  • Review contractors’ monthly payment certificates and submit to Project Manager for final approval.
  • Receive, review, assess and document any request for change from contractors in accordance with contractual agreements and project procedures.
  • Establish and implement change order control system and procedures for contract management and scope change.
  • Follow-up on project incurred costs (commitments and actual costs).
  • Support the Project Manager in preparing, controlling, and minimizing scope variations on contracts.
  • Manage risk management register.
  • Record details of commitments following the initial award of contract / purchase orders, including the registration of amendments and change orders,
  • Update the overall project forecast of direct (contracts, purchase orders, etc.) and indirect costs, as well as project contingency on a monthly basis, following reviews with key stakeholders.
  • Update the Management Reserve monthly following a review and agreement with the Project Manager.
  • Prepare Commitment Approval Form while presenting a Recommendation to Award for a Purchase Order or Contract.
  • Review of budget and forecast during the Commitment Package Close-out process.

Required qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering preferred.
  • At least 10 years of experience in a role of cost controller on industrial projects, for example: mines and metals, petrochemicals, pulp and paper, energy.
  • Working knowledge of PRISM G2 Cost Management software is required.
  • AACE Cost Engineer certification is an asset.
  • Excellent knowledge of engineering controls, cost control, project accounting and project reports.
  • Thorough knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel is essential.
  • Solid analytical and reasoning abilities required.
  • Excellent communication, in English and French.
  • Must have strong teamwork skills with the ability to establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships. ​
  • Ability to work in a constantly changing environment.

You want to join a growing company that values professional and personal development of its employees in respect of the individual and family life? You want to work with a dynamic team where you can reach and surpass your goals?

Join our team and submit your application now via our website http://progesys.ca/careers

Thank you for your interest. Please note that only selected applicants will be contacted.

description:
The WRIGHT career!

As part of Curtiss-Wright's Valve Division, Dyna-Flo is a Control Valves manufacturing business catering to the global process industry's most critical applications. As a recognized leader within the Oil & Gas, Chemical, Petrochemical, and Refining, Dyna-Flo offers a diverse product portfolio of Control Valve Systems.

Curtiss-Wright invests in the development, recruitment, and retention of critical skills as part of its model for business success. We offer a competitive wage, a comprehensive benefits package including medical and prescription drug coverage, dental benefits, life and disability insurance, retirement, tuition reimbursement, and paid vacation/holidays.

Title: Business Unit Controller, Reporting to the Business Unit General Manager

Coordinates, administers, and controls financial operations for the business unit while mitigating financial risk to the Company. Provides tax, insurance and other reports required by governmental regulations. Reviews, analyzes, and interprets financial and budgetary reports. Directs all aspects of accounting operations and the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial forecasts. Oversees the development of financial accounting systems required to maintain reporting requirements. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function.

Location: Edmonton, Alberta

Your Challenge:


* Ensures compliance with GAAP and other regulatory or governmental requirements such as Sarbanes-Oxley, Cost Accounting Standards (CAS), and Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) as well as Corporate policies and procedures. Must stay attuned to early warnings of financial problems, and be able to provide suggestions on decisive action to resolve or address these problems.
* Provide advice in developing objectives, strategies and tactics from an accounting and financial perspective. Plays an active role in the evaluation of business systems and develops proposals for upgrades. Measures performance against company goals
* Ensures accurate and timely reporting of financial statements and analyses results based on actual and forecast revenue/budget and provides reports with observation/recommendations to location management.
* Coordinates the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual budgets, forecasts, and cash flow projections to guide the financial management of the business segment.
* Review proposals and appropriation requests, analyze ledger and module transactions, prepare special reports, handle routine and special projects, manage elements of A/R and A/P transactional flow, active participation in strategic planning process.
* Interfaces with Program Management and Engineering to ensure accuracy of development program costs to date and estimates to complete in support of POC Revenue recognition.
* Prepares month end journal entries, maintain and reconcile ledger accounts, determine inventory reserve requirements.
* Lead and/or support annual Dyna-Flo physical inventories that include on-site implementation.
* Annual Cost Roll coordination, preparation, and implementation of standard cost rates.
* Detailed, hands-on work of cost accounting and inventory analysis and reporting.
* Collects data, allocates costs, and prepares reports on labor, equipment, depreciation, assembly, or other
* operating expenses, ensuring that established procedures are followed.
* Other ad hoc and special reporting related to financial reporting, P&L analysis, and cost and inventory



Your Expertise:


* Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration. MBA preferred
* CPA, with 10 years of industrial product manufacturing experince
* Valve product knowledge/experience preferred
* Strong oral and written communication skills with knowledge of MS Office
* Strong report writing abilities
* Excellent critical thinking, analytical skills, and problem-solving abilities

This position may require exposure to information that is subject to US export control regulations, i.e. the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) or the Export Administration Regulations (EAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of U.S. regulations.

Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. title: Corporate Controller
description:
About You:

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us:

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.


Overview

Avison Young's Corporate Accounting division is searching for a talented individual to join the team located in Alberta.  As a Corporate Controller, you will become an integral part of our corporate accounting group and will be completing a variety of accounting responsibilities for the Alberta platform. 


Responsibilities

Region of responsibility is Alberta 

  • Monitor the financial performance and manage accounting processes of the region 
  • Manage and review all supporting financial schedules to ensure balances are current and appropriate 
  • Review GL details for accuracy and completeness, including but not limited to reconciling revenue, reconciling commission expense and verifying proper coding of direct expenses. 
  • Prepare monthly financial statements with variance comments, adhering to strict reporting deadlines 
  • Work closely with Managing Directors; communicate financial results and other financial metrics regularly; provide information as requested for special projects 
  • Responsible for Accounts Receivables and Other Receivables, including Employee chargebacks and Draws 
  • Manage and review payroll information, including weekly commission payments 
  • Ensure compliance with real estate regulations related to Trade Records, Trust accounts and commission payments 
  • Prepare annual operating and CAPEX budget as well as provide reforecasts as required 
  • Support quarterly and year end audit requirements. 
  • Ensure that all tax payment obligations are met for region. Includes tax installments, payroll source deduction remittances, GST returns, WCB, etc. 
  • Provide information for tax, legal and regulatory requirements as requested. 
  • Participate in improvement initiatives around internal controls and system processes 
  • Special projects as assigned


Qualifications

  • Professional recognized accounting designation with minimum 5 years of relevant experience.
  • Strong knowledge in financial and operational reporting and analysis.
  • Advanced Excel knowledge.
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Highly organized, able to multi-task and manage time effectively in a demanding fast-paced environment


Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.  We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. 

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. 

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: PnL Controller
description:
15 month Contract

PNL Controller

P&L Controller Responsibilities:

Departmental Objectives
The preparation and supervisions of daily and monthly management revenues for the Equity activity and their reconciliation with the estimates of the traders and with the financial accounts
The participation in business development initiatives across support functions and locations
Analysis and reporting of daily P&L with detailed Greek breakdown for multiple products including futures, options, equities, variance & correlation swaps, interest rate derivatives and Structured Products
Reconciliation of PnL to Front office estimates with detailed Greeks and New deal breakdown
Resolution of PV breaks between client/ counterparty settlement amounts and P&L control estimates
Substantiation and resolution of Back office ledger vs. P&L systems cash breaks on a daily basis
Ensuring the pricing configuration complies with trading strategy and internal controls, collaboration with V&RC and Risk required to enforce consistency
Analysis, understanding and commentary on PnL using analytical tools
Working with front office and trade support and other parts of the middle office to resolve operational and booking issues
Working with front office and market risk to finalize month end PnL validating Map and Reserves at the trading book level
Collaboration with Risk to evaluate and explain cash and PV movements above established thresholds to facilitate risk reporting
Ensuring the MTD management P&Ls are consistent with the final end of month general ledger P&L
Monitoring the FX exposure of the group to analyze and report deviations from the mean
Lead new systems deployment which is not limited to being part of TAC/NAC, gathering requirements, testing UAT database, ensuring results match expectations and reporting impacts
Discussing and reviewing trading P&Ls with management
Assist with the training and development of junior (analyst) members of the team
Continuously improving controls
Continuously improving efficiencies

Trader Support & Customer Service
Liaise with trading floor personnel and ensure a satisfactory resolution of all FO inquiries
Interact with Operations functions and other infrastructure groups to support a one team approach
Resolve all issues / conflicts and strive to meet or surpass the service level agreement
Manage deadlines and objectives

Communication
Ensure timely and efficient dissemination of data and the resolution of inquiries
Identify and escalate time / risk sensitive issues to the team supervisor
Cohesively explain and maintain own position, logically, in light of differing views

Culture
Focus on the needs of the business
Act with integrity, accepting responsibility for actions
Recognize opportunities for creativity and development of processes
Achieve a sensible work/life balance.

Applicable to All

Ensure the business area conducts its activity in accordance with all relevant external regulators and internal policies.

Minimum Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor s degree or equivalent required
  • 2+ years of previous experience in P&L Control, Finance, Trade Support, Valuations, Risk, or Front Office environment including 1+ years covering Equity derivatives & hedges (e.g. Futures, Options, Structured Products, Equity Swaps, Variance Swaps, and Dispersion Swaps)
  • Strong working knowledge of P&L attributes/Greeks
  • Superior attention to detail and accuracy
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills a must
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work as part of a team in a split team organization
  • Strong Excel & PC skills with proven ability to work with multiple systems
  • Spirit of continuous improvement
  • Display good relationship qualities, team spirit, and ability to work across teams
  • Possess Control mindset

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Working knowledge of Programming languages such as VBA & Python (strong preference)
  • Graduate degree in Finance, Math or Engineering or other quantitative disciplines
  • Previous experience in Equity Derivatives P&L
  • Fluency in financial markets with an emphasis on Equities
  • Experience in pricing, valuation or hedging of derivatives

title: Senior Project Controller
description:
With offices in Africa, Australia, Canada and the Philippines, Lycopodium proudly delivers high quality professional engineering and project delivery services globally, across the mining and metals; infrastructure and process industries. By joining our global team and learning from renowned subject matter experts, we can offer you a rich and diverse career.

Lycopodium Minerals Canada is currently recruiting for a Senior Project Controller to join our growing team in Mississauga.

Reporting to the Project Controls Manager the Senior Project Controller is responsible for the accurate, effective, and timely control of Project costs and accounting functions to produce deliverable inline with Client’s and Project’s standards.

Your Main Objectives:

  • Ensure all the budgets; forecasts and cost commitments are produced efficiently to a high standard in line with Company, Client and regulatory requirements.
  • Provide specialist advice in designated areas of expertise.
  • Work collaboratively with personnel across all business units.

Your keyresponsibilities will include but are not limited to:

  • Support team members with re-forecasting and estimating activities to complete project cost forecasts (trending). 
  • Assist with the conversion of project estimate to capital control budget. 
  • Monitor Project performance including costs, progress against schedule and internal reviews to provide a transparent assessment of critical project performances.
  • Evaluate project progress to ensure that it is meeting budgetary and deadline objectives. Recognise progress concerns and report immediately to the Project Managers to ensure projects are completed within both budgetary and schedule constraints.
  • Collate project cost reporting requirements in accordance with company and Client standards to a high level of accuracy and professionalism. 
  • Assist Project Managers in decision making by constantly monitoring budget and expenditure changes, as well as providing regular updates of project status.
  • Coordinate inputs from various team members including engineering, procurement, contracts, project and construction in order to establish detailed cost, man-hour controls and schedule. 
  • Assist with the creation, implementation and maintenance of Project Control Procedures and Processes, in particular cost control.
  • Liaise with and provide professional support to Project Services team in the preparation Project deliverables.
  • Register and file all relevant project documentation in accordance to the Company approved procedures.
  • Assist with the entry and administration of data into the project controls software system.
  • Proactively support other team members as required to ensure Project deliverables are met.

You will possess:

  • 8+ years of experience in project supply chain management in a related industry (i.e. mining and minerals, process & energy, EPC/EPCM, or heavy industry)
  • A strong background in scheduling and cost control for construction projects.
  • Previous project controls experience within an EPCM company.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications (desirable). 

With international offices in Africa, Australia, Canada and the Philippines, Lycopodium proudly delivers high quality professional engineering and project delivery services globally, across the mining and metals; infrastructure and process industries.

We encourage and promote diversity and inclusion, and welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of gender, age, disability and ethnicity.

We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

title: Controller (FT)
description:
Controller 
 
Our client has engaged us to assist them in sourcing a Controller to join their growing team. This team has a passion for innovation and the experience to get the job done right, and on time. The ideal candidate will share this commitment to the vision and value a work environment that rewards initiative and effort.
 
This role is responsible for the accounting operations of the company including financial reports and a comprehensive set of controls and budgets designed to mitigate risk, enhance the accuracy of the company's reported financial results, and ensure that reported results comply with applicable practices and standards.
 
 If you are accustomed to working in a dynamic, small business environment where your ideas and drive are rewarded, this opportunity may be right for you:

 Key Responsibilities:
  • Participate in planning the objectives, methods, and resources of short- and long-range financial operations of the company.
  • Monitor and report on overall company financial performance including bank reconciliations and management reports.
  • Oversee the operations of the accounting department including supervision and development of administrative staff.
  • Direct and coordinate accounting, budgeting, and other financial operations.
  • Monitor debt levels and compliance with debt covenant. 
  • Recommend benchmarks against which to measure the performance of company operations.
  • Process payroll.
  • Liaise between staff and corporate accounting.
  • Coordinate information to external auditors.
  • Oversee payables and receivables.
  • Manage outsourced functions.
  • Comply with local and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings.
  • Provide financial analyses as needed for capital investments, pricing decisions, and contract negotiations.
  • Report and file accordingly with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
  • Represent the company externally to media, government agencies, funding agencies, and the public.
 
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Business Administration, or equivalent business experience and 10+ years of progressively responsible experience.
  • Professional Accounting designation (such as CA, CPA, CGA, CMA) preferred.
  • Extensive experience and knowledge of all aspects of Corporate Accounting and Financial Management.
  • Thorough knowledge of all relevant Federal, Provincial, and local requirements regarding financial records, pension, profit sharing, and the like.
  • Confident communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills.
  • Strong planning and organization skills.
  • Ability to think critically as well as problem-solve and make decisions
  • Proven leadership and conflict management skills
  • Solid negotiation skills
  • Adaptability and stress management capability

title: Controller - Leasing
description:
Employment Type: Full-time

Location: Calgary, AB

Division/Department: Accounting

Available vacancies: 1 Full-time

About Avmax:

Avmax is a diverse company offering every product and service related to aviation. We have locations, operations, and deployment worldwide.

Our vision at Avmax Group Inc. ("Avmax") is to simplify our customers' aviation needs through dependable, globally integrated services with trusted results. Established in 1976, our locations include: Calgary (HQ) and Vancouver in Canada, Great Falls and Jacksonville in the USA, Nairobi in Kenya, and N'Djamena in Chad.

Avmax offers the following capabilities: Aircraft Leasing, Airline Operations, Avionics, Component Repairs, Engineering, MRO, Paint and Spares. Avmax's engineering division is a Transport Canada authorized Design Approval Organization (DAO). Avmax's maintenance division is a Transport Canada authorized Maintenance Repair Organization (MRO).

Why work at Avmax?

Avmax has a diverse workforce with opportunity for growth and career advancements. We offer competitive compensation and benefit packages, flexibility, work-life balance and a friendly working environment.

We are proud of our work and commitment to create one of the leading workforce, products and services in the Aviation industry.

About the Role

Reporting

The Financial Controller reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer.


Core Competencies

  • In-depth GAAP & fundamental accounting knowledge
  • Problem Solving
  • Communication
  • Attitude
  • Professionalism
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Organizational skills
  • Flexibility
  • Relationship building
  • Multitasking

Key Performance Indicators / Duties & Responsibilities

  • Oversight and responsibility for full cycle accounting and all financial transactions of the entity. Ensuring that the books and records of the entity are kept in accordance with GAAP.
  • Document and maintain complete and accurate supporting information for all financial transactions
  • Design, implement and maintain client monthly / quarterly / annual reporting (financial, lease, and operations reporting), forecasting, and budgeting standards and processes to ensure compliance and effective business management
  • Ensure that all statutory requirements of the organization are met.
  • Sustain and continue to grow a highly engaged team by providing effective management, communicating direction, mentoring, performance management, coaching and developing direct reports; and empowering individuals to make decisions and be accountable for their actions;
  • Maintain regular contact and build solid working relationships with the Operations personnel by providing necessary financial information and support. Ensure evolving Operations requirements are anticipated and integrated into the accounting and finance processes;
  • Lead internal and external audits: managing the audit workflow and deliverables and liaising with auditors as required;
  • Provide information and assist the financial consolidation process as required;
  • Evaluate current processes & controls, recommend process improvements and upon approval – implement appropriate process improvements that demonstrate fiduciary due care.
  • Complete projects for CFO as they arise within the corporate group.

Qualifications

  • Professional accounting designation (CPA) required;
  • Advanced accounting education combined with a university degree in a related discipline;
  • Proven track record in leading and building an effective team. Demonstrated supervisory and management skill sets. Team player capable of contributing operationally and cooperatively as a member of the accounting management team;
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to communicate in a variety of formats and demonstrated ability to communicate with confidence in internal and external meetings and group presentation settings;
  • Be seen and known for professionalism, integrity and high personal standards as demonstrated by their actions, personal interactions and deliverables;
  • Proven ability to plan, prioritize and assign work, motivate and coach team members, manage deliverables to budget and schedule, solve problems and make effective decisions. Capability to chart future courses within a dynamic environment-based evaluation of current situations and past experience;
  • Advanced competencies in accounting standards (ASPE / IFRS), finance, audit, and design, implementation, and presentation of advanced financial and business reporting;
  • Highly self-motivated with outgoing personality and a desire to contribute to the strategic and financial success of the organization;
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills and the ability to manage conflicting priorities within structured deadlines and deliverables;
  • Preferred to have Microsoft Navision experience;
  • Exceptional Excel skills is a must;
  • Able to work overtime during month end and year end (especially during audit period);
  • Able to travel inside and outside of Canada (occasional travel may be needed).

Experience

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a designated CPA required.

  • Minimum 3 years' experience in supervising, leading and managing others.

  • Demonstrated development through progressively responsible accounting experience in general industry.


Our recruitment commitments:

  • We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
  • Depending on qualifications, selected candidates may be offered a role at a more appropriate level.
  • Avmax Group offers a competitive compensation package including an optimal benefits plan and pension plan.
  • Avmax Group Inc. is dedicated to, and prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate and welcome the diversity of all of our employees. Avmax Group Inc. has specific policies in place to prevent discrimination in our hiring practices on the basis of the protected grounds dictated by Canadian legislation. We therefore encourage applications from qualified Aboriginal Canadians, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities and women.
  • In order to be in compliance with the law, employees must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
