title: VP, Payments
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Clio is more than just a tech companywe are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

We are currently seeking a VP of Payments to join our senior leadership team. This role is available to candidates across Canada, excluding Quebec, and the US.

Who you are:

As VP Payments, you will lead Clios efforts to deliver an industry-leading electronic payments experience for lawyers and their clients. Working closely with our CEO, COO, CFO and CTO, you will develop and execute Clios electronic payments strategy.

  • A phenomenal business builder.  Able to set an ambitious yet achievable strategy, drive clarity throughout the organization in support of that strategy, and lead a cross-functional team of direct and indirect resources to grow and scale an emerging growth area
  • Comfort and acumen in dealing with fast-paced, highly ambiguous and rapidly evolving environment typical of early stage business formation
  • Experience in strategy formulation, GTM execution, driving growth initiatives and partnering closely with marketing and product to drive overall rapid growth
  • Exemplifying and sharing our values and culture, and working with the CEO, Executive Team, and  broader leadership team to ensure a values consistent work environment;
  • Experienced leader in all aspects of electronic payments, from credit card processing to ACH
  • Strong knowledge of the payments stack and underlying economic fundamentals
  • Track record of building and leading a successful payment operations teams
  • Strong cross-functional and collaborative leadership skills
  • Excellent communicator with the ability to clearly and concisely articulate a vision and value proposition to the company, customers and external stakeholders. 
  • Exceptional analytical, strategic and critical thinking skills to drive Clios payments strategy. 
  • Experience scaling at a software company or business at a comparable stage to Clio
  • Strong data orientation, with a deep understanding of SaaS- and payments-related metrics
  • Deep knowledge payments security and compliance standards such as PCI-DSS

What youll work on:

  • Develop, execute and own Clios payments strategy and associated revenue targets
  • Work cross-functionally across Clios Product, Marketing, Sales, Support and Finance teams to bring Clio Payments offerings to market and drive rapid scaling and adoption
  • Own and negotiate the commercials relating to Clios payments efforts
  • Manage relationships with payments vendors and partners
  • Drive international expansion strategy and operationalization of Clios payment offering
  • Lead and scale a high-performing, customer-obsessed Payment Operations team
  • Own, shape and build Clios broader financial services strategy
  • Ensure Clios compliance with relevant security standards

What you may have:

  • Deep experience building and scaling an electronic payments platform
  • Ability to lead a cross-functional team across GTM, product and engineering, and operations consisting of both direct and indirect resources to achieve overall revenue plan and drive rapid growth of Clio payments
  • Excellent ability to be very operationally focused while also developing and championing the longer term ambitious strategy and vision for the evolution of Clio payments
  • 10+- years at a Software-as-Service company with integrated payments expertise
  • Deep understanding / subject matter expertise in Payfac solutions, payment gateways and overall credit card transactions flows - including both traditional platforms and modern API platforms (e.g. Stripe Connect).

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

About Clio

At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system. 

We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canadas Best Managed Companies, Canadas Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Companys list of Most Innovative Companies.  In line with our mission, weve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative, and most recently, securing a  US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If youve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

Localisation : Rive-Nord + Hybride

Salaire : Compétitif

Particularités de l’employeur:

Leader dans son domaine, notre client est une firme de type tout terrain! Leur savoir-faire brille dans le secteur de l’électricité urbaine, civile, des transports et des télécoms. Ses équipes d’experts innovent constamment leurs techniques de travail afin de manipuler les outils derniers cris en termes de technologie et pour satisfaire leur garantie de solutions durables et conformes à leur clientèle.

Avantages : Offrir un environnement favorable au travail d’équipe et des formations de qualités à nos employés - Bureaux modernes – Grande rétention d’employés – Équipe fiable et dévouée – Programmes d’assurances – REER – Horaire flexible et en mode hybride – Salaire supérieur au marché

  • Préparer les prévisions financières annuelles et assurer les révisions
  • Analyser les états financiers mensuels et annuels avec les dirigeants
  • Rédiger le dossier de fin d’année pour les experts comptables externes
  • Faire l’évaluation mensuelle des travaux en cours
  • Tenir à jour les rapports de commandes de projets
  • Assurer le renouvellement annuel des assurances
  • Superviser l’équipe comptable (4 personnes)
  • Participer à l’élaboration de politiques et procédures internes

Vos Atouts pour ce poste!

  • Minimum 10 ans d’expérience dans le domaine des finances (Construction ou ingénierie sont des atouts)

  • Détenir des compétences en planification stratégique et en communication

  • Maîtriser la suite MS Office

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
The Position

Under the direction of the Chief Administrative Officer, the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) is a member of the senior management team who will provide sound, progressive and engaging leadership while contributing to the effective corporate management of the organization. If you would like to work within a progressive team philosophy, value trust, personal commitment and then be rewarded with a competitive salary and extended benefits, plus a pension matching package, paid professional development, and a gratitude fund, then read further.

 

The Candidate

Leadership and Strategy

  • Leading the development and implementation of short, medium and long-term financial strategies, including financial planning, reporting and monitoring systems, and ensuring alignment with the organization's strategic direction.

 

Influence

  • Providing professional advice and objective financial analyses that enable decision-makers to make timely and informed business decisions. Ensuring that opportunities and risks are fully considered and those decisions are aligned with the overall financial strategies.

 

Financial Management and Control

  • Leading the promotion and delivery of solid financial management practices so that assets are safeguarded at all times and are used appropriately, economically, efficiently, and effectively.

 

Direct Finance

  • Determining the resources, expertise and systems for the finance function that are sufficient to meet business needs and negotiate these within the overall financial framework.

 

Qualifications, Skills and Abilities

  • Professional Accounting Designation (CPA);
  • Experience with First Nations government or local government;
  • A minimum of five (5) years of progressive financial leadership and business experience;
  • First Nation's cultural awareness;
  • Thorough knowledge of Canadian Public Sector Accounting Standards;
  • Strong ability to navigate and interpret legislative laws, agreements and policy is a requirement;
  • Able to make good strategic decisions, to manage projects;
  • Strong sense of personal integrity and ethical practices; and 
  • Excellent change management, interpersonal and communication skills demonstrated through facilitating, networking, motivating, and leading.  

 

This is a fantastic opportunity to serve as a role model in a respected organization with strong community ties and values that honour the shíshálh culture, tradition, and beliefs. You will also live in a spectacular community with abundant natural beauty, water and mountain activities, cultural events, and community services.

 

If you are interested in the position, please send your resume and cover letter to the Human Resources Department.

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
Overview:

At Neo, weâ€™re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. Weâ€™re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions.

 

Neo Financial is seeking an experienced, strategic leader to join the team as a key partner to our CEO and the rest of the management team.   The successful hire will handle the company's income and expenses, investments, and overall capital structure, playing a pivotal role in the company's long-term success. This position will be located in Calgary, AB.

What you'll be doing::
  • Manage all financial operations (financial planning, accounting, cash management, investments, audit and fiscal functions), corporate finance (FP&A, bank partnerships, corporate finance, strategic planning) and credit risk of the company
  • Work with the management team to develop and execute corporate strategy and business plans to ensure that the company attains its short and long-term growth objectives
  • Provide strategic lens and thought leadership to growth opportunities and scaling the business for sustainability
  • Develop and oversee the development of financial tools, systems, and processes to enable effective and scalable decision-making throughout the company, providing critical financial and operational information and insights to all relevant stakeholders (Board, investors, CEO, senior management team, etc.)
  • Oversee cash management and capital structure needs, identify working capital and debt financing needs
  • Collaborate closely with and provide key insights to teams throughout the company, including HR, product, marketing, operations and growth
  • Evaluate, improve and help build cross-company processes that are efficient and scalable; assist with crafting and realizing company policies and procedures that institutionalize proper controls
  • Build strong internal control processes
  • Ensure compliance to regulatory reporting requirements
  • Lead and develop top finance and accounting talent
Who we're looking for::
  • A minimum of 10 years of extensive senior leadership experience in leading and developing finance functions at a fast-growing organization, preferably within the tech space
  • Excellent EQ - managing relationships with a large external network of partners, as well as building and managing an internal team
  • Extensive knowledge of and experience with FP&A, accounting, and capital management
  • Entrepreneurial DNA - comfortable building a business from the ground up, making decisions in the face of ambiguity (but make data-driven decisions when possible) and dealing with major challenges along the way with poise
  • Excellent communication skills; ability to develop concise summaries of complex analyses and data appropriate for various levels of consumption ranging from board members to team members across the company
  • Experience overseeing complex projects through completion
  • Strategic thinker with a strong â€˜business senseâ€™
About applying with us::

At Neo, youâ€™ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. Itâ€™s a serious deal, but that doesnâ€™t mean we donâ€™t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. title: Senior Vice-President, Finance & Controller
description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintech’s, and winners of the 2021 TSX30, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly-traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial and LendCare. We offer a wide variety of financial products and services including lease-to-own merchandise, unsecured and secured installment loans, direct-to-consumer auto loans, and point-of-sale financing to over 4,000 merchants in the powersports, automotive, retail, home improvement, and health sectors. With over 30 years of experience, our 2200 employees work with our customers to help them get access to the money they need today, while they rebuild their credit and graduate to prime rates. Our omni-channel model includes over 400 retail locations and digital/mobile platforms that enable our customers to transact with us through their channel of choice.

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer the SeniorVice-President, Finance & Controller is a newly configured role at goeasy! This is a key leadership role within the organization, which will require a seasoned hands-on leader to support the organization in fulfilling its ambitious goals while maintaining the necessary financial structure and controls. As part of goeasy’s plans for accelerated growth, this role will lead the creation and enhancement of processes to consolidate and report on financials and performance from a variety of business units and, eventually, geographies. This role will provide critical leadership to a talented finance team, providing opportunities for collective and individual growth.

Responsibilities (not limited to):

  • Direct oversight of the Controllership function including Corporate Accounting, Financial, Regulatory Reporting, Taxation, Audit Coordination, Disbursements, Asset & Inventory Management, Vendor & Expense Management, and other related analysis.
  • Overall responsibility for all required financial reports and related regulatory submissions across the organization’s legal entities and business units, including production of Financial Statements, Management Discussion & Analysis, Annual Report & Information Form, and the Management Information Circular.
  • Accountability for the completeness and accuracy of the organizations corporate accounts, including financial systems of record, accounting policies, provisions, valuations, and presentation under IFRS and local market GAAP, where applicable.
  • Lead and represent the company on all financial audit matters, including managing and coordinating external financial audits and reviews.
  • Ensuring optimization and compliance with all taxation requirements and obligations across the organization, including Income Tax, Indirect Tax, Transfer Pricing, Provisions, and Audits conducted by tax authorities.
  • Responsibility for the company’s disbursement accounting and related controls, including Vendor and Employee Payments & Distributions.
  • Preparation of required materials and reports to the company’s Audit Committee and Board of Directors.
  • Preparation and support of the company’s Management Reporting.
  • Directly impacting the management and financial integrity of goeasy through the effective stewarding of organizational resources, maintaining appropriate controls, and integrity of financial management in compliance with applicable legal, governmental, and regulatory requirements.

Providing support to other functional areas of finance:

  • Corporate Development - including M&A activity, New Business Venture & Deal analysis, Research, Investor Relations, Equity Research, Rating Agency enquiries, and Strategic Planning.
  • Treasury - including Capital and Debt Management, Funding Facilities, Transactional Banking, Securitization vehicle, Financial Instruments, and optimizing cost of credit.
  • Financial Planning & Analysis - including the preparation of Budgets, Forecasts, Investment Analysis, Business Unit Segment Analysis, Project Planning, Management Reporting, Strategic Analysis, Departmental Financial Support, Key Performance Indicators, and other related analysis.

Qualifications:

  • Chartered Accountant (CPA/CA) with at least 10-12 years of progressive financial management experience.
  • Experience within a publicly-traded organization along with relevant financial services experience is an asset.
  • Consolidation and reporting experience working in a parent company with multiple business units operating in multiple geographies.
  • Strong technical accounting knowledge and experience in IFRS is required. Knowledge of US GAAP is an asset.
  • Previous experience managing external financial audits is required.
  • Knowledge of Canadian Income and Indirect Taxation is required. Experience in International Tax is an asset.
  • Strong financial systems knowledge and experience is required.
  • Comfortable with a rapidly growing, fast-paced and dynamic environment.
  • A natural leader with strong people management and coaching skills.
  • A strong and organized leader that can manage financial processes but also distill communication with the executive team and business leaders.
  • Demonstrated ability to perform under pressure and meet deadlines and company goals.
  • Ability to multitask and deal with people and situations in a professional manner within a dynamic environment.  Able to manage competing priorities, meet deliverables while building relationships with colleagues.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire.  We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

title: Vice President Personal Insurance
description:
Vice President Personal Insurance
Winnipeg, MB, Canada Req #822

Friday, April 8, 2022

Westland Insurance Group Ltd has an exciting leadership opportunity for a Vice President, Personal Insurance for Saskatchewan & Manitoba. The VP, Personal Insurance will represent Westland to the market and drive growth within the SK & MB Regions. You will bring together expert business acumen and strong technical skills, constantly balancing risk, and opportunity to achieve the goals of the company, our clients, and employees. An important aspect of the role is supporting the acquisition growth in the SK & MB Regions. This role will work closely with the Mergers & Acquisitions team and newly acquired businesses on the successful transition and integration to Westland. Since 2019 Westland has grown from having no footprint in SK & MB to now having over 40 locations and 235 employees in the area...and still growing.

What we offer:

  • A highly customer centric organization and position focused on service first
  • High-growth company environment with great opportunity for development
  • Competitive compensation structure and bonuses
  • Comprehensive medical and dental benefits
  • Diverse mix of staff and demonstrated work/life balance
  • Career growth opportunities and continuing education programs

The Opportunity:

The VP Personal Insurance is accountable for sales and growth, enhancing employee engagement, talent management and business plan execution. Responsibilities include driving sales performance and revenue growth with relentless persistence to achieve or exceed targets. A critical component of the role is developing people, enhancing long-term client relationships, coaching managers to imp rove leadership and to ensure customers are provided sound advice.

In this role you'll:

  • Be responsible for Talent Managem ent within the region; ensuring the team is executing upon attraction, recruitment, retention, and engagement strategies.
  • Take an active role in ensuring the ongoing development of employees; ensure team and individual goals are set, coaching and feedback is being provided consistently and leaders are identifying career development opportunities based on interests and strengths.
  • Ensure there is an increased presence in the branches and communities, with minimum monthly visits by the sales leadership team and a regular (weekly) cadence to sales meetings.
  • Participate, collaborate, and contribute as a member of the Senior Leadership team to provide input into and then execute upon the strategic plan. Lead the development of the Region's annual business plan(s) complete with sales targets and tactics that will meet or exceed the budget for personal lines.
  • Work closely with the Mergers & Acquisitions team and newly acquired businesses on the successful transition and integration to Westland. Act as the Leadership point of contact in your region for leaders of newly acquired businesses to answer questions, navigate issues and provide support for at least the first 6 to 12 months.
  • Build client loyalty and retention with initiatives that promote a deeper penetration and share of the customers' wallet.
  • Brand promotion - the capture of google reviews with a focus on elevating scores to attract new clients and employees.
  • Review and monitor key performance metrics on a regular basis, working with Regional Managers to implement actions to address deficiencies and amplify successes.
  • Promote the achievement of a strong, proactive advisory based sales and service culture through motivational leadership, communication, and coaching.
  • Accountable for profitability within the Region by ensuring sales targets are met, teams are effectively managing salary budgets and forecasting of resourcing requirements.
  • Provide guidance to Regional Managers on communication strategies and implementing programs and initiatives effectively.
  • Demonstrate collaboration with other lines of business through reciprocity of referrals to lead to new members, customers, and product sales.
  • Identify and develop strategies related to competitive, environmental and industry trends that may impact marketing position and member satisfaction; set direction; focus resources and execute plans to develop and grow the business.
  • Foster and maintain strong relationships with Westland's key business partners, primarily, the Insurance companies through which the company writes business.
  • Maintain a high level of current industry knowledge and actively participate in professional associations related to insurance such as Insurance Brokers Associations, staying at the forefront of the profession.
  • Travel as required

Here's what you bring:

  • Preference for a Level 3 General Insurance License or willingness to obtain if previous transferable experience from applicable business environment
  • Industry designation preferred (CAIB, CIP, FCIP)
  • Minimum 10 years of front-line sales & service management
  • Minimum 10 years of senior leadership
  • Experience managing business and / or cultural transformation projects
  • Experience leading the enhancement of client service excellence
  • Strong understanding of change management
  • Experience in contributing to strategic direction and implementing plans / actions as it relates to achieving overall revenue, profit, and employee engagement goals
  • Experience collaborating with various business leaders and problem solving
  • Motivated to roll up your sleeves in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal and presentation/public speaking
  • Experience mentoring and developing business leaders
  • Excellent business acumen and entrepreneurial spirit
  • Experience with mergers & acquisitions


Westland Insurance Group is one of the largest and fastest-growing independent property and casualty insurance brokers in Canada. With a national network of 195 locations and over 2,100 employees, the company continues to expand coast to coast. Westland's brokers provide expert advice to home, business, farm, life, and auto insurance clients. Since its founding in 1980, Westland has remained a family-owned company that is committed to supporting its local communities.

Westland Insurance Ltd. is an inclusive organization that values diversity in its workforce. We listen, champion equality and diversity, and create safe welcoming spaces where everyone has a voice and is free to be themselves. Westland Insurance Ltd. encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.

If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@westlandinsurance.ca

Apply Now

title: VP Finance & Treasury
description:
Vice President Finance & Treasury

 Toronto

Our Client is a very prestigious Real Estate Developer in the GTA. We are conducting a search for a VP Finance & Treasury to join this team. The key objective is to Negotiate and arrange financing for the Trust’s acquisition, construction, secured debt and corporate needs, including unsecured debentures and equity.

Responsibilities:

The duties and responsibilities for this area include but are not limited to the following:

  • Take on a leadership role and provide support for the Finance & Treasury team in the functions required for funding acquisitions, construction, secured debt, to include financial analysis, ensuring that financing instruments placed are consistent with the Trust’s overall business strategy;
  • Support the CFO and President and C.E.O. in investor relations activities and guidance to investment analysts;
  • Support decision-making at the Executive level related to funding of acquisitions and financial risk management;
  • Nurture the existing relationships within the banking and financing industry and develop new relationships to ensure the viability of the Trust’s goals and financial requirements;
  • Nurture the relationships with your peers within the organization to ensure unity and effectiveness in the leadership for the Trust;
  • Maintain and strengthen relationship with the Trusts partners, to include major anchor tenants, JV partners, and the financial community;
  • Maintain a strategic focus on the political, economic, and financial trends in the marketplace, which includes local, national, and globally advising the Trust and relative to capital market conditions and financing techniques;
  • Analyze and support the maintenance of all processes and documentation to effectively manage and control the corporate finance function and its integration to Executive management information systems;
  • Be a champion of change through personal leadership.
  • Manage a small team of Finance professionals

    Academic/Professional Requirements:

  • CPA, MBA, CFA or Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related field.

    Required Skills/Experience:

  • Minimum of five years of experience in real estate finance activities;
  • Practice in the banking and financing community developing and arranging financing instruments for real estate development;
  • Practice in public capital markets activity including raising equity and debt financing and communication with banks and other financial stakeholders;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate across all levels within, as well as outside the organization.

title: Vice President, Auto Finance
description:
About Clutch:

At Clutch, we are reinventing the way Canadians buy and own cars. We had enough of traditional dealerships that took advantage of customers and knew that we could build an incredible car-buying experience while leaving a positive impact on the communities we serve.

Recently named one of the Fastest Growing Canadian Companies by the Globe & Mail and one of the Top Canadian Startups by LinkedIn, we're looking to add to our great team of people who embrace hard things, think like owners, and love to help their teammates. 

We pride ourselves on our high-quality certified vehicles, great prices, and customer experience. By visiting clutch.ca, customers can browse a large selection of high-quality vehicles, buy a car that's right for them, and enjoy seamless delivery - all from the comfort of their home.

Founded in 2016, Clutch is headquartered in Toronto and services Alberta, British Columbia, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Ontario, Saskatchewan and Prince Edward Island. It is backed by a number of world-class investors including D1 Capital Partners, Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, Upper90, FJ Labs, Global Founders Capital, and Azure Capital Partners.

About the role:

Clutch is looking for a Vice President, Auto Finance to join our team! You will be responsible for building a nonprime lending operation complete with prequalification, loan decisioning and loan servicing. This nonprime lending operation will integrate with Clutch's existing sales and online checkout process.  

As part of our recent funding, we're looking to further develop and enhance our finance offerings to improve the ease, transparency and speed of finance approvals for customers across the full credit spectrum - with particular focus on nonprime.  To achieve this goal, we are looking for a tenured leader that can both set the vision but also roll up their sleeves and develop a team, build out processes, and grow a winning culture. 

Starting with a clean slate, you will be building an auto finance product exclusively for customers purchasing a vehicle from Clutch. This is a unique opportunity to build a startup within a startup.  This requires a clear and robust process and deep data-driven decision making. This role reports directly to the CEO and provides an opportunity to join the leadership team to help set the strategic roadmap for the next stage of the business.

What you'll do: 

  • Re-evaluate and own Clutch's entire auto finance strategy and establish realistic and meaningful KPIs
  • Recruit a team of other experienced auto finance professionals to build and scale Clutch's nonprime lending operation
  • Lead discussions with debt providers to secure capital enabling rapid scaling of Clutch's lending operation
  • Design and implement best practices to operationalize a lending division that delivers an incredible experience for customers
  • Establish and manage relationships with outsourced service providers  
  • Work closely with Product and Sales teams to seamlessly integrate financing into the online purchase experience  
  • Provide visibility to the broader organization through weekly reporting
  • Build a strong culture of excellence and foster the next generation of leadership in Canadian technology by coaching and managing team performance
  • Forecast yearly and monthly lending targets and work with other business functions to achieve those targets 
  • Champion the team's continued professional development and career progression 
  • Position Clutch as a leading player in the Canadian automotive retail industry through leadership, education and representation

We're looking for: 

  • 10+ years of varied Canadian auto finance experience including: operations, credit decisioning and managing debt relationships 
  • Entrepreneurial mindset with a passion towards building something new 
  • Experience navigating ambiguity to scale a business and build out teams
  • Track record of consistently meeting/exceeding targets and objectives as a team leader and individual contributor
  • Data-driven with strong analytical and quantitative skills and attention to detail
  • Exceptional communicator with strong attention to detail, relationship-building and interpersonal skills, and effective presentation skills

Why you'll love it at Clutch: 

  • Autonomy & Ownership -- create your own path, and own your work
  • Competitive Compensation and Equity Incentives!
  • Generous Time Off Program
  • Learning Budget -- for whatever YOU want to learn
  • Health & Dental Benefits 

COVID-19 Vaccination Policy

The health and safety of all staff members at Clutch is our top priority. We are committed to taking every reasonable precaution to protect the health and well-being of our employees against the risks of COVID-19. Vaccination against COVID-19 is proven to be a safe and effective way to protect our health and our communities. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy requiring all staff members to be double vaccinated against COVID-19 to access the office or to attend a Clutch facility.

Clutch is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. If you require accommodation at any stage of the interview process, please email

title: Vice President of Investments
description:
The Brandt Group of Companies is looking for an experienced individual to develop and manage a strategic investment plan for the entire portfolio of Brandt entities, reporting directly to Brandt’s Chief Investment Officer in the Regina Head Office.

This position will be responsible for managing and deploying capital to support Brandt’s growth through strategic acquisitions and investments in the same or adjacent industries in which we operate today, as well as passive investments where Brandt is a non-controlling or non-operating shareholder as appropriate. To support implementing these strategies and the operation of the Brandt group of companies generally, this position will also be responsible for forecasting the cash flow of the business and maximizing capital efficiency in conjunction with the finance department.

The VP of Investments will work closely with ownership and senior management in developing and executing on investment opportunities. The successful individual will be expected to succeed in a high paced environment. The VP of Investments will be responsible for managing a team of analysts.

Duties & Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  1. Identify and develop recommendations for investment
  2. Manage and oversee the execution of acquisitions and business startup
  3. Identify and assist with optimization projects to improve the financial performance of Brandt’s operating businesses, include improving capital efficiency, reducing costs, increasing margins, or bolting on complementary product/service.
  4. Oversee treasury functions, in coordination with the Finance Department, including cashflow modeling, funding strategies, foreign exchange transactions, and hedging strategies.
  5. Trading in passive investments in coordination with Ownership
  • Strong ability to develop and communicate investment recommendations
  • Strong project management skills
  • Ability to work independently, effectively, and efficiently.
  • Team player.

The ideal candidate will have 10 years of experience in finance, and specifically experience in mergers & acquisitions. CFA, MBA, CPA or equivalent designation is an asset.

title: Vice President, Mergers and Acquisitions (Technology Sector)
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

The opportunity
 
EY Orenda Corporate Finance Inc., a specialty practice within EY's Strategy and Transactions (SaT) business, and is the leading mid-market investment bank in Canada. The practice is recognized as a trusted source of expertise for mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, financing, privatization, and valuations and has been advising clients on all aspects of strategic transactions and capital sourcing activities for more than 30 years. 


Our M&A team focused on the technology sector is the leading advisor in the mid-market for tech businesses, having closed several marquee transactions over the last 18 months. We are rapidly expanding these tech sector focused M&A capabilities across the country. We are looking for an experienced and motivated M&A professional to join our practice as a Vice President who will help us develop relationships, lead deal execution, and to help build a larger technology M&A team across Canada and within the EY global Tech M&A network.


As a VP, you will be an important part of our diversely talented, highly experienced team and work at the forefront of high-profile transactions within the technology space. When you join our industry-leading team, you’ll be right at the heart of that challenge, working with leading business tools and methodologies to provide to some of the most sophisticated clients around.

 

Your key responsibilities

 

As a Vice President within our Tech M&A team, you will be part of our M&A business called Ernst & Young Orenda Corporate Finance Inc. (“EYO”) and will have the opportunity to work alongside of our other practices within our Strategy and Transactions practice. EYO is recognized as a trusted source of expertise for mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, financing, valuations, privatization, and capital sourcing transactions. 

 

Skills and attributes for success

  • Collaborate with other service lines within EY, both within our Strategy and Transactions (SaT) business and across the Firm’s Assurance, Tax and Consulting businesses to deliver outstanding professional advice to our clients. 
  • Take an autonomous lead role in identifying, soliciting and exploring potential new business opportunities 
  • Lead and project manage complex acquisition, merger, divestiture or financing assignments, including taking a lead role in client relationship management 
  • Provide direction and oversight on research to be used in financial modeling, competitive analysis, industry analysis, negotiation support and various other applications 
  • Review and provide quality assurance on complex financial models within broadly defined guidelines 
  • Oversee the preparation and delivery of documents for, and presentations to, clients and prospects 
  • Manage staff teams of 2-3 professionals and assume developmental responsibility for junior staff 
  • Proactively develop an internal and external network within the local market
  • Participate in the development and execution of industry-specific thought leadership and business plans 

 

To qualify for the role, you must have

  • Minimum 7-8 years of experience in financial analysis and transaction/financing execution, in the technology sector (i.e. M&A, Private Equity, Investment Banking or Corporate Development). 
  • Undergraduate degree in business with concentration in finance and/or accounting supported by a CPA, CFA, CBV or MBA 
  • Understanding of key business drivers, business strategy, metrics and deal issues for technology businesses
  • Track record of helping develop new business, and boardroom presence
  • Strong financial modeling and analytical skills and financial modeling
  • Strong knowledge of financing capital structuring and strong negotiation / lead advisory skills
  • Experience working in small teams and developing/coaching/mentoring junior-level staff
  • Experience working with multiple internal / external advisors within the context of a transaction and coordinated various workstreams (i.e. lawyers, accountants, tax and other specialists, etc...)
  • U.S. Broker Dealer license and Canadian Securities Institute licensing are or will be required
  • Previous M&A experience in a professional services/Big 4 Firm or investment bank and direct experience working with private businesses

 

What we look for

 

We’re interested in talented professionals with the ability to visualize our clients’ goals and think creatively to facilitate them - often in politically charged environments. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, and a genuine passion for taking on new challenges, this role is for you.

 

What working at EY offers
 
At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.

 

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 

Diversity and Inclusion at EY


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 

EY Way of Work and your health and safety


EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided. 

 

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
 
Make your mark. Apply today.

 

EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

 

EY | Building a better working world 

 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  

 

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Chief Financial Officer - Fintech
description:
Join the ultimate Fintech solution provider for the International students market

 

Are you an accomplished finance leader in search of a unique opportunity where your contributions will go far beyond your role as a financial advisor?

Are you bold with a strategic vision? Do you take calculated risks? Do you live and breathe fast-paced growth start-ups?

We are in search of a unique breed of CFO, who has progressive finance and accounting experience with a focus on publicly-listed Technology startups with worldwide operations. Who, also is creative with an entrepreneurial flair that has a successful track record of building high-growth start-ups. 

       Who we are, and why should you be excited about this opportunity?

    "$300 B Economical contribution of the International Education Industry Worldwide"

 "The industry has numerous money-related problems and challenges that impact students, parents, agents and educational institutions"

International education and payment solutions are two growth industries that have come together to create one disruptive force in this niche market. 

We are a Vancouver-based; publicly listed startup poised to be the leading Fintech company servicing the international student market in Canada and beyond. We specialize in developing innovative financial solutions for the next generation of consumers. Our cutting-edge products- provide seamless and secure financial services to users around the world.

In this role you will be serving as a strategic business partner to the CEO and Executive team, acting as an advisor to the Board of Directors and overseeing the finance and accounting, human resources and legal functions. You will be in charge of championing business growth, building the business for scale and making the organization one of the best places to work at.

We want your brain - Expertise in overseeing the administrative, financial and risk management and operations of the organization. Execute on core business strategies and develop transformative new approaches for growth

We want your personality â€“ You are a natural-born leader, self-driven, resourceful with five-star interpersonal skills

You will engage and support key stakeholders - you will collaborate closely with our CEO on the strategic vision, engaging key stakeholders including our board and investors

You will earn a generous compensation package - your compensation package will include a competitive base salary, generous bonus structure stock options and company perks

 

The fine print:

  • Experience as a public company Finance Executive with a progressive career history
  • Experience in Mergers & Acquisitions and Capital raising 
  • Passion for tech and growing public companies
  • Bonus if you have international experience in Asian markets
  • CPA, MBA, CFA & CBV designations considered a bonus

title: VP of Finance
description:
Victoria Newitt Recruitment Inchas been retained by our ‘Client’ to search for aVice President of Finance.

This premium brand has 3 divisions; stores, wholesale/CPG and e-Commerce, with double digit growth, operating across Canada and into the US. With recent investment from PE, they have brought in strong leadership to now elevate the business to the next level, and building out the finance function from the ground up with people, systems and processes, partnering cross functionally to support the growth.

This trusted advisor will be the right hand to the CEO, providing the strategic financial information to support better decision making. This individual is passionate and energised in a growing, entrepreneurial environment. This is the chance to come in and build a business from the ground up, elevating financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting, costing, fiscal compliance and planning as well as capex reviews and managing the external banking and audits. We are seeking an inspirational leader, to lead a team of initially 5. There is lots of autonomy and the ability to truly create an impact with this role. It will sit on the leadership team and report into the President.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Ensure the accurate, timing, and integrity of financial reporting results.
  • Support business planning by providing strategic financial leadership and consultation to the President, Executive Team and other senior leaders within the organization.
  • Partner with senior leaders to develop and implement financial strategies that align with the company’s mission, vision and business objectives.
  • Oversee all finance-related activity including: budgeting, accounting, financial planning, financial reporting, forecasting, tax planning and audits.
  • Accountable for developing the systems, policies and controls necessary to ensure the effective management of the business and the accuracy and quality of information.
  • Implement a formal costing and approval system for new products going to market.
  • Develop strategies related to capital investments, financings, banking arrangements, hedging and cash management.
  • Understand and mitigate key elements of the company's risk profile, report issues to the board of advisors
  • Set goals, review performance, train and lead finance team.

Qualifications:
  • Undergraduate degree in finance or business administration or its equivalent.
  • CA or CPA designation.
  • 7 – 10 years progressive leadership experience in accounting and financial management.
  • Experience in Consumer Food and Beverage would be a strong asset.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of financial reporting requirements including Canadian GAAP.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet tight deadlines
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Relationship management skills
  • Teamwork skills
  • Experience in negotiating agreements
  • Attention to detail and presentation of information
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Highly developed communication (verbal and written) skills

If this position suits your skills and experience, we want to talk to you!

Please apply by submitting your resume and a covering letter outlining why you are a suitable candidate for this exciting role.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
About GROUPE ALLIÉES

Our client, Le GROUPE ALLIÉES, is looking for a recognized CPA professional to join their management team as Corporate Controller.

This privately owned manufacturing company in the metal transformation sector counts among its client's world-class companies such as Volvo, Lion Electric, Schneider, Michelin, Micro Bird (Girardin), and Novabus, among others.

In operation for more than 80 years, it has nearly 200 employees, supporting 4 business units and 2 trademarks: Entreprises Alliées, North Star Métal, Métal Sigma, JR Inox, ITOUCH, et Luminaires Alliées. The two main business units are in Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu and Ville St-Laurent.

In addition to being a leader in its field, the company has an ambitious growth plan that would lead it to multiply its size and notoriety in various sectors through an integrator and gas pedal vision. The company is also pursuing growth opportunities through strategic acquisitions.

You will have the chance to join this dynamic, ambitious, innovative, and high-performance company.

Culture and Values

Le GROUPE ALLIÉES offers an exceptional work environment based on listening, sharing knowledge, and valuing individual and collective success.

The management team is committed to consolidating the growth of the group around strong values centred on teamwork, respect, dedication, development, and the importance of the human being.  It is with great pride that the Group and its employees contribute to supporting its clients in the realization of their projects

The company is "family-friendly" and ensures a good work-life balance. It also offers a unique learning opportunity to its team with customized training, and to evolve in a pleasant work environment.

Brief Description

Reporting to the Executive Director of Finance, the Corporate Controller will be responsible for various mandates such as the processing of financial statements throughout the year, financial auditing, cost price analysis, supervision of various processes, financial reporting, and improvement of existing work methods.

Please note that the position requires occasional travel to Ville Saint-Laurent but is based primarily in St-Jean-sur-Richelieu. More specifically, the Corporate Controller will be responsible for the following activities:

Main Tasks and Responsibilities

  • Produce monthly financial statements for the entire Group
  • Prepare and present the monthly and annual financial statements of the company to the management team
  • Ensure effective control procedures and monitoring of results (dashboards and performance indicators)
  • Perform the complete accounting cycle for the company, its management company, and its trust
  • Ensure the preparation of the annual budget and financial forecasts for the (4) Group companies
  • Provide cost analysis for the Group's companies and actively participate in the improvement of the processes and systems in place
  • Promote and implement performance indicators (KPI) and participate in the analysis of potential acquisitions
  • Maximize the use of technology to ensure the simplification and improvement of processes

Required Qualifications

Training

  • Degree in business administration
  • Recognized accounting designation (CPA)

Professional Experience

  • 5 to 10 years of experience
  • Experience in a manufacturing company
  • Experience in costing/project cost tracking
  • Experience with ERP systems (asset)
  • Experience in an accounting firm (asset)

Skills

  • Good expertise in accounting, financial statements, and auditing
  • Ability to work with various systems
  • Proficiency in Windows and MS Office environment

Abilities

  • Professional proactivity
  • Collaborative team player
  • Willing to progress
  • Good communicator in both written and oral form

Among the challenges of the position

  • Contribute to the growth of the company
  • Multi-site environment
  • Improvement of technological processes
  • Strategic succession position with access to career opportunities more quickly

Why join GROUPE ALLIÉES

  • Working for a group of organizations with over 80 years of experience
  • Very competitive salary conditions & innovative fringe benefits
  • Fast-growing company in a weatherproof industry
  • Dynamic and passionate management team
  • Strategic feeder position with access to faster career opportunities
  • Recognition for loyal and dedicated employees
  • Ongoing training and skills development
  • Family-friendly jobs with a good work-life balance
  • Values promoted by the company
  • Safe, pleasant, and diversified work environment

Follow TALINKO on LinkedInand visit our Website

Only the people selected for an interview will be contacted. We support the principle of employment equity.

TALINKO is a recruitment firm of middle and senior executives also offering support in the recruitment of members of the board of directors or advisory committee. We operate in different business sectors.

title: Contrôleur financier / Drummondville / 100K-110K
description:
Recherchez-vous une opportunité de faire le saut comme contrôleur dans une entreprise présente à l'international? Notre client recherche la personne qui prendra en charge la supervision de la comptabilité financière et du contrôle de gestion pour son usine de Drummondville. Le ou la candidat(e) choisi(e) supervisera deux analystes comptables et travaillera de près avec le VP finance sur différentes initiatives.



Avantages

- Flexibilité d'horaire et télétravail
- Assurances collectives
- REER (5%)
- Belle entreprise en croissance

Responsabilités

- Coordonner la fin de mois comptable ainsi que la production des rapports de gestion
- Améliorer les systèmes et les contrôles en place
- Prendre en charge le contrôle de gestion de l'entreprise incluant le prix de revient, l'analyse de la performance et des variances.
- Accompagner les gestionnaires dans la production du budget annuel
- Prendre en charge le volet fiscal incluant aussi les dossiers de subventions, prix de transferts
- Encadre, supervise et optimise les activités de gestion et prévisions de flux de trésorerie et de gestion de crédit clients et assurance-crédit
- Développer et encadrer une équipe de 2 professionnels comptables
- Participer à différents projets spéciaux


Qualifications

- Un minimum de 5 à 10 ans d'expérience en comptabilité
- Titre CPA
- Expérience dans le manufacturier (un atout important)
- Expérience avec SAP (un atout)
- Un niveau d'anglais avancé


Sommaire
Si ce poste de contrôleur financier à Drummondville vous intéresse, contactez-moi directement - nicolas.graham@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. accessibilite@randstad.ca

title: Cost Controller
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood’s Power Solutions business performs consulting and EPCM services for many of Canada’s power generation and power distribution companies. 

 

Wood currently has an exciting opportunity for a Cost Controller.  Reporting to the Project Controls Manager, this position is located in Vancouver, BC.  If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Key responsibilities:  

  • Analyzing and forecasting project costs as well as developing, preparing and collecting schedule and cost data for monthly project reports
  • Reporting project cost status to management for internal reviews, as well as analyzing cost variances and recommending corrective actions
  • Setting up projects and tracking and analyzing engineering man-hours and associated costs within Wood's proprietary management system.
  • Reviewing project scope change(s) and preparing change order requests to ensure proper justification, schedule impacts, and adequate budget and funding
  • Assist with the coordination of resource planning within the business unit; including maintaining and updating associated resource planning system
  • Coordinate the administration of consultant time, including performing weekly timesheet reconciliation, monthly timesheet uploads and preparation of invoice reconciliation sheet for Accounts Payable processing
  • Provide timesheet support to the business unit, including troubleshooting issues and completing timesheet corrections as required
  • Maintain various project lists and assist with the generation and maintenance of various excel files and templates
  • Assist engineering/project controls with various tasks as required

Skills / Qualifications

  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills is essential
  • Detail and results oriented with the capacity to successfully manage multiple and competing priorities and timelines
  • Superior analytical, problem solving, audit and investigation skills
  • Demonstrated effective communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with multiple internal disciplines and external customers
  • An interest in a career in project controls, with some knowledge and understanding of basic cost control principles including earned value management
  • A degree in a relevant discipline is preferred

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

description: RESPONSIBILITES Financial and management statements – quarterly and annual preparation/presentation. title: Business Controller
description:
Číslo pracovní pozice: 44315 
Skupina: Magna Exteriors 
Divize: Magna Exteriors Trnava 
Typ pracovní pozice: Trvalý/Pravidelný 
Pracoviště:Trnava 

 

Popis skupiny

Portfolio produktů společnosti Magna Exteriors zahrnuje exteriérové díly, jako jsou zadní dveře, dveřní rámy, modulové systémy, front-end moduly včetně nárazníků, aktivní aerodynamické systémy a další odlehčené konstrukční komponenty pro automobilový trh, trh komerčních nákladních vozidel a jiné průmyslové trhy.

Jako globálně uznávaný inovátor řešení exteriérů vozidel, poskytuje Magna Exteriors vše potřebné, od vývoje a designu materiálů, přes výrobu a montáž, aby pomohla výrobcům automobilů po celém světe vytvářet elegantní a nejmodernější vozidla.

 

Shrnutí pozice

  • Tvorba ekonomických a finančných analýz a reportov za rôzne činnosti a oddelenia.
  • Analýza nákladov a podpora manažérov oddelení spoločnosti v rámci procesu controllingu a nákupu.
  • Spolupráca pri tvorbe rozpočtu a kontrola jeho plnenia. Interpretácia plnenia plánov. Tvorba business forecastu.
  • Tvorba objednávok materiálu a služieb, kontrola a párovanie faktúr s objednávkami, sledovanie úhrad dodávateľských faktúr.
  • Evidencia majetku a spotrebného materiálu, príprava finančných výkazov ohľadom spotreby režijného materiálu.
  • Úzka komunikácia s oddelením nákupu a controllingu materskej spoločnosti.
  • Kontinuálne vylepšovanie procesov - analýzy procesov, aktívne návrhy na zlepšenia pri výbere dodávateľov.

Klíčové zodpovědnosti

Klíčové kvalifikace / požadavky

  • Stredoškolské alebo vysokoškolské vzdelanie – odbor ekonomika, účtovníctvo
  • Pozícia je vhodná pre absolventa
  • Dobrá znalosť Excel
  • Vodičský preukaz B

Další informace

  • Home office možný
  • Zaškolovanie počas výkonu práce a aj v Českej republike

Povědomí. Shoda. Zmocnění.

Ve společnosti Magna jsme přesvědčeni, že různorodá pracovní síla má zásadní význam pro náš úspěch. Proto jsme hrdí na to, že jsme zaměstnavatelem s rovnými příležitostmi. Přijímáme zaměstnance na základě zkušeností a kvalifikace a v souladu s požadavky na pracovní místo, bez ohledu zejména na barvu pleti, původ, náboženství, pohlaví, sexuální orientaci, věk, občanství, rodinný stav, zdravotní postižení nebo genderovou identitu. Abychom vyhověli požadavkům GDPR a místního zákona o ochraně osobních údajů, nedoporučujeme vám zasílat žádosti o zaměstnání e-mailem.

title: Contrôleur
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Chez Techo-Bloc, nous ne faisons pas que paver des patios – nous pavons la voie à de grandes carrières! Fondé sur une culture d'innovation, nous fabriquons des produits d'aménagement paysager axés sur la qualité, la durabilité et la beauté. Notre équipe en pleine croissance recherche des personnes passionnées et prêtes à avoir un impact. Croyez-vous être prêt à relever ce défi?  

Pourquoi travailler chez Techo-Bloc ?

Nous aimons nous vanter! Techo Bloc offre à ses employés un salaire compétitif et un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux. Voici quelques-uns de nos avantages :

  • Des leaders qui s'investissent dans votre réussite ;
  • Emploi dynamique et un cheminement de carrière évolutif ;
  • Développement professionnel et travailler sur des projets ;
  • Accès gratuit à un médecin de famille virtuel grâce à la télémédecine.
  • Barbecues et fêtes de Noël épiques ;
  • Bonus de fin d'année ;
  • Modèle de travail hybride ;
  • Cuisine remplie de collations ;
  • Stationnement gratuit ;
  • Des primes de référencement généreuses ;
  • Rabais pour les employés sur les produits de Techo-Bloc ;
  • Programme d'aide aux employés (PAE disponible 24/7) ;
  • Cours d'anglais et de français disponibles (s'il s'agit d'une exigence professionnelle) ;
Description du poste

Relevant du Contrôleur d'entreprise en chef, nous somme à la recherche d’un contrôleur sera responsable de toutes les activités comptables pour les sites manufacturiers et centre de distributions. Vous jouerez un rôle stratégique au sein de l’équipe des finances qui aidera Techo-Bloc à continuer à grandir et vous participerez sur des projets qui auront un réel impact.

Une journée dans la vie:

Votre journée commence par une présentation des résultats financiers mensuels au PDG, suivie d'un café matinal avec le gestionnaire TI pour discuter de l'implémentation de l'ERP. Vous prenez ensuite le temps de réfléchir à la manière dont vous allez créer le mapping du grand livre général pour le nouveau système SIRH.  Vous prenez une pause pour dîner et vous resourcer. Plus tard dans l'après-midi, vous enquêtez sur une importante variation de stock et organisez un appel avec le directeur des achats et de la production. Votre journée de travail se termine par une rencontre avec votre assistant contrôleur. Enfin, vous vous déconnectez et sortez souper et faire du go-kart avec l'équipe des finances!

Dans votre rôle, vos principales responsabilités seront les suivantes :

  • Assurer la production des états financiers mensuels et annuels, incluant des toutes les annexes explicatives détaillés selon les échéances ;
  • Diriger l'analyse, la configuration, les essais, le dépannage et la mise en œuvre de projets spéciaux (p. ex. consolidation des comptes, nouveaux programmes de primes, mise en œuvre de l'ERP, etc.) ;
  • Procéder aux analyses financières et produire tous les rapports financiers requis ;
  • Être en mesure de maintenir une intervention crédible avec les vérificateurs externes, autant canadiens qu’américains et être le principal interlocuteur auprès des autorités fiscales, canadiennes et/ou américaines pour les sites manufacturiers sous sa responsabilité ;
  • Produire et coordonner le processus budgétaire avec les différents départements ;
  • Publier les rapports : Dépenses actuelles VS budget pour chacun des différents départements ;
  • Publier différents ratios d’indicateurs de performance ;
  • Établir les contrôles internes jugés pertinents ;
  • Participer à l’amélioration des processus comptable ;
  • Former et mobiliser votre équipe ;
  • Participer au processus d’analyse de rentabilité pour tous nouveaux produits et projets ;
  • Suivi des immobilisations (achats, ventes, dispositions et transferts) ;
  • Maintenir en tout temps une veille fiscale et légale des activités comptables de l’entreprise ;
  • Trouver des solutions et apporter de la valeur ajoutée pour Techo-Bloc.
Qualifications

  • Baccalauréat en sciences comptables ;
  • Expériences en milieu manufacturier ; 
  • Titre comptable ;
  • 5 à 8 ans d'expérience en comptabilité ;
  • Un minimum de 3 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire ;
  • Expérience en prix de revient et contrôle financier ;
  • Excellente maîtrise des systèmes de gestion intégrée (ERP) tel que Microsoft AX ou SAP ;
  • Excellente maîtrise de la Suite Office et particulièrement Excel ;
  • Bilinguisme écrit et oral.


Informations complémentaires

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue.

title: Contrôleur financier
description:
Vous avez envie de relever de nouveaux défis? Vous avez toujours souhaité travailler dans une entreprise internationale? Vous recherchez une ambiance de travail hors du commun où le plaisir rime avec dépassement de soi? Voici l’offre que vous attendiez!

Votre future équipe

Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous optimisons les installations manufacturières de nos clients grâce à des systèmes novateurs à haute valeur ajoutée qui exploitent le plein potentiel de l’automatisation et de la robotique. Nous faisons partie des plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage au monde – que ce soit pour des produits alimentaires, agricoles, organiques ou industriels.

Votre futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Assurer la consolidation des états financiers à l’international
  • Émettre des recommandations à l’Équipe Leadership suivant l’analyse des résultats financiers
  • Coordonner une équipe d’analystes
  • Développer, implanter et assurer l’efficacité des méthodes de contrôles internes et de gouvernance
  • Participer à la préparation des budgets, suivre le processus, puis expliquer les écarts au besoin
  • Participer au développement et au suivi des indicateurs de performance financière 
  • Manipuler des modèles de simulation et de prévision financière
  • Être responsable du dossier de fin d’année et du processus d’audit des états financiers par nos vérificateurs externes

Compétences requises

  • Formation universitaire – profil comptabilité
  • Titre CPA – un atout
  • Leadership
  • Maîtrise de Microsoft Excel
  • Passion pour l’optimisation des procédés comptables
  • Proactivité
  • Rigueur
  • Excellentes habiletés communicationnelles en anglais et en français – tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

Votre futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots te parlent?

comptabilité, contrôleur, états financiers, budgets, audits, consolidation, contrôle interne, cabinet, milieu manufacturier,

Envie d’en savoir plus? N’attendez plus, vous êtes à un clic de propulser votre carrière au niveau supérieur!
