title: Controller
description:
mCloud Technologies Corp. (“mCloud”) is one of Canada’s fastest growing tech companies, most recently ranking #57 on the Deloitte Fast 500 List and #2 on the Canada Clean Technology Fast 50 list. As a global provider, mCloud is committed to solving the worlds most challenging energy problems with AI and its proprietary solution AssetCareTM. In November 2021, mCloud successfully up listed to the Nasdaq, positioning the company to accelerate R&D, take new solutions to market, and expand its presence internationally. The Company currently reports in Canada on the TSX.V and in the USA on the Nasdaq.

The Controller will oversee mCloud’s accounting operations. The successful candidate will be a versatile professional with excellent communication skills. You’re motivated to achieve efficiencies through continuous improvement and systemization. The Controller plays a key role in partnering with the business and finance leadership team, informing leadership of actual and projected performance. Furthermore, the Controller will analyze business trends, changes, and new initiatives in a fast paced, dynamic, and highly collaborative, cross-functional environment. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, driven, have strong business acumen, and will enjoy diving into the details.

This position can be based out of Calgary, Alberta or Vancouver, British Columbia.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions reporting to the Director, Finance
  • Maintain, review, and complete all general ledger reconciliations and financial report analysis, investigating and resolving account discrepancies
  • Responsible for ensuring accounting software is maintained current, accurate and used to its most effective capabilities by all level users
  • Review working papers for quarterly and year-end reporting
  • Preparation of annual/monthly budgets and forecasts as required
  • Ensure accounting entries are made promptly, accurately and supported including reconciling accounts on a monthly basis
  • Daily cash management and forecasting processes
  • Ownership of the accounts receivable and accounts payable functions and related accounting processes, including receivable collections
  • Oversee filing of GST/PST returns
  • Review bank reconciliations
  • Wires and online banking
  • Review, analyze and implement internal controls/business policies and procedures
  • Responsible for HR and employee management including hiring, training, supervising and resourcing accounting staff
  • Special projects on an individual or team basis as assigned.

Must Have Experience, Education, and Designations:

  • Professional Accounting Designation (CPA preferred) with 5+ years of experience
  • Knowledge of finance, accounting, IFRS, budgeting, forecasting, risk management, operational finance
  • Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills including the ability to think outside the box, and see the “big picture”
  • Strong relationship builder and collaborative team player with ability to influence stakeholders
  • Excellent team leader with the ability to motivate, coach and develop upcoming talent
  • Passion for continuous improvement

About you:

You are approachable, confident, forward-thinking, and have a winning teamwork attitude. As a self-starter, you multitask and adapt to changing priorities. You are creative in problem-solving and excel in a dynamic work environment. Overall, you navigate and act inclusively and collaboratively in an organization that brings together many different perspectives and skill sets from all over the world.

About us:

mCloud is unlocking the untapped potential of energy-intensive assets using IoT, AI, and the cloud. We operate three lines of business, connecting and optimizing assets like HVAC units in commercial buildings, wind turbines in renewable energy, and the control systems at process industry facilities. We’re a global company, headquartered in Calgary with a presence across North America, the UK and continental Europe, the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and China.

Today, we connect and manage over 59,000 energy assets through our AssetCare™️ platform. We help our customers double asset productivity, reduce their asset energy consumption by up to 25%, and triple the speed at which they are able to respond to the unexpected. mCloud helps eliminate about 80,000 tons in greenhouse gas emissions every year – or the same amount of GHG emitted by 18,000 passenger cars on the road.

Solving the world’s most challenging energy problems is hard work – it takes dedicated, talented, and innovative people working together as one team to make it all happen. We are a team, which means "we" comes before "me." And we are driven to deliver measurable, bottom-line results for our customers everywhere through our technology. We get stuff done and we have fun doing it!

Why you want to join our team:

If you want to be part of an elite team with the ambition to become Canada’s next big unicorn tech company, mCloud is the place for you. We are a team that helps one another succeed and thrive – you will get the autonomy, support, and flexibility you need to be successful from every part of our business.

Why you shouldn't join our team:

We are busy and fast-paced! We work hard. We are a global company, so our hours are not standard. Sometimes you might be up early or work late to meet with people in different time zones, but with that comes flexibility.

Our expectations are high. This is not an organization where you can hide or not constantly be driving for results.

No day is ever the same, and most days, you come in with a list of things to do, and then something happens, and you need to pivot.

We do not tolerate people who are only in it for themselves. We are a team, and we are all in the business of helping those around us succeed. We expect and demand nothing less.

title: Controller (Contract)
description:
It all started on a bus. An election campaign bus.

Through his experience providing mobile connectivity for election campaigns, Dejero founder Bogdan Frusina witnessed first-hand the challenges that journalists faced reporting live from the field. He knew there was a better way.

Building a team with a passion for innovation and a drive to persevere, he set about developing and commercializing a portable and wireless live video broadcast solution. In November 2009, that vision came to life. Dejero enabled the world’s first live transmission of the torch relay across Canada for the Vancouver Winter Olympics.

Since then, we’ve evolved into a world-leading wireless telecommunications aggregator, providing resilient, uninterrupted internet connectivity vital for critical communications. Broadcasters, production companies, first responders, defense departments, and government agencies put their trust in Dejero.

Here’s how you help us continue our story...

We are currently seeking a Controller to lead and manage a team of finance professionals. The ideal candidate will have strong knowledge and experience working with accounting standards for private enterprises (ASPE) and is driven to lead a team of accounting professionals. As we at Dejero continue to grow and provide the reliable internet connectivity of the future we are looking for someone to help us drive this growth, and grow with us. This is a contract position expected to continue until November 2023. This individual will be expected to work in office approximately one day per week.

As a key member of our Finance team, you will:

  • Manage and oversee the daily operations of accounts receivable, billing, accounts payable, payroll, expense management, and cash operations 
  • Monitor and analyze accounting data and review monthly and quarterly financial reports and statements prepared by the finance team
  • Prepare monthly/quarterly/annual compliance reports for all debt facilities; liaise with lenders as necessary
  • Assist in the preparation of financial material for the quarterly and annual Board of Directors meetings
  • Lead the finance team in the preparation of annual financial statements, and manage the execution of the annual audit; support strong working relationship with Company’s external auditors
  • Assist in the annual financial budgeting process, including assistance with the preparation of the budget file, the Board of Directors presentation, and bank packages, as well as regularly updating the rolling forecast file 
  • Establish, document, and model new processes, policies and principles to streamline the operational accounting process and drive efficiency; develop action plans and implement change management across the finance team
  • Work cross-functionally in the organization with sales and procurement operations to ensure and improve customer and vendor relations
  • Allocate tasks and projects to ensure results are delivered in a timely and accurate manner
  • Maintain bank accounts and any related administrative matters; oversee and approve required payments
  • Evolve and manage credit terms and work with Sales Ops to establish credit strategies and processes
  • Oversee collections and work directly with customers to maintain superior customer service on any escalated matters
  • Work with procurement to maintain adequate inventory levels and controls
  • Review Canadian tax and SRED filing working papers and work with external tax accountants to finalize the annual tax filings
  • Review and evaluate revenue recognition and related entries processed through the Company’s ERP system
  • Provide assistance with government grant applications and complete periodic reporting to applicable government agencies; respond to audit queries as needed
  • Ad hoc projects as assigned

Here’s why you should join the Dejero team:

  • If you aren’t growing, we aren’t growing. You will have the opportunity to develop your own career path with support from your manager and the People + Culture team.
  • If the pandemic has taught us anything, it’s that work-life balance is extremely important. As we find our new normal, our employees are able to choose their preferred work environment; home, work or hybrid.
  • We are home to an award-winning culture, products, and teams. Last year, Great Place to Work ranked us 5th Best Place to Work in Canada! We have also won two Emmys for our Smart Blending Technology.
  • Giving back is a key pillar of our culture. Last year, Dejero and its employees contributed thousands of dollars to 12 local and international charities. In addition, through Dejero’s Day of Doing Great Things and employees’ annual paid volunteer day, we encourage our team to go out into the community and volunteer for local organizations.

To check out all of the awesome benefits and perks Dejero has to offer, check out https://www.dejero.com/company/careers.

What you'll bring to the role:

  • A Bachelor’s degree with an accounting focus
  • Accounting designation (CPA, CMA, CGA, CA) designation required
  • 5+ years of accounting experience
  • Previous experience working with CRM/ERP tools and systems
  • Strong work ethic, ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while maintaining composure and ability to prioritize competing tasks is essential
  • Strong Excel skills, ability to manage complex workbooks
  • Exceptional attention to detail and takes ownership of their work
  • Knowledgeable about processes and has previous experience working with recurring sales revenues

Bonus points if you have experience with:

  • NetSuite
  • Working at the Controller or Senior Accountant/Accounting Manager level

Want to learn more about how Dejero has provided reliable connectivity across the globe? Check out some of our success stories here: www.dejero.com/resources/customer-stories.

We thank all applicants for their interest; only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Dejero is committed to providing a barrier-free application and interview process for all candidates. Should you require accommodations due to a disability or medical condition at any point throughout the hiring process, please contact the People and Culture team by email at careers@dejero.com or by telephone at 519.772.4824

title: Controller
description:
Location: Calgary, AB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/19/2022Job ID: DL60368419Category: Accounting & Finance
If you are a talented and experienced Controller Drea Larson, Senior Consultant at David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you!  Our client, a leader in their field, has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Calgary.

The Controller is responsible for the overall functions of accounting and financial operations. You will lead the provision and delivery of sound financial structures, controls, processes, and procedures.

Responsibilities:
  • Prepare year-end working papers for external review
  • Month-end Financial Statement preparation for management review
  • Bi-weekly payroll processing requires a good understanding of payroll and labor laws
  • Administration of employee benefit program
  • Monthly, quarterly, and annual compliance reporting and remittances to CRA, CBSA, Statistics Canada, and WCB
  • Recommend benchmarks for measuring the financial and operating performance of the company
  • Oversee the finance team, providing continuous coaching, mentorship, and career development support
Qualifications:
  • Accounting designation (CPA) preferred, and 5+ years of accounting and financial reporting experience at a senior management level
  • Prior responsibility for full-cycle accounting and finance functions, including reporting, analysis, and issues resolution
  • Full cycle accounting knowledge including knowledge of GAAP
  • Knowledge of foreign currency trading would be considered an asset
  • Willingness to be hands-on in all aspects of accounting
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Suite, specifically Excel
  • Experience with P21 Software and experience with distribution and inventory is considered an asset
Job ID: DL60368419
 
If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Contrôleur (#3107)
description:
Poste : Contrôleur.euse (#3107)

Catégorie :  Permanent

Localisation : Montréal-Est + Hybride

Salaire : Compétitif

Particularités de l’employeur:

Rejoignez un environnement de recherche renommé, d’innovation et de bon cœur pour de bonnes causes. Notre client est un spécialiste en recherches pharmaceutiques qui offre une qualité de travail impressionnante pour ses employés.es.

Avantages : Entreprise en croissance – Environnement moderne et technologique – Horaires flexibles et en mode hybride – Assurances collectives – REER – Programme de bonification – Salaire concurrentiel sur le marché

Vos responsabilités en quelques mots!

  • Préparer les états financiers périodiques;
  • Effectuer le suivi de l’avancement des projets ainsi que le rapprochement des charges;
  • Implanter des KPI au sein de différentes unités d’affaires en collaboration avec les gestionnaires;
  • Maintenir les systèmes de prix de revient au coût standard et les analyses de coûts à jour;
  • Approuver les factures des fournisseurs et la facturation clients;
  • Préparer des analyses financières et les analyses d’écarts;
  • Améliorer les registres financiers et les contrôles internes;
  • Développer des tableaux de bord;
  • Participer à l’élaboration des budgets, à la réalisation des audits externes et à l’implantation des systèmes financiers et non financiers (ERP).

Vos Atouts pour ce poste!

  • BAC en administration des affaires, en comptabilité ou en finances;
  • Détenir un titre de CPA et un minimum de 3 ans d’expérience à titre d'analyste financier ou de contrôleur;
  • Parfaite maîtrise du logiciels Excel, excellente maîtrise des logiciels PowerPoint et Word ;
  • Expérience de travail avec des logiciels ERP;
  • Connaissance du cycle comptable complet et des systèmes informatiques de gestion;
  • Rigueur professionnelle et créativité organisationnelle; 
  • Diplomatie, intégrité, professionnalisme et capacité à travailler en équipe; 
  • Bilinguisme : communication claire à l’écrit et à l’oral (français et anglais).

Une opportunité idéale pour…

Quelqu’un de flexible, dynamique, qui s’adapte facilement et qui aimerait apprendre davantage dans cette position. Sous la responsabilité d’un CFO très accessible et organisé, la personne en poste sera responsable du cycle comptable complet et des opérations quotidiennes du département des finances. En collaboration avec son équipe, elle s’assurera de l’organisation du travail et du rendement des analyses.  Elle participera activement aux opérations et à la planification financière des unités d’affaires. Vous aimeriez rejoindre une belle équipe qui travail pour des causes qui nous touchent tous? Avoir un revenu à la hauteur de votre dévotion? Alors, contactez-nous rapidement pour de plus amples informations au sujet de cet offre.

title: Controller
description:
Description:

Agilus is recruiting for a Controller in the Manufacturing Industry in Iroquois, Ontario.
Reporting to the owner, the Controller will oversee the accounting department while running all day-to-day financials duties; bookkeeping, financial statement prep, month end, quarter end and year end closing, budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and cashflows. The Controller will also oversee the Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable department. If you are looking for an opportunity where you can make an impact and leave your mark than we need to hear from you.
Responsibilities:
  • Manage month-end and year-end close processes
  • Lead the preparation of the annual budget and financial forecasts and report variances
  • Supervise and mentor a small accounting team
  • Establish and monitor internal controls to ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with established legal regulatory and internal company policies and procedures
  • Implement and manage purchases, payables, and payment processes
  • Implement and manage revenues, receivables, and receipt processes

Successful candidates will have:
  • 5+ years of accounting experience in a senior accounting position
  • CPA, MBA or bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance
  • Knowledge and understanding of all accounting practices
  • High flexibility and strong interpersonal skills
  • Bilingual (English and French) would be considered an asset

Total rewards:
  • Permanent Full time
  • Salary Range: $75,000 or up ( Depend on Experience)
  • Benefits Package + 3 weeks vacation

Interested?
Please apply directly online by phone 613.288.0970 or by email mchui@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Controller/Finance Manager (22-213)
description:
Thank you for your interest in positions at IPG Photonics. All Applicants must apply on our company website to be considered. Please visit www.ipgphotonics.com and click on the “Company” tab. We look forward to seeing your application soon!

IPG Photonics (Canada) Inc. designs, develops and manufactures a unique and rapidly growing laser welding process monitoring technology with significant importance to the electric vehicle revolution. We are the national subsidiary of IPG Photonics Corporation (NASDAQ:IPGP).  

IPG Photonics Canada Inc. is growing rapidly and is seeking to hire a new Controller/Financial Manager. This hands-on position is responsible for overseeing the financial operations of the subsidiary (~30-50 employees), preparing intra-company reports and basic payroll/benefits administration through existing commercial software platforms.

The ideal candidate will have over 5 years of accounting and financial management experience; a CPA designation is preferred, however, candidates with a solid track record of bookkeeping and payroll/benefits administration will be considered as well. 

Detailed Responsibilities:
  • Directing all aspects of accounting operations, overseeing all transactions related to general ledger, receivables, payables, payroll and financial reporting.
  • Reconcile general ledger accounts, sub ledgers and prepare reconciliation entries. 
  • Administer payroll and benefits specific to the Canadian subsidiary 
  • Manage day-to-day banking operations, reconcile monthly bank statements.
  • Applying corporate finance policies.
  • Oversee Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Payroll and Human Resource operations with assistance from corporate headquarters. 
  • Fulfill month-end closing requirements.
  • Ensuring that records are maintained in accordance with GAAP/ASPE standards.
  • Prepare documents and forms related to regulatory requirements (GST/HST, CRA, Ministry of Finance, WSIB, StatsCan etc.) and ensure accuracy and timely submission.
  • Work with corporate staff and local accounting firms to prepare tax submissions.
  • Analyze subsidiary and product line profitability and suggest improvements to transfer pricing and related policies.
  • Customized financial reporting as required by management.
  • Administer all payroll activities and benefits administration.
  • Managing all tax planning and compliance with all required federal, provincial, local, payroll, property and other applicable taxes.
  • Calculate royalty payments from sales documentation.
 
Qualifications:
  • A CPA designation with 5 years of Financial management experience or 10+ years of bookkeeping and payroll administration experience
  • Preference will be given to candidates who are familiar with reporting requirements of a publicly traded company with global subsidiaries, and experience with enterprise ERP software.
  • Meticulous level of detail, highly organized, business oriented, dependable and capable of supporting the rest of the team.
  • Experience working with a rapid growth company is preferred.
  • Self-motivated and interested in streamlining processes.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Able to work with tight deadlines.
  • Strong computer skills. Ability to design/prepare reports and other appropriate documentation.

title: Controller
description:
This is your chance to join a fast-paced organization with a large, stable and continuously growing presence in the vertical market software industry! As Controller, you will be a part of Harris Healthcare Group’s finance management team and will be looked upon to provide financial support and analysis that will have a direct impact on the success of the Business Units you will support.

Reporting to the VP, Finance, the successful candidate will lead an existing team of finance professionals while overseeing the month, quarter and year-end close process. Additionally, the Controller will work closely with the senior management operations teams in the Business Unit they will support as their trusted business advisor.

What will be your impact?

• Review complex revenue recognition for software contracts which are accounted for under IFRS 15, including regular review of WIP schedules

• Review account reconciliations, analyze results, and prepare reporting to senior management on a monthly and quarterly basis

• Assist the business and operational leaders with monthly forecasting

• Become a business partner by providing support and analysis to the business and operational leaders

• Manage, coach and mentor a team of finance professionals

• Ensure internal controls are in place and identify potential risks and controls to mitigate them

• Identify, improve and standardize finance processes

• Prepare audit requests and respond to queries during reviews and the interim and year-end audit

• Special projects and ad hoc reports (ex: due diligence and integration of new acquisitions)

What are we looking for?

• 5+ years of work experience within a large accounting firm and/or experience in industry

• CPA 

• Experience with complex revenue recognition (project accounting, software accounting)

• Experience with IFRS

• Intermediate to advanced skills with Excel, and good practical knowledge of Microsoft Office

What we offer

• Opportunities to grow your career

• 3 weeks' vacation when starting, 4 weeks after 3 years, and 5 weeks after 7 years of service

• 5 personal days per year

• Lifestyle rewards

• Flexible work options (office, remote, hybrid)

• Group insurance paid 100% by the employer starting from your first day of employment

• Employee stock ownership and RRSP/401k programs

• Lifestyle rewards

• Fun and collaborative work environment

title: Project Controller, Finance Consulting
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Ottawa, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Ottawa

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Have many careers in one Firm.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.

Are you a financial analyst looking to provide your expertise to project management team(s), and learn and grow within a firm? Do you bring passion to what you do, showcase a can-do spirit and radiate the drive to do things right the first time to deliver high quality service? Then this is the job for you!

What will your typical day look like?

Your proactive nature will aid you in supporting preparation of budgets and forecasts to track and predict financial metrics such as revenue, expense, and profitability. Your attention to detail will allow you to track expenditures and perform the client bill and receivable collection functions with accuracy. Your communication skills will serve you well in interacting frequently with senior level internal and external clients and firm leadership to present various reporting, analyses, and discuss recommendations. Your business and/or financial education and experience will allow you to understand and utilize standard processes for project management, quality management, and risk management. You are self-motivated to continuously learn and improve your technical and financial skill set. Your ability to work independently will make you thrive with little supervision and lead the project financial lifecycle end-to-end from contract to close.

About the team

Deloitte Consulting's "Engagement Financial Services Practice" is comprised of Project Controls professionals serving as a focal point for financial aspects of project, program, and account management.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone who:
• Has a Major in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Management and a minimum of 3 years' experience in a financial analysis role
• Must be eligible for GOC security clearance
• Understands key financials and operational concepts and can integrate these into financial model for analysis and forecasting to asses progress on projects
• Has excellent analytical, prioritization and problem-solving skills
• Has experience working with the entire Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced level Excel
• Has outstanding attention to detail and adherence to project deadlines while handling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
• Bilingualism (an asset)
• Preferably has working knowledge of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software, such as SAP or other comparable systems
• Seeks challenging opportunities takes accountability for personal results
• Builds relationships and communicates effectively in order to positively influence peers and other stakeholders
** This role requires eligibility for obtaining a security clearance from the Government of Canada, that is to say, have been in continuous service in Canada for at least 5 years?

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by (insert date).

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Controller
description:
Who we are: Amilia is more than just a tech company – we’re a close-knit family made up of caring, entrepreneurial-minded individuals. Our multi-disciplinary team members will challenge and support you on every project.

What we do: We provide online registration and digital management software solutions to recreation organizations, such as cheer gyms, gymnastics clubs, dance studios, and many more.

How we do what we do: We provide all our team members with the tools and flexibility they need to succeed every day. We also put an emphasis on collaboration and encourage everyone to bring new ideas to the table, even if it’s outside of your department.

Why we do what we do: We’re not just here to sell software – we want to revolutionize the way recreation organizations leverage technology. Every Amilian is incredibly invested in our mission to disrupt the status quo and help our clients achieve great things.


What can you expect:

Under the supervision of the Director of finance and administration, you will be responsible for ensuring the compliance of the accounting and financial operations of the Canadian and American entities. You will also support the Director in the process of creating and implementing policies and procedures to identify, resolve and document accounting issues.


You'll be responsible for:

  • Preparing monthly financial statements and reviewing them with the director;
  • Putting in place analysis of balance sheet accounts and monthly verification;
  • Verifying and approving month-end journal entries;
  • Verifying and approving supplier invoices and expense accounts;
  • Leading the annual audit file process and follow-ups;
  • Preparing the file for tax credits (SRED & E-Business credit) and following up with the resources involved;
  • Suggesting and documenting any improvements to be made to internal controls and processes;
  • Monitoring cash-flow;
  • Monitoring and accounting for inter-company transactions.

title: Divisional Controller
description:
Overview

Divisional Controller

 

Cooke Aquaculture Inc., a dynamic and growing east coast family company, with Platinum Member status in the Canada’s Best Managed Companies Program, and one of Atlantic Canada’s Top Employers, has an opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join the Company’s Finance Team.

 

Cooke is a global seafood company with operations in North America, Europe, and South America. Our company’s success is driven by our dynamic, highly-skilled and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who live in coastal communities and contribute to the local area’s economy and sense of community.

 

The Role:

We are hiring a Divisional Controller to join our team of accounting professionals. This role will work out of our Saint John, and / or Blacks Harbour, NB office. This position will be responsible for the divisional accounting functions. You will manage a team and be responsible for completing period end financial statements and management reports, working paper files and ad hoc reporting. You will be responsible for continuous process improvement and will be involved, periodically, in projects to support the overall accounting and finance team. You will also be responsible for coordinating the requests of the external auditors for both the interim and year end audit tasks.

 

 Qualifications:

  • Professional accounting designation preferred,
  • University degree in accounting or finance,
  • 5 years plus of relevant experience,
  • Excellent leadership and communication skills 
  • Valid passport required for travel to other non-Canadian operations (when permitted),

The Opportunity:

The role description is just one part of the story. This is your opportunity to grow, to work within the parameters of the role but to reach your fullest potential.

We are a team that is driven to succeed. We count performance, we reward contribution and we recognize talent. 

It is about being at the centre of a global leader in seafood and knowing you are an important part of that growth. 

The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer.

 

The Why:

Why Cooke? Simple – we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness and work ethic. We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career and your future.

 

NOTE: The recruiter is reviewing and interviewing eligible applicants for this position as they are received. If you are interested in this posting, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. 

 

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted

Our Purpose.

•    3-5 years of progressive accounting experience; previous accounting firm experience a strong asset
•    Accounting software literacy, ability to transact in multiple program and propensity to learn new software, as required
•    Client-service orientation as demonstrated with strong oral and written communication skills 
•    Intermediate to advanced level of MS Office Suite proficiency (e.g., MS Excel, Outlook, Word)
•    Job costing skills
•    Ability to prioritize and manage competing priorities leveraging sound attention to detail and strong organization skills
•    Understanding, implementing and monitoring an adequate control environment.
•    Ability to work independently with minimum supervision, as well as, on a team

description:
Are you the new Controller at Pagefreezer?

What we do and why:

  • Millions of conversations are taking place online every minute. And the content of all these conversations is often important and sensitive. Regulations demand accurate recordkeeping of all content, and companies are realizing the value of having access to complete, searchable electronic records—not only for evidence capture and litigation preparedness, but also for greater insight into how and why conversations are taking place. 
  • We offer solutions at every stage of the information governance lifecycle (creation, retention, management, and disposal) that archives data in real-time and gives organizations a simple and effective way to search and use it.
  • Pagefreezer's Social Media Archiving and Monitoring solution enables organizations to create and share defensible records of their social media content, quickly and easily in our dashboard, in real-time—every like, share, edit, and deletion. With added features like sentiment analysis and keyword flagging, our customers can also get insights into the conversations taking place and receive alerts when inappropriate or sensitive information is shared in their platforms, to help them promote and protect their employees, customers, brand, and business.

What's special about us:

  • Our coworkers are collaborative, proactive, and interesting -- and they care about the right things. We've built a culture based on values that mean something to us and we practice them daily.
  • Our compensation is comprehensive, competitive, and can include benefits like extended health insurance, a $600 Lifestyle Spending Account, a $1000 annual learning budget, a Tax-Free Savings Account and a matching Retirement Savings Plan and paid time off, if you're in Canada. Not in Canada? We'll create a compensation package you're excited about together.
  • Our employees' priorities matter. Career growth? Balancing work and life? Growing your own side-hustle? Helping you live your best life is #goals.
  • Our track record is strong, our market opportunity is growing, and we're already providing solutions to some of the biggest companies in the world-- and you'll be helping us accelerate even faster. Come join a sustainably profitable, small company and see the impact of your work.

What our Controller does: 

  • Enable the company to achieve its mission, vision, and goals in a values-aligned way through creating and implementing comprehensive, creative, and measurable finance and accounting projects, and programs.
  • Excel at overseeing and organizing the Finance team to complete mission critical finance operations -- general accounting, record-keeping, budgeting, payroll, cash flow, receivables and payables, financial controls and policies, reports, etc. 
  • Prepare and review the budget, cash flow, audits and other financial reports in collaboration with the CEO. 
  • Empower department managers to create and manage their budgets, make advantageous vendor selections and purchasing decisions, and understand trends and compliance.
  • Collaborate with HR to recruit, retain, reward, engage and develop your people and teams through practical talent acquisition, talent management, and talent development initiatives (including workforce planning, onboarding, career pathing, coaching, performance reviews, and more).
    • Promote a Values-led working environment that is safe, respectful, diverse, equitable, and inclusive through role-modeling, accountability and support.
  • Manage the tools, stakeholders, trends, best practices, processes, and budget necessary to stay compliant and financially secure.
  • Enforce adherence to legal, regulatory, and company policies to maintain the company's legality and business ethics with regards to finance and accounting practices, including the following information security (IS) responsibilities.

What makes you a great fit:

  • Alignment with our Core Values
  • Deep understanding of SAAS finance operations and metrics and ability to adapt your experience to our organization to create initiatives 
    • CGA or CFA certifications
    • 5+ years of progressive Finance or Accounting leadership experience or;
    • 5+ years of managing the finances for a SAAS company
    • Bonus points for experience scaling a finance operation from $15+ million revenues
    • Bonus points for M&A due diligence experience
  • Demonstrated ability to build relationships with and serve as a knowledgeable resource to the executive management team that provides overall company leadership and direction
  • Familiarity with several different Finance and Accounting tools and ability to leverage them
    • Specifically, Xero, Klipfolio, etc
  • Impressive negotiation skills
  • Discipline, organizational and time management skills to work with a high amount of autonomy while delivering results
  • Outstanding interpersonal relationship and consulting skills, maintaining a high level of confidentiality
  • Keen ability to work under pressure, organize workload effectively, and delegate
  • Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills
  • Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Finance or Accounting, or in Business, Organization Development, or similar
    • Bonus points for MBA, Masters or higher degree 
  • Customer service-oriented “all hands on deck” attitude, driven to serve the organization
  • Able to work 40 hours a week and either authorized to work in Canada (anywhere in Canada works for us)

title: Flow Controller
description:
Job Description:

What do you get to do in this position?

  • Define and update the parameters of supply and stock management including ramp-up to achieve the target service level while reducing stock / SIOP (Master Production Schedule)
  • Ensure the quality and consistency of key data: Lead Time, Quantity, Stocking policy
  • Manage the continuous needs/resources balance (MRP, Kanbanâ€¦) for raw material, components and sub-assemblies
  • Manage the replenishment backlog (creation and rescheduling of the manufacturing and purchase orders)
  • Manage the backorder portfolio (BOL), the shortage and to take actions to insure the availability of product
  • This position will support the Short Interval Management (SIM) process in accordance with the Schneider Production System (SPS). This requires daily participation in SIM meetings, documentation of barriers as well as barrier resolution.
  • The individual may be required to participate in daily operations meetings with various other functions of the manufacturing team.
  • The individual will work with Engineering and Manufacturing to provide value added lean solutions for material flow and material providing and handling.
(External) English Qualifications:

This job might be for you if:

  • DCS (diploma of college studies in Supply Chain Management or Business Administration with Supply Chain is an asset
  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience in Supply Chain Management in a manufacturing setting
  • Proficient with using computers and advanced knowledge with applications (access, excel)
  • Effective communication, facilitation, and strong negotiation skills
  • Problem-solving skills are required
  • Ability to plan and organize effectively and has strong decision-making skills
  • Experience with conflict management and resolution
  • Must be detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task

#LI-SV1

description:
ALL APPLICANTS MUST BE ALLOWED TO WORK IN CANADA

Responsibilities:
  • Maintain and improve the product costing process and bill of materials process within the factories. Ensure they represent and drive factory processes.
  • Improve and document month-end procedures to enhance the accuracy of financial reporting

  • Working knowledge of ADP payroll and electronic time cards for bi-weekly payroll function 
  • Full Back up to AP/AR staff.
  • Perform Invoicing as needed.

  • Expert knowledge of Sage 300
  • Advance Excel skills required
  • Accounting degree required such as CPA or equivalency 
  • Minimum of three (3) years with a multi-product manufacturing standard product costing system
  • High level of critical thinking and analysis to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts

title: Financial Controller - Garden Grove - Client Opportunity
description:
Your opportunity:

With a winning mindset, Garden Grove improves commercial property value in the summer and mitigates risk in the winter with guaranteed service. Operating in commercial grounds maintenance, landscape and snow management/removal services, Garden Grove has proven next level results over the past 30 years! By putting people first, Garden Grove has built a reliable, talented team that provides high-quality customer service.

The role

This is an exciting opportunity to bring Financial Leadership to an organization alongside its President, Vice President and General Manager. As a Financial Controller, you will perform a pivotal role regarding monthly reporting and analysis, ad hoc reporting, budgeting, forecasting and projections. This position involves interaction with all divisions at Garden Grove.  

Essential Duties and Responsibilities;

Account & Financial Statements:

  • Support all divisions with financial statement analysis. Provide recommendations for improvement in quoting and managing projects based on analysis
  • Manage all accounting operations including cash management functions (13-week cashflow), overseeing invoicing, A/R, A/P, General Ledger, Cash disbursements, payroll, and bank reconciliation functions
  • Prepare weekly statements for analysis of Performance Metrics, Sales Gross Margins, and the Incentive Reports for all divisions
  • Manage, coordinate, and perform the preparation and review of budget, financial forecasts, and variances
  • Perform bi-monthly analysis of Balance Sheet accounts
  • Make recommendations to Senior Management and Office Administrator regarding Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable to ensure minimum cash requirements are being met
  • Review monthly financial statements with Senior management to ensure accuracy of statements for all revenue and expense accounts
  • Work with Senior Management to ensure budgets are accurately depicted for the goals of each department
  • Prepare budget vs. actual analysis of financial statements for the Senior Management Team
  • Assist in tracking and maintaining Fixed Asset sub ledgers. Prepare journal entries for new assets as well as depreciation, sale of FAâ€™s and write off of FAâ€™s
  • Provide leadership, accuracy, and clerical support with the Office Administration team
  • Review standard quoting and pricing strategies to ensure consistency with plan
  • Perform review analysis for all customer contract renewal agreements ensuring gross margins, providing recommendations for price increases where needed along with cost recovery strategies for CPI, labour, and material price increases
  • Develop and document business processes and counting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls
  • Post customer payments by recording cheques and EFT transactions
  • Posts revenues by verifying and entering transactions from local deposits
  • Update and maintain Accounts Receivable reporting and strategies and management of collecting outstanding Accounts Receivables
  • Prepare payroll from all employee time logs and any other related employee documentation

Monthly and Year End Analysis and Support:

  • Prepare working papers for company auditors
  • Liaise with company auditors to answer any questions posed by the audit team
  • Prepare internal statements for the Senior Management team to evaluate the year versus budget and the strategic plan
  • Accurate preparation of monthly returns (HST, EHT, WSIB, Payroll Deductions)
  • Accurate preparation of yearly reporting (T4â€™s, T4 summaries, ROEâ€™s)  

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • 10+ years of overall combined accounting and finance experience as a Financial Controller/Accounting Manager
  • 3 â€“ 5 years experience in Financial Analysis
  • Expert proficiency in QuickBooks and Microsoft Excel
  • CPA, CA designation
  • Excellent leadership skills with a proven track record of leading financial teams and direct reports
  • Thorough business acumen in relation to accounting principles and supporting several departments in an organization
  • Proven experience with general ledger functions, month-end/year-end close process and working with external auditors
  • Strong team player and strong communication skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Technology savvy and strong software abilities
  • Experience in service industry
  • Experience in implementation of new ERP systems


Click â€œApply nowâ€ to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.


To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our  careers page.

title: Cost Controller
description:
Here's what you will do as a Cost Controller at Spark Power:

  • Set up project and work orders in the SparkOps Operations Management System
  • Maintain the costing database and manage cost and accuracy against work orders and project budgets
  • Prepare detailed project accruals and forecasts at the WBS level based on project schedules
  • Work closely with the accounting team on the preparation of client invoices and processing of vendor invoices
  • Identify trends and monitor project cost variances and report to Project Managers. Provide variance explanations as required.
  • Support the project managers on preparation of change orders
  • Maintain change order log and follow up regularly on the status of change orders
  • Prepare monthly reports for projects and portfolio level that shows key financial KPI's, cash flow projections, risks and opportunities
  • Review of WIP and unbilled cost reports and provide explanations
  • Other tasks as assigned/required by project management and controls

Do you have the Spark? Here's what we are looking for:                                                                                                

  • Post-Secondary degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Management or Technical discipline
  • Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in project planning and control preferably on EPC projects
  • Proficiency in project control and monitoring principles
  • Advanced MS office skills and proficient in Excel
  • Experience with other Financial/Cost systems is an asset
  • Highly organized and attention to detail and keen on getting accurate data and results
  • Able to manage time effectively and work
  • Able to meet deadlines, deliver, and manage multiple tasks
  • Excellent communication skills both orally and in written

Who is Spark Power?

  • We provide end-to-end electrical contracting, operations and maintenance services, and energy sustainability solutions to the industrial, commercial, utility, and renewable asset markets.
  • We have over 1300 employees across 38 offices across North America.
  • We have numerous exciting projects in commercial, industrial, and institutional sectors across Canada and the US.

What we offer our employees:

  • Diverse and exciting scope of work
  • Continuous training and skills improvement
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Competitive wages plus incentive program
  • Excellent benefit package with wellness spending account options and corporate discounts
  • RRSP matching
  • Laptop and phone provided
  • Employee Share Ownership Program
  • Fun and supportive company culture

….and much more

title: Business Unit Controller
description:
In addition to the responsibilities listed below, employees are also expected to complete other duties as required. All managers are expected to have familiarized themselves with the Health & Safety and Human Resources manuals, including their responsibilities as outlined in each.

Role #1:Accounting and Finance 60 % of time:

Responsibilities:

  • Provide the necessary planning, organization, direction, coordination, control and management of Finance including - general ledger, cost accounting, reporting, payroll, invoicing, payables, collection of accounts receivables, HST, US sales tax, and monthly financial statements.
  • Responsible for preparation, auditing, and analysis of financial statements. Prepares balance sheets, profit and loss statements, and other management reports as requested.
  • Develops and implements processes either within the Finance team or as part of a collaborative effort with other teams to ensure compliance with appropriate internal controls and audit readiness and compliance.
  • Establish, maintain and monitor the financial records and transactions of the company - assuring compliance with applicable taxes, local regulations, rules, laws and requirements.
  • Research cost variance issues as they arise and identify root cause and implement improvements to prevent future occurrences.
  • Monitors cash flow of the company and ensures that all inputs and outputs are managed to provide maximum cash flow: AR, Collections, Payables, etc. Prepares weekly cash projections.
  • Leads the effort to ensure all information needed for annual financial audit is timely and accurate.
  • Responsible for providing all supporting data needed for the timely completion of the Canadian and US income tax returns
  • Raise awareness of any financial issues to be addressed to Controller.
  • Prepare annual budget.
  • Support annual insurance renewal.
  • Ensure sales commissions are paid in a timely manner.
  • Independently or as part of a team identifies and implements business process improvements. Seeks ways to increase the value that the accounting department brings to the organization. Supports management team with timely data and efficient accounting processes.
  • Work in conjunction with all policies and procedures.

Role #2:Accounting and Finance 40 % of time:

Responsibilities:

  • Establish Finance and Accounting related policies.
  • Facilitate Finance/Accounting meetings on a regular cadence.
  • Attend Management meetings and contribute to the Management team.
  • Select new employees when necessary - Process, Reference check, checklist.
  • Orientation of new employees.
  • Conduct regular coaching and feedback to ensure employees meet or exceed Job performance standards.
  • Manage performance issues.

Qualifications:

Education, Experience & Skills:

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field with 5 or more years of progressive experience including supervision of staff.
  • Preferred Professional designation in Accounting.
  • Demonstrated leadership ability, including coaching and development of direct reports.
  • Strong accounting background in manufacturing with costing experience.
  • Have a positive attitude and a willingness to learn and to change, to suit Company needs.
  • Be a team player & self-motivated.
  • Strong internal auditing and financial analysis skills.
  • Strong proficiency with personal computers and associated word processing/spreadsheet skills; experience working with ERP systems.
  • Demonstrated success in executing process improvements.
  • Ability to work effectively with others and lead and participate successfully on team.
  • High degree of business acumen.
  • Strong ethics and drive for results.
  • Must be able to occasionally travel to the United States.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Controleur Financier/ Financial Controller
description:
DESCRIPTION DU POSTE

Se rapportant au  Président, le Contrôleur financier planifie, organise et coordonne l’ensemble des opérations du cycle comptable. Il assure le contrôle comptable, le suivi financier et la fiabilité des informations comptables et financières pour l’ensemble de l’entreprise. IL supervise une équipe de 5 personnes dédiée à la comptabilité.

RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Diriger les activités reliées au crédit, au recouvrement et aux comptes payables;
  • Superviser la production des états financiers mensuels et procéder à des analyses de performance;
  • Superviser les comptes payables, la facturation et  les comptes recevable
  • Assurer que les inventaires sont correctement comptabilisés et évalués au système financier
  • Développer les politiques et les procédures requises au bon fonctionnement de la  fonction comptable;
  • Assurer le respect des lois fiscales;
  • Assurer un suivi du respect des contrôles et des politiques internes et implanter les mesures correctives lorsque requis;
  • Effectuer le suivi et la mise à jour des composantes/variables du coût de revient;
  • Effectuer la planification, l’analyse et le suivi des budgets;
  • Préparer des rapports sur les mesures financières en temps opportun (budgets, prévisions de la trésorerie, autres indicateurs financiers); 
  • Superviser la préparation du dossier de vérification externe et assurer le rôle de personne ressource dans le cadre du processus de vérification annuelle; 
  •  S’acquitter des autres tâches qui lui seront assignées.
 

PROFIL DU CANDIDAT

Éducation 
  • Baccalauréat en administration; 
  • Détenir un titre comptable de CPA –CGA -CMA

Expérience
  • Minimum 10 ans d’expérience de travail en comptabilité dont au moins 3 années à titre de contrôleur financier; 
  • Expérience en gestion de personnel; 
  • ·Expérience en implantation de systèmes comptables (un atout);

title: Business Controller
description:
Business ControllerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Process Industries division delivers complete electrification and automation solutions, industry-specific products and lifecycle services across industries. Engineering and delivering automation solutions from device to monitoring and control make our customers get more out of their investment; digitalization solutions including collaborative operations and augmented reality help improve plant and enterprise productivity, reduce maintenance and energy costs. Our engineering, project management, services and solutions portfolio covers a wide range of industries - Mining, Pulp & Paper, Metals, Aluminum and Cement, Data centers and Food and Beverage.Serving as the key partner for the Process Industries, Process Automation business, you will be a vital member of its finance team in Canada. You will help to set business strategy in line with wider division and product group strategies.In this role you will provide key support to the business, ensuring accurate tracking and processing of all transactions. You will translate business strategy into plans and establish measurable targets, evaluate the financial implications of various strategic decisions, identify risks and recommend actions.
Your responsibilities

  • Overseeing the business planning and forecasting process for Process. Industries, Process Automation and serving as the interface with Global Divisions and Local Industry Managers.
  • Establishing cost structures, productivity optimization and capital efficiency while closely monitoring cash flow and taking relevant actions to improve net working capital.
  • Ensuring compliance with internal guidelines/procedures and external regulatory requirements.
  • Performing financial analysis, reporting to business managers and making suggestions to improve performance, where appropriate.
  • Establishing and overseeing processes and tools to obtain transparent and reliable financial data and business information.
  • Ensuring timely and efficient communication with relevant Controllers, the Accounting Center and others to identify and discuss issues, and suggest improvements.

Your background
  • 10 years of experience in an accounting role.
  • Experience with computerized accounting systems and financial reporting software, including SAP, Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Outstanding attention to detail, accuracy and the ability to multitask.
  • A collaborative, solution-focused approach and strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • A bachelor's degree in accounting or finance related.
  • Fluent in English and French.
  • Travel is minimal, less than 5%.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our websitewww.abb.com.For the 4th year in a row, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's top employers by Forbes Magazine and has been ranked #1 within the industry category. Also named as Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Top Employers, Canada's Top Employers for Young People, and Best Candidate Experience Award (CandE Award), ABB's culture and commitment are to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Hybrid

title: Controller
description:
We are searching for a Controller for our client, a fast-growing, privately-held designer and manufacturer of industrial lighting fixtures in Etobicoke. The opportunity arises due to the upcoming retirement of a long-tenured member of the team.

The company is on a steep growth curve in a rapidly advancing sector (i.e. LED lighting), an area with huge potential for energy savings and positive global impacts.  With roots going back over 50 years, they are also poised as a leader in new technology.  They have a strong collaborative culture and an aggressive growth agenda.

The successful candidate will be a finance leader able to lead a team through full-cycle accounting and reporting, with a particular focus on manufacturing costing. The role reports to the VP of Finance and is a key member of the management team.  Experience in manufacturing or distribution and strong Excel skills are required.

The ideal candidate:
  • Has a CPA designation, and 5+ years of management experience.
  • Has a strong understanding of product costing, Bill-of-Material management, etc.
  • Is a strong communicator, and respected people manager
  • Has a high level of integrity, dependability, and sense of urgency
  • Collaborates effectively across the organization
  • Has a curious and analytical mindset.
Apply today and in confidence to be considered for this opportunity.

title: Controller
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Controller at our 591 Arvin Ave. facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reports directly to the Director of Finance.

Responsibilities:

ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING & ANALYSIS

  • Responsible for the accuracy and maintenance of the General Ledger and accounting systems, including providing oversight of all day-to-day accounting transactions.
  • Preparation of timely and accurate monthly, quarterly and annual year-end financial statements plus other reporting and analysis for internal management and external financial stakeholders.
  • Provides a detailed review and analysis of monthly consolidated financial statements including analysis on sales, gross margins/program profitability, expenses and inventories.
  • Leadership in co-ordinating and managing all internal and external audits.
  • Plans and co-ordinates all aspects of the year-end audit to ensure a smooth audit process and clean audit results. Activities include: preparation of the audit package and schedules, review of tax and other provisions, preparation of the financial statements and notes to the financial statements, and interface with external auditors.
  • Prepares reports for regulatory agencies.
  • Responsible for preparing all schedules and information to support the completion of Corporate Income Tax Returns and Tax Planning.
  • Provides support to the Director of Taxes.

BANKING, CASH MANAGEMENT AND TREASURY

  • Prepares and submits reports to the bank and other external entities.
  • Responsible for cash flow management, processing and reporting of cash.
  • Responsible for the corporate accounts receivable and accounts payable operations and accounting processes.
  • Manages reporting to support insurance coverage, including reporting of Insurable Values to insurance providers on an annual basis.

INTERNAL CONTROLS AND SYSTEMS

  • Ensures compliance with accounting policies and procedures and generally accepted accounting principles.
  • Monitors, evaluates, enhances and maintains the internal controls to support the business.
  • Establishes and recommends to senior management objectives, policies and procedures for the safeguarding of corporate assets.
  • Responsible for the integrity and accuracy of the Fixed Asset Sub-ledger.
  • Senior leader in the deployment of upgrades to the ERP system and implementation of other new systems and software.

BUSINESS LEADERSHIP AND OPERATION SUPPORT

  • Leadership in managing direct reports, executing on people management best practices and fostering a culture of teamwork and operational excellence.
  • Key member of the Senior Finance Leadership team responsible for business simplification and process re-engineering of accounting and financial processes.
  • Participates as part of the company leadership team in supporting business activities and the achievement of corporate objectives.
  • Provide business advice, analysis and guidance to support Operations, Engineering, Quality, Sales, IT, Purchasing, HR and Legal.
  • Provides data, analysis and advice to ownership & senior management in assessing and evaluating business opportunities and strategic plans.
  • Supports and enforces the company priority of Safe Operations, assisting and managing others to perform work in a safe manner so that no work site accident or illness results from any operational activity.

Qualifications:

  • Accounting designation, CPA/CA Preferred
  • University degree (Business Administration or Accounting/Finance)
  • At least 5 years' experience in Public Accounting (Audit) and/or related experience
  • Management experience leading teams
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Manufacturing experience is an asset
  • Experience in business process re-engineering and process simplification
  • Strong systems & computer skills (Knowledgeable in ERP/MRP, QAD experience is an asset: Microsoft Office, Excel, other accounting packages)


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

title: Ingénieur en Contrôle de Coût \ Cost Controller Engineer
description:
English version follows.

Progesys est une firme reconnue en gestion de projets industriels et leurs transitions optimales de la construction à l'opération. La société est basée à Laval (Canada) depuis 2002 et possède des bureaux aux États-Unis, au Moyen-Orient et en Asie.

Progesys est à la recherche d'un Ingénieur en Contrôle de Coût pour rejoindre son équipe de travail !

Principales responsabilités:

  • Planifier et organiser la gestion et les contrôles du projet
  • Participer aux prévisions, à la ligne de base de contrôle des coûts et aux délais
  • Supporter les projets en cours avec l'analyse des coûts, les rapports, les prévisions, la budgétisation et la gestion du changement
  • Préparer des rapports de coûts mensuels et des relevés des coûts-heures et des progrès du travail (budgets, prévisions, dépenses, engagements)
  • Exécuter les procédures de gestion de changement et veiller à ce qu'elles soient suivies tout au long du projet
  • Émettre les mises à jour budgétaires et les flux de trésorerie du projet.
  • Préparer les prévisions, les rapports sur les tendances des coûts et suivre les prévisions de coûts et de budget
  • Surveiller et faire des rapports sur les répercussions financières dû aux changements
  • Assurer le respect des procédures de qualité en matière de contrôle de la documentation
  • Établir et maintenir des relations avec les clients
  • Surveiller la conformité de la santé, de la sécurité, de la réglementation et de l'environnement
  • Coordonner les efforts des différentes parties prenantes
  • Travailler avec les coordonnateurs de contrats sur les budgets des contrats, les paiements progressifs, le processus de fin de mois, les variations des contrats, ainsi que la clôture des contrats.
  • Surveiller la qualité globale des produits livrables
  • Soutenir l'équipe de gestion pour s'assurer que le projet respecte le budget approuvé.
  • Diriger, former et encadrer une équipe de contrôleurs de coûts

Qualifications requises :

  • Baccalauréat en génie mécanique, industriel ou civil
  • Au moins 5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle de contrôleur de coûts, dans un environnement EPCM sur des projets industriels ou miniers légers ou lourds.
  • Expérience de travail avec PRISM G2 est un atout.
  • Excellente connaissance des contrôles d'ingénierie, du contrôle des coûts, de la comptabilité des projets et des rapports sur les projets.
  • Connaissance des achats / contrats, de la gestion de la construction et de la planification.
  • Excellentes aptitudes analytiques et attention aux détails.
  • Réflexion stratégique. Capacité de gérer et de prendre des décisions
  • Un bon communicateur
  • Capacité de travailler avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires
  • Connaissance approfondie de MS Office, en particulier Excel est obligatoire.
  • Connaissance de Primavera, SAP
  • Bilingue (anglais, français)

Vous désirez joindre une entreprise en pleine croissance qui valorise le développement professionnel et personnel de ses employés? Vous désirez travailler avec une équipe dynamique où vous pouvez relever des défis intéressants? Nous attendons votre candidature dès maintenant!

Merci pour votre intérêt. Veuillez noter que seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

___________________________________________________________________________________

Progesys is a recognized firm in project management and the optimal transition of these projects from construction to operation. The company has been based in Laval (Canada) since 2002 and has offices in the United States, the Middle East and Asia.

Progesys is looking for a cost controller to work on current and future projects in Canada. The person will be responsible for the implementation of control procedures, from the initiation phase to the completion of the project. The cost controller is also responsible that all cost activities, including change management, are reported and tracked accordingly.

Main responsibilities:

  • Support in monitoring the Project performance, activities progress, verifying and reviewing progress and cost reports.
  • Understand the project resources requirements, review manpower curve and act to prevent any resource constraints.
  • Prepare and issue monthly status reports providing critical analysis of progress status, trends and potential problems as well as identifying corrective action.
  • Review contractors' monthly payment certificates and submit to Project Manager for final approval.
  • Receive, review, assess and document any request for change from contractors in accordance with contractual agreements and project procedures.
  • Establish and implement change order control system and procedures for contract management and scope change.
  • Follow-up on project incurred costs (commitments and actual costs).
  • Support the Project Manager in preparing, controlling, and minimizing scope variations on contracts.
  • Manage risk management register.
  • Record details of commitments following the initial award of contract / purchase orders, including the registration of amendments and change orders,
  • Update the overall project forecast of direct (contracts, purchase orders, etc.) and indirect costs, as well as project contingency on a monthly basis, following reviews with key stakeholders.
  • Update the Management Reserve monthly following a review and agreement with the Project Manager.
  • Prepare Commitment Approval Form while presenting a Recommendation to Award for a Purchase Order or Contract.
  • Review of budget and forecast during the Commitment Package Close-out process.

Required qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering preferred.
  • At least 10 years of experience in a role of cost controller on industrial projects, for example: mines and metals, petrochemicals, pulp and paper, energy.
  • Working knowledge of   PRISM G2 Cost Management software is required.
  • AACE Cost Engineer certification is an asset.
  • Excellent knowledge of engineering controls, cost control, project accounting and project reports.
  • Thorough knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel is essential.
  • Solid analytical and reasoning abilities required.
  • Excellent communication, in English and French.
  • Must have strong teamwork skills with the ability to establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships. ​
  • Ability to work in a constantly changing environment.

You want to join a growing company that values professional and personal development of its employees in respect of the individual and family life? You want to work with a dynamic team where you can reach and surpass your goals?

Join our team and submit your application now via our website http://progesys.ca/careers

Thank you for your interest. Please note that only selected applicants will be contacted.
