title: CFO Chief Financial Officer
description:
CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER - Southern Alberta  
$175K - $200K, benefits ++
Relocation Package Available to southern Alberta.

As Chief Financial Officer, you will join the dynamic Executive Team of a Group of Companies to administer the highest level of fiscal responsibility within a fast paced and growing manufacturing organization. The ideal candidate will be an excellent team player, demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit, who is effective working collaboratively with all departments to ensure the companies stay on track with financial goals and targets.

If you are eager to join an energetic organization that is looking to the future in everything they do AND you want to live in an amazing rural environment close to the mountains - this opportunity may be the career of a lifetime.

A new work family! A beautiful community where you and your family will enjoy your time away from work.

If you have the skills, experience and the desire to embrace a new opportunity, send us your resume and let's talk.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Strategy, Planning and Management
- Reports to CEO and is a member of the leadership team;
- Participate in Weekly, Quarterly and Annual EOS Leadership Team meetings;
- Lead, Management and Accountability (LMA) for all financial and all other CFO function roles;
- Assess and evaluate financial performance of the organization’s budgets and forecasts;
- Contribute to the visioning of the companies long-term then shorter-term goals;
- Participate in decisions as they relate to strategic initiatives and operational models;
- Ensure strong relationships with external banking, accounting, and other financial service partners;
- Analysis and minimization of company financial risks and liabilities;
- Support department Managers on budgeting, margin analysis and department planning.

Forecasting, Budgeting and Financial Analysis
- ­Financial reporting by company and critical department operations; 
- Review and analyze current financial results and provide improvement recommendations;
- Analysis of new business initiatives, products and/or service offerings;
- Develop and maintain monthly operating budgets and annual company operating budgets;
- Analyze and qualify the company’s growth and expansion plans.

Accounting, Administration and Operations
- Ensure software and systems are functioning accurately and efficiently; 
- Review and ensure application of appropriate internal financial controls;
- Ensure timeliness and accuracy of financial and management reporting data;
- Accurate and timely financial statements;
- Accurate and timely filing and payment of all relevant government agency taxes;
Month-end closing activities including GL’s, balance sheets and overhead cost allocation;
- Analyze and improve financial systems, policies, processes, and controls;
- Identify, onboard, coach and LMA for accounting team members.

Financial and Cash Management
- Cash flow projections, planning and management;
-Oversee investments and other business assets;
- Ensure accurate and Timely AR/AP functions within Finance department.

Skill Requirements:
- CPA Designation;
- 7+ years of proven experience as CFO, Director or Finance, Financial Officer, or comparable role; strategic planning and execution and partnering with a leadership team;
- Experience with a variety of ERP Systems;
- Experience working with multiple banking and accounting organizations;
- Manufacturing and/or Construction experience considered an asset;
- High level of skill with IT and technology services and systems; - Outstanding communication and presentation skills;
- Excellent analytical, reasoning, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills.

Company Core Values: 
Passionate, Positive & Productive: Promote Positive Workspaces. Pursue Challenging Goals, We are Eager to Succeed.
Respectful, Helpful & Caring: BE Open and Approachable. Help Others Succeed. Treat Everyone with Respect.

Solution-Focused: See it, own it, solve it, do it. Embrace Continuous Improvement. We Always Find a Way.
Do the Right Thing: Know What is Important. We Make the Most of Our Time & Energy. Our Decision Impact Everyone.

If you are eager to join an energetic organization that is looking to the future in everything they do AND you want to live in an amazing rural environment close to the mountains - this opportunity may be the career of a lifetime. A new work family! A beautiful community to enjoy your time away from work. If you have the skills, experience and the desire to embrace a new opportunity, send us your resume and let's talk.

title: Valuation & Advisory Vice President
description:
Our Story

About You:

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us:

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Overview

The Vice President will work on our Valuation & Advisory Services team to mentor our junior staff, produce appraisal reports, consulting studies and portfolio valuations. Working alongside our market leaders, you will build relationships with clients, develop growth opportunities, and use the Company’s advanced internal technology platforms to enhance your appraisal reports.

Responsibilities

  • Independently prepare and sign off on appraisal reports to clients.
  • Provide consistent mentorship, guidance and feedback to Valuation Associates and Senior Appraisers.
  • Model cash flows using ARGUS Enterprise.
  • Property inspections as needed.
  • Client relationship management on an ongoing basis.
  • Ability to summarize data and provide analysis of market trends and future forecast and any considerations for the Valuation & Advisory business operation
  • Work with market leaders to develop new business opportunities and prepare presentations for clients.
  • Any other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Qualifications

  • Education - Minimum of a 4-year university degree in a relevant functional area including Bachelor of Commerce or MBA or similar, etc.
  • Experience – 7+ years of related work experience. Experience managing people and teams is an asset.
  • AACI Designation, in good standing with the Appraisal Institute of Canada.
  • Must be proficient in Argus, MS Word and MS Excel.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the market, appraisal process and commercial real estate industry.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to write reports, effective oral and written communication skills, and an aptitude for continuous learning.
  • Ability to self-motivate and effectively manage competing priorities while providing excellent support to clients with an uncompromised high caliber work product.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and provide leadership to junior members to ensure Valuation and Advisory team goals are achieved.
  • Effectively and tactfully handling difficult or sensitive issues.
  • Respect the confidentiality of clients and information.

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: Vice President, Financial Planning & Analysis
description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintech’s and North America’s Most Engaged Workplaces, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly-traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial and LendCare. We offer a wide variety of financial products and services including lease-to-own merchandise, unsecured and secured installment loans, direct-to-consumer auto loans, and point-of-sale financing to over 4,000 merchants in the powersports, automotive, retail, home improvement and health sectors. With over 30 years of experience, our 2200 employees work with our customers to help them get access to the money they need today, while they rebuild their credit and graduate to prime rates. Our omni-channel model includes over 400 retail locations and digital/mobile platforms that enable our customers to transact with us through their channel of choice.

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer and working closely with the Executive Team, the Vice President, Financial Planning & Analysis will be responsible for leading and evolving the Financial Planning & Analysis function for the Company.  As a trusted business partner with senior leaders and across functions, they will determine how to support the rapid growth of the business.  This role has accountability for managing financial planning, budgeting, consistent reforecasting, strategic planning, management reporting, preparing fact-based analytics, supporting corporate development initiatives, and developing value-add insights and analysis to drive and influence business decisions.

 

Responsibilities include (not limited to):

  • Developing a scalable FP&A infrastructure that will be able to support the evolution/ growth of the business – acquisitions (domestic and international), business units & segments, product verticals, project tracking/evaluation, corporate cost allocation & transfer pricing, etc.
  • Enhancement of Management Reporting capability by growing the function’s competencies in business unit, product-level, and Board packages and insights.
  • Direct oversight of the Financial Planning & Analysis function in the preparation of Budgets, Forecasts, Investment Analysis, Business Unit & Cost Centre Segment Analysis, Project Planning, Key Performance Indicators, and other related analysis.
  • Support and partnership to the Treasury function’s management Capital and Debt Management, Funding Facilities, Transactional Banking, Securitization vehicle, Financial Instruments, and optimizing cost of credit.
  • Support of the Corporate Development function including M&A activity, New Business Venture & Deal analysis, Research, Investor Relations, Equity Research, Rating Agency enquiries, and Strategic Planning.
  • Manage, coach, and develop a group of corporate finance professionals. Promote a culture of high engagement, high performance, and continuous improvement that values learning and a commitment to quality.
  • Identify opportunities to challenge team members and grow their skillsets.
  • Be viewed as a trusted advisor by the business unit leadership and senior executive and provide timely and valued support.
  • Continual improvement of the budgeting process through education of department managers on financial issues impacting department budgets.
  • Provide strategic guidance around capital financing options to support company growth.

Who you are:

  • 10 + years of relevant corporate finance experience with at least 3-5 years in a senior management role.
  • Have successfully held a similar role as the Vice President with another high-growth organization.  Preference for someone with experience having worked in the consumer-finance/lending space or broader financial services.
  • Previous experience working in a dynamic environment with the aptitude to support and integrate key processes with other areas of finance (Controllership, Treasury, Corporate Development, etc.).
  • Have worked with a rapidly growing organization achieved organically and through M&A.
  • Hands-on experience having analyzed and supported M&A activity.
  • Strong people management and coaching skills.  An “eye for talent” and a desire to build and retain a high-performing team.
  • Highly analytical and thorough – delving into details of the business, ensuring that financial insights are effectively communicated to business partners to drive improved business results.
  • A strong and organized leader that can effectively communicate complex financial information to non-financial audiences in a succinct, clear and concise manner.
  • Ability to perform under pressure and meet deadlines and company goals.
  • Ability to multitask and deal with people and situations in a professional manner.  Able to manage competing priorities, meet deliverables while building relationships with colleagues. 
  • University Degree (Accounting, Finance, Business or a related discipline).
  • An MBA or CPA designation would be desirable.

 

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire.  We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

title: Vice President, Mergers and Acquisitions (Technology Sector)
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

Vice President - Mergers and Acquisitions – Technology Sector (Montreal, Calgary)

The opportunity
 
EY Orenda Corporate Finance Inc., a specialty practice within EY's Strategy and Transactions (SaT) business, and is the leading mid-market investment bank in Canada. The practice is recognized as a trusted source of expertise for mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, financing, privatization, and valuations and has been advising clients on all aspects of strategic transactions and capital sourcing activities for more than 30 years.
 
Our M&A team focused on the technology sector is the leading advisor in the mid-market for tech businesses, having closed several marquee transactions over the last 18 months. We are rapidly expanding these tech sector focused M&A capabilities across the country. We are looking for an experienced and motivated M&A professional to join our practice as a Vice President who will help us develop relationships, lead deal execution, and to help build a larger technology M&A team across Canada and within the EY global Tech M&A network.

As a VP, you will be an important part of our diversely talented, highly experienced team and work at the forefront of high-profile transactions within the technology space. When you join our industry-leading team, you’ll be right at the heart of that challenge, working with leading business tools and methodologies to provide to some of the most sophisticated clients around.
 

Your key responsibilities
 

As a Vice President within our Tech M&A team, you will be part of our M&A business called Ernst & Young Orenda Corporate Finance Inc. (“EYO”) and will have the opportunity to work alongside of our other practices within our Strategy and Transactions practice.  EYO is recognized as a trusted source of expertise for mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, financing, valuations, privatization, and capital sourcing transactions.  

 

Skills and attributes for success

  • Collaborate with other service lines within EY, both within our Strategy and Transactions (SaT) business and across the Firm’s Assurance, Tax and Consulting businesses to deliver outstanding professional advice to our clients. 
  • Take an autonomous lead role in identifying, soliciting and exploring potential new business opportunities 
  • Lead and project manage complex acquisition, merger, divestiture or financing assignments, including taking a lead role in client relationship management 
  • Provide direction and oversight on research to be used in financial modeling, competitive analysis, industry analysis, negotiation support and various other applications 
  • Review and provide quality assurance on complex financial models within broadly defined guidelines 
  • Oversee the preparation and delivery of documents for, and presentations to, clients and prospects 
  • Manage staff teams of 2-3 professionals and assume developmental responsibility for junior staff 
  • Proactively develop an internal and external network within the local market
  • Participate in the development and execution of industry-specific thought leadership and business plans 

 

To qualify for the role, you must have

  • Minimum 7-8 years of experience in financial analysis and transaction/financing execution, in the technology sector (i.e. M&A, Private Equity, Investment Banking or Corporate Development). 
  • Undergraduate degree in business with concentration in finance and/or accounting supported by a CPA, CFA, CBV or MBA 
  • Understanding of key business drivers, business strategy, metrics and deal issues for technology businesses
  • Track record of helping develop new business, and boardroom presence
  • Strong financial modeling and analytical skills and financial modeling
  • Strong knowledge of financing capital structuring and strong negotiation / lead advisory skills
  • Experience working in small teams and developing/coaching/mentoring junior-level staff
  • Experience working with multiple internal / external advisors within the context of a transaction and coordinated various workstreams (i.e. lawyers, accountants, tax and other specialists, etc...)
  • U.S. Broker Dealer license and Canadian Securities Institute licensing are or will be required
  • Previous M&A experience in a professional services/Big 4 Firm or investment bank and direct experience working with private businesses

 

What we look for
 

We’re interested in talented professionals with the ability to visualize our clients’ goals and think creatively to facilitate them - often in politically charged environments. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, and a genuine passion for taking on new challenges, this role is for you.
 

What we Offer
 

At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.
 

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future.  Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 

Diversity and Inclusion at EY


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.


EY Way of Work and your health and safety


EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely.  To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations.  A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.

 
About EY
 

As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy, transactions and consulting services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. 
 

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
 

Make your mark. Apply today.
 

EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility.  We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

 

EY | Building a better working world 

 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  

 

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Vice President, Corporate Services & Chief Finance Officer (1-year contract)
description:
At Home and Community Care Support Services Toronto Central by providing an accessible workplace, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. That is why we are intentionally committed to diversity and inclusion by providing an accessible and inclusive work place for all persons. We are strongly committed to include Black, Indigenous, visible minorities, Francophone, 2SLGBTQ+ persons, neurodiversity, women, national origin, ancestry, disability status, age, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, all faiths, or any other aspect, which makes them unique, through recognizing each applicant through anti-racism and anti-oppressive practices to ensure equitable opportunity.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Vice President, Corporate Services and Chief Finance Officer (VP, Corporate Services and CFO) provides strategic leadership, direction and oversight for financial and business planning, financial controllership and management, performance management and accountability, business analytics (metrics, monitoring and reporting), information management and technology and related corporate support services. This position is responsible for ensuring that the organization is setting, measuring goals and objectives as needed and plans and implements mitigation strategies. This position is responsible for ensuring and maintaining that all adequate controls are in place and corporate policies meet compliance standards and would withstand independent and government audits.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Leads and directs financial analysis, cost accounting, forecasting, banking relations, accounts receivable, accounts payable, treasury functions, taxes, payroll processing, and compliance with the Ministry, audit, Canada Customs and Revenue, and International Financial Reporting Standards requirements.
  • Oversees, directs and provides strategic direction on the day-to-day internal operations as it relates to financial operations and systems, information technology and information management (supporting telecommunications infrastructures), business analytics, administration services (facilities, asset management, procurement, purchasing), Service Provider Organizations (SPOs) performance and accountability, and related shared services relationship management.
  • Responsible for leading the development of a Corporate Services strategy that is aligned with the organization’s strategic priorities and acts as key point of interface in corporate service-related matters (information technology, facilities, asset management, procurement and purchasing)
  • Provides expert guidance and advice in regards to compliance with Ministry of Health (the “ministry”) and Home and Community Care Support Services Performance Agreement, Management Board Directives, Financial Administration Act, Connecting Care Act, Local Health Services Integration Act, and other applicable agreements, directives and legislation.
  • Manages the flow of funding from the Ministry to external SPOs, ensures that appropriate accounting systems and processes are in place, ensures the appropriateness of funding agreements/contracts/grants and monitors available funding for Home and Community Care Support Services; initiatives.
  • Accountable for the development and management of the Home and Community Care Support Services Toronto Central’s annual operating budget and provides input into the development of the annual business plan for operational issues.
  • Oversees the financial planning, budgeting, forecasting and financial performance reporting initiatives, integrating financial information into overall business planning and objectives.
  • Responsible for all financial information prepared by the finance staff, for internal and external purposes.
  • Accountable for financial operations, systems and internal procurement, including accounting operations, financial processing, financial systems and facility contract administration.
  • Prepares year-end audited financial statements and audit file, and manages the year-end external audit process.
  • Works with Ministry and Ontario Health to define performance agreements, negotiates agreements with SPOs within the geographical area.
  • Manages SPO performance agreements and monitors provider risks and opportunities, evaluating and reporting on SPO performance in achieving established goals and objectives on a regular basis, provide dashboards, presentations and special reports on performance.
  • Acts as the key representative to evaluate and report on Home and Community Care Support Services and SPO performance, develop and implement best practices, and recommend changes to existing programs and allocation of funds.
  • Contributes expert advice and input on performance standards and service provider performance / accountability to the interpretation of performance issues.
  • Provides strategic leadership for data governance.
  • Oversees business intelligence and leverages organizational data as well as other data sources to drive quality and operational effectiveness.
  • Translates complex information using analytical techniques and complex data collection to inform Home and Community Care Support Services Toronto Central strategic priorities and support solutions, recommendations and actions aimed at addressing performance issues.
  • Participates provincially on working groups, committees and works collaboratively with other Home and Community Care Support Services agencies.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Education:

  • Master’s degree in business administration, finance, health administration or relevant field, including appropriate accreditation (CPA-CA, CPA-CMA, CGA).

Knowledge and Skills

  • Knowledge of Ontario health sector and workforce trends within this sector.
  • In-depth knowledge of complex and dynamic business environments in the public and private sectors in Information Technology and Information Management, Financial Management and Operations, Performance Management, Business Analytics, Administrative Services, Procurement, and Project Management.
  • In-depth understanding of financial principles, practices, and techniques including budgeting, accounting, costing, auditing, and financial information systems, data processing applications, project management principles and methods.
  • In-depth knowledge of Canadian Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), including Not-for-Profit standards and Public Sector Accounting Board standards.

Experience:

  • Minimum 10 years of professional experience (or equivalent) in business / public administration management and financial management. 
  • Healthcare experience is preferable
  • Significant in-depth experience and proven ability to develop and establish corporate policy, procedures, and Financial Management Framework within a public sector environment.

title: Contrôleur
description:
À propos de Canest Transit

DG Canest-Transit est une jeune entreprise en pleine croissance et un chef de file dans l'industrie du transport et de la logistique.

DG Canest Transit opère depuis plus de 6 ans sur le Port de Montréal à charger des conteneurs de grains pour les exportateurs canadiens. Son terminal céréalier imposant sur la Rue Notre-Dame est connu des Montréalais avec son affichage visible dans un rayon de plus de 15 KM. Canest satisfait ses clients et partenaires par son efficacité et sa flexibilité. Nous sommes très fiers de contribuer avec des gens responsables au succès de l'organisation et des individus. L'environnement de travail apporte continuellement son lot de défis. Ensemble, on va plus loin!

CanEst Transit Inc. est une entreprise spécialisée dans le nettoyage et la mise en conteneur de produits agricoles.

Stratégiquement située dans le port de Montréal, à proximité des terminaux à conteneurs, CanEst Transit reçoit le grain par train et par camion. L’entreprise offre différents services tels que le nettoyage, le tamisage, le conditionnement ainsi que la mise en conteneur de produits de même que la manipulation de grain et sous-produits en vrac.

Description sommaire

Relevant du Directeur Général, le Contrôleur sera un membre clé de l'équipe de direction. Son rôle comprendra également l'optimisation de la fonction financière globale. Nous recherchons une personne ayant des compétences analytiques, de leadership et de gestion.

Principales tâches et responsabilités

  • Superviser une équipe dédiée à la comptabilité, la paie, la gestion des fonds de recherche et travailler en étroite collaboration avec le directeur, Planification financière et analyses;
  • Superviser le suivi budgétaire et proposer des actions correctives;
  • Gérer le processus et les activités des auditeurs externes ainsi que la préparation des dossiers d’audit de fin d’année;
  • Gérer les programmes de subvention
  • Planifier, diriger et coordonner toutes les fonctions opérationnelles sous sa responsabilité;
  • Identifier les opportunités d’optimisation des processus financiers en identifiant et en élaborant des politiques, des directives et des procédures administratives et financières;
  • Travailler conjointement avec les gestionnaires et agir à titre de rôle-conseil;
  • Soutenir à l’élaboration de rapports de gestion et d’indicateurs de performance pour permettre à la direction de prendre des décisions éclairées.
  • Embaucher, former et fidéliser le personnel comptable qualifié



Qualifications requises

Formation

  • Diplôme universitaire dans un domaine connexe
  • Détenir un titre comptable reconnu (CPA)

Expérience professionnelle

  • Un minimum de 3 à 5 ans d’expérience dans un rôle de contrôleur
  • Expérience en petite-moyenne entreprise (PME)
  • Expérience en gestion d’équipe et gestion de projets

Compétences

  • Grandes compétences en communication, en technologie, en analyse et en gestion
  • Connaissance avancée des applications Microsoft (Outlook, Word, Excel et PowerPoint)
  • Connaissance d’un logiciel comptable (Sage 50, un atout)
  • Bilinguisme tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

Habiletés spécifiques

  • Capacité à gérer plusieurs dossiers simultanément,
  • Travailler de manière autonome
  • S’adapter au changement des échéanciers et des priorités
  • Faire preuve d'un haut niveau de discrétion



Parmi les défis du poste

  • Entreprise en croissance ayant fait une acquisition récemment
  • Programme d’expansion et d’acquisition
  • Gestion multi-divisions (3 entités indépendantes)
  • Optimisation des structures opérantes

Pourquoi se joindre à Canest Transit

  • Programme de rémunération et avantages compétitifs
  • Équipe jeune et dynamique
  • Environnement de travail stimulant
  • Entreprise fière de contribuer avec des gens responsables au succès de l'organisation et des individus

Suivez TALINKO sur LinkedIn et visitez notre site web

Seules les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue seront contactées. Nous souscrivons au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi.

TALINKO est une firme de recrutement de cadres intermédiaires et supérieurs offrant également l’accompagnement dans le recrutement de membres de conseil d’administration ou comité aviseur. Nous œuvrons dans différents secteurs d’activités.

Veuillez noter que le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

title: Contrôleur-Adjoint
description:
Contrôleur-Adjoint
Poste permanent
Rive-sud
65K à 70K
Domaine Manufacturier


Vous aimeriez occuper un poste de Contrôleur-Adjoint dans une entreprise en Montérégie ? Vous possédez 3 à 5 ans d'expérience en comptabilité dans une entreprise ? Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un Contrôleur-Adjoint pour une entreprise manufacturière en pleine croissance située en Montérégie.

Se rapportant au Contrôleur, les principales responsabilités seront:

- Prendre en charge le dossier de prix de revient
- Participe au processus de fin de mois
- Suivi des indicateurs de performances
- Implantation et suivi des contrôles internes
- Processus budgétaire et établir les prévisions financières
- Dossier de fin d'année
- Effectuer différentes analyses selon les demandes ad hoc




Avantages
Conditions liées au poste:

- Salaire 65K à 70K selon l'expérience
- Bonification
- Assurance collective
- REER collectif
- Frais de cotisation et formation continue

Responsabilités
Se rapportant au Contrôleur, les principales responsabilités seront:

- Participe au processus de fin de mois
- Production des états financiers
- Conciliation bancaire
- Gestion des flux de trésorerie
- Implantation et suivi des contrôles internes
- Participe au processus budgétaire
- Dossier de fin d'année
- Effectuer différentes analyses selon les demandes ad hoc

Qualifications
Possédez-vous les compétences requises ?

- BAC en comptabilité ou domaine connexe
- Titre CPA (un atout)
- 3 ans d'expérience
- Expérience en entreprise manufacturière (un atout)
- Bilingue
- Expérience avec un système ERP

Sommaire
Merci de postuler pour ce poste d'Assistant-Contrôleur. Nous examinerons votre demande et nous vous contacterons rapidement si votre profil correspond à nos critères.

Communiquez Eric Pelletier pour discuter de ce rôle au 514.476.6961 ou eric.pelletier@randstad.ca

À propos de Randstad

De nos jours, les entreprises comme les services doivent faire face à une pression sans cesse grandissante pour continuer à rendre des comptes en matière de gouvernance, tandis que les demandeurs d'emploi sont confrontés aux défis du nouveau monde de l'emploi. La situation est tout aussi complexe pour ce qui est de la reddition de comptes envers les gouvernements, les actionnaires et les clients. Les spécialistes en finances et en comptabilité, armés de leur formation ciblée et leur expérience à des postes de créneaux précis – des commis et des représentants du service aux analystes financiers, comptables techniques et cadres dirigeants –, sont tout indiqués pour assurer cette obligation de rendre compte.

Le service Finance et comptabilité de Randstad procure des solutions intégrées en matière de ressources humaines et de placement temporaire et permanent dans l’industrie des services financiers, des finances et de la comptabilité, et agit comme un pont entre les candidats hautement qualifiés et leurs futurs employeurs. Depuis des années, nous trouvons des professionnels hautement qualifiés en finance et en comptabilité qui permettent aux entreprises et aux institutions d’améliorer leurs résultats, de gérer les changements, de créer de la richesse et d’orienter les activités.

Le service Finance et comptabilité de Randstad est le seul fournisseur de travailleurs possédant les compétences en finance et en comptabilité dont vous avez besoin. Que vous soyez à la recherche d’une main-d’œuvre souple pour répondre aux augmentations saisonnières de la charge de travail, de solutions intégrées en matière de ressources humaines pour le recrutement et la gestion des talents à long terme ou des meilleurs spécialistes pour un poste important, notre équipe de consultants chevronnés et dévoués vous aidera à atteindre vos objectifs.

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Assistant Controller
description:
Group: Cosma International
Division: Maple Stamping
Job Type: Full Time, Permanent
Location: 401 Caldari Road, Concord, ON

 

Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

Role Summary

The Assistant Controller is responsible for overseeing day-to day accounting functions, the maintenance of the balance sheet by supporting general accounting activities including the preparation and entry/posting of various journal entries, and supporting accounts receivable, and accounts payable as issues arise.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage the month end process from reviewing journal entries and account reconciliations through preparing financial statements and variance analysis.
  • Supervision of Accounts Payable Clerks and Staff Accountant providing support and guidance.
  • Maintains fixed asset subledgers and records monthly depreciation.
  • Ensures accurate and timely monthly, quarterly and year-end close.
  • Provide financial analysis and advice as required to Senior Management (GM/AGM/Controller).
  • Ensure that a complete and accurate set of accounting records are maintained according to generally accepted accounting principles and following corporate procedures and internal controls.

Other Key Responsibilities

  • Assists with preparation of the business plan and periodic updated forecasts as well as subsequent monthly variance analysis.
  • Leads the preparation of the annual audit file and co-ordinates with external auditors in their subsequent examination of the division’s financial statements.
  • Responsible for the preparation and submission of tax package requirements as set out by Magna Tax.
  • Review and maintain financial computer system requirements.
  • Champions archiving of files etc. from all department, ensuing meet government regulations.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Accounting designation CA/CGA/CMA required
  • Undergraduate degree preferred
  • Five plus years of related experience required
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment which includes stamping and assembly would be an asset.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project)
  • Good command of the English language both verbal, written and the ability to communicate to the customer.
  • Must be able to work in a strict confidential environment.

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Financial Controller
description:
Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French. 

Vous avez envie de relever de nouveaux défis? Vous avez toujours souhaité travailler dans une entreprise internationale? Vous recherchez une ambiance de travail hors du commun où le plaisir rime avec dépassement de soi? Voici l’offre que vous attendiez!

Votre future équipe

Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous optimisons les installations manufacturières de nos clients grâce à des systèmes novateurs à haute valeur ajoutée qui exploitent le plein potentiel de l’automatisation et de la robotique. Nous faisons partie des plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage au monde – que ce soit pour des produits alimentaires, agricoles, organiques ou industriels.

Votre futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Assurer la consolidation des états financiers à l’international
  • Émettre des recommandations à l’Équipe Leadership suivant l’analyse des résultats financiers
  • Coordonner une équipe d’analystes
  • Développer, implanter et assurer l’efficacité des méthodes de contrôles internes et de gouvernance
  • Participer à la préparation des budgets, suivre le processus, puis expliquer les écarts au besoin
  • Participer au développement et au suivi des indicateurs de performance financière 
  • Manipuler des modèles de simulation et de prévision financière
  • Être responsable du dossier de fin d’année et du processus d’audit des états financiers par nos vérificateurs externes

Compétences requises

  • Formation universitaire – profil comptabilité
  • Titre CPA – un atout
  • Leadership
  • Maîtrise de Microsoft Excel
  • Passion pour l’optimisation des procédés comptables
  • Proactivité
  • Rigueur
  • Excellentes habiletés communicationnelles en anglais et en français – tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

Votre futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots te parlent?

comptabilité, contrôleur, états financiers, budgets, audits, consolidation, contrôle interne, cabinet, milieu manufacturier,

Envie d’en savoir plus? N’attendez plus, vous êtes à un clic de propulser votre carrière au niveau supérieur!

title: Controller (# 3039)
description:
Position: Controller (# 3039)

Category: Permanent

Location: West of Montreal Island

Salary: Competitive

Employer Particularities:

Join a team of professionals in a private manufacturing SME. You will be part of an organization that has the interests of its heart employees and offers global visibility, enriching work and continuous improvement, innovative software tools and a highly stimulating work environment in learning and professional development. Advantages: full range of benefits - 4 weeks of vacation - flexible schedule - Strong retention of employees - Versatile role - possibility of evolution.

Your responsibilities in a few words !

  • Supervise the accounting operations of the department, such as billing, writing of the big book, budgeting, etc.

title: Controller
description:
Location: Saskatoon, SK, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/5/2022Job ID: 9A24295345Category: Accounting & Finance
If you are a talented and experienced Accountant, Angela Degelman, Director & Managing Consultant, Accounting and Finance, at David Aplin Group, is a great opportunity for you to consider!  Our client, a leader in their field, has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Saskatoon.  They are a leader in their industry throughout Western Canada and offer a supportive growth environment for a Senior Accountant that is looking to develop their leadership skills and be involved in an exciting, fast-paced industry.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee all accounting department activities, processes and procedures including accounts receivable, accounts payable, bank reconciliation, cash application/management, payroll and cost accounting
  • Direct the Bookkeeper and Office Manager in accounting procedures and accounting system applications
  • Maintain proper, accurate records and accounting controls
  • Maintain a system of controls over accounting transactions
  • Direct the Bookkeeper in assisting in the preparation of the regular monthly reports including income statements, balance sheets and any reporting required for financial institutions and project managers; checks information for accuracy and makes adjustments as required
  • Maintain intercompany loan documents and accounts
  • Monitor debt levels and compliance with debt covenants
  • Meet regularly with the President, CFO and other senior managers to review financial reports, rental and job reports/results, including variances to budget and point out opportunities for improvement and recommend appropriate action as required
  • Liaise with financial institutions for financing and reporting, the legal team and outside accountants
     Under the direction of the CFO, oversee all year-end reporting, preparation and requirements to ensure timely submission to all required government agencies, financial institutions and third-party accounting firms (including minute books, annual returns, dividends,profit-share)
  • Ensure compliance with all federal (i.e. CRA), provincial and municipal regulations, requirements and submissions with respect to payroll remittances, WCB, GST, property tax assessments; act as liaison with all agencies as required
  • Support the development and implementation of the Strategic Plan
  • Lead and implement all financial activities to support the achievement of the organization's Strategic Objectives
  • Work collaboratively with other employees to implement projects and initiatives that advance the organization’s Strategic Priorities
  • Lead and manage human resources initiatives and activities for direct reports including coaching, recruitment, onboarding, performance management, employee development, employee recognition and general support
  • Ad hoc responsibilities include occasional and one time responsibilities as needed and identifying any work, issue or task that does not appear to be under the care of any particular Job Description, and proactively resolving the work, issue or task or flagging it to the appropriate co-worker for their attention

Qualifications
  • Demonstrated ability to work with highly sensitive and confidential information
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills; ability to work well in a team environment that promotes inclusiveness and proactive communication among team members
  • Excellent communication skills with strong, written, verbal and presentation skills
  • Well-developed listening, coaching, delegating, training and mentoring skills; advocates a team approach
  • Ability to work independently under pressure
  • Excellent analytical and organizational skills; the ability to think and plan ahead and manage multiple projects, prioritize and meet deadlines
  • Excellent decision-making and time-management skills
  • Strong attention to detail to maintain organizational systems
  • Valid CPA designation preferred with demonstrated technical accounting knowledge and experience
  • 3 – 8 years of experience in financial management including a strong background in finance, accounting, budgeting and cost control principles including GAAP
  • Knowledge of financial and accounting computer software; experience with construction software as an asset
  • Experience in the construction and/or residential/commercial rental and leasing industries

JOB ID: 9A24295345 

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Project Controller/Senior Project Controller, Finance Consulting
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto

Have many careers in one Firm.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.

Are you a highly analytical, financially focused problem-solver who is looking to provide project control solutions to project management team(s)? Then this is the job for you!

What will your typical day look like?

You will take accountability for various financial analyses, reconciliations and scenario analyses in relation to budgets and forecasts. Your excellent communication skills will prepare you to interact frequently with senior level internal and external clients, as well as firm leadership to present your creative solutions, discuss recommendations and provide project financial advice. You are a self-motivated learner who will build complex financial reporting models and customize project financial reporting. Your impeccable attention to detail will enable you to conduct quality reviews and provide feedback on the technical work products of junior resources. You will look to drive change and contribute to the growth and development of the overall Engagement Financial Services Practice through active involvement in one or more practice initiatives.

About the team

Deloitte Consulting's "Engagement Financial Services Practice" is comprised of Project Controls professionals serving as a focal point for financial aspects of project, program, and account management.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone who:

  • Has a Major in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Management and a minimum of 3-5 years' experience in a financial analysis role working with the entire Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced level Excel
  • Has outstanding attention to detail and adherence to project deadlines while handling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Has the ability to identify problems and develop creative solutions
  • Has experience developing budgets, forecasts, and project pricing models as well as performing complex scenario analysis
  • Seeks challenging opportunities across businesses and borders and takes accountability for personal and team results
  • Builds relationships and communicates effectively in order to positively influence peers and other stakeholders
  • Bilingualism in French and English is an asset

MANDATORY: must be eligible for obtaining a security clearance from the Government of Canada, that is to say, have been in continuous service in Canada for at least 5 years

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

  • You will lead at every level: We grow the world's best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
  • You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
  • You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates that represents the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes candidates from Indigenous communities in support of living our values and our commitments to our Reconciliation Action Plan . We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Accounting, Financial, Consulting, Business Manager, Project Manager, Finance, Technology, Management

Apply now "

title: Assistant Controller
description:
Job Description

Assistant Controller, RemoteCanada| Full TimeZonda Home Canada, Inc. is redefining the future of housing. We are perfectly placed in the heart of the fast-growing real estate industry. We are making big bets on the future of real-estate, trailblazing a 2030 vision for the industry. Here at Zonda, you’ll be able to use your passion and curiosity to drive the next generation of real estate analysts, advisors, and technologists.Zonda is looking for a passionate Assistant Controller with corporate business experience to continue the integration of accounting processes from three recent acquisitions. Zonda looks for people who can grow, think, dream, and create. When you join our team, you’ll be in a unique position to make a change with every project. You’ll use your full range of skills to build great experiences and learn about the real estate industry, economics, and data. You’ll be supported with the necessary tools, and you'll be working with an awesome and like-minded team. Our teams are innovative, diverse, multidisciplinary, and collaborative - all working to build the future of housing.The ideal candidate will have direct management experience of a team of accounting professionals and managing all aspects of a monthly accounting cycle. This position has been created due to three recent acquisitions in Canada and we are looking for a leader who can continue to create the right processes to integrate those entities efficiently into Zonda’s accounting team.Responsibilities:• Coordinate and supervise month-end close process for 3 operating divisions in Canada in British Columbia, Ontario, and Quebec per the corporate calendar and timelines• Manage intercompany transactions between the Canadian and sister US entities• Consolidate and review reporting for all Canadian entities• Lead general accounting function, including recurring journal entries, accounts reconciliation, trailing 12-month trending and account analysis• Manage Canadian accounting team to ensure all accounts receivable, accounts payable, account reconciliations and other daily accounting operations are performed accurately and timely• Transition of accounting function to create an efficient and consistent process across all the Canadian business units• Ability to review and implement process improvements as identified• Resolve one off accounting matters that arise• Lead analytical reviews for all areas of Canadian accounting• Work with various levels of professionals inside and outside the organization• Support external auditors and corporate teams• Work with tax professionals to respond to requests for information and ensure all required tax filings in Canada are made timely and accurately• Oversee regulatory reporting, including US and Canadian tax compliance at both the federal and provincial/state levels• Assist with special projects and ad-hoc reports as required

Requirements:• Professional Accounting Designation required (CPA)• 5+ years of progressively senior roles in accounting• Bilingual in English and French is an asset• Experience with multi-currency transactions• Canadian tax experience• Excellent knowledge of MS Office, particularly intermediate MS Excel skills• Previous management of accounting systems such as Quickbooks Online, Salesforce, Concur or other related programs• Extensive knowledge of Canadian accounting and tax standards• Experience in overseeing month general ledger functions and month-end/year-end close process to support an annual audit• Exposure to all areas of operational accounting, including Revenue, Deferred Revenue, A/P, and A/R• Prior experience in managing subscription database revenue, annual recurring revenue and associated deferred revenue is an asset• Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize workload in order to meet strict deadlines• Ability to mentor and motivate staff to full potential• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills• Team player and can collaborate with other departments in the organization

title: Assistant Controller
description:
Description:
Fantastic Assistant Controller Opportunity for a professional who is Energetic, thrives in a busy work environment, and effective when faced with ambiguity and uncertainty.
Agilus is recruiting for an Assistant Controller in the Energy Space in Calgary, Alberta.
To assists in the coordination/development of the budgeting process, corporate submissions and departmental summaries to support the organization’s objectives. To identify/monitor key financial indicators to gauge performance, identify trends, and suggest strategies that can impact results.
Responsibilities:
  • Assist in the coordination of the monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting requirements. Prepare monthly and quarterly accruals, including elimination journal entries
  • Prepare and maintain the PP&E and leases continuity schedules. Prepare and maintain debt amortization working papers
  • Lead and assist in gathering key inputs from various departments related to the forecasting and budgeting process. Assist and coordinate daily and monthly cash management, including Cheque, EFT and wire distribution
  • Assist with control compliance and the monitoring of internal controls. Participate in the development of and support the company’s strategic plans, including the development and achievement of financial benchmarks, metrics and other KPIs in line with strategic goals
  • Act as a change agent, evaluating the current processes and procedures of the accounting team, developing efficiency improvements and implementing these improvements across the organization. Monitor the financial performance of the company and develop and maintain an effective system of financial controls over all financial data in accordance with the organization’s procedures
  • Coordinate the preparation of the annual operating budget process, corporately and with business units. Liaise with the Office of the Auditor General to assist with annual audit of financial statements; Assist with all statutory reporting requirements being met (tax, legal, etc.)
  • Support New Business Developments and initiatives with input of required financial accounting interpretations, processes and analysis. Prepare ad hoc queries as requested by leadership team.

Successful candidates will have:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related discipline
  • Accounting designation (CMA, CGA or CA), or an equivalent combination of related experience and education
  • Minimum 6 years accounting experience post designation
  • An internal controls expert, who is very knowledgeable in oil and gas sector and possesses a strong understanding and working knowledge of international financial reporting standards
  • Demonstrated experience in working in a dynamic environment dealing with complex issues while supporting and mentoring staff

Total rewards:
  • Competitive Pay
  • Full Time Permanent Opportunity
  • Hybrid Opportunity

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email radagha@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Contrôleur d'affaires
description:
Contrôleur d'affairesFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

La division Process Industries fournit des solutions complètes d'électrification et d'automatisation, des produits spécifiques à l'industrie et des services tout au long du cycle de vie dans toutes les industries. Le segment d'affaires Industries de procédés conçoit et livre des solutions d'automatisation depuis l'appareil jusqu'à la surveillance et au contrôle, permettant ainsi à nos clients de tirer le maximum de leur investissement. Nos solutions numériques aident à rehausser la productivité des usines et des entreprises, tout en réduisant les coûts d'entretien et d'énergie. Grâce à nos vastes connaissances du domaine, nous sommes en mesure de bien comprendre les possibilités et défis de l'automatisation des processus, et d'y faire face.À titre de partenaire clé pour la division Industries de procédés du secteur d'activité Automatisation de processus, vous serez un membre vital de l'équipe des finances au Canada. Vous aiderez à établir des stratégies commerciales en phase avec les stratégies plus globales de la division et du groupe de produits.Dans le cadre de vos fonctions, vous aiderez à offrir un soutien clé à l'entreprise en veillant au bon suivi et traitement de toutes les transactions. Vous transformerez la stratégie commerciale en plans et établirez des objectifs quantifiables, évaluerez les incidences financières de diverses décisions stratégiques, déterminerez les risques et recommanderez des mesures.
Vos responsabilités

  • Superviser la planification commerciale et le processus de prévision de la division Industries de procédés du secteur d'activité Automatisation de procédés et servir d'interface entre les directeurs des divisions mondiales et ceux de l'industrie locale.
  • Établir des structures de tarification, une optimisation de la productivité et une efficacité du capital tout en surveillant de près les flux de trésorerie et en prenant des mesures pertinentes pour améliorer le fonds de roulement net.
  • Assurer le respect des lignes directrices et procédures internes, ainsi que des exigences réglementaires externes.
  • Effectuer des analyses financières, en faire un compte-rendu aux directeurs commerciaux et donner des suggestions pour améliorer le rendement au besoin.
  • Établir et superviser les processus et les outils nécessaires pour obtenir des données financières et des renseignements commerciaux transparents et fiables.
  • Assurer une communication rapide et efficace avec les contrôleurs, le centre de comptabilité et autres pour permettre de déterminer les problèmes, d'en discuter et de proposer des améliorations.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Dix années d'expérience dans un poste de comptabilité.
  • Avoir de l'expérience avec les systèmes de comptabilité informatisés et les logiciels de rapports financiers, notamment SAP, Excel et PowerPoint.
  • Avoir une excellente attention aux détails, une précision et la capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément.
  • Avoir une approche collaborative axée sur les solutions et d'excellentes aptitudes de communication écrite et orale.
  • Détenir un baccalauréat en comptabilité ou en lien avec les finances.
  • Parler couramment l'anglais et le français.
  • Peu de déplacements; ils constituent moins de 5 % du travail.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur ABB, consultez notre site web www.abb.com.Pour la quatrième année consécutive, ABB Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada par le magazine Forbes et s'est classée au premier rang dans la catégorie de l'industrie. Également nommée parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada, les meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes au Canada et le prix de la meilleure expérience du candidat (CandE Award), la culture et l'engagement d'ABB consistent à offrir un milieu de travail bienveillant où chacun collabore, se sent valorisé, respecté, inclus et soutenu. Nous nous engageons également à veiller à ce que toutes les politiques et pratiques respectent le Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, nous visons à ce que notre main-d'œuvre soit réellement représentative des quatre groupes désignés : les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB fournira des accommodements adéquats aux candidats handicapés et les encouragera à s'identifier dans le processus de candidature.#LI-Hybrid

title: Senior Project Controller, Finance Consulting (Calgary, Alberta, Canada)
description:
Job Type: [[filter6]] 
Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada 
All Available Locations: Calgary 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Have many careers in one Firm.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.

Are you a Senior Project Controller looking to provide project controls knowledge to the entire project management team(s)? Then this is the job for you!

What will your typical day look like?

 

You will perform various financial analysis, reconciliations and variance analysis. Also prepare budgets and forecasts and track financial values such as revenue & expenses. Interact frequently with senior level internal and external clients and firm leadership to present various analysis, discuss recommendations and provide project financial advice. Build complex financial reporting models in excel and customize project financial reporting. Conduct quality reviews and provide feedback on the technical work products of junior resources. Support the growth and career development of junior resources by serving as an informal mentor and as a formal Coach to junior staff, providing them with regular career and professional development guidance. Participate in formal mid-year and year-end performance assessment activities for assigned counselees. Contribute to the growth and development of the overall Engagement Financial Services Practice through active involvement in one or more practice initiatives.

About the team

 

Deloitte Consulting's “Engagement Financial Services Practice” is comprised of Project Controls professionals serving as a focal point for financial aspects of project, program, and account management.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

 

You are someone with:

  • Has a Major in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Management and a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a financial analysis role working with the entire Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced level Excel
  • Has outstanding attention to detail and adherence to project deadlines while handling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Has the ability to identify problems and develop creative solutions
  • Has experience developing project pricing models and performing scenario analysis
  • Seeks challenging opportunities across businesses and borders and takes accountability for personal and team results
  • Builds relationships and communicates effectively in order to positively influence peers and other stakeholders

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

    The next step is yours

    Sound like The One Firm. For You? 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally. Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.
