title: Controller, Development
description:
Our client,QuadReal PropertyGroup, a leading global real estate investment, development and operating company is aggressively growing their Development Portfolio and building their Finance Management team to support the many projects underway. QuadReal manages the real estate and mortgage programs of British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI), one of Canada’s largest asset managers with almost $200 billion portfolio.

As Business Partner to Development Operations, while holding financial accountability to Head Office in Vancouver, you will be instrumental in providing meaningful financial information on Eastern Canada project profitability, analysis and risk assessment.

Reporting directly to the VP, Development Accounting & Finance, theController, Developmentwill provide analysis of project-related agreements and legal structure. You will partner with Development Management to prepare project budgets, cashflow and variance analysis. In a leadership role, you will provide financial leadership for current and new staff. You will have overall responsibility for the accounting and financial reporting function of the Eastern Canada development portfolio ensuring the project teams and senior management are provided timely financial information to assist with decision making while continually developing and improving business processes.

The ideal candidate will have 10+ years progressive experience including in-depth experience and understanding of Development Accounting. You will have managed teams in past roles and be an excellent relationship builder. You will hold an Accounting Designation and have demonstrated experience with both operational and technical accounting to fulfill needs of both Corporate Finance as well as Business Operations. You will thrive in a dynamic but stable workplace and love the challenge of building a department and providing value to stakeholders. With an innate ability to identify, analyze, and problem solve, you are a quick-study and quick on your feet.

Up for a challenging but rewarding role with an exciting opportunity to make your mark? Don’t miss out on this opportunity to join this highly regarded and high-growth organization. Please apply immediately to be given consideration.

title: CFO Chief Financial Officer
description:
CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER - Southern Alberta  
$175K - $200K, benefits ++
Relocation Package Available to southern Alberta.

As Chief Financial Officer, you will join the dynamic Executive Team of a Group of Companies to administer the highest level of fiscal responsibility within a fast paced and growing manufacturing organization. The ideal candidate will be an excellent team player, demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit, who is effective working collaboratively with all departments to ensure the companies stay on track with financial goals and targets.

If you are eager to join an energetic organization that is looking to the future in everything they do AND you want to live in an amazing rural environment close to the mountains - this opportunity may be the career of a lifetime.

A new work family! A beautiful community where you and your family will enjoy your time away from work.

If you have the skills, experience and the desire to embrace a new opportunity, send us your resume and let's talk.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Strategy, Planning and Management
- Reports to CEO and is a member of the leadership team;
- Participate in Weekly, Quarterly and Annual EOS Leadership Team meetings;
- Lead, Management and Accountability (LMA) for all financial and all other CFO function roles;
- Assess and evaluate financial performance of the organization’s budgets and forecasts;
- Contribute to the visioning of the companies long-term then shorter-term goals;
- Participate in decisions as they relate to strategic initiatives and operational models;
- Ensure strong relationships with external banking, accounting, and other financial service partners;
- Analysis and minimization of company financial risks and liabilities;
- Support department Managers on budgeting, margin analysis and department planning.

Forecasting, Budgeting and Financial Analysis
- ­Financial reporting by company and critical department operations; 
- Review and analyze current financial results and provide improvement recommendations;
- Analysis of new business initiatives, products and/or service offerings;
- Develop and maintain monthly operating budgets and annual company operating budgets;
- Analyze and qualify the company’s growth and expansion plans.

Accounting, Administration and Operations
- Ensure software and systems are functioning accurately and efficiently; 
- Review and ensure application of appropriate internal financial controls;
- Ensure timeliness and accuracy of financial and management reporting data;
- Accurate and timely financial statements;
- Accurate and timely filing and payment of all relevant government agency taxes;
Month-end closing activities including GL’s, balance sheets and overhead cost allocation;
- Analyze and improve financial systems, policies, processes, and controls;
- Identify, onboard, coach and LMA for accounting team members.

Financial and Cash Management
- Cash flow projections, planning and management;
-Oversee investments and other business assets;
- Ensure accurate and Timely AR/AP functions within Finance department.

Skill Requirements:
- CPA Designation;
- 7+ years of proven experience as CFO, Director or Finance, Financial Officer, or comparable role; strategic planning and execution and partnering with a leadership team;
- Experience with a variety of ERP Systems;
- Experience working with multiple banking and accounting organizations;
- Manufacturing and/or Construction experience considered an asset;
- High level of skill with IT and technology services and systems; - Outstanding communication and presentation skills;
- Excellent analytical, reasoning, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills.

Company Core Values: 
Passionate, Positive & Productive: Promote Positive Workspaces. Pursue Challenging Goals, We are Eager to Succeed.
Respectful, Helpful & Caring: BE Open and Approachable. Help Others Succeed. Treat Everyone with Respect.
Responsible & Reliable: We do what we say. Own Your Seat. We can Lean on Each Other.
Solution-Focused: See it, own it, solve it, do it. Embrace Continuous Improvement. We Always Find a Way.
Do the Right Thing: Know What is Important. We Make the Most of Our Time & Energy. Our Decision Impact Everyone.

If you are eager to join an energetic organization that is looking to the future in everything they do AND you want to live in an amazing rural environment close to the mountains - this opportunity may be the career of a lifetime. A new work family! A beautiful community to enjoy your time away from work. If you have the skills, experience and the desire to embrace a new opportunity, send us your resume and let's talk.

title: Valuation & Advisory Vice President
description:
Our Story

About You:

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us:

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Overview

The Vice President will work on our Valuation & Advisory Services team to mentor our junior staff, produce appraisal reports, consulting studies and portfolio valuations. Working alongside our market leaders, you will build relationships with clients, develop growth opportunities, and use the Company’s advanced internal technology platforms to enhance your appraisal reports.

Responsibilities

  • Independently prepare and sign off on appraisal reports to clients.
  • Provide consistent mentorship, guidance and feedback to Valuation Associates and Senior Appraisers.
  • Model cash flows using ARGUS Enterprise.
  • Property inspections as needed.
  • Client relationship management on an ongoing basis.
  • Ability to summarize data and provide analysis of market trends and future forecast and any considerations for the Valuation & Advisory business operation
  • Work with market leaders to develop new business opportunities and prepare presentations for clients.
  • Any other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Qualifications

  • Education - Minimum of a 4-year university degree in a relevant functional area including Bachelor of Commerce or MBA or similar, etc.
  • Experience – 7+ years of related work experience. Experience managing people and teams is an asset.
  • AACI Designation, in good standing with the Appraisal Institute of Canada.
  • Must be proficient in Argus, MS Word and MS Excel.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the market, appraisal process and commercial real estate industry.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to write reports, effective oral and written communication skills, and an aptitude for continuous learning.
  • Ability to self-motivate and effectively manage competing priorities while providing excellent support to clients with an uncompromised high caliber work product.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and provide leadership to junior members to ensure Valuation and Advisory team goals are achieved.
  • Effectively and tactfully handling difficult or sensitive issues.
  • Respect the confidentiality of clients and information.

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: Senior Vice-President, Finance & Controller
description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintech’s, and winners of the 2021 TSX30, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly-traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial and LendCare. We offer a wide variety of financial products and services including lease-to-own merchandise, unsecured and secured installment loans, direct-to-consumer auto loans, and point-of-sale financing to over 4,000 merchants in the powersports, automotive, retail, home improvement, and health sectors. With over 30 years of experience, our 2200 employees work with our customers to help them get access to the money they need today, while they rebuild their credit and graduate to prime rates. Our omni-channel model includes over 400 retail locations and digital/mobile platforms that enable our customers to transact with us through their channel of choice.

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer the SeniorVice-President, Finance Controller is a newly configured role at goeasy! This is a key leadership role within the organization, which will require a seasoned hands-on leader to support the organization in fulfilling its ambitious goals while maintaining the necessary financial structure and controls. As part of goeasy’s plans for accelerated growth, this role will lead the creation and enhancement of processes to consolidate and report on financials and performance from a variety of business units and, eventually, geographies. This role will provide critical leadership to a talented finance team, providing opportunities for collective and individual growth.

Responsibilities (not limited to):

  • Direct oversight of the Controllership function including Corporate Accounting, Financial, Regulatory Reporting, Taxation, Audit Coordination, Disbursements, Asset Inventory Management, Vendor Expense Management, and other related analysis.
  • Overall responsibility for all required financial reports and related regulatory submissions across the organization’s legal entities and business units, including production of Financial Statements, Management Discussion Analysis, Annual Report Information Form, and the Management Information Circular.
  • Accountability for the completeness and accuracy of the organizations corporate accounts, including financial systems of record, accounting policies, provisions, valuations, and presentation under IFRS and local market GAAP, where applicable.
  • Lead and represent the company on all financial audit matters, including managing and coordinating external financial audits and reviews.
  • Ensuring optimization and compliance with all taxation requirements and obligations across the organization, including Income Tax, Indirect Tax, Transfer Pricing, Provisions, and Audits conducted by tax authorities.
  • Responsibility for the company’s disbursement accounting and related controls, including Vendor and Employee Payments Distributions.
  • Preparation of required materials and reports to the company’s Audit Committee and Board of Directors.
  • Preparation and support of the company’s Management Reporting.
  • Directly impacting the management and financial integrity of goeasy through the effective stewarding of organizational resources, maintaining appropriate controls, and integrity of financial management in compliance with applicable legal, governmental, and regulatory requirements.

Providing support to other functional areas of finance:

  • Corporate Development - including MA activity, New Business Venture Deal analysis, Research, Investor Relations, Equity Research, Rating Agency enquiries, and Strategic Planning.
  • Treasury - including Capital and Debt Management, Funding Facilities, Transactional Banking, Securitization vehicle, Financial Instruments, and optimizing cost of credit.
  • Financial Planning Analysis - including the preparation of Budgets, Forecasts, Investment Analysis, Business Unit Segment Analysis, Project Planning, Management Reporting, Strategic Analysis, Departmental Financial Support, Key Performance Indicators, and other related analysis.

Qualifications:

  • Chartered Accountant (CPA/CA) with at least 10-12 years of progressive financial management experience.
  • Experience within a publicly-traded organization along with relevant financial services experience is an asset.
  • Consolidation and reporting experience working in a parent company with multiple business units operating in multiple geographies.
  • Strong technical accounting knowledge and experience in IFRS is required. Knowledge of US GAAP is an asset.
  • Previous experience managing external financial audits is required.
  • Knowledge of Canadian Income and Indirect Taxation is required. Experience in International Tax is an asset.
  • Strong financial systems knowledge and experience is required.
  • Comfortable with a rapidly growing, fast-paced and dynamic environment.
  • A natural leader with strong people management and coaching skills.
  • A strong and organized leader that can manage financial processes but also distill communication with the executive team and business leaders.
  • Demonstrated ability to perform under pressure and meet deadlines and company goals.
  • Ability to multitask and deal with people and situations in a professional manner within a dynamic environment.  Able to manage competing priorities, meet deliverables while building relationships with colleagues.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire.  We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

title: Contrôleur Corporatif
description:
À propos du GROUPE ALLIÉES

Notre client, Le GROUPE ALLIÉES, est à la recherche d’un professionnel reconnu à titre de CPA afin de se joindre à leur équipe de direction à titre de Contrôleur Corporatif.

Cette entreprise privée manufacturière dans le secteur de la transformation de métaux compte parmi ses clients des entreprises de calibre mondial tels que: Volvo, Lion Électrique, Schneider, Michelin, Micro Bird (Girardin), et Novabus, entre autres.

En activité depuis plus de 80 ans, elle compte près de 200 employés, supportant 4 unités d’affaires et 2 marques de commerce : Entreprises Alliées, North Star Métal, Métal Sigma, JR Inox, ITOUCH, et Luminaires Alliées. Les deux principales unités d’affaires se situent à Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu et Ville St-Laurent.

En plus d’être un chef de file, l’entreprise a un plan de croissance ambitieux qui l’amènerait à multiplier sa taille et sa notoriété dans divers secteurs par le truchement d’une vision d’intégrateur et d’accélérateur. L’entreprise est également à saisir des opportunités de croissance par des acquisitions stratégiques.

Vous aurez la chance de vous joindre à cette entreprise dynamique, ambitieuse, innovante et hautement performante.

Culture et Valeurs

Le GROUPE ALLIÉES offre un environnement de travail exceptionnel axé sur l’écoute, sur le partage des connaissances et sur la valorisation des réussites individuelles et collectives.

L’équipe de gestion s’assure de consolider la croissance du groupe autour de fortes valeurs centrées sur le travail d’équipe, le respect, le dévouement, le développement et l’importance de l’être humain.  C’est avec grande fierté que le Groupe et ses employés contribuent à supporter ses clients dans la réalisation de leurs projets.

L’entreprise est « Pro-famille » et assure un équilibre vie-travail conciliant. Elle offre aussi l'opportunité unique d'apprendre à son équipe avec une formation sur mesure, afin d’évoluer dans un environnement de travail agréable.

Description sommaire

Relevant du Directeur exécutif des finances, le Contrôleur corporatif sera responsable de divers mandats tels que le traitement des états financiers tout au long de l’année, la vérification financière, l’analyse du prix de revient, l’encadrement de différents processus, le traitement des rapports financiers, et l’amélioration des méthodes de travail en place.

À noter que le poste demande des déplacements occasionnels à Ville Saint-Laurent, mais est basé principalement à St-Jean-sur-Richelieu. Plus précisément, le titulaire du poste sera responsable des activités suivantes:

Principales tâches et responsabilités

  • Responsable de la production des états financiers mensuels pour l’ensemble du Groupe
  • Préparer et présenter les états financiers mensuels et annuels de l’entreprise à l’équipe de direction
  • Assurer des procédures de contrôle efficaces et le suivi des résultats (tableaux de bord et indicateurs de performance)
  • Effectuer le cycle comptable complet pour l’entreprise, sa société de gestion et sa fiducie
  • S’assurer de la préparation du budget annuel et des prévisions financières pour les (4) compagnies du Groupe
  • Fournir l’analyse des coûts de fabrication (Prix de revient) pour les compagnies du Groupe et participer activement à l’amélioration des processus et des systèmes en place
  • Favoriser et implanter des indicateurs de performance (KPI) et participer à l’analyse d’acquisitions potentielles
  • Maximiser l’utilisation de la technologie pour assurer la simplification et l’amélioration des processus

Qualifications requises

Formation

  • Diplôme universitaire en administration des affaires
  • Titre comptable reconnu CPA

 Expérience professionnelle

  • Détenir 5 à 10 ans d’expérience
  • Détenir une expérience en entreprise manufacturière
  • Expérience en prix de revient/suivi de coûts de projet
  • Expérience avec des systèmes de gestion intégrée ERP (atout)
  • Expérience en cabinet comptable (atout)

Compétences

  • Bonne expertise en comptabilité, états financiers et vérification
  • Habileté à travailler avec divers systèmes
  • Maîtrise de l’environnement Windows et MS Office

Habiletés spécifiques

  • Proactivité professionnelle
  • Joueur d’équipe collaborateur
  • Prêt à progresser
  • Bon vulgarisateur tant à l’écrit qu’à l’oral

Parmi les défis du poste

  • Contribuer à la croissance de l’entreprise
  • Environnement multisite
  • Amélioration des processus technologiques
  • Poste stratégique de relève avec accès à des opportunités de carrière plus rapidement

Pourquoi se joindre au GROUPE ALLIÉES

  • Travailler pour un regroupement d’organisations cumulant plus de 80 ans d’expérience
  • Conditions salariales très compétitives & bénéfices marginaux innovants
  • Entreprise en forte croissance dans une industrie à l’abri des intempéries
  • Équipe de gestion dynamique et passionnée
  • Poste stratégique de relève avec accès à des opportunités de carrière plus rapidement
  • Reconnaissance pour les employés loyaux et dévoués
  • Formation en continu et développement de compétences
  • Emplois pro-famille offrant un bon équilibre vie-travail
  • Valeurs véhiculées par l’entreprise
  • Environnement de travail sécuritaire, agréable et diversifié

Suivez TALINKO sur LinkedInet visitez notre site web

Seules les personnes sélectionnées pour une entrevue seront contactées. Nous souscrivons au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi.

TALINKO est une firme de recrutement de cadres intermédiaires et supérieurs offrant également l’accompagnement dans le recrutement de membres de conseil d’administration ou comité aviseur. Nous œuvrons dans différents secteurs d’activités.

Veuillez noter que le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

title: Controller - 90K-120K
description:
Our client in the Service Industry is looking for a Controller to join their Montreal team. The ideal candidate would have 5+ years of experience in a similar role.

Job Title:: Controller 90K-120K
Location: Montreal (Hybrid)
Salary : 50$-60$/h depending on experience
Duration : 12 month contract with a possibility of permanence

Are you interested in the possibility of working for a company that is known for being an excellent employer?

Then this position is for you!

Advantages
- Competitive salary
- A great team
- Positive and stimulating work environment
- Flexible hours with the possibility of remote work
- 3-4 week vacation depending on experience
- Parking space available


Responsibilities
Under the supervision of the Director of Finance, you will be responsible for the following tasks:

- Prepare, analyze and review monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements
- Manage a team of 3 people (1 technician, 2 analyst)
- Participate in the month-end reporting process
- Participate in the annual budget and monthly forecasts
- Apply and ensure compliance with the internal control structure
- Contribute and support finance process improvements
- Develop and maintain performance indicator reports (KPI)
- All other related tasks

Qualifications
- Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role
- CPA (an important asset) or CPA candidate
- French speaking environment
- Functional English
- Advanced Excel (VLookup, PVT)


Summary
Are you interested in this position? Don't hesitate to contact me!

To apply :
- Send me an email anytime at veronique.hoang@randstad.ca

title: Contrôleur (#3039)
description:
Poste : Contrôleur (#3039)

Catégorie :  Permanent

Localisation : Ouest de l’ile de Montréal

Salaire : Compétitif

Particularités de l’employeur:

Joignez-vous à une équipe de professionnels dans une PME manufacturière privée. Vous ferez partie d’une organisation qui a les intérêts de ses employés à cœur et qui offre une visibilité mondiale, un travail enrichissant et en amélioration continue, des outils logiciels innovateurs et un environnement de travail hautement stimulant en apprentissage et développement professionnel. Avantages : Gamme complète d’avantages sociaux – 4 semaines de vacances – Horaire flexible – Forte rétention des employées – Rôle polyvalent – Possibilité d’évolution.

Vos responsabilités en quelques mots!

  • Superviser les opérations comptables du département, telles que la facturation, l'écriture du grand livre, la budgétisation, etc.
  • Collaborer à l’analyse des prévisions financières et noter les écarts à des fins d’évaluation
  • S’assurer de la conformité des processus comptables et opérationnels
  • Effectuer les fermetures de mois et de fins d’années
  • Assurer la bonne coopération avec les vérificateurs externes
  • Réaliser une liste de recommandations afin d’assurer l’intégrité de l’information financière
  • Former et tenir à jour les connaissances du personnel du département des finances

Vos Atouts pour ce poste!

  • Détenir le titre CPA
  • Expérience dans un cabinet ou un environnement manufacturier
  • Expérience en gestion
  • Autonomie, polyvalence et esprit d’équipe
  • Bilinguisme essentiel

Une opportunité idéale pour…

Un ou une Contrôleur qui aimerait un rôle clé à haute valeur ajoutée, dans un environnement stable et évolutif ! Une personne qui possède une agilité relationnelle, et qui saura épauler la CFO et superviser une petite équipe. Nous avons la vision d’un candidat rigoureux, attentif aux détails, conviviale et qui aime l’autonomie. Avez-vous envie de partager votre savoir-faire dans ce rôle varié? Saisissez la chance d’avoir un impact, en participant au bon roulement d’une organisation qui apporte un changement positif dans le monde et dans votre quotidien !

title: CONTROLLER
description:
Job Number: 43747 
Group: Magna Mechatronics, Mirrors & Lighting  
Division: Autosystems Canada - Bld3 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: BELLEVILLE 

 

Group Description

The Mechatronics, Mirrors and Lighting group specializes in automotive technologies that are driving the future of mobility. Combining a deep systems knowledge to develop unique vehicle access experiences, intelligent visions systems and advanced automotive lighting technologies, MML's expertise light the path to innovation, safety and styling.

 

GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible and accountable to lead, manage, support and provide direction to all staff within the department through effective goals/objectives setting, performance monitoring and reviews, communication, and the execution of on-the-job training and development plans.
  • Ensures a robust department structure by maintaining effective staffing levels and creating succession plans and related employee development plans to support current and future needs. 
  • Develops and executes an annual strategic plan for the department supporting company performance objectives and industry/field related benchmarking and trends.
  • Collects, measures and monitors data related to the overall effectiveness of the department; benchmarking and analyzing these trends to establish action plans for continuous improvement (QOS process).
  • Develops and implements new processes and procedures, as needed to support changing business demands.
  • Facilitates effective two-way communication through department meetings (minimum monthly) and an Open-Door philosophy
  • Accountable for department budget preparation, approval and attainment.
  • Ensure all departmental requirements are met on a timely basis, specifically buy not limited to the following:
  •    Monthly reporting requirements (internal and corporate)
  •    Year-end reporting and audit requirements
  •    Annual budget requirements
  •    Capital acquisition process requirements
  •    Bi-weekly payroll requirements
  •    Other management reporting requirements
  •    Regular forecasting
  •    Hedging Analysis
  •   Ensures compliance with GAAP, and Sarbanes-Oxley policies and requirements.
  •    Ensures confidentiality of all proprietary and human resources related information.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  •     Leads by Example
  •     Makes Decisions
  •     Excellent ability to persuade, influence and motivate others
  •     Communicates Effectively
  •     Negotiates
  •     Strong time management and organization skills
  •     Strong computer skills, especially MS Excel
  •     Decisive
  •     Ability to work overtime to complete projects by the required deadline

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or related field of study
  • Accounting Designation (CPA) required
  • Post-secondary Degree in a related field preferred (business)

WORK EXPERIENCE:

  • 7 or more years of work-related experience
  • Minimum 5 years related experience
  • Minimum 3 years supervisory experience preferred
  • Experience in the automotive industry preferred

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

PERFORMANCE MEASURES:

•   Budget Attainment

•   Budgeting/forecasting accuracy

•   Departmental Strategic Plan Execution

•   Departmental Succession Plan and Employee development plans.

•   Detailed forecasting methodology

•   EOS Metrics

•   On-time month-end reporting

•   On-time quote capitals

•   QOS Measurables

•   Year-end audit binder submission for external auditor's - timely completion and management of audit staff

 

Physical Demands – Normal amount of sitting and standing; Ability to move around an office environment and on the production floor;  Ability to work at a computer workstation; Ability to bend, twist, lift, reach.  Required to carry out job duties and responsibilities in a work environment that may include, but is not limited to, varying levels of noise and/or temperature. Ability to lift max. 50lbs periodically.

title: Corporate Controller, Manufacturing
description:
Location: Edmonton, AB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 3/24/2022Job ID: DL142047324Category: Accounting & Finance
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit for the permanent position of Corporate Controller, Manufacturing, based in Edmonton, Alberta.
 
Responsibilities:
  • Manage the manufacturing division’s financial systems including budgetary processes and the preparation of its consolidated financial statements
  • Overseeing all plant accountants and accounting operations for the manufacturing division
  • Provide timely and insightful financial operational support to the facilities’ General Managers
  • Develop and maintain financial policies and procedures across all facilities
  • Preparation of financial reports for management to support the reporting requirements for various company stakeholders
  • Communicate with and maintain working relationships with banking institutions and auditors
  • Lead the annual audit for the Company’s manufacturing division
  • Provide feedback and recommendations to senior management regarding the infrastructure for the financial function
  • Coordinate with other financial professionals throughout the organization to meet overall corporate requirements
Qualifications:
  • A University degree and Canadian accounting designation (CPA) is required
  • 5+ years of progression through financial positions with increasing responsibility
  • Strong knowledge of ASPE
  • Experience with external auditors and the audit process
  • Experience in the implementation of an ERP or similar system is considered an asset
  • Proficient in technology, such as MS PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and QuickBooks
  • Demonstrates a positive work ethic, is self-motivated, has strong attention to detail, and is a team player
Job ID: DL142047324

If you meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to submit your resume in confidence to Drea Larson, Senior Consultant, Accounting & Finance. We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Business controller
description:
Business controllerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

****Referral bonus premium $1,500.00****As a business controller, you will be an essential member of the Finance team within the Electrical Installation Products business line at the St-Jean-sur-Richelieu plant in Quebec City and will also provide service to other EL divisions. Under the responsibility of the operations controller, you will provide essential support to the business, ensuring the accurate tracking and processing of all transactions.ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts),is the number one manufacturer of electrification products in North America with a 125-year history of providing innovation and customer- focused solutions for connecting and protecting electrical systems, as well as a unique differentiated medium voltage offering. Our products are used all around you, every day - orbiting the earth, working on Mars, on the fastest trains we ride, in the fastest cars of the world, crossing oceans, in factories producing your food, in the tallest buildings of the world, in the most modern hotels and in the walls of your home. With a portfolio of more than 200,000 products marketed under more than 38 premium brand names, our Division offerings are found wherever electricity is used.
Your responsibilities

  • Financial controls of the activities of the Canadian distribution centre.
  • Financial controls of the inventory transactions.
  • Financial controls of the Resales purchase activities.
  • Financial controls of the customs and transport activities.
  • Oversee the process of planning and forecasting the activities of the Electrical Installation Products business line and serve as an interface with the country function.
  • Define and implement the internal controls related to the corporate requirements. Ensure compliance with the internal guidelines/procedures and the external regulatory requirements.
  • Perform financial analyses, report to the company directors, and make suggestions to improve performance, as appropriate.
  • Be involved in the development and implementation of new financial systems to increase the financial and operational performance of the company.

Your background
  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Business.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in an accounting role in a manufacturing environment.
  • Knowledge of SAP and Oracle is an asset.
  • Current CPA/CMA valid in Québec.
  • Outstanding attention to details, accuracy and ability to multitask.
  • A strong collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and written and verbal communication skills.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our websitewww.abb.com.For the 4th year in a row, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's top employers by Forbes Magazine and has been ranked #1 within the industry category. Also named as Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Top Employers, Canada's Top Employers for Young People, and Best Candidate Experience Award (CandE Award), ABB's culture and commitment are to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Hybrid

title: Project Controller
description:
Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.  

Vous avez envie de prendre part à des projets d’envergure afin de transformer nos processus de développement organisationnels? Vous avez de l’intérêt pour les technologies 4.0 vous intéressent? Vous avez même un petit côté « geek »? Voici l’offre que vous attendiez!

Votre futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Assurer une vision globale et suivre de près les échéanciers, les budgets et les ressources des différents projets en cours
  • Documenter les enjeux, les réunions de suivi et les demandes de changement
  • Produire des rapports afin de compiler des données tout au long de la réalisation du projet
  • Coordonner la planification de projets
  • Relayer l’information pertinente à l’ensemble des parties prenantes
  • Agir à titre de mentor auprès des chargés projets et les accompagner dans la gestion des risques
  • Créer les plans de projets, puis faire la gestion des ressources
  • Optimiser la planification en anticipant les impacts et en revoyant les séquences de projets – au besoin

Compétences requises

  • Expérience pertinente dans un rôle similaire ou comme coordinateur ou chargé de projets
  • Proactivité
  • Rigueur – vous avez une bonne vision d’ensemble et aucun détail ne vous échappe
  • Stratège
  • Maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office, dontProject
  • Habiletés communicationnelles en anglais et en français – tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

Votre futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Vos yeux s’illuminent à la lecture de cette offre rêvée? Postulez dès maintenant, nous attendons votre candidature avec impatience!

title: Controller, Development
description:
Our client, QuadReal Property Group, a leading global real estate investment, development and operating company is aggressively growing their Development Portfolio and building their Finance Management team to support the many projects underway.  QuadReal manages the real estate and mortgage programs of British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI), one of Canada’s largest asset managers with almost $200 billion portfolio.

As Business Partner to Development Operations, while holding financial accountability to Head Office in Vancouver, you will be instrumental in providing meaningful financial information on Eastern Canada project profitability, analysis and risk assessment. 

Reporting directly to the VP, Development Accounting & Finance, the Controller, Development will provide analysis of project-related agreements and legal structure.    You will partner with Development Management to prepare project budgets, cashflow and variance analysis.  In a leadership role, you will provide financial leadership for current and new staff.  You will have overall responsibility for the accounting and financial reporting function of the Eastern Canada development portfolio ensuring the project teams and senior management are provided timely financial information to assist with decision making while continually developing and improving business processes.

The ideal candidate will have 10+ years progressive experience including in-depth experience and understanding of Development Accounting. You will have managed teams in past roles and be an excellent relationship builder. You will hold an Accounting Designation and have demonstrated experience with both operational and technical accounting to fulfill needs of both Corporate Finance as well as Business Operations.  You will thrive in a dynamic but stable workplace and love the challenge of building a department and providing value to stakeholders.  With an innate ability to identify, analyze, and problem solve, you are a quick-study and quick on your feet.

Up for a challenging but rewarding role with an exciting opportunity to make your mark?   Don’t miss out on this opportunity to join this highly regarded and high-growth organization. Please apply immediately to be given consideration.

title: Controller - Client Opportunity
description:
Your opportunity:

 

Are you an Assistant Controller looking for the next phase in your career? Or looking for a family-owned and operated business to contribute to as a leader in accounting and financial reporting? Consider  Muskoka Auto Parts (MAP).  We value our employees as family and are looking forward to bringing a proficient and dynamic  Controller  onboard to enhance our corporate team.

 

Beyond our competitive compensation and benefits package, we provide a close-knit team environment at our headquarters in Huntsville and opportunity for longevity and growth to support career development.

title: Project Controller, Finance Consulting (Ottawa, Ontario, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Ottawa, Ontario, Canada 
All Available Locations: Ottawa 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Have many careers in one Firm. 
Experience a firm where wellness matters.

Are you a financial analyst looking to provide your expertise to project management team(s), and learn and grow within a firm? Do you bring passion to what you do, showcase a can-do spirit and radiate the drive to do things right the first time to deliver high quality service? Then this is the job for you!

What will your typical day look like?

Your proactive nature will aid you in supporting preparation of budgets and forecasts to track and predict financial metrics such as revenue, expense, and profitability. Your attention to detail will allow you to track expenditures and perform the client bill and receivable collection functions with accuracy. Your communication skills will serve you well in interacting frequently with senior level internal and external clients and firm leadership to present various reporting, analyses, and discuss recommendations. Your business and/or financial education and experience will allow you to understand and utilize standard processes for project management, quality management, and risk management.  You are self-motivated to continuously learn and improve your technical and financial skill set. Your ability to work independently will make you thrive with little supervision and lead the project financial lifecycle end-to-end from contract to close.

About the team

Deloitte Consulting's “Engagement Financial Services Practice” is comprised of Project Controls professionals serving as a focal point for financial aspects of project, program, and account management.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone who:
•    Has a Major in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Management and a minimum of 3 years’ experience in a financial analysis role
•    Must be eligible for GOC security clearance
•    Understands key financials and operational concepts and can integrate these into financial model for analysis and forecasting to asses progress on projects
•    Has excellent analytical, prioritization and problem-solving skills
•    Has experience working with the entire Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced level Excel
•    Has outstanding attention to detail and adherence to project deadlines while handling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
•    Bilingualism (an asset)
•    Preferably has working knowledge of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software, such as SAP or other comparable systems
•    Seeks challenging opportunities takes accountability for personal results
•    Builds relationships and communicates effectively in order to positively influence peers and other stakeholders
** This role requires eligibility for obtaining a security clearance from the Government of Canada, that is to say, have been in continuous service in Canada for at least 5 years?

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.


The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by [insert date].
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Valuation & Advisory Vice President
description:
Our Story

About You:

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us:

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Overview

The Vice President will work on our Valuation & Advisory Services team to mentor our junior staff, produce appraisal reports, consulting studies and portfolio valuations. Working alongside our market leaders, you will build relationships with clients, develop growth opportunities, and use the Company’s advanced internal technology platforms to enhance your appraisal reports.

Responsibilities

  • Independently prepare and sign off on appraisal reports to clients.
  • Provide consistent mentorship, guidance and feedback to Valuation Associates and Senior Appraisers.
  • Model cash flows using ARGUS Enterprise.
  • Property inspections as needed.
  • Client relationship management on an ongoing basis.
  • Ability to summarize data and provide analysis of market trends and future forecast and any considerations for the Valuation & Advisory business operation
  • Work with market leaders to develop new business opportunities and prepare presentations for clients.
  • Any other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Qualifications

  • Education - Minimum of a 4-year university degree in a relevant functional area including Bachelor of Commerce or MBA or similar, etc.
  • Experience – 7+ years of related work experience. Experience managing people and teams is an asset.
  • AACI Designation, in good standing with the Appraisal Institute of Canada.
  • Must be proficient in Argus, MS Word and MS Excel.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the market, appraisal process and commercial real estate industry.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to write reports, effective oral and written communication skills, and an aptitude for continuous learning.
  • Ability to self-motivate and effectively manage competing priorities while providing excellent support to clients with an uncompromised high caliber work product.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and provide leadership to junior members to ensure Valuation and Advisory team goals are achieved.
  • Effectively and tactfully handling difficult or sensitive issues.
  • Respect the confidentiality of clients and information.

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: CFO Chief Financial Officer
description:
CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER (CFO)  
$175K - $200K, benefits ++
Relocation Package Available to southern Alberta.

As Chief Financial Officer, you will join the dynamic Executive Team of a Group of Companies to administer the highest level of fiscal responsibility within a fast paced and growing manufacturing organization. The ideal candidate will be an excellent team player, demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit, who is effective working collaboratively with all departments to ensure the companies stay on track with financial goals and targets.


Roles & Responsibilities:

Strategy, Planning and Management
- Reports to CEO and is a member of the leadership team;
- Participate in Weekly, Quarterly and Annual EOS Leadership Team meetings;
- Lead, Management and Accountability (LMA) for all financial and all other CFO function roles;
- Assess and evaluate financial performance of the organization’s budgets and forecasts;
- Contribute to the visioning of the companies long-term then shorter-term goals;
- Participate in decisions as they relate to strategic initiatives and operational models;
- Ensure strong relationships with external banking, accounting, and other financial service partners;
- Analysis and minimization of company financial risks and liabilities;
- Support department Managers on budgeting, margin analysis and department planning.

Forecasting, Budgeting and Financial Analysis
- ­Financial reporting by company and critical department operations; 
- Review and analyze current financial results and provide improvement recommendations;
- Analysis of new business initiatives, products and/or service offerings;
- Develop and maintain monthly operating budgets and annual company operating budgets;
- Analyze and qualify the company’s growth and expansion plans.

Accounting, Administration and Operations
- Ensure software and systems are functioning accurately and efficiently; 
- Review and ensure application of appropriate internal financial controls;
- Ensure timeliness and accuracy of financial and management reporting data;
- Accurate and timely financial statements;
- Accurate and timely filing and payment of all relevant government agency taxes;
Month-end closing activities including GL’s, balance sheets and overhead cost allocation;
- Analyze and improve financial systems, policies, processes, and controls;
- Identify, onboard, coach and LMA for accounting team members.

Financial and Cash Management
- Cash flow projections, planning and management;
-Oversee investments and other business assets;
- Ensure accurate and Timely AR/AP functions within Finance department.

Skill Requirements:
- CPA Designation;
- 7+ years of proven experience as CFO, Director or Finance, Financial Officer, or comparable role; strategic planning and execution and partnering with a leadership team;
- Experience with a variety of ERP Systems;
- Experience working with multiple banking and accounting organizations;
- Manufacturing and/or Construction experience considered an asset;
- High level of skill with IT and technology services and systems; - Outstanding communication and presentation skills;
- Excellent analytical, reasoning, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills.

Company Core Values: 
Passionate, Positive & Productive: Promote Positive Workspaces. Pursue Challenging Goals, We are Eager to Succeed.
Respectful, Helpful & Caring: BE Open and Approachable. Help Others Succeed. Treat Everyone with Respect.
Responsible & Reliable: We do what we say. Own Your Seat. We can Lean on Each Other.
Solution-Focused: See it, own it, solve it, do it. Embrace Continuous Improvement. We Always Find a Way.
Do the Right Thing: Know What is Important. We Make the Most of Our Time & Energy. Our Decision Impact Everyone.

If you are eager to join an energetic organization that is looking to the future in everything they do AND you want to live in an amazing rural environment close to the mountains - this opportunity may be the career of a lifetime. A new work family! A beautiful community to enjoy your time away from work. If you have the skills, experience and the desire to embrace a new opportunity, send us your resume and let's talk.
 


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Vice President, Financial Planning & Analysis
description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintech’s and North America’s Most Engaged Workplaces, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly-traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial and LendCare. We offer a wide variety of financial products and services including lease-to-own merchandise, unsecured and secured installment loans, direct-to-consumer auto loans, and point-of-sale financing to over 4,000 merchants in the powersports, automotive, retail, home improvement and health sectors. With over 30 years of experience, our 2200 employees work with our customers to help them get access to the money they need today, while they rebuild their credit and graduate to prime rates. Our omni-channel model includes over 400 retail locations and digital/mobile platforms that enable our customers to transact with us through their channel of choice.

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer and working closely with the Executive Team, the Vice President, Financial Planning Analysis will be responsible for leading and evolving the Financial Planning Analysis function for the Company.  As a trusted business partner with senior leaders and across functions, they will determine how to support the rapid growth of the business.  This role has accountability for managing financial planning, budgeting, consistent reforecasting, strategic planning, management reporting, preparing fact-based analytics, supporting corporate development initiatives, and developing value-add insights and analysis to drive and influence business decisions.

Responsibilities include (not limited to):

  • Developing a scalable FPA infrastructure that will be able to support the evolution/ growth of the business – acquisitions (domestic and international), business units segments, product verticals, project tracking/evaluation, corporate cost allocation transfer pricing, etc.
  • Enhancement of Management Reporting capability by growing the function’s competencies in business unit, product-level, and Board packages and insights.
  • Direct oversight of the Financial Planning Analysis function in the preparation of Budgets, Forecasts, Investment Analysis, Business Unit Cost Centre Segment Analysis, Project Planning, Key Performance Indicators, and other related analysis.
  • Support and partnership to the Treasury function’s management Capital and Debt Management, Funding Facilities, Transactional Banking, Securitization vehicle, Financial Instruments, and optimizing cost of credit.
  • Support of the Corporate Development function including MA activity, New Business Venture Deal analysis, Research, Investor Relations, Equity Research, Rating Agency enquiries, and Strategic Planning.
  • Manage, coach, and develop a group of corporate finance professionals. Promote a culture of high engagement, high performance, and continuous improvement that values learning and a commitment to quality.
  • Identify opportunities to challenge team members and grow their skillsets.
  • Be viewed as a trusted advisor by the business unit leadership and senior executive and provide timely and valued support.
  • Continual improvement of the budgeting process through education of department managers on financial issues impacting department budgets.
  • Provide strategic guidance around capital financing options to support company growth.

Who you are:

  • 10 + years of relevant corporate finance experience with at least 3-5 years in a senior management role.
  • Have successfully held a similar role as the Vice President with another high-growth organization.  Preference for someone with experience having worked in the consumer-finance/lending space or broader financial services.
  • Previous experience working in a dynamic environment with the aptitude to support and integrate key processes with other areas of finance (Controllership, Treasury, Corporate Development, etc.).
  • Have worked with a rapidly growing organization achieved organically and through MA.
  • Hands-on experience having analyzed and supported MA activity.
  • Strong people management and coaching skills.  An “eye for talent” and a desire to build and retain a high-performing team.
  • Highly analytical and thorough – delving into details of the business, ensuring that financial insights are effectively communicated to business partners to drive improved business results.
  • A strong and organized leader that can effectively communicate complex financial information to non-financial audiences in a succinct, clear and concise manner.
  • Ability to perform under pressure and meet deadlines and company goals.
  • Ability to multitask and deal with people and situations in a professional manner.  Able to manage competing priorities, meet deliverables while building relationships with colleagues.
  • University Degree (Accounting, Finance, Business or a related discipline).
  • An MBA or CPA designation would be desirable.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire.  We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

title: Controller
description:
About Canest Transit

DG Canest-Transit is a young and growing company and a leader in the transportation and logistics industry.

DG Canest Transit has been operating at the Port of Montreal for over 6 years loading grain containers for Canadian exporters. Its imposing grain terminal on Notre-Dame Street is known to Montrealers with its visible signage within a 15 KM radius. Canest satisfies its customers and partners with its efficiency and flexibility. We are very proud to contribute with responsible people to the success of the organization and the individuals. The work environment is always challenging. Together, we go further!

CanEst Transit Inc. is a company specializing in the cleaning and containerization of agricultural products.

Strategically located in the Port of Montreal, next to the container terminals, CanEst Transit receives grain by rail and truck. It offers different services such as product cleaning, sifting, packaging, and containerization, as well as handling of bulk grain and by-products.

Brief Description

Reporting to the Managing Director, the Controller will be a key member of the management team. The role will also include optimizing the overall finance function. We are looking for someone with analytical, leadership, and management skills.

Main Tasks and Responsibilities

  • Supervise a team dedicated to accounting, payroll, research fund management and work closely with the Director, Financial Planning and Analysis;
  • Oversee budget monitoring and propose corrective actions;
  • Manage the process and activities of the external auditors and the preparation of year-end audit files;
  • Manage grant programs
  • Plan, direct and coordinate all operational functions under his/her responsibility;
  • Identify opportunities to optimize financial processes by identifying and developing administrative and financial policies, guidelines, and procedures;
  • Work in conjunction with managers and act in an advisory capacity;
  • Support the development of management reports and performance indicators to enable management to make informed decisions.
  • Hire, train and retain qualified accounting personnel

Required Qualifications

Training

  • University degree in a related field
  • Hold a recognized accounting designation (CPA)

Professional experience

  • A minimum of 3 to 5 years experience in a controller role
  • Experience in a small to medium sized business (SME)
  • Experience in team management and project management

Key Competencies

  • Strong communication, technology, analytical, and management skills
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
  • Knowledge of accounting software (Sage 50, an asset)
  • Bilingualism, both oral and written

Abilities

  • Ability to manage multiple files simultaneously,
  • Work independently
  • Adapt to changing deadlines and priorities
  • Demonstrate a high level of discretion

Among the challenges of the position

  • Growth company with a recent acquisition
  • Expansion and acquisition program
  • Multi-division management (3 independent entities)
  • Optimization of operating structures

Why join Canest Transit

  • Competitive compensation and benefits program
  • Young and dynamic team
  • Stimulating work environment
  • Company proud to contribute with responsible people to the success of the organization and individuals

Follow TALINKO on LinkedIn and visit our Website

Only the people selected for an interview will be contacted. We support the principle of employment equity.

TALINKO is a recruitment firm of middle and senior executives also offering support in the recruitment of members of the board of directors or advisory committee. We operate in different business sectors.

title: Contrôleur corporatif- Construction - Laval
description:
Contrôleur corporatif – Domaine de la construction - Laval

Aimerez-vous travailler pour la division corporative d'une grande entreprise de construction à Laval?
Êtes-vous un leader naturel et vous aimerez avoir une belle équipe à votre charge?
Vous aimez un rythme de travail qui est rapide et changeant?

Nous avons un beau poste pour vous!







Avantages
Notre client vous offre :
• Salaire entre $100,000-$110,000 + 10% de bonis
• Assurances groupe
• 3-4 semaines de vacances selon l'expérience
• Horaire de travail de 37.5h/semaine

Responsabilités
Se rapportant à la Directrice, le Contrôleur est responsable de :
- Planifier, organiser, diriger, contrôler et évaluer les activités de son service en conformité avec les orientations de l’entreprise;
- Participer à l’élaboration des objectifs, des priorités, des stratégies et des plans d’action de son service;
- Superviser, encadrer et assurer le développement du personnel sous sa responsabilité (10 employés);
- Élaborer des politiques et procédures, afin d’assurer le maintien des contrôles financiers et administratifs appropriés, en assurer la mise en application, la diffusion, ainsi que la mise à jour, en vertu de tout changement aux lois, ainsi qu’à leur interprétation;
- Coordonner et contrôler la production des différents rapports financiers et de gestion, selon les échéanciers, en lien avec l’évolution des budgets, en interpréter les résultats, soumettre ses recommandations au comité exécutif;
- Planifier et organiser le processus de vérification annuelle avec les vérificateurs externes;
- Diffuser l’information relative à l’interprétation et à l’application des normes et pratiques financières;
- Formuler des recommandations visant à simplifier les mécanismes de contrôle et les rendre plus efficaces;
- Optimiser les structures et processus existants du département et fournir des recommandations aux compagnies sous-gestion pour également optimiser leur structures et processus;
- Participer à l’élaboration, la mise en place et l’application de contrôles internes au sein du département et des compagnies sous-gestion;
- Supporter la direction dans les projets spéciaux.


Qualifications
Qualifications :
• 10 ans d’expérience en comptabilité, avec un minimum de 3 ans d’expérience en gestion d'équipe;
• Titre professionnel de CPA complété;
• Expérience dans une grande entreprise, avec un gros volume de travail ;
• Anglais au niveau intermédiaire;
• Excel au niveau avancé;


Sommaire
Si le poste de Contrôleur vous intéresse et vous avez les qualifications requises, veuillez svp faire parvenir une copie récente de votre cv à angela.bonfitto@randstad.ca. Si vous avez déjà un dossier d’ouvert chez Randstad, veuillez svp communiquer avec Angela au 450.682.9564.

Nous remercions tous les candidats pour leurs intérêts, cependant nous communiquerons seulement avec les candidatures retenues pour le poste.

Veuillez svp consulter notre site web au www.randstad.ca pour voir d’autres opportunités d’emplois.

Merci,
Angela

title: Controller (m/w/d)
description:
Gruppenbeschreibung

 

Eine mehr als 100-jährige Erfahrung in der Fahrzeugproduktion und ein breites Leistungsspektrum machen Magna Steyr zum weltweit führenden, markenunabhängigen Engineering- und Fertigungspartner für OEMs.

Unser umfassendes Leistungsangebot erstreckt sich über die Produktgruppen Gesamtfahrzeugentwicklung, angefangen bei Systemen und Modulen bis hin zum Gesamtfahrzeug-Engineering, und Gesamtfahrzeugfertigung, wo wir flexible Lösungen von der Nischen- bis zur Volumenfertigung auf Weltklasse-Niveau anbieten. Bislang hat Magna Steyr mehr als 3,5 Millionen Fahrzeuge, aufgeteilt auf 29 Modelle, produziert.

Magna Steyr ist der weltweit erste Fahrzeug-Auftragsfertiger, der eine breite Palette an Antriebstechnologien – vom konventionellen Antrieb über Plug-in-Hybrid bis hin zum rein elektrischen Fahrzeug – in einem Werk fertigt, und das zum Teil auch auf derselben Produktionslinie. Dies unterstreicht unsere Kompetenz als Automobilzulieferer auch in den Bereichen Elektrifizierung und Elektromobilität.

Rollenzusammenfassung

Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir zum frühestmöglichen Eintritt fürunseren Standort inNeumarkteinen engagierten Controller(m/w/d).

Hauptverantwortlichkeiten

  • Mitarbeit bei der Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung eines wirkungsvollen und transparenten Controllingsystems
  • Eigenverantwortliche Durchführung der Monats-, Quartals-, und Jahresabschlüsse nach HGB und US-GAAP
  • Erstellung von jährlichen Budgets und Forecasts (G&V, Bilanz)
  • Durchführung von Soll/Ist-Vergleichen, Abweichungsanalysen und Ad-hoc-Auswertungen
  • Erstellung von Wirtschaftlichkeitsberechnungen
  • Mitwirkung bei der Definition von Maßnahmen zur Ergebnisoptimierung sowie Verfolgung der Maßnahmen
  • Aufbereitung des Werks- und Managementreportings
  • Erstellung von Produktkalkulationen
  • Ansprechpartner der Fachbereiche für kaufmännische Fragen
  • Unterstützung des Leiters Controlling

Schlüsselqualifikationen / Zentrale Anforderungen

  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes, betriebswirtschaftliches Studium mit den Schwerpunkten Controlling oder Finanzbuchhaltung
  • Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in einem produzierenden Unternehmen, idealerweise im Automotive Umfeld
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Microsoft Office insbesondere in Excel
  • Erfahrung mit SAP R3 (FI/CO) wünschenswert
  • Hohe Eigeninitiative, Zuverlässigkeit und Einsatzbereitschaft
  • Selbstständiges und strukturiertes Arbeiten
  • Gute Englischkenntnisse

Wir bieten Ihnen

  • Ein umfangreiches Einschulungsprogramm, bei dem Sie unsere Produkte, Aufgaben und Prozesse kennenlernen
  • Ein vielseitiges und interessantes Aufgabenfeld mit hoher Eigenverantwortung
  • Die Job-Perspektiven eines erfolgreichen internationalen Konzerns
  • Ein sehr gutes Betriebsklima in einem engagierten Team
