title: Contrôleur d'affaires
description:
Contrôleur d'affairesFaites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

****Prime de recommandation d'un employé $1,500.00****En tant que contrôleur d'affaires, vous serez un membre essentiel de l'équipe des finances au sein de la ligne d'affaires des produits d'installation électrique, à l'usine de St-Jean sur Richelieu, au Québec et offrirez également un service aux autres divisions de EL. Sous la responsabilité du contrôleur des opérations, vous apporterez un soutien essentiel à l'entreprise, en assurant le suivi et le traitement précis de toutes les transactions.Rejoignez la division ABB Produits d'installation, fabricant numéro un de produits d'électrification en Amérique du Nord comptant 125 ans d'expérience en innovation et en solutions axées sur les clients afin de connecter et protéger les systèmes électriques, ainsi qu'une offre unique démarquée de moyenne tension. Nos produits sont utilisés tout autour de vous, chaque jour - en orbite autour de la Terre, en travaillant sur Mars, dans les trains les plus rapides que nous empruntons, dans les voitures les plus rapides du monde, en traversant les océans, dans les usines produisant votre nourriture, dans les immeubles les plus hauts du monde, dans les hôtels les plus modernes et même dans les murs de votre maison. Avec une gamme de produits comportant plus de 200 000 articles sous plus de 38 marques de commerce de première qualité, les offres de la division ABB Produits d'installation sont disponibles partout où l'on utilise de l'électricité.
Vos responsabilités

  • Contrôles financiers des activités du Centre de distribution Canadien.
  • Contrôles financiers des transactions d'inventaire.
  • Contrôles financiers des activités d'achat revente.
  • Contrôles financiers des activités de douanes et Transport
  • Superviser le processus de planification et de prévision des activités du secteur d'activité des produits d'installation électrique et servir d'interface avec la fonction pays.
  • Définir et implanter les contrôles internes en lien avec les exigences corporatives. Assurer la conformité avec les directives/procédures internes et les exigences réglementaires externes.
  • Effectuer des analyses financières, faire des rapports aux directeurs d'entreprise et faire des suggestions pour améliorer les performances, le cas échéant.
  • S'impliquer dans l'élaboration et la mise en place de nouveaux systèmes financiers afin d'accroître la performance financière et opérationnelle de l'entreprise.
  • Vivre les valeurs fondamentales d'ABB en matière de sécurité et d'intégrité, ce qui signifie assumer la responsabilité de ses propres actions tout en prenant soin de ses collègues et de l'entreprise.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Baccalauréat en comptabilité, en finances ou en commerce.
  • Au moins 5 années d'expérience en comptabilité dans un environnement de fabrication
  • Connaissances de SAP et Oracle sont des atouts.
  • Titre de CPA/CMA valide au Québec.
  • Excellente attention aux détails, précision et capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément.
  • Une approche collaborative axée sur les solutions et d'excellentes aptitudes de communication orale et écrite.

Benefits
  • Plan retraite
  • Mutuelle d'entreprise
  • Programme bien-être
En savoir plus sur nous
Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur ABB, consultez notre site web www.abb.com.Pour la quatrième année consécutive, ABB Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada par le magazine Forbes et s'est classée au premier rang dans la catégorie de l'industrie. Également nommée parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada, les meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes au Canada et le prix de la meilleure expérience du candidat (CandE Award), la culture et l'engagement d'ABB consistent à offrir un milieu de travail bienveillant où chacun collabore, se sent valorisé, respecté, inclus et soutenu. Nous nous engageons également à veiller à ce que toutes les politiques et pratiques respectent le Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, nous visons à ce que notre main-d'œuvre soit réellement représentative des quatre groupes désignés : les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB fournira des accommodements adéquats aux candidats handicapés et les encouragera à s'identifier dans le processus de candidature.#LI-Hybrid

title: Controller
description:
Location: Vancouver, BC, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 2/18/2022Job ID: 9A159669218Category: Accounting & Finance
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered up with a very important client to assist them in sourcing quality candidates for a Controller in Humboldt, SK. 

The Controller position is very important to the short- and long-term success of the organization, as well as its strategic plan. Reporting to the CFO, this business partner will lead the finance function, with a focus on excellence and always keeping the customer’s needs at the forefront. n outlined in the strategic plan.

The Role:
  • Oversee accounting, financial and banking functions, and processes
  • Collaborates with the CFO in the effective coordination of the annual budgeting process and the period forecasting updates
  • Establish and maintain the processes to meet deadlines in a timely manner.
  • Collaborate with the CFO in the development and preparation of internal management reports and Audit and Finance and Board of Director reports.
  • Subject matter expert on financial systems and the interfaces impacting the flow of financial information throughout the organization
  • Delivery of custom reports required to support the needs of key business partners
  • Preparation of statistical reports required by various governmental organizations
  • Developing a relationship with the external auditor is critical, along with the effective delivery of audit requirements on an annual basis
  • Act as a key finance business partner throughout the organization
  • Collaborate with the CFO to ensure that ad hoc requests are supported through the organization

The Ideal Candidate:

Key Competencies:
  • Technical Accounting Leadership
  • An experienced finance and accounting professional who is strong in financial accounting, analytics, and controlling.
  • An ability to understand financial systems and to ensure that the accounting is performed correctly as designed.
  • A familiarity with PSAB and be trained and understand GAAP and have the ability to apply technical accounting skills to meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite of products and particular proficiency in the utilization of spreadsheets.
  • A demonstrated track record of driving operational excellence, top-tier service delivery, continuous improvement and innovation, accountability, and the associated team culture.
People Leadership:
  • Experience in leading people would be a benefit. Well-developed skills in coaching, mentoring and developing technical and leadership skills will maximize the benefits to the organization.
  • A champion of best people, practices, systems, and processes. Safety- and process-oriented, with the ability to apply and implement this in a consulting environment.
  • A proven ability to lead, motivate, engage and empower teams in the development and execution of operating plans and activities that are aligned with the broader strategic plan.
Project Leadership:
  • Business and financial acumen, coupled with strong performance measurement and metrics management orientation and well-developed analytical, budgeting, and business planning skills.
Interpersonal Leadership:
  • Strong communication (written, oral, presentation) skills with the ability to comfortably and effectively engage at a variety of levels and with a range of audiences. A particular strength in communicating accounting concepts and explaining the results of analytics.
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build collaborative relationships with key stakeholders (internally and externally) and with all levels of management and staff, industry partners and colleagues, and others.
  • Leadership skills as demonstrated through a reputation of credibility and integrity in the field; problem-solving abilities; an understanding of team dynamics and how to manage them; and the ability to successfully organize and execute on multiple competing priorities.
Education and Experience:
  • Commerce or Administration degree with a specialization in Accounting
  • A CPA designation is preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of experience within a similar position

If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Angela Degelman, Director and Managing Consultant. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-DNP #IND-DNP

title: Financial Controller
description:
Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French. 

Vous avez envie de relever de nouveaux défis? Vous avez toujours souhaité travailler dans une entreprise internationale? Vous recherchez une ambiance de travail hors du commun où le plaisir rime avec dépassement de soi? Voici l’offre que vous attendiez!

Votre future équipe

Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous optimisons les installations manufacturières de nos clients grâce à des systèmes novateurs à haute valeur ajoutée qui exploitent le plein potentiel de l’automatisation et de la robotique. Nous faisons partie des plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage au monde – que ce soit pour des produits alimentaires, agricoles, organiques ou industriels.

Votre futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Assurer la consolidation des états financiers à l’international
  • Émettre des recommandations à l’Équipe Leadership suivant l’analyse des résultats financiers
  • Coordonner une équipe d’analystes
  • Développer, implanter et assurer l’efficacité des méthodes de contrôles internes et de gouvernance
  • Participer à la préparation des budgets, suivre le processus, puis expliquer les écarts au besoin
  • Participer au développement et au suivi des indicateurs de performance financière 
  • Manipuler des modèles de simulation et de prévision financière
  • Être responsable du dossier de fin d’année et du processus d’audit des états financiers par nos vérificateurs externes

Compétences requises

  • Formation universitaire – profil comptabilité
  • Titre CPA – un atout
  • Leadership
  • Maîtrise de Microsoft Excel
  • Passion pour l’optimisation des procédés comptables
  • Proactivité
  • Rigueur
  • Excellentes habiletés communicationnelles en anglais et en français – tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

Votre futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus!

title: Project Controller/Senior Project Controller, Finance Consulting (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto 

Have many careers in one Firm.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.

Are you a highly analytical, financially focused problem-solver who is looking to provide project control solutions to project management team(s)? Then this is the job for you!

What will your typical day look like?

You will take accountability for various financial analyses, reconciliations and scenario analyses in relation to budgets and forecasts.  Your excellent communication skills will prepare you to interact frequently with senior level internal and external clients, as well as firm leadership to present your creative solutions, discuss recommendations and provide project financial advice. You are a self-motivated learner who will build complex financial reporting models and customize project financial reporting. Your impeccable attention to detail will enable you to conduct quality reviews and provide feedback on the technical work products of junior resources. You will look to drive change and contribute to the growth and development of the overall Engagement Financial Services Practice through active involvement in one or more practice initiatives.  

About the team

Deloitte Consulting's “Engagement Financial Services Practice” is comprised of Project Controls professionals serving as a focal point for financial aspects of project, program, and account management.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone who:

  • Has a Major in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Management and a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a financial analysis role working with the entire Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced level Excel
  • Has outstanding attention to detail and adherence to project deadlines while handling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Has the ability to identify problems and develop creative solutions
  • Has experience developing budgets, forecasts, and project pricing models as well as performing complex scenario analysis
  • Seeks challenging opportunities across businesses and borders and takes accountability for personal and team results
  • Builds relationships and communicates effectively in order to positively influence peers and other stakeholders
  • Bilingualism in French and English is an asset

MANDATORY: must be eligible for obtaining a security clearance from the Government of Canada, that is to say, have been in continuous service in Canada for at least 5 years

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

  • You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
  • You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
  • You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.


The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities!  Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates that represents the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes candidates from Indigenous communities in support of living our values and our commitments to our Reconciliation Action Plan . We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

 

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
Our client is an iconic, first-generation, owner founded and family-owned retailer, whose brand and marketing messages are instantly recognizable to shoppers.They have built a name synonymous with great value and superb customer service. We have a search underway for an enthusiastic and motivatedChief Financial Officer, based in Surrey, BC.

Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to oversight of an empowered and high performing finance team responsible for Financial Reporting, Financial Planning & Analysis, Strategies, Tax, Compliance, and Treasury. You will be the right hand to the President and to the business and will be involved with and lead strategic and transformational initiatives.You must bring an analytical mind in reviewing the business and openly provide suggestions for performance measurement and improvements, champion a new SAP implementation and have a strong understanding of retail, warehousing and distribution.

The business is on an exceptional growth path and to this end, there are a number of exciting projects imminent including geographic expansion into Ontario. This is a hands-on role with responsibilities which will extend beyond the finance function. There is a need to update reporting and control systems and also manage relationships with various stakeholders and with external services providers including auditors, lawyers and bankers.

The successful candidate will have the following qualifications and characteristics:
  • A CPA designation.
  • An experienced Finance and Accounting leader, combining a hands-on operational bent with broad business acumen.
  • Experience with improving management reporting and controls.
  • Attitude and drive will be key for this role - thinking and behaving with an ownership mindset; a focus on superb customer service; a “no job is too small” attitude; and a drive for continuous improvements is required
  • Retail experience is a must-have.Relevant experience can also include distribution, logistics, or perhaps consumer packaged goods manufacturing.
  • Evidence of strong relationship-building skills, cross-functional leadership capabilities and high emotional intelligence will be valued.

There is the potential for meaningful incentive compensation for a leader who will drive the company’s success.

If this resonates as an environment where you can thrive and make a difference, apply promptly and in confidence. We want to hear from you!

title: CFO Chief Financial Officer
description:
CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER (CFO)
$175K - $200K, benefits ++
Relocation Package Available to southern Alberta.

As Chief Financial Officer, you will join the dynamic Executive Team of a Group of Companies to administer the highest level of fiscal responsibility within a fast paced and growing manufacturing organization. The ideal candidate will be an excellent team player, demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit, who is effective working collaboratively with all departments to ensure the companies stay on track with financial goals and targets.


Roles & Responsibilities:

Strategy, Planning and Management
-Reports to CEO and is a member of the leadership team;
- Participate in Weekly, Quarterly and Annual EOS Leadership Team meetings;
- Lead, Management and Accountability (LMA) for all financial and all other CFO function roles;
- Assess and evaluate financial performance of the organization’s budgets and forecasts;
-Contribute to the visioning of the companies long-term then shorter-term goals;
- Participate in decisions as they relate to strategic initiatives and operational models;
- Ensure strong relationships with external banking, accounting, and other financial service partners;
- Analysis and minimization of company financial risks and liabilities;
- Support department Managers on budgeting, margin analysis and department planning.

Forecasting, Budgeting and Financial Analysis
-­Financial reporting by company and critical department operations;
- Review and analyze current financial results and provide improvement recommendations;
-Analysis of new business initiatives, products and/or service offerings;
-Develop and maintain monthly operating budgets and annual company operating budgets;
-Analyze and qualify the company’s growth and expansion plans.

Accounting, Administration and Operations
-Ensure software and systems are functioning accurately and efficiently;
-Review and ensure application of appropriate internal financial controls;
-Ensure timeliness and accuracy of financial and management reporting data;
-Accurate and timely financial statements;
-Accurate and timely filing and payment of all relevant government agency taxes;
Month-end closing activities including GL’s, balance sheets and overhead cost allocation;
-Analyze and improve financial systems, policies, processes, and controls;
-Identify, onboard, coach and LMA for accounting team members.

Financial and Cash Management
-Cash flow projections, planning and management;
-Oversee investments and other business assets;
-Ensure accurate and Timely AR/AP functions within Finance department.

Skill Requirements:
-CPA Designation;
- 7+ years of proven experience as CFO, Director or Finance, Financial Officer, or comparable role;strategic planning and execution and partnering with a leadership team;
-Experience with a variety of ERP Systems;
-Experience working with multiple banking and accounting organizations;
-Manufacturing and/or Construction experience considered an asset;
-High level of skill with IT and technology services and systems; -Outstanding communication and presentation skills;
-Excellent analytical, reasoning, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills.

Company Core Values:
Passionate, Positive & Productive:Promote Positive Workspaces. Pursue Challenging Goals, We are Eager to Succeed.
Respectful, Helpful & Caring: BE Open and Approachable. Help Others Succeed. Treat Everyone with Respect.
Responsible & Reliable: We do what we say. Own Your Seat. We can Lean on Each Other.
Solution-Focused:See it, own it, solve it, do it. Embrace Continuous Improvement. We Always Find a Way.
Do the Right Thing:Know What is Important. We Make the Most of Our Time & Energy. Our Decision Impact Everyone.

If you are eager to join an energetic organization that is looking to the future in everything they do AND you want to live in an amazing rural environment close to the mountains - this opportunity may be the career of a lifetime. A new work family! A beautiful community to enjoy your time away from work. If you have the skills, experience and the desire to embrace a new opportunity, send us your resume and let's talk.

title: Valuation & Advisory Vice President
description:
Our Story

About You:

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

 

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

 

About Us:

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

 

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

 

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

 

 

Overview

The Vice President will work on our Valuation & Advisory Services team to mentor our junior staff, produce appraisal reports, consulting studies and portfolio valuations.  Working alongside our market leaders, you will build relationships with clients, develop growth opportunities, and use the Company’s advanced internal technology platforms to enhance your appraisal reports.

Responsibilities

  • Independently prepare and sign off on appraisal reports to clients.
  • Provide consistent mentorship, guidance and feedback to Valuation Associates and Senior Appraisers.
  • Model cash flows using ARGUS Enterprise.
  • Property inspections as needed.
  • Client relationship management on an ongoing basis.
  • Ability to summarize data and provide analysis of market trends and future forecast and any considerations for the Valuation & Advisory business operation
  • Work with market leaders to develop new business opportunities and prepare presentations for clients.
  • Any other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Qualifications

  • Education - Minimum of a 4-year university degree in a relevant functional area including Bachelor of Commerce or MBA or similar, etc.
  • Experience – 7+ years of related work experience. Experience managing people and teams is an asset. 
  • AACI Designation, in good standing with the Appraisal Institute of Canada.
  • Must be proficient in Argus, MS Word and MS Excel.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the market, appraisal process and commercial real estate industry.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to write reports, effective oral and written communication skills, and an aptitude for continuous learning.
  • Ability to self-motivate and effectively manage competing priorities while providing excellent support to clients with an uncompromised high caliber work product.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and provide leadership to junior members to ensure Valuation and Advisory team goals are achieved.
  • Effectively and tactfully handling difficult or sensitive issues.
  • Respect the confidentiality of clients and information.

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.  We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. 

 

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

 

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. 

 

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: Contrôleur adjoint
description:
Notre client une entreprise publique est à la recherche d'un contrôleur adjoint BILLINGUE qui sera impliqué dans tous les aspects du cycle comptable . À titre de Contrôleur adjoint vous serez impliqué dans les tâches comptable journalière, les prévisions mensuelles, les budgets annuels et plusieurs autres tâches connexes. Si vous avez un sens des communications, êtes axé solutions et n'avez pas peur de vous impliqué directement alors ceci est pour vous.


Avantages
-salaire en ligne avec les compétences rechercher
-2-3 semaines de vacances
-Avantages
-doit être capable de se déplacer entre Ottawa et Gatineau

Participer au processus de fermeture du moi , réconciliation des GL et préparation des états financiers
Analyse des projets mensuelle
Analyse et explications des écarts budgétaires
Participer et planifier l'exercice budgétaire annuel
Supervise et document le processus d'achat capitalisé
mis en place et maintien des contrôles internes
mis en place et maintinsse d'un processus de rapports afin de bien supporté les opérations dans leurs objectifs financiers.
Planifie et coordonne le processus de prise d'inventaire
Vulgarise l'information au différent département afin de maintenir en place les contrôles internes et les processus comptable acceptable.
Facilite la révision des performances financières avec les autres départements

Min 2 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire
Bonne communication en français
Connaissance d'Excel fort
Confortable dans un environnement qui ''Bouge''
Expérience dans un environnement manufacturier ou de production un atout
Bac en comptabilité ou équivalence

Sommaire
Si ceci vous intéresse

Contactez-moi alexander.masny@randstad.ca faite-moi parvenir votre CV.

puisqu'il faut se rendre au travail à tous les jours seuls les candidats résidents dans la région seront retenus

Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

title: Controller
description:
Job Number: 42752 
Group: Magna Exteriors  
Division: Mytox Mfg. 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: Woodbridge 

 

Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

Role Summary

Key Responsibilities

•    Provides direction to Financial Accounting and Payroll
•    Ensures consistent and appropriate accounting records and standards are maintained.  Establishes and maintains internal controls over accounting records
•    Ensures implementation of new legislation or Magna Exteriors accounting requirements
•    Prepares budgets, annual business plan and forecast updates as required
•    Ensures accurate monthly financial statements in required Magna format and any other required financial reports are produced on time
•     Investigates any unusual or significant variances and reports on these to management
•    Ensures compliance with Magna/Exteriors reporting format for year-end, month-end and quarterly
•     Ensures audit file is accurate and complete by deadline  
•    Liaises with outside auditors
•    Coordinate and supervise all A/P functions
•    Ensures that employees reporting to him/her directly adhere to the policies and standards set forth in the Employee Handbook and keeps Employee Files up-to-date which includes:
o    Monitoring attendance
o    Keeping record of training
o    Conducting regular and timely performance reviews
o    Entering any other information into the folder that is relevant to the employee’s performance
•    Writes and implements any BOS/desk procedures relating to areas of responsibility
•    Responsible for archives and timely destruction of obsolete material
•    Conduct Customer Specific Requirements for Layered Process Audit
•    Comply with Sections 25, 26 & 27 of the OHSA
•    Perform regular workplace inspections
•    Be involved with accident/incident investigation program
•    Correct unsafe acts or conditions
•    Commend or correct health and safety performance
•    Conducting performance appraisals for Worker’s Safety performance
•    Train new employees regarding Job Specific Hazards
•    Adhere to all rules and regulations as outlined in the Mytox Employee Handbook

title: Senior Project Controller
description:
Senior Project ControllerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Electrification organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.The Senior Project Controller will lead various initiatives linked to ERP transformations allowing ABB to simplify our interactions and processes with customers internally as well as suppliers. The role pertains to the Electrification Businesses in Canada, for front-end marketing and sales. The role reports to the Director of Operational Excellence and Digital Transformations in Canada. The Digital Transformation team serves the internal businesses; ELSP, ELSB, ELDS, ELIP, ELSE & Commercial Operations. Our team provides innovative, simplified solutions through digital tools to improve sales, productivity and customer satisfaction.
Your responsibilities

  • ERP Transformation: Plan, coordinate and participate in all relevant ERP transformation training and testing, advising local business of any finance/business issues, support local business and global project team to implement and roll out the system, support data validation and ERP migration.
  • Business process leader: represent voice of the business, sign-off on critical milestones & decisions, identify and sign-off on business requirements, identify and work with SME's, define test script development, support training initiatives, etc.
  • Participate in SIT (System Integration Testing) & UAT (User Acceptance Testing), preparing the business for go-live, expedite business decisions, support organizational change management efforts (i.e. Super User program, training, etc.), coordinating on-site and Hypercare support at go-live.
  • Change Agent -> assist the project team and leadership in the implementation of change initiatives; people readiness (internal and external users), change impacts, internal and external communications, training, Super User readiness, etc.
  • Participate in requirements gathering, design, testing, and solutioning.
  • Support and deliver on key activities and project milestones: SIT, UAT, Training, Go-Live, and Hypercare.
  • Post go-live support during the month end and period end financial close.
  • Track and oversee continuous improvement initiatives in the Record to Report (RTR) workstream for NAM-T (North America Transformation).

Your background
  • 10+ years of Finance and Cost accounting experience as a Controller or Finance Manager with Professional accounting designation or certification (C.P.A.).
  • ERP integration, Digital Transformation and SAP experience in Finance and Accounting process areas.
  • Experience designing and deploying SAP modules: FI, CO, SD, MM, & PS.
  • Outstanding attention to detail, accuracy, deadlines, and ability to multi-task with Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven success in ability to manage and lead multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.For the 4th year in a row, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's top employers by Forbes Magazine and has been ranked #1 within the industry category. Also named as Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Top Employers, Canada's Top Employers for Young People, and Best Candidate Experience Award (CandE Award), ABB's culture and commitment are to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Hybrid

title: Controller
description:
Location: Calgary, AB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 2/18/2022Job ID: 9A159669218Category: Accounting & Finance
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered up with a very important client to assist them in sourcing quality candidates for a Controller in Humboldt, SK. 

The Controller position is very important to the short- and long-term success of the organization, as well as its strategic plan. Reporting to the CFO, this business partner will lead the finance function, with a focus on excellence and always keeping the customer’s needs at the forefront. n outlined in the strategic plan.

The Role:
  • Oversee accounting, financial and banking functions, and processes
  • Collaborates with the CFO in the effective coordination of the annual budgeting process and the period forecasting updates
  • Establish and maintain the processes to meet deadlines in a timely manner.
  • Collaborate with the CFO in the development and preparation of internal management reports and Audit and Finance and Board of Director reports.
  • Subject matter expert on financial systems and the interfaces impacting the flow of financial information throughout the organization
  • Delivery of custom reports required to support the needs of key business partners
  • Preparation of statistical reports required by various governmental organizations
  • Developing a relationship with the external auditor is critical, along with the effective delivery of audit requirements on an annual basis
  • Act as a key finance business partner throughout the organization
  • Collaborate with the CFO to ensure that ad hoc requests are supported through the organization

The Ideal Candidate:

Key Competencies:
  • Technical Accounting Leadership
  • An experienced finance and accounting professional who is strong in financial accounting, analytics, and controlling.
  • An ability to understand financial systems and to ensure that the accounting is performed correctly as designed.
  • A familiarity with PSAB and be trained and understand GAAP and have the ability to apply technical accounting skills to meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite of products and particular proficiency in the utilization of spreadsheets.
  • A demonstrated track record of driving operational excellence, top-tier service delivery, continuous improvement and innovation, accountability, and the associated team culture.
People Leadership:
  • Experience in leading people would be a benefit. Well-developed skills in coaching, mentoring and developing technical and leadership skills will maximize the benefits to the organization.
  • A champion of best people, practices, systems, and processes. Safety- and process-oriented, with the ability to apply and implement this in a consulting environment.
  • A proven ability to lead, motivate, engage and empower teams in the development and execution of operating plans and activities that are aligned with the broader strategic plan.
Project Leadership:
  • Business and financial acumen, coupled with strong performance measurement and metrics management orientation and well-developed analytical, budgeting, and business planning skills.
Interpersonal Leadership:
  • Strong communication (written, oral, presentation) skills with the ability to comfortably and effectively engage at a variety of levels and with a range of audiences. A particular strength in communicating accounting concepts and explaining the results of analytics.
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build collaborative relationships with key stakeholders (internally and externally) and with all levels of management and staff, industry partners and colleagues, and others.
  • Leadership skills as demonstrated through a reputation of credibility and integrity in the field; problem-solving abilities; an understanding of team dynamics and how to manage them; and the ability to successfully organize and execute on multiple competing priorities.
Education and Experience:
  • Commerce or Administration degree with a specialization in Accounting
  • A CPA designation is preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of experience within a similar position

title: Contrôleur financier
description:
Vous avez envie de relever de nouveaux défis? Vous avez toujours souhaité travailler dans une entreprise internationale? Vous recherchez une ambiance de travail hors du commun où le plaisir rime avec dépassement de soi? Voici l’offre que vous attendiez!

Votre future équipe

Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous optimisons les installations manufacturières de nos clients grâce à des systèmes novateurs à haute valeur ajoutée qui exploitent le plein potentiel de l’automatisation et de la robotique. Nous faisons partie des plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage au monde – que ce soit pour des produits alimentaires, agricoles, organiques ou industriels.

Votre futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Assurer la consolidation des états financiers à l’international
  • Émettre des recommandations à l’Équipe Leadership suivant l’analyse des résultats financiers
  • Coordonner une équipe d’analystes
  • Développer, implanter et assurer l’efficacité des méthodes de contrôles internes et de gouvernance
  • Participer à la préparation des budgets, suivre le processus, puis expliquer les écarts au besoin
  • Participer au développement et au suivi des indicateurs de performance financière 
  • Manipuler des modèles de simulation et de prévision financière
  • Être responsable du dossier de fin d’année et du processus d’audit des états financiers par nos vérificateurs externes

Compétences requises

  • Formation universitaire – profil comptabilité
  • Titre CPA – un atout
  • Leadership
  • Maîtrise de Microsoft Excel
  • Passion pour l’optimisation des procédés comptables
  • Proactivité
  • Rigueur
  • Excellentes habiletés communicationnelles en anglais et en français – tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

Votre futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots te parlent?

comptabilité, contrôleur, états financiers, budgets, audits, consolidation, contrôle interne, cabinet, milieu manufacturier,

Envie d’en savoir plus? N’attendez plus, vous êtes à un clic de propulser votre carrière au niveau supérieur!

title: Vice President, Finance
description:
Vice President, Finance
Real Estate Development
Vancouver, BC

Our client, an established Real Estate Developer, is seeking a Vice President, Finance to join their Executive Team. The Vice President, Finance will report to the CFO and assume a strategic role in the overall financial management of the company. The position will have primary day-to-day responsibility for planning, implementing, managing and controlling all financial-related activities of the company. This will include direct responsibility for accounting, finance, forecasting, strategic planning, job costing, legal, deal analysis and negotiations, investor relationships and partnership compliance and private and institutional financing.
 
Vice President, Finance duties:
  • Oversee business operations which include setting up reporting systems, implementing internal controls and systems procedures, new project evaluation, project closing and funding, cash flow management, payables/receivables, processes and policies.
  • Responsible for the supervision, guidance and overall smooth operations of the Accounting Department.
  • Provide support and advice to the Principals of the company on various business issues including strategy, financing, and acquisitions.
  • Liaise and manage relationship with business partners, accounting firms, law firms, banks, external auditors, insurers and realtors, government auditors, and communicate with executive team on any issues.
  • Support Development team with proformas, disclosure statements, building closings, and manage changes.
  • Collaborate with executive team and review the procurement of assets and sales, construction and lease contracts.
  • Responsible for accounting & reporting (internal & external) for all group affiliated companies.
  • Assist Principals to negotiate and secure all bank financing for acquisitions development and construction projects.
  • Prepare and analyze cash flow projections, budgets, and forecasts.
  • Review calculations, procurement of assets and sales, construction & lease contracts.
  • Preparation of long–range business plans including projections of taxable income, cash flow and capital projections.
  • Tenant Management and leasing.
  • Responsible for year-end audits for group of companies, internal controls and annual corporate budgets.
  • Other duties as required
 
Director, Finance requirements:
  • Professional designation in Accounting/Finance.
  • 5-7 years of progressive financial responsibility and solid real estate development experience required
  • Strong management skills, ability to influence and engage direct and indirect reports and peers.
  • Self-reliant, good problem solver, results-oriented.
  • Energetic, flexible, collaborative, proactive; a team leader who can positively and productively impact both strategic and tactical finance and administration initiatives.
  • Exceptional written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills and the ability to effectively interface with senior management and external clients.
  • Ability to operate as an effective tactical as well as strategic thinker.
  • Expertise with new and current market development requirements
 
Vice President, Finance Similar Job Titles: 
Director, Finance
Senior Director Finance
Finance Director
Real Estate Finance
Chief Financial Officer
CFO

title: Assistant Controller
description:
Our client a publicly-traded company is looking for a BILINGUAL assistant controller that will be involved in every piece of the accounting cycle. As the assistant controller, you will be involved in the daily accounting tasks, the monthly forecasting, the annual budget, and many other great tasks. If you have good communication skills, are solutions-minded, and not afraid to get hands-on. Then this is for you.


Advantages
Salary in line with your experience + benefits
2 -3 weeks’ vacation
Work on-site required (travel between Ottawa and Gatineau a must)


Responsibilities
Responsible for the monthly financial close function and the preparation of the financial statements
Responsible for the GL reconciliation
Analysis of the monthly projections
Explanations of budget variance analysis
Participate and plan the annual financial budget exercise
Overseas the capital purchase process
Implement and maintain required internal controls
Implement and maintain regular reporting processes to support operations
Coordinate and perform Inventory counts
Disseminate the necessary information to maintain proper internal control compliance and accounting procedures and facilitate financial performance review with other departments


Qualifications
Min. 2 years of experience in a similar role
Good communication skills in French and English.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Experience in a manufacturing or production environment is an asset
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, environment
Bachelor’s degree in accounting or equivalent


Summary
If this is interesting to you

Get in touch with us ASAP! Please send your resume directly alexander.masny@randstad.ca


All applications will be reviewed but only qualified candidates will be contacted. No candidates living outside of the greater Ottawa Area will be considered since you are expected to show up to work every day .

title: Business controller - Drives
description:
Business controller - DrivesTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Drive Products is a technology leader serving industries, infrastructure and machine builders with world-class drives and softstarters. With our products, global scale and local presence, we help our customers to improve energy efficiency, productivity and safety. Our people and culture are the foundation of our success. We all together make the difference for our customers every day.As a business controller, you will act as the business partner to the Motion business in Canada to monitor and optimize financial performance within an assigned area. Support effective business decisions by monitoring, analyzing, and interpreting financial data in order to evaluate various business alternatives and recommend the most appropriate business solutions. Reporting to the Business controller Motion.
Your responsibilities

  • Serving as the business partner for the Finance and Business Management.
  • Translating business strategy into plans and establishing measurable targets, evaluating the financial implications of various strategic decisions, identifying risks, and recommending actions.
  • Supporting the business in the coordination and preparation of monthly order reviews. Provides the necessary documentation.
  • Updating forecasted KPIs and timing of e.g. revenues, cash flows based on business development + cost to come i.e. margin expectation.
  • Assuring the correctness of the balance sheet and income statement of the respective business of responsibility as well as for cash flow and monthly/quarterly forecast.

  • Good, analytical decision-making and problem-solving skills as well as ability to quickly adapt changing situations and work under pressure.
  • Autonomy, rigor, ethics, flexibility, adaptability, persuasiveness.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office software applications and familiarity with SAP is a plus.
  • Fluent in English and French.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program

Also named as Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Top Employers, Canada's Top Employers for Young People, and Best Candidate Experience Award (CandE Award), ABB's culture and commitment are to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. title: Project Controller
description:
Please note that this position is based in Rivière-du-Loup (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.  

Vous avez envie de prendre part à des projets d’envergure afin de transformer nos processus de développement organisationnels? Vous avez de l’intérêt pour les technologies 4.0 vous intéressent? Vous avez même un petit côté « geek »? Voici l’offre que vous attendiez!

  • Assurer une vision globale et suivre de près les échéanciers, les budgets et les ressources des différents projets en cours
  • Documenter les enjeux, les réunions de suivi et les demandes de changement
  • Produire des rapports afin de compiler des données tout au long de la réalisation du projet
  • Coordonner la planification de projets
  • Relayer l’information pertinente à l’ensemble des parties prenantes
  • Agir à titre de mentor auprès des chargés projets et les accompagner dans la gestion des risques
  • Créer les plans de projets, puis faire la gestion des ressources
  • Optimiser la planification en anticipant les impacts et en revoyant les séquences de projets – au besoin

Compétences requises

  • Rigueur – vous avez une bonne vision d’ensemble et aucun détail ne vous échappe
  • Stratège

Votre futur environnement de travail

title: Vice President, Finance
description:
Vice President, Finance
Real Estate Development
Vancouver, BC

Our client, an established Real Estate Developer, is seeking a Vice President, Finance to join their Executive Team. The Vice President, Finance will report to the CFO and assume a strategic role in the overall financial management of the company. The position will have primary day-to-day responsibility for planning, implementing, managing and controlling all financial-related activities of the company. This will include direct responsibility for accounting, finance, forecasting, strategic planning, job costing, legal, deal analysis and negotiations, investor relationships and partnership compliance and private and institutional financing.

Vice President, Financeduties:
  • Oversee business operations which include setting up reporting systems, implementing internal controls and systems procedures, new project evaluation, project closing and funding, cash flow management, payables/receivables, processes and policies.
  • Responsible for the supervision, guidance and overall smooth operations of the Accounting Department.
  • Provide support and advice to the Principals of the company on various business issues including strategy, financing, and acquisitions.
  • Liaise and manage relationship with business partners, accounting firms, law firms, banks, external auditors, insurers and realtors, government auditors, and communicate with executive team on any issues.
  • Support Development team with proformas, disclosure statements, building closings, and manage changes.
  • Collaborate with executive team and review the procurement of assets and sales, construction and lease contracts.
  • Responsible for accounting & reporting (internal & external) for all group affiliated companies.
  • Assist Principals to negotiate and secure all bank financing for acquisitions development and construction projects.
  • Prepare and analyze cash flow projections, budgets, and forecasts.
  • Review calculations, procurement of assets and sales, construction & lease contracts.
  • Preparation of long–range business plans including projections of taxable income, cash flow and capital projections.
  • Tenant Management and leasing.
  • Responsible for year-end audits for group of companies, internal controls and annual corporate budgets.
  • Other duties as required

Director, Financerequirements:
  • Professional designation in Accounting/Finance.
  • 5-7 years of progressive financial responsibility and solid real estate development experience required
  • Strong management skills, ability to influence and engage direct and indirect reports and peers.
  • Self-reliant, good problem solver, results-oriented.
  • Energetic, flexible, collaborative, proactive; a team leader who can positively and productively impact both strategic and tactical finance and administration initiatives.
  • Exceptional written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills and the ability to effectively interface with senior management and external clients.
  • Ability to operate as an effective tactical as well as strategic thinker.
  • Expertise with new and current market development requirements

Vice President, Finance Similar Job Titles:
Director, Finance
Senior Director Finance
Finance Director
Real Estate Finance
Chief Financial Officer
CFO

Interested?
Apply below

Only applicants with the legal right to work in Canada can be considered for this opportunity.
We thank all those who express interest in this opportunity however only those short-listed we be contacted.

title: CFO, Infrastructure
description:
Our client, a well-regarded Investment and Asset Manager, with a long and successful track record in Canada and globally, are on a growth and succession plan. They provide a broad range of traditional and alternative investment products and services and have been an investor and owner of infrastructure assets for over 15 years.

Due to planned growth and opportunity, they are currently searching for an experienced VP Finance or newly appointed CFO to step into their CFO Infrastructure role. The role is an exciting opportunity to lead the Infrastructure accounting team, working closely and collaboratively with the Infrastructure investments and asset management teams. Manage a high performing accounting team which is expected to grow as the portfolio of assets continues to grow, providing coaching and mentoring to further develop their skills and careers.

This is a key and pivotal role as the CFO will be deeply engaged in supporting the investment team in their transaction process through onboarding and offboarding investments. Set up new organizational structures including cross-border and international tax structures and provide insights on the tax consequences to investors and stakeholders. Engage in tax planning, working with external advisors in multiple jurisdictions, tax reporting and respond to queries from tax authorities. Manage the infrastructure budget process, cash flows and recommend distribution decisions impacting projects at various stages of development. With a deep understanding of projects under development in a complex environment, prepare and review financial statements, stay current on current accounting treatments for transactions, manage the treasury function, review loan and cash flow agreements, review NAV calculations for all investment vehicles and audit multiple entities annually.

In order to be considered for this role, you will possess the following:
  • CPA, CA Designation
  • 10+ years of progressive experience required, in a leadership role managing a high performing team
  • Industry background from infrastructure/renewables/project or asset management industry with infrastructure assets required,  coupled with audit/assurance in a public accounting firm
  • Experience with IFRS and ASPE especially as they relate to investment funds, unitized investment vehicles and operating infrastructure projects
  • Tax compliance and tax planning knowledge, preferably involving the use of partnerships/infrastructure/renewable energy. Cross-border and international tax structuring for infrastructure investments an asset
  • Experience from a complex and technical project environment required, experience with transactions and deals and related capital raising, financial modeling, valuation calculations and financial reporting
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills required, collaborative and team player with the ability to build deep and trusting relationships
  • A “get it done” attitude, roll up your sleeves and lead from the front leadership style
  • Strong attention to detail, results and deadline driven with a problem-solving mindset
This is an exceptional opportunity for a career-oriented Finance & Accounting professional where technical and business opportunities and challenges will arise frequently, in a fast paced and high growth environment. Take on a key and pivotal role as an executive leader as the firm continues its global infrastructure expansion.
Please apply directly in confidence.

title: Valuation & Advisory Vice President
description:
Our Story

About You:

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

 

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

 

About Us:

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

 

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

 

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

 

Overview

The Vice President will work on our Valuation & Advisory Services team to mentor our junior staff, produce appraisal reports, consulting studies and portfolio valuations.  Working alongside our market leaders, you will build relationships with clients, develop growth opportunities, and use the Company’s advanced internal technology platforms to enhance your appraisal reports.

Responsibilities

  • Independently prepare and sign off on appraisal reports to clients.
  • Provide consistent mentorship, guidance and feedback to Valuation Associates and Senior Appraisers.
  • Model cash flows using ARGUS Enterprise.
  • Property inspections as needed.
  • Client relationship management on an ongoing basis.
  • Ability to summarize data and provide analysis of market trends and future forecast and any considerations for the Valuation & Advisory business operation
  • Work with market leaders to develop new business opportunities and prepare presentations for clients.
  • Any other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Qualifications

  • Education - Minimum of a 4-year university degree in a relevant functional area including Bachelor of Commerce or MBA or similar, etc.
  • Experience – 7+ years of related work experience. Experience managing people and teams is an asset. 
  • AACI Designation, in good standing with the Appraisal Institute of Canada.
  • Must be proficient in Argus, MS Word and MS Excel.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the market, appraisal process and commercial real estate industry.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to write reports, effective oral and written communication skills, and an aptitude for continuous learning.
  • Ability to self-motivate and effectively manage competing priorities while providing excellent support to clients with an uncompromised high caliber work product.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and provide leadership to junior members to ensure Valuation and Advisory team goals are achieved.
  • Effectively and tactfully handling difficult or sensitive issues.
  • Respect the confidentiality of clients and information.

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.  We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. 

 

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

 

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. 

 

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: Controller
description:
Location: Winnipeg, MB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 2/18/2022Job ID: 9A159669218Category: Accounting & Finance
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered up with a very important client to assist them in sourcing quality candidates for a Controller in Humboldt, SK. 

The Controller position is very important to the short- and long-term success of the organization, as well as its strategic plan. Reporting to the CFO, this business partner will lead the finance function, with a focus on excellence and always keeping the customer’s needs at the forefront. n outlined in the strategic plan.

The Role:
  • Oversee accounting, financial and banking functions, and processes
  • Collaborates with the CFO in the effective coordination of the annual budgeting process and the period forecasting updates
  • Establish and maintain the processes to meet deadlines in a timely manner.
  • Collaborate with the CFO in the development and preparation of internal management reports and Audit and Finance and Board of Director reports.
  • Subject matter expert on financial systems and the interfaces impacting the flow of financial information throughout the organization
  • Delivery of custom reports required to support the needs of key business partners
  • Preparation of statistical reports required by various governmental organizations
  • Developing a relationship with the external auditor is critical, along with the effective delivery of audit requirements on an annual basis
  • Act as a key finance business partner throughout the organization
  • Collaborate with the CFO to ensure that ad hoc requests are supported through the organization

The Ideal Candidate:

Key Competencies:
  • Technical Accounting Leadership
  • An experienced finance and accounting professional who is strong in financial accounting, analytics, and controlling.
  • An ability to understand financial systems and to ensure that the accounting is performed correctly as designed.
  • A familiarity with PSAB and be trained and understand GAAP and have the ability to apply technical accounting skills to meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite of products and particular proficiency in the utilization of spreadsheets.
  • A demonstrated track record of driving operational excellence, top-tier service delivery, continuous improvement and innovation, accountability, and the associated team culture.
People Leadership:
  • Experience in leading people would be a benefit. Well-developed skills in coaching, mentoring and developing technical and leadership skills will maximize the benefits to the organization.
  • A champion of best people, practices, systems, and processes. Safety- and process-oriented, with the ability to apply and implement this in a consulting environment.
  • A proven ability to lead, motivate, engage and empower teams in the development and execution of operating plans and activities that are aligned with the broader strategic plan.
Project Leadership:
  • Business and financial acumen, coupled with strong performance measurement and metrics management orientation and well-developed analytical, budgeting, and business planning skills.
Interpersonal Leadership:
  • Strong communication (written, oral, presentation) skills with the ability to comfortably and effectively engage at a variety of levels and with a range of audiences. A particular strength in communicating accounting concepts and explaining the results of analytics.
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build collaborative relationships with key stakeholders (internally and externally) and with all levels of management and staff, industry partners and colleagues, and others.
  • Leadership skills as demonstrated through a reputation of credibility and integrity in the field; problem-solving abilities; an understanding of team dynamics and how to manage them; and the ability to successfully organize and execute on multiple competing priorities.
Education and Experience:
  • Commerce or Administration degree with a specialization in Accounting
  • A CPA designation is preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of experience within a similar position

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
The traditional supply chain system is woefully inadequate and too expensive to support individual customized items packed and shipped to the customer in real-time. Our client is revolutionizing the global supply chain, fulfillment and warehousing industry. They set out to solve the fundamental problem of how to meet online consumer demand and expectations for next-day or same-day fulfillment and delivery.

Our client is looking for a trusted advisor and business partner to be a key member of the senior management team. Being both hands-on and strategic, the CFO will focus on the growth of the company, the capital structure required to fund capital investments and support business initiatives. A CFO wears many different hats and this role will require exactly that.

The staples of a CFO role apply as well - overseeing all fiscal and fiduciary financial responsibilities; including accounting and financial statement accuracy; budgeting and forecasting; treasury; tax compliance and strategy; credit and enterprise risk; and investor relations. However, the main focus will be on directly supporting the CEO to make the right short and long-term decisions, work with the Board of Directors, current and future investors, and initiate new fundraising opportunities. You will challenge stakeholders to innovate and think strategically.
 
Key responsibilities include:
  • Effectively communicate and convey the company’s value and financial performance to internal and external stakeholders 
  • Evaluating potential acquisitions and other business ventures in order to effectively assess risk and return
  • Guide and lead the business through fundraising opportunities
  • Developing and executing the overall financial strategy ensuring it aligns with the company’s strategic goals. 
  • Overseeing financial systems and procedures and establishing strong financial discipline across the organization.  
Essential to success in this position are:
  • 10 or more years of experience in a leadership position; at least 5 years of CFO experience in a fast paced, growing company. 
  • Experience with complex financing instruments, including equity and convertible notes. 
  • Executive presence and credibility with peers and senior management. 
  • Communicates effectively at all levels - someone who speaks to the business, not just the numbers
  • Extensive experience in working with investors and Company Board of Directors to ensure transparency and alignment of objectives/strategy 
  • Demonstrated ability to lead across the company while influencing and motivating in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • Develops and builds talent and high-performing teams through mentoring, feedback and professional development. 
  • Experience with M&A activities preferred
Having worked in fast growing companies in both mid-sized and larger business environments, particularly in the tech sector is definitely an asset.

Location is not a factor, however the successful candidate must be willing to travel to a major Canadian city once a month.

If the opportunity to play a key role in expanding the global reach of this exciting company is appealing, please email me (dberger@farbergroup.com) or apply directly and in confidence to this posting.

title: Valuation & Advisory Vice President
description:
Our Story

About You:

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

 

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

 

About Us:

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

 

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

 

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

 

 

Overview

The Vice President will work on our Valuation & Advisory Services team to mentor our junior staff, produce appraisal reports, consulting studies and portfolio valuations.  Working alongside our market leaders, you will build relationships with clients, develop growth opportunities, and use the Company’s advanced internal technology platforms to enhance your appraisal reports.

Responsibilities

  • Independently prepare and sign off on appraisal reports to clients.
  • Provide consistent mentorship, guidance and feedback to Valuation Associates and Senior Appraisers.
  • Model cash flows using ARGUS Enterprise.
  • Property inspections as needed.
  • Client relationship management on an ongoing basis.
  • Ability to summarize data and provide analysis of market trends and future forecast and any considerations for the Valuation & Advisory business operation
  • Work with market leaders to develop new business opportunities and prepare presentations for clients.
  • Any other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Qualifications

  • Education - Minimum of a 4-year university degree in a relevant functional area including Bachelor of Commerce or MBA or similar, etc.
  • Experience – 7+ years of related work experience. Experience managing people and teams is an asset. 
  • AACI Designation, in good standing with the Appraisal Institute of Canada.
  • Must be proficient in MS Office
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the market, appraisal process and commercial real estate industry.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to write reports, effective oral and written communication skills, and an aptitude for continuous learning.
  • Ability to self-motivate and effectively manage competing priorities while providing excellent support to clients with an uncompromised high caliber work product.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and provide leadership to junior members to ensure Valuation and Advisory team goals are achieved.
  • Effectively and tactfully handling difficult or sensitive issues.
  • Respect the confidentiality of clients and information.

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.  We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. 

 

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

 

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. 

 

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!
