title: Financial Controller
description:
Randstad Staffing is currently looking for experienced Financial Controllers to join some of Winnipeg's top firms and companies!
We have partnered up with several great companies that are looking for you!

Do you have your CPA designation? Do you have a minimum of 5 years of experience as an Accountant (public or private practice)? Are you familiar with all aspects of full-cycle accounting and have a passion for numbers?
Are you a problem solver, can think outside the box and have an analytical mind?
Does financial reporting excite you? Do you have great leadership skills and enjoy working as part of a team?
Are you looking to take the next step in your career?

If this sounds like you, reach out to us today!

All applications are fully confidential and you can think of us as your sports agent - we would love to connect with you and help you grow your career!

Advantages
- Competitive compensation - depending on experience
- Opportunity to work with some of Winnipeg's top companies and accounting firms
- Great company culture
- Monday - Friday daytime hours - Work from home opportunities may be available
- Great benefit packages are available
- Potential growth opportunity

Responsibilities
- Financial reporting
- Oversee and lead a team of accountants and staff
- Full-cycle accounting functions
- Communication with internal and external stakeholders
- Analysis and creation of financial reports
- Other finance and accounting duties as assigned


Qualifications
- Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or related field
- CPA designation is required
- 5+ years of experience as an accountant in public or private practice
- Outstanding communication, interpersonal and leadership skills
- Superior understanding of general accounting principles
- Great computer skills (MS Office, Excel and other computerized accounting systems)
- High attention to detail and ability to work in a deadline-driven environment

Summary
All information and resumes received will be treated with strict confidentiality!


Ways to apply:

- Apply directly on this site
- Go to our website at www.randstad.ca, create a profile and apply directly
- Email your resume to lena.vincent@randstad.ca and include the title of the position in the subject line.


At this time we are no longer accepting walk-in candidates to our office as it is closed due to COVID-19. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to hearing from you soon!

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position and only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Controller
description:
Location: Saskatoon, SK, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 2/18/2022Job ID: 9A159669218Category: Accounting & Finance
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered up with a very important client to assist them in sourcing quality candidates for a Controller in Humboldt, SK. 

The Controller position is very important to the short- and long-term success of the organization, as well as its strategic plan. Reporting to the CFO, this business partner will lead the finance function, with a focus on excellence and always keeping the customer’s needs at the forefront. n outlined in the strategic plan.

The Role:
  • Oversee accounting, financial and banking functions, and processes
  • Collaborates with the CFO in the effective coordination of the annual budgeting process and the period forecasting updates
  • Establish and maintain the processes to meet deadlines in a timely manner.
  • Collaborate with the CFO in the development and preparation of internal management reports and Audit and Finance and Board of Director reports.
  • Subject matter expert on financial systems and the interfaces impacting the flow of financial information throughout the organization
  • Delivery of custom reports required to support the needs of key business partners
  • Preparation of statistical reports required by various governmental organizations
  • Developing a relationship with the external auditor is critical, along with the effective delivery of audit requirements on an annual basis
  • Act as a key finance business partner throughout the organization
  • Collaborate with the CFO to ensure that ad hoc requests are supported through the organization

The Ideal Candidate:

Key Competencies:
  • Technical Accounting Leadership
  • An experienced finance and accounting professional who is strong in financial accounting, analytics, and controlling.
  • An ability to understand financial systems and to ensure that the accounting is performed correctly as designed.
  • A familiarity with PSAB and be trained and understand GAAP and have the ability to apply technical accounting skills to meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite of products and particular proficiency in the utilization of spreadsheets.
  • A demonstrated track record of driving operational excellence, top-tier service delivery, continuous improvement and innovation, accountability, and the associated team culture.
People Leadership:
  • Experience in leading people would be a benefit. Well-developed skills in coaching, mentoring and developing technical and leadership skills will maximize the benefits to the organization.
  • A champion of best people, practices, systems, and processes. Safety- and process-oriented, with the ability to apply and implement this in a consulting environment.
  • A proven ability to lead, motivate, engage and empower teams in the development and execution of operating plans and activities that are aligned with the broader strategic plan.
Project Leadership:
  • Business and financial acumen, coupled with strong performance measurement and metrics management orientation and well-developed analytical, budgeting, and business planning skills.
Interpersonal Leadership:
  • Strong communication (written, oral, presentation) skills with the ability to comfortably and effectively engage at a variety of levels and with a range of audiences. A particular strength in communicating accounting concepts and explaining the results of analytics.
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build collaborative relationships with key stakeholders (internally and externally) and with all levels of management and staff, industry partners and colleagues, and others.
  • Leadership skills as demonstrated through a reputation of credibility and integrity in the field; problem-solving abilities; an understanding of team dynamics and how to manage them; and the ability to successfully organize and execute on multiple competing priorities.
Education and Experience:
  • Commerce or Administration degree with a specialization in Accounting
  • A CPA designation is preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of experience within a similar position

If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Angela Degelman, Director and Managing Consultant. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-DNP #IND-DNP

WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.

If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian-owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, over four decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!

Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.

ABB Marine & Ports supplies world-leading technologies that are driving the evolution of sustainable shipping. Electrical propulsion, data-driven decision support and integrated solutions for ship and shore from ABB are paving the way to a zero-emission marine industry, providing greater efficiency and reliability to shipowners, and preparing vessels to meet the demands of tomorrow. Our automation and electrical solutions are making port and terminal operations safer, greener and more productive. ABB Marine & Ports operates in 26 countries and has 2,000 employees. www.abb.com/marineProviding input in negotiations on commercial issues as well as during the risk review process, you will play a key role in financial control, assisting the Tender Manager in the PAMP/PA, PG 7713/7711/7709 in United States, Canada, Americas region.Reporting to the PAMP Americas Region Controller, you will give input on the financial aspects of project execution plans, and help to prepare project invoices and financial accounting and reporting.
Your responsibilities

  • Optimizing project cash flow, revenues and GM while keeping project balance sheets, income statements and monthly/quarterly forecasts accurate
  • Helping to identify opportunities and risks, and monitoring mitigation actions to ensure timely implementation
  • Ensuring alignment with other functions, including project controls and planning/scheduling
  • Providing help in claim management, currency risk, tax issues, bonds, back charges, insurance cases, and monitoring proper follow-up
  • Helping to ensure adherence to corporate governance, rules and regulation, guidelines, and instructions.
  • Responsible for closing and facilitating the booking of journal entries, analysis, and completion of internal controls in line with defined standards and financial closing.
  • Administer a variety of financial activities and monitor financial transactions in accordance with generally accepted accounting practices (US GAAP)
  • Drive and co-ordinate project reviews per local policies, to ensure project financials are correct and aligned with project controls.

Your background
  • 12 years of experience in project controlling and project management with a bachelor's degree in accounting or finance
  • Experience of computerized accounting systems and financial reporting software, must have SAP experience
  • Drive finance digitalization to improve efficiency and processes.
  • Outstanding attention to detail, accuracy, and the ability to multitask
  • A team-based, solution-focused approach and strong written and verbal communication skills
  • English is a required language skill
  • Current Canadian VISA/work permit valid in Montreal, Canada.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Controller
description:
Location: Halifax, NS, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 2/18/2022Job ID: 9A159669218Category: Accounting & Finance
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered up with a very important client to assist them in sourcing quality candidates for a Controller in Humboldt, SK. 

The Controller position is very important to the short- and long-term success of the organization, as well as its strategic plan. Reporting to the CFO, this business partner will lead the finance function, with a focus on excellence and always keeping the customer’s needs at the forefront. n outlined in the strategic plan.

The Role:
  • Oversee accounting, financial and banking functions, and processes
  • Collaborates with the CFO in the effective coordination of the annual budgeting process and the period forecasting updates
  • Establish and maintain the processes to meet deadlines in a timely manner.
  • Collaborate with the CFO in the development and preparation of internal management reports and Audit and Finance and Board of Director reports.
  • Subject matter expert on financial systems and the interfaces impacting the flow of financial information throughout the organization
  • Delivery of custom reports required to support the needs of key business partners
  • Preparation of statistical reports required by various governmental organizations
  • Developing a relationship with the external auditor is critical, along with the effective delivery of audit requirements on an annual basis
  • Act as a key finance business partner throughout the organization
  • Collaborate with the CFO to ensure that ad hoc requests are supported through the organization

The Ideal Candidate:

Key Competencies:
  • Technical Accounting Leadership
  • An experienced finance and accounting professional who is strong in financial accounting, analytics, and controlling.
  • An ability to understand financial systems and to ensure that the accounting is performed correctly as designed.
  • A familiarity with PSAB and be trained and understand GAAP and have the ability to apply technical accounting skills to meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite of products and particular proficiency in the utilization of spreadsheets.
  • A demonstrated track record of driving operational excellence, top-tier service delivery, continuous improvement and innovation, accountability, and the associated team culture.
People Leadership:
  • Experience in leading people would be a benefit. Well-developed skills in coaching, mentoring and developing technical and leadership skills will maximize the benefits to the organization.
  • A champion of best people, practices, systems, and processes. Safety- and process-oriented, with the ability to apply and implement this in a consulting environment.
  • A proven ability to lead, motivate, engage and empower teams in the development and execution of operating plans and activities that are aligned with the broader strategic plan.
Project Leadership:
  • Business and financial acumen, coupled with strong performance measurement and metrics management orientation and well-developed analytical, budgeting, and business planning skills.
Interpersonal Leadership:
  • Strong communication (written, oral, presentation) skills with the ability to comfortably and effectively engage at a variety of levels and with a range of audiences. A particular strength in communicating accounting concepts and explaining the results of analytics.
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build collaborative relationships with key stakeholders (internally and externally) and with all levels of management and staff, industry partners and colleagues, and others.
  • Leadership skills as demonstrated through a reputation of credibility and integrity in the field; problem-solving abilities; an understanding of team dynamics and how to manage them; and the ability to successfully organize and execute on multiple competing priorities.
Education and Experience:
  • Commerce or Administration degree with a specialization in Accounting
  • A CPA designation is preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of experience within a similar position

If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Angela Degelman, Director and Managing Consultant. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-DNP #IND-DNP

title: Valuation & Advisory Vice President
description:
Our Story

About You:

You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

 

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

 

About Us:

Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

 

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

 

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

 

 

Overview

The Vice President will work on our Valuation & Advisory Services team to mentor our junior staff, produce appraisal reports, consulting studies and portfolio valuations.  Working alongside our market leaders, you will build relationships with clients, develop growth opportunities, and use the Company’s advanced internal technology platforms to enhance your appraisal reports.

Responsibilities

  • Independently prepare and sign off on appraisal reports to clients.
  • Provide consistent mentorship, guidance and feedback to Valuation Associates and Senior Appraisers.
  • Model cash flows using ARGUS Enterprise.
  • Property inspections as needed.
  • Client relationship management on an ongoing basis.
  • Ability to summarize data and provide analysis of market trends and future forecast and any considerations for the Valuation & Advisory business operation
  • Work with market leaders to develop new business opportunities and prepare presentations for clients.
  • Any other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Qualifications

  • Education - Minimum of a 4-year university degree in a relevant functional area including Bachelor of Commerce or MBA or similar, etc.
  • Experience – 7+ years of related work experience. Experience managing people and teams is an asset. 
  • AACI Designation, in good standing with the Appraisal Institute of Canada.
  • Must be proficient in Argus, MS Word and MS Excel.
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the market, appraisal process and commercial real estate industry.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to write reports, effective oral and written communication skills, and an aptitude for continuous learning.
  • Ability to self-motivate and effectively manage competing priorities while providing excellent support to clients with an uncompromised high caliber work product.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and provide leadership to junior members to ensure Valuation and Advisory team goals are achieved.
  • Effectively and tactfully handling difficult or sensitive issues.
  • Respect the confidentiality of clients and information.

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.  We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. 

 

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

 

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. 

 

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: Controller
description:
Randstad Staffing is currently looking for an experienced Controller to join a busy pharmaceutical company in the south of Winnipeg.
The successful candidate will directly report to the Chief Financial Officer and is responsible for all aspects of financial reporting.

Do you have your CPA designation as well as a Bachelor of Commerce degree? Do you have previous Controller experience in a publically traded company? Do you enjoy financial reporting and juggling with numbers?
Do you have great leadership experience and like working with people? Do you have high attention to detail and are able to meet tight deadlines?
Are you a problem solver with an analytical mind who can think outside the box? Do you have experience with business operations in the US?


If this sounds like you, reach out to us today!

Advantages
- Competitive compensation - depending on experience
- Generous vacation time
- Monday - Friday daytime hours with flexibility
- Positive dynamic work environment with growth opportunities
- Great benefits package available with 75% of premiums paid by the employer

- Free parking on site

- Financial analysis

title: Controller
description:
Location: Mississauga, ON, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 2/18/2022Job ID: 9A159669218Category: Accounting & Finance
David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered up with a very important client to assist them in sourcing quality candidates for a Controller in Humboldt, SK. 

The Controller position is very important to the short- and long-term success of the organization, as well as its strategic plan. Reporting to the CFO, this business partner will lead the finance function, with a focus on excellence and always keeping the customer’s needs at the forefront. n outlined in the strategic plan.

The Role:
  • Oversee accounting, financial and banking functions, and processes
  • Collaborates with the CFO in the effective coordination of the annual budgeting process and the period forecasting updates
  • Establish and maintain the processes to meet deadlines in a timely manner.
  • Collaborate with the CFO in the development and preparation of internal management reports and Audit and Finance and Board of Director reports.
  • Subject matter expert on financial systems and the interfaces impacting the flow of financial information throughout the organization
  • Delivery of custom reports required to support the needs of key business partners
  • Preparation of statistical reports required by various governmental organizations
  • Developing a relationship with the external auditor is critical, along with the effective delivery of audit requirements on an annual basis
  • Act as a key finance business partner throughout the organization
  • Collaborate with the CFO to ensure that ad hoc requests are supported through the organization

The Ideal Candidate:

Key Competencies:
  • Technical Accounting Leadership
  • An experienced finance and accounting professional who is strong in financial accounting, analytics, and controlling.
  • An ability to understand financial systems and to ensure that the accounting is performed correctly as designed.
  • A familiarity with PSAB and be trained and understand GAAP and have the ability to apply technical accounting skills to meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite of products and particular proficiency in the utilization of spreadsheets.
  • A demonstrated track record of driving operational excellence, top-tier service delivery, continuous improvement and innovation, accountability, and the associated team culture.
People Leadership:
  • Experience in leading people would be a benefit. Well-developed skills in coaching, mentoring and developing technical and leadership skills will maximize the benefits to the organization.
  • A champion of best people, practices, systems, and processes. Safety- and process-oriented, with the ability to apply and implement this in a consulting environment.
  • A proven ability to lead, motivate, engage and empower teams in the development and execution of operating plans and activities that are aligned with the broader strategic plan.
Project Leadership:
  • Business and financial acumen, coupled with strong performance measurement and metrics management orientation and well-developed analytical, budgeting, and business planning skills.
Interpersonal Leadership:
  • Strong communication (written, oral, presentation) skills with the ability to comfortably and effectively engage at a variety of levels and with a range of audiences. A particular strength in communicating accounting concepts and explaining the results of analytics.
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build collaborative relationships with key stakeholders (internally and externally) and with all levels of management and staff, industry partners and colleagues, and others.
  • Leadership skills as demonstrated through a reputation of credibility and integrity in the field; problem-solving abilities; an understanding of team dynamics and how to manage them; and the ability to successfully organize and execute on multiple competing priorities.
Education and Experience:
  • Commerce or Administration degree with a specialization in Accounting
  • A CPA designation is preferred
  • Minimum 5 years of experience within a similar position

If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Angela Degelman, Director and Managing Consultant. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-DNP #IND-DNP

title: Contrôleur - Ventes et Planification des Opérations
description:
Contrôleur - Ventes et Planification des Opérations
80K à 100K + Bonus
Poste permanent
Rive-sud de Montréal
Grande entreprise manufacturière

Vous êtes à la recherche d'un poste de Contrôleur en milieu corporatif ? Vous aimeriez vous joindre à une grande entreprise Québécoise ? Vous aimeriez trouver un emploi sur la Rive-sud de Montréal ? Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un Contrôleur - Ventes et Planification des Opérations pour une grande entreprise Québécoise dont le bureau corporatif est situé sur la Rive-Sud de Montréal. L'entreprise vous offrira un environnement dynamique, en évolution. Des conditions très compétitives sur le marché et des possibilités de carrière à long terme.

Avantages
Conditions liées au poste:

- Salaire: 80K à 100K selon expérience
- Système de bonification
- Horaire flexible, Horaire d'été
- Assurances collectives complètes et adaptée à vos besoins
- Possibilité de télétravail
- Plan de retraite
- Gym sur place
- Cotisation CPA et formation continue
- Plan pour activités sportives payées
- Plan de partage aux profits

Responsabilités
En tant que Contrôleur Corporatif - Ventes, les principales responsabilités seront:

- Agir comme personne ressource pour la direction en matière de production et d'analyse de l’information financière
- Gestion des volets S&OP (''Sales and Operation Planning'')
- Analyse les résultats au niveau Transport, Entreposage et Sous-traitance
- Assurer le suivi du processus S&OP mensuel
- Analyse des différents scénarios potentiels pour les décisions S&OP
- Mise en place de processus et d'initiatives pour le contrôle des coûts
- Suivi et valorisation des inventaires
- Mise à jour et amélioration des processus associés au S&OP
- Supervise et dirige les opérations de son équipe

Qualifications
Possédez-vous les compétences requises ?

- BAC en comptabilité ou domaine connexe
- Titre CPA (atout important)
- 5 à 7 ans d’expérience en milieu corporatif
- Bilingue
- Bonne connaissance de la Suite Office (Excel) et SAP (un atout)
- Connaissance de Power BI (un atout)

Sommaire
Merci de postuler pour ce poste de Contrôleur. Nous examinerons votre demande et nous vous contacterons rapidement si votre profil correspond à nos critères.

Communiquez Eric Pelletier pour discuter de ce rôle au 514.476.6961 ou eric.pelletier@randstad.ca

À propos de Randstad

De nos jours, les entreprises comme les services doivent faire face à une pression sans cesse grandissante pour continuer à rendre des comptes en matière de gouvernance, tandis que les demandeurs d'emploi sont confrontés aux défis du nouveau monde de l'emploi. La situation est tout aussi complexe pour ce qui est de la reddition de comptes envers les gouvernements, les actionnaires et les clients. Les spécialistes en finances et en comptabilité, armés de leur formation ciblée et leur expérience à des postes de créneaux précis – des commis et des représentants du service aux analystes financiers, comptables techniques et cadres dirigeants –, sont tout indiqués pour assurer cette obligation de rendre compte.

Le service Finance et comptabilité de Randstad procure des solutions intégrées en matière de ressources humaines et de placement temporaire et permanent dans l’industrie des services financiers, des finances et de la comptabilité, et agit comme un pont entre les candidats hautement qualifiés et leurs futurs employeurs. Depuis des années, nous trouvons des professionnels hautement qualifiés en finance et en comptabilité qui permettent aux entreprises et aux institutions d’améliorer leurs résultats, de gérer les changements, de créer de la richesse et d’orienter les activités.

Le service Finance et comptabilité de Randstad est le seul fournisseur de travailleurs possédant les compétences en finance et en comptabilité dont vous avez besoin. Que vous soyez à la recherche d’une main-d’œuvre souple pour répondre aux augmentations saisonnières de la charge de travail, de solutions intégrées en matière de ressources humaines pour le recrutement et la gestion des talents à long terme ou des meilleurs spécialistes pour un poste important, notre équipe de consultants chevronnés et dévoués vous aidera à atteindre vos objectifs

title: Controller
description:
Our Client a national retailer is in the process of searching for an interim Controller to partner with their business for 10 months. This organization is a leading technology provider to businesses, government agencies, and consumers across the world.

If you are looking to join a global company as a controller keep reading!

Advantages


Randstad finance & accounting is unique among recruitment firms. We say that with confidence born of success and a steadfast, non-negotiable value proposition from which all our decisions are made. Everything we do is a result of our expertise, entrepreneurial spirit, and commitment to recruitment excellence.


We will reach out to the chosen professionals, please apply and submit your resume to jonathan.beeson@randstad.ca, stephen.jabez@randstad.ca, and divya.shukla@randstad.ca


Responsibilities

-Oversee a division of the business, leading the day to day accounting activities
-Report monthly financial results
-Investigate variances in budgets, reporting, internal controls, and general accounting; deploy measures to resolve variances
-Collects and compiles financial data at the business unit level
-A critical part of making decisions based on financial performance
-Interpret and analyze accounting information to ensure profitability, capital expenditures, and performance against budget are within established guidelines
-Prepare, monitor, and maintains policies and work instructions
-Prepares documentation, reporting and compliance with internal, external, and SOX audit teams
-Mentors staff, provide development and guidance
-

Qualifications

• MBA, business degree, or designation is required.
• ERP experience
• Manufacturing or retail or transferable industry experience
• Openness to get involved in projects, a self-starter
• Knowledge of SOX compliance
• Advanced Excel skills
• Foresight to drive change, innovative
• Management experience

We will reach out to the chosen professionals, please apply and submit your resume to jonathan.beeson@randstad.ca, stephen.jabez@randstad.ca, and divya.shukla@randstad.ca


Summary
Controller

Location: North York – Work from Home
Duration: 10 months
Compensation: 80-110.hour


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Contrôleur
description:
Nouveau poste : Contrôleur, grande entreprise dans l’industrie du transport, horaire hybride
Lieu: St-Simon-de-Bagot
Type : Permanent
Salaire: 75k
Horaire: 40h, horaire hybride, possibilité d’horaire réduit le Vendredi, horaire flexible
Début : Dès que possible

Grande entreprise dans l’industrie du transport ayant activités en Amérique du Nord. La personne recherchée devra être débrouillarde et avoir du leadership. Voici les avantages offerts pour ce poste situé à St-Simon-de-Bagot :


Avantages
La personne occupant le rôle de contrôleur (St-Simon-de Bagot) sélectionné profitera des avantages suivants :
• Horaire hybride
• Horaire flexible
• Possibilité de bonus selon la performance
• Possibilité de terminer plus tôt le Vendredi
• 3 semaines de vacances (dès l’embauche)
• Assurances collectives (dès l’embauche)
• REER avec possibilité de participation de l’employeur (dès l’embauche)
• Possibilité d’évolution de carrière


Responsabilités
Relevant du directeur de transport, la personne occupant le rôle de contrôleur (St-Simon-de-Bagot) aura sous sa supervision une équipe de 4-5 personnes. Voici les autres responsabilités du poste :

• Analyse des résultats financiers (hebdomadaires, mensuels et périodiques)
• Préparation et analyse des KPI et des rendements financiers
• Préparer les budgets
• Participer aux dossiers de fin d’année
• Préparer et faire le suivi des déboursés majeurs
• Préparer des documents pour le reporting
• Participer au comité de gestion
• Suivi des dépenses pour la loi 90
• Suivi des réclamations transporteurs
• Toutes autres tâches connexes


Qualifications
Le poste de contrôleur à St-Simon-de-Bagot requiert du leadership et une très bonne capacité d’adaptation. Ce rôle peut vous intéresser? Voici comment vous qualifier :

• 2-3 ans d’expérience dans un rôle similaire
• CPA ou en voie d’obtention
• BAC en science comptable
• Qui se débrouille bien en anglais
• Expérience dans le domaine du transport (un gros atout)
• Expérience avec un logiciel de type ERP (as-400, un gros atout)
• À l’aise avec la suite office (Excel principalement)
• Bonne capacité de communication, multitâches, bon sens des priorités, minutieux
• Autonomie, organisé, responsable, très à l’aise avec la technologie


Sommaire
Le poste de contrôleur peut vous intéresser? Il me fera plaisir de considérer votre candidature. Karl.sauthere@randstad.ca ou 514-434-6794.
Merci.

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
Location: Calgary, AB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 12/20/2021Job ID: 9S8480911220Category: Executive

The Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo region is a place like no other. It’s where a small-town feel is combined with extensive career opportunities, strong cultural diversity, family-orientated neighborhoods, world-class recreation facilities, and the natural beauty of the boreal forest.


The region is located within Treaty 8 Territory, the traditional lands of the Cree, Dene, and unceded territory of the Métis. Comprising of Fort McMurray, 9 rural communities, and 12 Indigenous communities, the diversity and rich cultures in the region are truly remarkable. We are committed to reconciliation and recognize our responsibility to understand our history so that we can honour the past, be aware of the present, and create a just and caring future for all.


Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo is a place for anyone and everyone to pursue opportunity together. With residents from all over the world, strengthened by a sense of resiliency, our community is a place where neighbours help neighbours, embrace differences, and honour the Indigenous heritage and traditions of the land. We are proud to call Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo home and serve the communities in which we live.  

Chief Financial Officer


The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) is responsible for directing the overall vision and holds overall responsibility for the Financial Services Department, which includes Financial Services, Information Technology, and Assessment. Reporting to the CAO, the CFO is responsible for all financial accounting and reporting, procedures internal controls, and effective risk management while planning the organization’s fiscal strategy in accordance with the Canada Revenue Agency and the Municipal Government Act. 


The ideal candidate will offer:

  • A university degree in Business Administration (Accounting).
  • Recognized Accounting Designation: Certified Personal Accountant (CPA), Certified General Accountant (CGA), Certified Management Accountant (CMA), or Chartered Accountant (CA).
  • Fifteen (15) years of progressive experience in Finance with a minimum of seven (7) years at a Senior Management level.
  • Experience working with both unionized and non-unionized employees.
  • Proven ability to empower, organize, and innovate in situations involving shifting priorities and rapid change.
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with managers, employees, leaders, bargaining agents, and external contracts in a manner that builds trust, credibility, and rapport.
  • Political awareness and sensitivity are essential. Sound knowledge of all aspects of municipal government is considered an asset.
  • A technical breadth of experience dealing with departmental issues and consultation practices to support the implementation of business strategies, goals, and objectives.
  • A valid Alberta Class Five (5) operator’s license is preferred as incumbent may be required to operate a personal or municipal vehicle for business use.#LI-DNP #IND-DNP


If you are an individual with proven experience who aspires to and is capable of providing innovative vision and strategic leadership in the role of Chief Financial Officer (CFO) for the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo, please contact:


Marcus Haccius, BA

Team Lead, Talent Delivery

mhaccius@aplin.com

Poste de Contrôleur Adjoint

Vous êtes prêts à relever de nouveaux défis ? Vous avez envie de travailler pour une entreprise reconnue dans son marché ? Vous carburez aux défis et vous avez envie d’avoir un équilibre travail-vie personnelle ? Cette opportunité est pour vous …

Sous la supervision de la directrice financière, nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne qui a un bon sens de l’analyse, de la rigueur, de l’autonomie et de bonnes aptitudes en communication.


Advantages
Le poste de Contrôleur Adjoint-Poste permanent comporte de nombreux avantages :

- Salaire compétitif et bonis de performance;
- 3 semaines de vacances;
- Club Social très actif;
- Assurances collectives complètes payées à 50% par l’employeur;
- RPDB avec cotisation de l’employeur de 2%;
- Horaire flexible de 40 heures par semaine (mode hybride);
- Équipe professionnelle, dynamique et grandissante;
- Grande possibilité de développement et de cheminement de carrière au sein de l’organisation;
- Entreprise avec une belle notoriété sur le marché.


Responsibilities
Les fonctions du Contrôleur Adjoint -Poste permanent-Québec sont très variées :

• Coordonner les activités relatives à la comptabilité et procéder aux écritures de fins de mois et de fin d’année;
• Effectuer différentes analyses financières;
• Participer à la préparation des états financiers;
• Implication au niveau de différents projets;
• Superviser le travail des techniciens comptables;
• Participer à la vérification de fin d’année;
• Participer aux processus d’amélioration continue;
• Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes en lien avec le secteur d’activité.


Qualifications
Le poste de Contrôleur Adjoint–Poste permanent nécessite les qualifications suivantes :

-BAA ou CPA;
-2 ans d’expérience minimum dans un rôle similaire;
-Anglais intermédiaire;
-Gestion d’équipe comptable;
-Leadership, autonomie et gestion des priorités sont des qualités recherchées.

description:

title: Plant Financial Controller
description:
Randstad, Canada's #1 Agency, is currently looking to fill a financial controller role in PEI. This is a permanent role .

Some important duties will include but are not limited to:
As the Plant Controller you will be responsible for planning and coordinating plant budget and business planning activities in alignment with corporate policies and practices. You will provide financial direction to the plant and provide recommendations to improve site performance.



Advantages
Full time permanent position
Competitive Salary
Full benefits
Flexible work environment


Responsibilities
• Manage and maintain the daily financial reporting of the plant from receiving to shipping and beyond.
• Prepare monthly and annual financial statements.
• Control the distribution of Purchase Orders (POs) and approve invoices for payment.
• Check and approve production costs prior to the accountant entries in Sage 500.
• Continually work to improve and ensure all financial KPIs such as inventory, labor costs, overheads, analysis, costings, reduction of expenses, distribution etc are at forecasted levels.
• Prepare annual production projections, annual budgets and ensure their implementation.
• Analyze the costs of daily production with the managers to meet required margins and follow up with corrective measures necessary to achieve goals.
• Take charge of the preparation and filing of requests for financial assistance, insurance claims, and other claims from institutions.
• Take charge of the foreign workers' file, complete the applications associated with their arrival to departure following CRA and IRCC guidelines.
• Participate in all plant audits and its subsequent corrective actions with the administration team of the plant.
• Take charge, prepare, and participate in certification programs like ECCP and others.
• Support and update the CTPAT program.
• Supervise financial product processing activities to ensure actual production costs meet the forecasted costs.
• Manage and coordinate documentations of finished products and that of the special orders of customers as defined by the sales and marketing department.
• Regularly suggest any changes that can maximize the profitability of the business and implement them when approved.
• Participate in the development and implementation of all new projects, products, cash and document their files.
• Actively participate in decision-making for the proper management of the company and the achievement of its objectives.
• Act as a company representative at industry or government meetings, seminars etc.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in finance or related major
• Hand on experience of plant accounting
• Professional accounting designation
• Five to eight years accounting experience in food processing or related firm
• Advance knowledge of Sage 500 and ADP’s Work Force Now Software
• Willing to relocate to commuting distance from the plant
• Advance Excel skills and high proficiency with Microsoft Suite
• In depth knowledge of federal financial regulations.
• Strong ability to build effective relationships within and outside the Company

Summary
Please apply in one of these ways:

apply here directly
send your resume to halifax.staffing@randstad.ca , with the subject line
text 902-237-8570 and let us know which job you are wanting to apply for (with your name)

We have jobs in all of the Atlantic Provinces (New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, and Newfoundland and Labrador.) so don't hesitate to send your friends!

title: Contrôleur - Manufacturier - Laval
description:
Contrôleur - Entreprise publique manufacturière - Laval - $115,000-$125,000 + 10% de boni

Vous êtes expérimenté comme Contrôleur dans le domaine manufacturier et vous aimerez vous joindre à une entreprise publique au niveau mondial?
Vous aimerez superviser 2 usines de fabrication?
Vous êtes un bon mentor et vous aimerez avoir une équipe stable à votre charge?

Nous avons une belle opportunité d'emploi pour vous!


Avantages
Pour le poste de Contrôleur, notre client vous offre:
-Salaire entre $115,000-$125,000
-Boni de 10%
-Jusqu'à 8% vers un RÉER
-4 semaines de vacances (incluant 2 semaines fixes en été)
-Assurance groupe
-Horaire de 39h/semaine, en présentiel, pas d'heures supplémentaires



Responsabilités
Les responsabilités du contrôleur incluent:

Conformité
- S’appropriée pleinement la responsabilité de l’état des résultats et du bilan.
- Se conformer aux exigences de rapporter l’aspect financier ainsi que des contrôles internes. 
- Agir en tant qu'autorité sur les questions comptables liées aux PCGR pour le site, y compris des domaines tels que la comptabilisation des coûts et des revenus. 
- Agir en tant que contact principal avec les auditeurs externes en ce qui concerne les questions relatives aux sites de Laval et de Georgetown.

Leadership
- Superviser et développer les employés du service de la finance/achats/système d’information tout en leur donnant les outils nécessaires. 
- Fixer des objectifs et évaluer les membres de l'équipe par rapport aux objectifs fixés.

Partenariat d'affaires
- Identifier les éléments clés pour stimuler l'amélioration de l'entreprise et fournir un leadership pour assurer la mise en œuvre des opportunités d'amélioration. 
- Déterminer en collaboration avec la direction de l'usine, les objectifs pour les mesures de performance de qualité, productivité, livraison, temps de cycle, optimisation des stocks et rentabilité. 
- Coordonner et administrer un plan adéquat pour le contrôle des opérations, y compris ; la planification des bénéfices, des prévisions de ventes, des budgets de dépenses, des normes de coûts, des opportunités d'économies et des investissements en capital.
- Coordonner le processus d'affectation des capitaux et des revues post-projet. 
- Prévoir les besoins et obligations de trésorerie à court et à long terme comme base pour maintenir des fonds adéquats. 
- Tenir le contrôleur du Corporatif informé des performances du site et fournir des conseils sur toutes les questions financières, y compris les ajustements opérationnels souhaitables. 
- Gérer efficacement les ressources et s'assurer que ces ressources satisfont les calendriers de production et les attentes des clients tout en répondant aux besoins du site
- Être membre du comité de retraite, administrer le fonds de pensions à prestations déterminé et le fonds de pensions à cotisations déterminé. 
- S’assurer que la gestion des impôts sur le revenu et sur les taxes de ventes soit conforme



Qualifications
Les qualifications pour le poste de Contrôleur incluent:
- Titre professionnel de CPA
- 7-10 ans d'expérience dans un environnement de fabrication, incluant 2 ans avec la supervision de personnel
- Bilinguisme
- Expérience avec un système ERP (Oracle est un atout)
- Excel au niveau avancé

Si le poste de Contrôleur vous intéresse et vous avez les qualifications requises, veuillez svp faire parvenir une copie récente de votre cv à angela.bonfitto@randstad.ca. Si vous avez déjà un dossier d’ouvert chez Randstad, veuillez svp communiquer avec Angela au 450.682.9564.

description:

description:
Our client, in the Real Estate Development REIT space is seeking a Controller, Corporate Finance will be responsible for all financial reporting functions within the Corporate Finance Group. The Controller, Corporate Finance will be responsible for the design and implementation of internal controls across all financial reporting processes.

Work with our large client in the real estate space, while leading a highly motivated team of finance professionals.

title: Contrôleur
description:
Nouveau poste : Contrôleur financier, industrie manufacturière
Lieu: St-Hubert
Type : Permanent
Salaire: 95-105k selon l’expérience
Horaire: 40h, possibilité de télétravail
Début : Dès que possible

Entreprise manufacturière qui existe depuis plus de 50 ans. Cette pme à des activités en Amérique du nord ainsi que des partenaires en Chine. La personne recherchée devra avoir du leadership, un bon niveau d’anglais ainsi qu’un titre CPA. Voici les avantages offerts pour ce poste situé à St-Hubert :


Avantages
Le contrôleur (St-Hubert) sélectionné profitera des avantages suivants :
• 4 semaines de vacances
• Possibilité de faire du télétravail
• Possibilité de bonus selon le rendement
• Paiement de cotisation à l’ordre
• Assurance collective
• REER avec possibilité de participation de l’employeur
• Stationnement disponible
• Accessible en transport en commun




Responsabilités
Relevant du président, le contrôleur (St-Hubert) sélectionné pour ce poste devra assurer la planification, l’organisation, et le contrôle de l’ensemble des activités comptables de l’entreprise en s’assurant que celles-ci rencontrent les objectifs corporatifs en plus des responsabilités suivantes :

• Embauche, supporter et supervision complète d’une équipe de 2 personnes
• Formation (travailler en étroite collaboration avec les ressources humaines)
• Participe à la négociation de la convention collective
• Superviser le département de comptabilité
• S’assurer que les politiques comptables de l’entreprise soient respectés
• Processus de planification budgétaire, en faire l'analyse et corriger les prévisions
• Analyser les résultats financiers
• Gérer le fond de roulement, devise étrangère, établir les politiques de crédit
• Gérer le prix de revient
• Établir un contrôle sur tous les engagements contractuels auprès des clients et fournisseurs
• Rechercher de financement et subventions pour le fonctionnement de certains projets
• Analyse de tous investissements et améliorations en usine (ROI)
• Réviser et négocier tous les coûts annuels de services divers
• Superviser et conclure le rapport annuel de R&D
• Évaluation et amélioration des procédures
• Préparer les dossiers de vérifications externes
• Rédiger les rapports comptables pour la direction générale
• Participer, à titre de membre du comité de direction, à la définition de la mission et de la vision de l’entreprise et travailler à réaliser ces objectifs
• Responsable du département TI. Développer et superviser les projets d'informatisation des processus administratifs de l'entreprise
• Gérer les clés et le système d’alarme
• Remplacer le comptable principal lors d’absence
• Toutes autres tâches connexes


Qualifications
Le poste de contrôleur à St-Hubert requiert du leadership, d’avoir une bonne communication et d’être très débrouillard. Êtes-vous la personne que l’on recherche? Voici comment vous qualifier :
• Minimum 5 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire
• CPA (CMA) obligatoire
• Expérience en industrie manufacturière obligatoire
• Bonne connaissance de Excel (tableau croisé dynamique, recherche verticale)
• Bonne connaissance de Power BI
• Connaissance de Acomba, Nethris (un atout)
• Bilingue ou qui se débrouille très bien
• Très bonne connaissance du cycle comptable complet
• Expérience en supervision
• Bon communicateur, leadership, autonome, bon négociateur, flexible


Sommaire
Le poste de contrôleur peut vous intéresser? Il me fera plaisir de considérer votre profil. Vous pouvez communiquer avec moi par courriel ou téléphone :
Karl.sauthere@randstad.ca
514-434-6794
Au plaisir de collaborer avec vous!

title: VP, Finance
description:
Are you a forward-thinking, strategic business partner who has experience helping grow a start-up with your financial acumen, ideally within the Saas industry? Do you have the ability to influence strategic business decisions, enjoy leading and developing the budgeting & forecasting process, and strive for results?

If you are an analytical, VP of Finance who is a collaborative team player and have 10+ years of experience in FP&A and a passion for start-ups, this could be an excellent permanent opportunity for you to explore with a successful and growing company!

Advantages
- Incredible base salary
- Unlimited vacation
- Stock Options
- 100% remote, permanently - no aspirations to re-open an office
- Health and dental plan
- Mobile phone, laptop, internet paid, as well as continuing education
- The opportunity to collaborate with colleagues in different cities in the world

Responsibilities
Reporting to the COO, and working closely with the CEO, your focus would be on the following;

- Develop and manage the budgeting, forecasting, and reporting process
- Involvement in influential and strategic business decisions and plans
- Uncover ways to maximize revenue
- Equity fundraising and capital fundraising
- Oversee Accounting Manager and accounting operations, including payables, receivables, payroll, and tax preparation
- Forecasting, budgeting, consolidations, and financial reporting to stakeholders, leadership, and the Board
- Evaluate merger and acquisition opportunities
- Manage external auditors and banking relationships
- Corporate governance practices and cap table management
- Manage insurance coverage, including compliance
- Financial guidance for the creation and management of foreign subsidiaries

Qualifications
- Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Finance, Business, or Economics
- Experience building and leading FP&A and accounting teams
- Strong understanding of finance and accounting principles, including financial modeling as it applies to usage-based business models
- Knowledge of the Canadian and US government's financial regulations, tax requirements, gig work policies, and GAAP
- 10+ years of experience in investment banking, M&A, or related fields
- Experience working in a fast-growing, Saas, a start-up is highly preferred

Summary
If reading this excites you and you have the required skills and experience, please reach out to us today with your resume for consideration or share it with your network, if you may know of someone!
